关于作者

UML 模式语言，A

UML Pattern Language, A

保罗·埃维茨
Paul Evitts
出版商：新骑手出版社
Publisher: New Riders Publishing
第一版 2000 年 2 月 10 日

 

 

ISBN：1-57870-118-X，288 页



购买印刷版



Buy Print Version

UML 模式语言将软件设计模式概念与统一建模语言 (UML) 相结合，为从事系统建模和软件开发的软件专业人员提供工具集。本书提供： 系统建模领域的一组模式，包括对管理、运营和部署团队以及软件开发人员有用的模式；对模式和 UML 发展的调查；讨论使用该语言的模式和说明的基本理论；对设计过程和模型驱动开发的全面探索。 UML 模式语言认识到设计和建模已经成为软件开发企业中编程和编码的平等伙伴。提供对设计工作的理解以及模式和 UML 结合以促进设计的方式。

A UML Pattern Language pairs the software design pattern concept with the Unified Modeling Language (UML) to offer a tool set for software professionals practicing both system modeling and software development. This book provides: a collection of patterns in the domain of system modeling, including those that are useful to management, operations, and deployment teams, as well as to software developers; a survey of the development of patterns and the UML; a discussion of the underlying theory of the patterns and instructions for using the language; a thorough exploration of the design process and model-driven development. A UML Pattern Language recognizes that design and modeling have become equal partners with programming and coding in the enterprise of software development. Providing both an understanding of the work of design and the way patterns and the UML combine to facilitate design.

UML 模式语言，A

艾米帕克

奉献精神

我想将本书献给在个人层面上使本书成为可能的四个人。每当幽默消失时，我的儿子杰西偶尔会贡献出一种难以理解的幽默感。我的兄弟克里斯在喝了几杯啤酒后唠叨我做点什么。我的妻子莱恩知道什么时候该消失，什么时候不该消失。最后但同样重要的是，我的岳父尤金·科特 (Eugene Cote)，他对这本书的必然性的坚定信念使我度过了许多难关。没有他，这本书就不会完成。而且，作为 lagniappe，我还要感谢我的妈妈，没有她，我不可能成为可能。她是第五，也是第一。

Dedications

I want to dedicate this book to four people who have made this book possible on a personal level. My son, Jesse, contributed an occasionally inscrutable sense of humor whenever humor disappeared. My brother, Chris, nagged me to do something over a few beers. My wife, Lyne, knew when to disappear, and when not to. Last but not least, my father-in-law, Eugene Cote, whose sparkling faith in the book's inevitability got me over many rough spots. This book would not have been finished without him. And, as a lagniappe, I also want to thank my Mom, without whom I wouldn't have been possible. She's number five, but also number one.

关于作者

About the Author

Paul Evitts是来自多伦多的系统和管理顾问，他是 neoLogistiks, Inc. 的总裁。他在系统集成、技术规划和实施以及软件方法/生命周期开发方面拥有 20 多年的经验。Paul 的客户包括北美的数十家私营部门和政府组织，包括保险和制造公司、房地产和零售组织、教育机构和金融部门公司。

Paul Evitts is a systems and management consultant from Toronto, and he is the President of neoLogistiks, Inc. He has more than 20 years of experience in systems integration, technology planning and implementation, and software methodology/lifecycle development. Paul's clients have included dozens of private sector and government organizations across North America, including insurance and manufacturing companies, real estate and retail organizations, educational institutions, and financial sector firms.

在过去的 10 年里，Paul 成功地为客户制定了定制的用例驱动开发方法，担任了各个项目的业务架构师和项目经理，并为迁移到新技术的客户提供了战略规划支持。

Over the last 10 years, Paul has successfully crafted custom use-case driven development approaches for clients, acted as business architect and project manager for individual projects, and provided strategic planning support for clients migrating to new technologies.

他的咨询活动并不局限于传统的应用程序开发和系统集成。他还评估了第三世界（非洲、拉丁美洲和加勒比地区）系统技术的商业机会，担任航海者公司出版的商业 CD-ROM 的技术制作人，协助一家初创多媒体媒体公司进行业务规划，并担任系统架构师，在业务重组方面取得了重大成功。

His consulting activities have not been limited to traditional applications development and system integration. He has also evaluated business opportunities for systems technology in the Third World (Africa, Latin America, and the Caribbean), acted as technical producer for a commercial CD-ROM published by The Voyager Company, assisted a startup multimedia media company in business planning, and worked as a system architect for one of the significant successes in business re-engineering.

Paul 的方法论咨询实践并不仅限于面向对象的开发。他在 1980 年代花了很多年时间为客户提供快速应用程序开发和基于事件的开发方法，并使用各种 CASE 工具指导和指导建模。

Paul's methodology consulting practice has not been limited to object-oriented development. He spent many years in the 1980s providing clients with Rapid Application Development and event-based development approaches, coaching and mentoring modeling using a variety of CASE tools.

在进入信息技术之前，Paul 参与了社区发展和使用新兴技术来促进社会变革。作为一名社会经济顾问，他是加拿大北极地区因纽特人土地索赔工作的早期成员，最近最终建立了一个名为努纳武特的新加拿大领土。保罗帮助因纽特人在北方建立初步共识的过程中使用视频和其他媒体，他还提供了有关住房和社区规划的建议。他第一次接触到克里斯托弗·亚历山大的想法是在较早的时候，因为他在英国伦敦的一个合法占屋社区工作，在那里他参与了废弃社区的合作修复。

Before getting into Information Technology, Paul was involved in community development and the use of emerging technologies to promote social change. As a socio-economic consultant, he was an early part of the Inuit Land Claims effort in the Canadian Arctic, which recently culminated in the establishment of a new Canadian Territory called Nunavut. Paul helped the Inuit use video and other media in the process of initial consensus-building across the North, and he provided advice on housing and community planning. His first exposure to the ideas of Christopher Alexander came about earlier as a result of work with a legalized squatting community in London, Englandwhere he was involved in the cooperative rehabilitation of abandoned neighborhoods.

保罗在多伦多罗奇代尔学院学习社区发展、政治和先进技术。罗奇代尔是他帮助建立的一个实验性教育社区。它是传统大学的替代品。他在罗奇代尔的经历最近被拍成了加拿大非常受欢迎的电视纪录片，加拿大广播公司多次播出，加拿大国家电影委员会也提供视频。请参阅 Paul 的网站www.umlpatterns.com以获得与本书相关的更多资料。

Paul studied community development, politics, and advanced technology at Rochdale College in Toronto. Rochdale is an experimental educational community that he helped establish. It is an alternative to traditional universities. His experiences at Rochdale were recently made into a very popular television documentary in Canada, which aired a number of times by the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and is available as a video from the National Film Board of Canada. Please refer to Paul's Web site, www.umlpatterns.com, for further materials related to this book.

关于技术评审员

About the Technical Reviewers

这些审阅者为A UML Pattern Language 的整个开发过程贡献了相当多的实践专业知识。在撰写本书时，这些人审查了所有材料的技术内容、组织和流程。他们的反馈对于确保A UML Pattern Language满足读者对最高质量技术信息的需求至关重要。

These reviewers contributed their considerable, hands-on expertise to the entire development process for A UML Pattern Language. As the book was being written, these folks reviewed all the material for technical content, organization, and flow. Their feedback was critical to ensuring that A UML Pattern Language fits our readers' needs for the highest quality technical information.

David G. Lewis是华盛顿特区的一名技术顾问，专门从事企业软件开发和技术管理。10 多年来，他一直活跃于分布式面向对象技术的设计、开发和管理。David 的职业生涯始于 1986 年在运行 Venix 的 DEC Rainbow 上用 C 语言开发面向对象的销售点系统。该公司失败了，但该产品成功地使用了面向对象的原则、可重用的框架和深思熟虑的设计证明了这种方法的优点。从而开始了对面向对象设计和软件重用的长期承诺。

David G. Lewis is a technology consultant in the Washington D.C. area, specializing in enterprise software development and technology management. He has been active in the design, development, and management of distributed object-oriented technology for more than 10 years. David began his career working on an object-oriented point-of-sale system in C on a DEC Rainbow running Venix in 1986. The company failed, but the product's successful use of object-oriented principles, reusable frameworks, and thoughtful design demonstrated the merits of this approach. Thus began a career-long commitment to object-oriented design and software reuse.

David 在该领域的贡献包括洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室 GenBank 项目的持久性框架；为 NeXTSTEP 操作系统许可的文件系统技术；在面向对象系统的开发、可重用框架和技术采用方面发挥着关键作用，在华盛顿地区的公司（包括 Fannie Mae、MCI 和 T. Rowe Price）中担任重要角色。他目前在弗吉尼亚州北部的一家初创公司参与开发和推广 CORBA 技术。大卫于 1985 年毕业于圣达菲圣约翰学院的名著计划。

David's contributions in this area included a persistence framework for the GenBank project at Los Alamos National Laboratory; file-system technology licensed for the NeXTSTEP operating system; and key roles in the development of object-oriented systems, reusable frameworks, and technology adoption at Washington-area companiesincluding Fannie Mae, MCI, and T. Rowe Price. He is currently involved in developing and promoting CORBA technology at a start-up company in northern Virginia. David graduated from the Great Books Program at St. John's College in Santa Fe in 1985.

马克·桑德伯格 (Mark Sandberg)为包括金融、电信和医疗保健企业在内的众多行业开发软件已有 14 年多。目前，Mark 是 HealthObjects Corporation 的电子商务开发经理，负责管理医疗保健门户产品的设计和开发。

Mark Sandberg has been developing software for over 14 years for a wide variety of industries, including financial, telecommunications, and healthcare businesses. Currently, Mark is the e-commerce development manager for HealthObjects Corporation, where he is managing the design and development of a healthcare portal product.

从 1995 年到 1999 年，Mark 是 Object Systems Group 的一名顾问，为此他专注于应用程序开发团队的技术和流程指导。从 1989 年到 1995 年，他在 Campbell and Co. 工作，为期权和期货市场开发专有交易系统。从 1985 年到 1989 年，Mark 在 Electronic Data Systems 工作，为美国陆军的住房管理系统实施和支持客户端/服务器应用程序。他于 1985 年在维克森林大学获得数学和经济学学士学位。

From 1995 to 1999, Mark was a consultant with Object Systems Group, for which he concentrated on technical and process mentoring on application development teams. From 1989 to 1995, he worked at Campbell and Co., developing proprietary trading systems for the options and futures markets. From 1985 to 1989, Mark worked at Electronic Data Systems, implementing and supporting client/server applications for the US Army's Housing Management System. He received his B.S. degree in Mathematics and Economics from Wake Forest University in 1985.

致谢

Acknowledgments

我必须感谢我在 MTP 的开发编辑 Tom Cirtin 和我们的编辑协调员 Jen Garrett 的决心和上帝般的耐心。在专业层面上，他们让我这么做了。并去做。并去做。评论家 David Lewis（SoapBox 先生）和 Mark Sandberg（Laconic 先生）在让我保持诚实和真实方面发挥了互补（如果不是总是互补）的作用。Dion Hinchcliffe 是巴尔的摩 T. Rowe Price 的高级架构师，他在这里提供了大部分更具技术性的模式的原始版本，以及这本书的最初想法，尽管我已经偏离了很多。

I have to acknowledge the determination and god-like patience of Tom Cirtin, my development editor at MTP, and Jen Garrett, our editorial coordinator. On a professional level, they made me do it. And do it. And do it. The reviewers, David Lewis (Mr. SoapBox) and Mark Sandberg (Mr. Laconic), played complementary (if not always complimentary) roles in keeping me honest and real. Dion Hinchcliffe, a senior architect at T. Rowe Price in Baltimore, provided the original version of a large percentage of the more technical patterns here, as well as the initial idea for the book, although one I've deviated from enormously.

介绍

Introduction

Arma virumque 卡诺。

我歌颂工具和人。

维吉尔对埃涅阿斯纪的介绍，自由翻译

Arma virumque cano.

I sing of tools and the man.

Virgil's introduction to the Aeneid, freely translated

这本书是关于如何对软件系统建模以及如何使用这些模型的。它植根于新兴的知识“生态系统”，包括各种网络（互联网、内联网、外联网等）、分布式对象、基于短开发周期的零碎开发以及称为模式的东西。它面向软件系统的开发人员、设计人员和架构师以及他们实践技能的方式。

This book is about how to model software systems and how to use those models. It is rooted in that emerging intellectual "ecosystem" comprising the various networks (the Internet, intranets, extranets, and so on), distributed objects, piecemeal development based on short development cycles, and something called patterns. It is aimed at developers, designers, and architects of software systems and the ways they practice their craft.

它提出了模式的收敛外观和统一建模语言(UML) 并非偶然。模式是一种记录关于设计和构建软件系统的集体的、永恒的思考方式的方式。UML 是一种在特定时间记录系统细节的方法，以支持随着系统的发展和变化而进行的开发工作。两者都是消除困扰我们行业的过程和产品的短暂质量的练习。

It proposes that the convergent appearance of patterns and the Unified Modeling Language (UML) is no accident. Patterns are a way of documenting collective, timeless ways of thinking about designing and building software systems. The UML is a way of documenting the specifics of a system for a particular time to support a development effort as the system evolves and changes. Both are exercises in eliminating the ephemeral quality of process and product that has bedeviled our profession.

这两者是系统设计和构建方式发生根本转变的表现，软件专业人员才刚刚开始努力应对。这种转变表明专业人员的工作方式以及他们与本应帮助的人合作的方式出现了更广泛的趋势，软件社区开始感受到这种趋势。

The two are manifestations of a basic shift in the way systems are designed and builtone that software professionals are just beginning to grapple with. This shift is indicative of a broader trend in the way professionals work and the way they work with the people they are supposed to help, which is beginning to be felt in the software community.

简而言之，软件开发人员的变化代表着软件开发不再是一个由孤独的编码员主导的领域的不成熟愿景。它朝着软件开发的协作性质的更成熟的愿景迈进，这是真正的专业实践的典型。但它也挑战了软件开发人员对其职业的传统看法。

At its simplest, the change for software developers represents a shift away from an immature vision of software development as a field dominated by solitary coders. It moves toward a more mature vision of a collaborative nature of software developmentone that is typical of genuine professional practice. But it also challenges the traditional views that software developers have about their profession.

从某种意义上说，模式和 UML 的出现也标志着系统文化的转变，在这种文化中，编程定义了学科的核心，而编码定义了其实践的核心。在软件开发企业中，设计和建模已成为编程和编码的平等伙伴。

In a sense, the emergence of patterns and the UML also symbolizes a shift away from a systems culture, in which programming defined the core of the discipline and coding defined the core of its practice. Design and modeling have become equal partners with programming and coding in the enterprise of software development.

本书中的模式语言是这种转变的实用辅助工具。它的目标是提供一个软件专业人员可以使用的工具集，一个适合在建模系统中完成的工作规模的工具集，并且同样适合从事软件开发的实际从业者和工匠的需要。

The pattern language in this book is a practical adjunct to this shift. Its goal is to provide a toolset that software professionals can use, one that is fitted to the dimensions of the work to be done in modeling systems and is equally fitted to the needs of real practitioners and craftspeople engaged in software development.

本书的读者既不是黑客（最初意义上的牛仔程序员）、工程师，也不是学者；而是软件开发人员。它的读者是有文化的，不仅在软件语言方面，而且在软件思想方面。他们有专业的需求来了解正在出现的令人兴奋的新想法，以及对他们生成的工具的需求。他们对影响他们工作的想法的起源有着专业的好奇心。

This book's audience is neither hackers (in the original sense of cowboy programmers), engineers, nor academics; rather it is software developers. Its readers are literate, not just in software languages, but also in software ideas. They have a professional need to understand the exciting new ideas that are emerging, as well as a need for the tools they generate. And they have a professional curiosity about the origins of the ideas that shape their work.

作为本书核心的模式语言本身就体现了实用性的重要性。模式本质上是实用的。然而，通过坚持当前的实用性概念（特别是避免创建方法论的需要），本书并不打算成为“货架”。也不是课件。它不打算作为统一的学习体验从头到尾阅读。相反，它应该被应用、使用和塑造用户。

The pattern language itselfthe core of this bookreflects the importance of being practical. Patterns are inherently practical. By keeping faith with current notions of practicality (in particular, the need to avoid creating a methodology), however, this book is not intended to end up as "shelfware." Nor is it courseware. It isn't intended to be read from cover to cover as a unified learning experience. Rather, it's meant to be applied, used, and shaped by the user.

模式和 UML

Patterns and the UML

在他们的最简单的是，模式是以文学形式结构化、打包的问题解决方案。

At their simplest, patterns are structured, packaged problem solutions in literary form.

模式是一种新的文学形式，最早起源于软件社区。正如您将看到的，这种形式源于建筑，尤其是克里斯托弗亚历山大的作品，一位富有远见的建筑师，他在 1970 年代的建筑设计工作中首次声名鹊起。在系统开发中，模式的想法在很大程度上是软件开发人员为了应对沟通障碍和对超越对象的媒介的需求而挪用的“私生子继子”，作为组织设计背后的复杂思维的一种方式。

Patterns are a new literary form, the first to originate from the software community. As you will see, this form has its roots in architectureespecially in the work of Christopher Alexander, a visionary architect who first achieved prominence for his work on architectural design in the 1970s. In systems development, the idea of patterns is very much a "bastard stepchild" appropriated by software developers in response to communication frustrations and to the need for a medium that goes beyond objects as a way of organizing the complex thinking behind design.

模式语言是具有共同域的相关模式的集合。在解释当今如何进行软件建模方面，它们比方法论和课程有很多优势。它们是描述性的，而不是规定性的（方法论的祸根）。尽管它们捕捉经验，但模式语言不是说教的，也不是单一观点的表达。它们是松散的和开放式的。

Pattern languages are collections of related patterns that have a common domain. They have many advantages over methodologies and courses for explaining how to go about modeling software today. They are descriptive, not prescriptive (the bane of methodologies). Although they capture experience, pattern languages are not didactic nor the expression of a single perspective. They are loose and open-ended.

在最好的情况下，模式可以增强创造力。在最坏的情况下，它们允许解释，从而支持决策制定的敏捷性和优雅性。它们通过“超文本”和动态而非顺序的链接促进结构化学习。他们支持的学习更适合“适时”的方法，许多人发现这种方法对软件工作比传统培训更明智。

At their best, patterns enhance creativity. At their worst, they allow for interpretation, and thus support agility and grace in decision-making. They facilitate structured learning through links that are "hypertextual" and dynamic, not sequential. The learning they support is better suited to the "just in time" approach that many find more sensible for software work than traditional training.

本书中模式语言的领域是系统建模软件密集型系统建模，正如 UML 所说的那样。尽管模式正在成为软件世界的概念通用语，但本书关注的不是模式本身，而是商店中新兴的操作通用语一楼：UML。

The domain for the pattern language in this book is system modeling software-intensive system modeling, as the UML puts it. Although patterns are becoming the conceptual lingua franca of the software world, this book focuses not on patterns per se, but rather on the emerging operational lingua franca of the shop floor: the UML.

UML 在其方式上与模式一样具有革命性，而不仅仅是另一种建模工具。它对软件从业者的重要性既取决于它的作用，也取决于它如何演变，因为它是它提供的结果。

The UML is as revolutionary in its way as patterns, and not as just another modeling facility. Its importance for the software practitioner is as much a result of its role and how it evolved as it is a result of what it provides.

直到最近，软件建模一直是一个割裂的领域，进入该领域的知识和实际成本由专有且经常相互冲突的标准决定。工具和培训很昂贵，典型的软件开发人员必须在为大型组织开展大型项目时获得有用的经验。

Up until recently, software modeling has been a Balkanized domain, in which the intellectual and practical cost of entry was determined by proprietary and often conflicting standards. Tools and training were expensive, and a typical software developer had to gain useful experience doing work on big projects for big organizations.

对于专注于内部标准化的大型组织来说，这种进入成本是可以承受的。他们付钱是因为在内部使用标准化模型符合他们的利益。这些模型有助于为其信息技术资产建立一个通用的企业图景，用于控制和规划。建模的结果常常对用户的价值有疑问，对程序员的实用性也有限。

This cost of entry was affordable for big organizations focused on internal standardization. They paid because it was in their interest to use standardized models internally. These models helped to establish a common corporate picture of their information technology assets, both for control and planning. The results of modeling were, frequently, of questionable value to users and of limited utility for programmers.

然后是客户端/服务器、各种新的编程语言，最后是 Internet。例如，建模结构化建模和信息工程的旧方法不再适用。它们的目标是在相对同质的计算环境中构建以一种或另一种形式驻留在大型机上的内部独立操作系统，即所谓的单体系统或烟囱系统。它们无法很好地扩展到组织之间动态交互以及与客户、供应商、竞争对手和合作伙伴交互的更复杂的世界。

Then, client/server, a variety of new programming languages, and finally the Internet entered the picture. The old ways of modelingstructured modeling and information engineering, for exampleceased to be relevant. They were aimed at building internal, self-contained operational systems residing on mainframes in one form or anotherthe so-called monolithic or stovepipe systemsin a relatively homogeneous computing environment. They didn't scale up well to a more complex world of dynamic interactions between organizations and interactions with customers, suppliers, competitors, and partners.

同时，对象和组件的新环境还不成熟。它在软件开发人员中占据了大部分难以捉摸的“思想份额”（市场份额的智力等价物），这些通常决定了信息技术接下来会发生什么。如果对象技术要成熟，那么使模型成为开发过程中的关键元素的开发方法被视为必不可少的。但是对象建模就像主流建模一样是狗的早餐。

Meanwhile, the new environment of objects and components was immature. It had captured most of the elusive "mindshare," (the intellectual equivalent of market share) among software developers that so often determines what happens next in information technology. Development approaches that made models a critical element in the development process were being seen as essential if object technology was to mature. But object modeling was as much of a dog's breakfast as mainstream modeling.

UML 就是从这种机会和需求的结合中产生的。与以前为软件建模定义工具集的努力不同，UML 是集体努力。因此，它已经摆脱了专有的死胡同。它是有意构建的，可以随着新需求的出现而发展和响应。这些差异反映了软件建模必须适应当今以及 UML 所服务的不同环境。

The UML emerged from this combination of opportunity and need. Unlike previous efforts to define a toolset for software modeling, the UML has been a group effort. So, it has escaped the dead end of being proprietary. It is intentionally built to evolve and respond to new needs as they emerge. These differences reflect the different landscape that software modeling has to fit into today and that the UML serves.

模型驱动开发的概念已经适用于各种规模和类型的软件项目。在模型的帮助下计划的迭代、增量开发正在取代大型机风格开发的一次性所有废话。廉价的个人生产力软件的可用性培养了开发人员对个人负担得起的开发工具的期望。重用的口头禅鼓励了可共享解决方案的概念，这在模型中记录并在组件中实现。组织周围的铁幕和柏林墙正在被具有需要建模的接口、职责和协作的防火墙所取代。

The notion of model-driven development has taken hold for all sizes and types of software projects. Iterative, incremental development that is planned with the help of models is replacing the all-at-once crapshoot of mainframe style development. The availability of inexpensive personal productivity software has nurtured expectations among developers for development tools that are personally affordable. The mantra of reuse has encouraged the notion of sharable solutions, which is documented in models and implemented in components. The Iron Curtains and Berlin Walls around organizations are being replaced by firewalls with interfaces, responsibilities, and collaborations that need to be modeled.

建模现在处于中心位置，而 UML 可能是推动世界发展所需的杠杆。它为廉价工具、可共享模型和可管理的开发过程提供了起点。它已被系统行业的所有重要参与者塑造或接受。

Modeling is now at center stage, and the UML is perhaps the lever that is needed to move the world. It provides the starting point for inexpensive tools, shareable models, and a manageable development process. It has been shaped or embraced by all the significant players in the systems industry.

由于专注于使用 UML 建模，我特别选择了模式作为媒体，因为它们以与 UML 相同的方式适合软件开发的动态环境。两者是同一文化的互补而非正交的产物。

And with a focus on modeling using the UML, I specifically chose patterns as media because they fit the dynamic landscape of software development in the same way as the UML. The two are complementary, not orthogonal, artifacts of the same culture.

模式压缩经验，而模型过滤和抽象关系和概念结构。模式是文学的；模型是建筑的。两者都是管理复杂性的方法。两者都源于一种不稳定的共识，这种共识反映了一种更大的趋势，即远离专有和封闭，转向标准和开放。两者都反映了零碎增长、基于团队的发展以及所谓的可渗透组织理念的成功: 组织没有墙壁。

Patterns compress experience, whereas models filter and abstract relationships and conceptual structures. Patterns are literary; models are architectural. Both are ways of managing complexity. Both emerged out of a volatile consensus that reflects a bigger tendency away from the proprietary and the closed, and toward the standard and the open. Both reflect the success of a philosophy of piecemeal growth, team-based development, and what might be called permeable organizations: organizations without walls.

级别和共享习语

Levels and Shared Idioms

本书包含的模式均来源于模式挖掘，这是过去几年在软件开发人员中出现的自我描述模式社区创造的一个术语。模式挖掘是 Alexander 和他的同事在创建第一组架构模式时采用的原始方法的变体。

The patterns included in this book are all derived from pattern-mining, a term coined by the self-described patterns community that surfaced in the last few years among software developers. Pattern-mining is a variation on the original approach taken by Alexander and his colleagues when they created the first set of architectural patterns.

我使用模式来记录现有文献中使用 UML 的成功方法。对软件文献进行了搜索，以寻找良好建模和模型良好使用的重复示例。这些示例经过评估、验证、过滤、分解和重构，然后记录在案。

I use patterns to document the successful approaches to working with the UML from the existing literature. The software literature was scoured for repeated examples of good modeling and good uses of models. These examples were evaluated, validated, filtered, factored and refactored, and then documented.

一些模式是现有模式的改造版本；有些是基于经过验证的实践或解决建模问题的通用方法的初稿。有些模式比其他模式更强。所有这些都对进一步发展持开放态度。

Some patterns are reworked versions of existing patterns; some are first drafts that are based on proven practices or common approaches to solving modeling problems. Some patterns are stronger than others. All of them are open to further evolution.

模式语言有多个维度和层次。我松散地遵循亚历山大设定的例子。他建造人体结构的模式范围从区域的水平到房屋的组成部分。亚历山大的模式语言的副标题确定了他使用的三个关键组织思想：城镇、建筑物和建筑（1977 年）。

The pattern language has multiple dimensions and levels. I loosely follow the example set by Alexander. His patterns for building human structures range from the level of the region to that of the components of a house. The subtitle of Alexander's A Pattern Language identifies the three key organizing ideas he uses: towns, buildings, and construction (1977).

我冒昧地采纳并自由改编了三个在高质量软件开发中变得重要的关键组织思想： 领域， 产品, 和组件. 这些是我们的模式语言网络中的级别；它们为建模工作提供了背景。

I've taken the liberty of adopting and freely adapting three of the key organizing ideas that are becoming important in quality software development: domain, products, and components. These are the levels in our pattern language network; they provide the context for the work of modeling.

为了本书的目的，一个 领域是技术和业务结构和概念的结合，为软件开发提供了直接的上下文。它汇集了高级业务模型和高级技术架构。域是此模式语言的最高建模级别。领域定义工程、建模和管理的上下文、范围和业务词汇。对于软件开发人员来说，域可能是一个“系统家族”（Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson 1997, 19），即产品的集合；对于进行业务再造的人来说，可能是整个企业。

For the purposes of this book, a domain is the combination of technical and business constructs and concepts that provides the immediate context for software development. It brings together a high-level business model with a high-level technology architecture. Domain is the highest level of modeling for this pattern language. Domains define the context, scope, and business vocabulary for engineering, modeling, and management. For a software developer, a domain may be a "family of systems" (Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson 1997, 19), that is, a collection of products; for someone doing business re-engineering, it may be the overall enterprise.

产品有作为一个单元计划、管理和交付给最终用户的内容。它们的生命周期和生命周期与开发生命周期是分开的，尤其是现在有迭代设计和增量交付。它们诞生、引进、进化、成熟，理论上有一个日落。无论是在组织内部还是在公开市场上销售，产品都需要在单个开发项目的边界之外进行管理和建模，并且它们为每个开发突增提供了上下文。

Products are what are planned, managed, and delivered to the end user as a unit. They have a life and a lifecycle that is separate from the development lifecycle, especially now with iterative design and incremental delivery. They are born, introduced, evolved, matured, and theoretically have a sunset. Whether internal to an organization or sold on the open market, products need to managed and modeled beyond the boundaries of a single development project, and they provide the context for each development spurt.

就本书而言，产品不仅仅是软件本身。它是一个整体包，技术营销大师 Geoffrey Moore 称之为“整体产品”：支持服务、文档和持续管理 (1991, 11035)。

For the purposes of this book, a product goes beyond just the software itself. It is the total package, what Geoffrey Moore, the technology marketing guru, called a "whole product": the supporting services, the documentation, and the ongoing management (1991, 11035).

随着短周期开发取代大型机时代的长期开发风格，产品成为软件开发的持续现实，取代项目成为黑暗管理中心的集体迷信。UML 尤其具有支持建模的工件产品。

As short-cycle development replaces the protracted development style of the mainframe era, products become the ongoing reality of software development, replacing projects as the collective fetish in the management heart of darkness. The UML is especially endowed with artifacts to support the modeling of products.

成分是什么被部署。首先，它们是在处理器和设备上交付给最终用户的可执行文件。在 UML 中，它们也是使可执行解决方案有用和可维护所需的文档、源代码、帮助文件和任何其他支持工件。

Components are what is deployed. To start with, they are the executables delivered to the end user on processors and devices. In the UML, they are also the documentation, the source code, the help files, and any other supporting artifact needed to make the executable solution useful and maintainable.

这种解释跨越了一切都是组件之间的定义鸿沟，强调重用，组件是部分（即，只有二进制代码是系统的一部分）。与产品一样，模式语言不仅着眼于构成组件的所有事物，而且还涵盖了严格意义上不属于开发问题的问题（尽管它们对于长期发展至关重要成功）。

This interpretation straddles the definition gap between everything is a component, with its emphasis on reuse, and components are parts (that is, only binary codea portion of a system). As with products, the pattern language looks not just at all the things that make up a component, but it also covers problems that are not strictly development issues (although they are critical for long-term success).

我不会将这些模式限制为开发人员所面临的问题。我还包括对管理、运营和部署团队有用的模式，尽管它们是架构师和设计人员应该牢记的模式，因为它们提供了与管理层沟通的基础。

I don't limit these patterns to the problems faced by a developer. I also include patterns useful to management, to operations, and to the deployment teamalthough they are patterns that an architect and designer should keep in mind because they provide a basis for communication with management.

有些模式是惯用的，特别是关于制作图表和创建 UML 工件。其他人则更关心打包、对工件进行选择以及对建模成功至关重要的管理和组织考虑因素。

Some patterns are idiomatic, specifically about making diagrams and creating UML artifacts. Others are more concerned with packaging, making choices about artifacts, and management and organizational considerations that are critical to modeling success.

大多数（但不是全部）惯用模式与前面描述的模式语言级别是分开的。这些是风格的模式和实质模式，适用于任何 UML 建模工作。对于刚接触建模或 UML 的任何人，它们提供了一些关于格式化模型和有效使用 UML 工件的基本指南。在那里寻找有关使用 UML 设置图表或为特定情况建模的最佳方法的指导。它们还有助于解释如何利用 UML 的一些特定特性，这些特性将 UML 与过去或现在的其他建模语言区分开来。这些模式可以应用于从概念到细节的任何级别的建模。

Most, but not all, of the idiomatic patterns are separated from the pattern language levels described previously. These are the patterns of style and patterns of substance, addressed to any UML modeling effort. For anyone new to modeling or the UML, they provide some basic guidelines for formatting models and using the UML artifacts effectively. Look there for guidance on the best way to set up a diagram or model a particular situation with the UML. They also help explain how to make use of some of the specific features of the UML that differentiate the UML from other modeling languages, past or present. These patterns can be applied at any level of modeling, from the conceptual to the detailed.

使用本书

Using This Book

本书的核心是第二部分，“模式语言”。 这是一种用于构建、规划和使用软件密集型系统模型的语言。本书的其余部分可以被视为使用该语言或更有效地使用它的理论和说明。无需按顺序阅读本书或其中的主要部分。您选择的路线应取决于您的需要。

The core of this book is Part II, "The Pattern Language." This is a language for building, planning, and using models of software-intensive systems. The rest of the book can be considered the theory and instructions for using the language, or for using it more efficiently. There's no need to read the book or major parts of it sequentially. The route you take should depend on what you need.

那些不熟悉模式的人至少应该阅读第 1 章“模式基础”， 这是对模式的介绍。那些不熟悉 UML 的人应该阅读介绍 UML的第 2 章“统一建模语言” 和概述UML 的元素和工件的第 3 章“UML 要素、元素和工件”。从建模的角度来看 UML。

Those unfamiliar with patterns should at least read Chapter 1, "Pattern Essentials," which is an introduction to patterns. Those unfamiliar with the UML should read Chapter 2, "The Unified Modeling Language," which is an introduction to the UML, and Chapter 3, "UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts," which is an overview of the elements and artifacts of the UML from a modeling perspective.

模式语言之后是第 III 部分，“另一个起点”。 这些章节提供了上下文并丰富了 UML 和一般模式的使用。它们旨在作为本书主体（模式语言本身）的注解。它们既是介绍性的又是广泛的，提供与其他作品的链接。它们可以为进一步探索模式和 UML 提供一个起点。

Following the pattern language is Part III, "Another Starting Point." These chapters provide context and enrich the use of both the UML in particular and patterns in general. They are meant to be glosses for the main body of the book, the pattern language itself. They are both introductory and extensive providing links to other works. They can provide a starting point for exploring both patterns and the UML further.

UML 和模式都不是固定的或简单的。为了最大限度地利用其中任何一个，从用户转变为从业者并最终成为专业人士，除了我在这里提供的内容之外，还需要做很多进一步的工作。

Neither the UML nor patterns are fixed or simple. In order to make maximum use of either, move from being a user to a practitioner and eventually become professional, a lot of further work is required beyond what I offer here.

UML 在形成时受到了极大的关注，它是以前定义建模语言的努力的自然延伸。因此，不仅成为一名认真的从业者所需的重要信息随时可用，而且所需的大部分技能将是任何具有建模经验的人现有技能的扩展。

The UML received a great deal of attention as it formed and is a natural extension of previous efforts to define a modeling language. As a result, not only is the important information needed to become a serious practitioner readily available, but most of the skills needed will be extensions of existing skills for anyone with modeling experience.

就模式而言，还需要了解历史和背景，因为模式不仅仅是一种形式。它们也与大多数开发人员熟悉的任何东西都大不相同。此外，还没有为初学者很好地记录模式。当它们出现时，很少有外界关注它们，而且对于有效处理和使用模式至关重要的背景材料充其量也很少。对于现在接触模式的任何人来说，结果可能令人困惑甚至令人沮丧。

In the case of patterns, there's history and background to get acquainted with as well because patterns are much more than just a form. They are also very different from anything most developers will be familiar with. Also, patterns have not been well documented for the beginning user. Very little outside attention was paid to them as they emerged, and the background material critical to working with and using patterns effectively is skimpy at best. For anyone getting involved with patterns now, the results can be confusingeven frustrating.

因此，我更多地关注模式并提供其他无法获得的信息，希望那些希望超越模式语言的有限范围的读者能够有效地武装起来处理模式的迷宫本身。

Therefore, I dwell a bit more on patterns and provide otherwise unavailable information in the hopes that those readers looking to move beyond the limited scope of the pattern language will be armored effectively to deal with the pattern's labyrinth itself.

因为这不是一个简单的主题，所以我使用的模式格式的背景在第 1 章中进行了详细讨论。然而，对于本书的用户来说，每个模式的关键部分将有助于确定模式的适用性及其作为起点的潜力，这些部分是上下文和问题陈述。这些部分应该先看，然后一起看。可以通过阅读强制声明进一步细化适用性，该声明详细说明了解决方案需要解决的压力、趋势、需求和约束。

Because it is not a simple topic, the background to the pattern format I use is discussed in detail in Chapter 1. However, for the user of this book, the critical parts of each pattern that will help determine the applicability of a pattern and its potential as a starting point are the context and problem statements. These parts should be looked at first and looked at together. Applicability can be further refined by reading the forces statement, which details the pressures, tendencies, needs, and constraints that the solution needs to resolve.

一章中的许多模式将具有重叠的上下文和/或力量。两者都不一定对每个模式都是唯一的。可能有相关的模式需要查看，尤其是在使用模式中。模式名称旨在有意义，并且在扫描有用的模式时也可以提供一个钩子。并且因为这些模式旨在成为创造性解决方案的基础，所以一些不特别适合当前环境和力量的模式可能值得考虑。

A number of patterns within a chapter will have overlapping contexts and/ or forces. Neither is meant to be necessarily unique for each pattern. There may be related patterns to look at, especially among the patterns of usage. The pattern names are intended to be meaningful and may also provide a hook when scanning for one that is useful. And because the patterns are meant to be the basis for creative solutions, some patterns that do not specifically fit the context and forces at hand may be worth considering.

资源、来源和参考

Resources, Sources, and References

模式和 UML 都是在过去六年中出现的，当时 Internet 对系统世界中人们的交流方式产生了如此巨大的影响。这里的大部分内容都是从公开来源中挑选出来的；大多数都可以在万维网上找到。Internet 的邮件列表和电子邮件设施对于支持本书的研究也至关重要。在很大程度上，这本书在互联网出现之前是不可能的。

Both patterns and the UML emerged in the last half-dozen years, when the Internet made such a big impact on the way people in the systems world communicate. Much of what is here is culled from publicly available sources; most is available on the World Wide Web. The Internet's mailing lists and e-mail facilities were also critical for supporting the research that went into this book. To a significant extent, this book would not have been possible before the Internet.

最著名的模式资料来源是WikiWikiWeb 站点，也称为 Portland Pattern Repository。由 Ward Cunningham 创立，他是模式、CRC 卡和其他将系统与人连接起来的此类工具的先驱，这个站点是对模式社区的迷人而独特的一瞥，也许就像蜘蛛的多面眼睛所看到的那样。

The most notable source for material on patterns is the WikiWikiWeb site, also known as the Portland Pattern Repository. Started by Ward Cunningham, a pioneer of patterns, CRC cards, and other such tools for connecting systems to people, this site is a fascinating and idiosyncratic glimpse at the patterns community, perhaps as seen by the multifaceted eye of a spider.

它使用一种利用 Web 最被忽视的超文本功能的技术，结合了模式片段、较长的漫无边际的观察和个人轶事，以及自由形式的评论。结果是独一无二的。任何人都可以贡献。每个贡献都可以由任何人以自由形式添加、编辑、删除和连接到其他贡献。它使 Web 成为它应有的样子：一种支持我将要解释的内容的工具是一个非常重要的虚拟实践社区。

Using a technology that exploits the mostly neglected hypertext capabilities of the Web, it combines snippets of patterns, longer rambling observations and personal anecdotes, and freeform commenting. The results are unique. Anyone can contribute. Each contribution can be added to, edited, erased, and connected to other contributions in a free-form fashionby anyone. It results in the Web being what it should be: a tool for supporting what I will explain is a very vital and virtual community of practice.

我使用了各种模式的邮件列表、杂志网站文章和模式书籍来获取关于改变想法、改变态度的详细信息，并作为特定材料的来源。邮件列表提供了指向我引用和参考的来源的指针，并且在其他方​​面可用作模式社区最近演变的档案。

I used the various patterns' mailing lists, magazine Web site articles, and patterns books for details on changing ideas, changing attitudes, and as sources for specific material. The mailing lists provided pointers to sources that I quote and reference and are otherwise useful as an archive of the recent evolution of the patterns community.

已经出版的少数好书提供了想法的即时快照和真实模式的详尽示例。为了与模式哲学保持一致，模式书籍中的许多最佳模式也可以在 Web 上找到，它们在 Web 上受到不断的批评、演变和反思。软件开发杂志的文章和专栏不如列表（和 WikiWikiWeb）直接，但比书籍更容易访问。他们提供了一个额外的宝贵的批评和洞察力来源。

The handful of good books that have been published have provided frozen-in-time snapshots of ideas and intensive examples of real patterns. In keeping with the philosophy of patterns, many of the best patterns in the patterns books are also available on the Web, where they are subject to ongoing criticism, evolution, and reflection. Software development magazines have articles and columns that are both less immediate than the lists (and WikiWikiWeb) and more accessible than the books. They provide an additional invaluable source of critiquing and insight.

UML 源是模式源的镜像，因为它们反映了组织“官方”计划与社区出现的计划之间的差异。直接用于 Web 的材料是次要的，尽管大部分材料都可以在 Web 上获得。

The UML sources are a mirror image of those for patterns, as they reflect the difference between organizational "official" initiatives and those that emerge from a community. Material directly meant for the Web is secondary, although much of the material is available on the Web.

因为 UML 是由组织（特别是被称为对象管理组的元组织和被称为 Rational 软件的商业开发工具组织）驱动的倡议，官方和匿名的 UML 声明已经取代了 WikiWikiWeb 的让步一个中央来源。然而，专门用于剖析 UML 和谴责其作者的邮件列表（尤其是 OTUG 邮件列表及其由 Rational 维护的变体）作为态度和高度的来源是最有用的，这是一个更高层次的观点。

Because the UML is an initiative driven by organizations (in particular, the metaorganization known as the Object Management Group and the commercial development tools organization known as Rational Software), official and anonymous UML pronouncements have substituted for the give-and-take of WikiWikiWeb as a central source. However, the mailing lists dedicated to dissecting the UML and castigating its authors (especially the OTUG mailing list and its variants that are maintained by Rational) have been most useful as sources of attitude and altitude, that is a higher-level perspective.

其他非系统著作直接为我的书做出了贡献。特别是 Donald Schon 的The Reflective Practitioner (1983)和托马斯库恩的科学革命的结构(1970) 提供了一些关于专业从业者如何工作和思考的有趣见解，阐明了模式和 UML 的各个方面。而且，自然地，克里斯托弗·亚历山大的所有作品都具有批判性。

Other, non-system works have contributed directly to my book. In particular, Donald Schon's The Reflective Practitioner(1983) and Thomas Kuhn's The Structure Of Scientific Revolutions (1970) provide some intriguing insights into how professional practitioners work and think that elucidate aspects of both patterns and the UML. And, naturally, all of Christopher Alexander's works have been critical.

各种网站以及杂志和书籍的集合反映了我们所处的新知识文化。例如，许多引述是有意从二手资料中摘取的（电子邮件信息、网络论文和 WikiWikiWeb 材料提供的参考资料）。他们展示了开发人员认为为他们所做的事情增添了意义的引语。不过，必须要说的是，我所写的大部分内容都是基于我自己非常普遍的经历。在从这个公共仓库中进行选择时，我一直是故意个人化的、有选择性的，也许是特别的——为了更好地讲述这个故事。

The various Web sites and collections of magazines and books reflect the new intellectual culture we're living in. For example, many of the quotes are deliberately taken from secondary sources (references provided by email messages, Web papers, and WikiWikiWeb material). They show the quotes that developers feel add meaning to what they do. Still, it must be said, much of what I write about is based on my own very general experience. In selecting from this public storehouse, I've been deliberately personal, selective, and perhaps idiosyncraticthe better to tell the story well.

第一部分：入门

Part I: Getting Started

我开始

1 模式要点

1 Pattern Essentials

2 统一建模语言

2 The Unified Modeling Language

3 UML 要素、元素和工件

3 UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts

第 1 章模式要点

Chapter 1. Pattern Essentials

这里的新内容是这里没有新内容。模式是关于什么有效。模式为我们提供了一种讨论什么有效的方法。

Brian Foote，模式作家 (1997, ix)

What's new here is that there's nothing new here. Patterns are about what works. Patterns give us a way to talk about what works.

Brian Foote, pattern writer (1997, ix)

什么是模式？为什么模式很重要，为什么有用？这些是本章要回答的问题。

What are patterns? Why are patterns important, and why are they useful? These are the questions answered in this chapter.

尽管给出了理解模式的解释，但与软件开发工具库中的任何其他工具相比，更好地使用模式需要了解表单本身的背景。

Although an explanation of understanding patterns is given, using patterns well requires an understanding of the background to the form itselfmore so than for any other tool in the software development arsenal.

模式隐藏了许多文化和概念的“包袱”，作为回报提供了一种压缩的强度和一种经济的表达方式。通过研究文献，体验过模式力量的模式用户已经获得了这个包袱，无论是默认（通过重复使用）还是明确地。这与模型相反，模型的句法和语义充当模型消息的解码器环。但它也解释了模型和模式作为成功和注重质量的软件开发工具的互补性。

Patterns hide a lot of cultural and conceptual "baggage," providing a compressed intensity and an economy of expression in return. Patterns users who experience the power of patterns have acquired this baggage, either tacitly (through repeated use) or explicitly, by studying the literature. This is the opposite of models, for which syntax and semantics act as decoder rings for the model message. But it also explains the complementarity of models and patterns as tools for successful and quality-focused software development.

因此，本章介绍行李作为如何使用本书的一部分。稍后，有一个更个性化的技术主题说明（参见第 9 章，“上下文中的模式”）。但请注意。这本书被认为是一段旅程的起点，如果你想踏上这段旅程，这两章都是必要的。幸运的是，与现实生活不同，一路上行李越来越轻。

So, this chapter introduces the baggage as part of how to use the book. Later on, there is a more personalized account of a technical subject(see Chapter 9, "Patterns in Context" ). But be warned. This book is conceived as a starting point for a journey, and if you want to make that journey, both chapters are necessary. Fortunately, unlike in real life, the baggage gets lighter along the way.

1.1 模式与范式

1.1 Patterns and Paradigms

在他现在的经典书，科学革命的结构，托马斯·库恩挪用了范式这个词, 扭曲意思以适应新的需要。库恩用它来表示具有两个特征的重大成就：

In his now-classic book, The Structure of Scientific Revolutions, Thomas Kuhn appropriated the word paradigm, twisting the meaning to suit a new need. Kuhn used it to mean significant achievements that share two characteristics:

  • 它们“史无前例，足以吸引一群持久的追随者远离竞争性的活动模式。”

  • They are "sufficiently unprecedented to attract an enduring group of adherents away from competing modes of activity."

  • 它们“足够开放，可以将各种问题留给重新定义的从业者群体来解决”（1970 年，第 10 页）。

  • They are "sufficiently open ended to leave all sorts of problems for the redefined group of practitioners to resolve" (1970, 10).

库恩的拨款非常成功，以至于 范式现在甚至被进一步挪用到成为行话的地步。

Kuhn's appropriation was so successful that paradigm has now been even further appropriated to the point of becoming jargon.

他的含义、相关的革命概念以及由此产生的世界观变化是理解模式和统一建模语言 (UML) 最有用的起点。库恩对范式转变方式的分析重塑正常世界的运作是对过去五年软件开发中发生的事件的最好解释。

His meaning, his associated notions of revolution, and the change in world-view that results are the most useful starting points for understanding patterns and the Unified Modeling Language (UML). Kuhn's analysis of the way that a paradigm shift reshapes the workings of the normal world is the best explanation for events that have taken place in the last half-decade in software development.

库恩解释了一种新的范式是如何从思想革命中产生的。这使得科学家们以后有可能从事他所谓的常规科学：一种科学实践，在这种实践中，构成问题的定义以及达成解决方案时可接受的内容均由构成范式转变的重大成就提供。从这个角度来看，新范式不是关于革命，而是关于完成工作。新范式建立后，明智和传统的人就会涌入。新范式提供了其他人可以用来弄清楚革命的含义和应用革命的工具和例子。

Kuhn explained how a new paradigm emerges from a revolution in ideas. This makes it possible afterwards for scientists to engage in what he called normal science: a scientific practice in which the definition of what constitutes a problem and what is acceptable in arriving at a solution are both provided by the significant achievements that constitute the paradigm shift. Seen this way, new paradigms are not about revolution, but rather about getting the job done. After a new paradigm is established, sensible and conventional people rush in. The new paradigm provides the tools and examples that everyone else can use in figuring out what the revolution means and in applying the revolution.

在信息时代到来之前，库恩所描述的正常世界仅限于真正的知识工作者在计算机出现之前就存在的：科学家和学者。现在，Peter Drucker 所说的知识工作者和 Robert Reich 所说的符号分析师是新知识经济中的问题解决者 (Nonaka and Takeuchi 1995, 7)。

The normal world Kuhn describes was, until the advent of the information age, limited to the only real knowledge workers that existed before the computer: scientists and academics. Now, what Peter Drucker calls knowledge workers and Robert Reich calls symbolic analysts are the people who are problem-solvers in the new knowledge-based economy (Nonaka and Takeuchi 1995, 7).

具有讽刺意味的是，库恩重新设计的范式的传统意义（结果现在几乎消失了）是一种公认​​的模型或模式。在后来对他的书进行了修订，库恩承认他赋予范式的多重含义令人困惑。他的回应是建议将范例添加到范例中可能是一个很好的术语。通过建议这个术语，他指的是理科学生在学习中接触到的经验模式，表示为在掌握科学的过程中必须解决的问题。这很像软件模式的一个用意：提供问题的例子，由高手解决，可供下属学习。没有经验。

Ironically, the conventional meaning of paradigm that Kuhn reworked, which has now almost disappeared as a result, is that of an accepted model or pattern. In later revisions of his book, Kuhn accepted that the multiple meanings he attached to paradigm were confusing. He responded by suggesting that exemplar might be a good term to add to paradigm. By suggesting this term instead, he meant the patterns of experience that science students were exposed to in their studies, expressed as problems that had to be solved in the course of mastering science. This is very much like one of the intentions of software patterns: to provide examples of problems, as solved by the masters, which can be learned from by the inexperienced.

这正在重塑软件开发人员和用户世界的软件开发新范式基本上基于模式和模型。体现在 UML 中的模式运动和公认的软件文档方法都是一场革命的关键要素，这场革命正在改变软件开发，在这场千禧年革命结束时，这场革命终于开始实现计算机可以做什么的炒作 对于我们其他人。

The new paradigm in software development, which is reshaping the world of both software developers and users, is substantially based on patterns and models. The patterns movement and the accepted approach for software documentation that is embodied in the UML are both critical elements in a revolution that is transforming software development at the end of this millenniuma revolution that is finally starting to live up to the hype of what computers can do for the rest of us.

1.1.1 模式的概念

1.1.1 The Idea of a Pattern

定义模式是那些挑战我们通常都想围绕想法设置的简单界限的那些非常困难的练习之一。根据牛津英语词典，模式是“一种规则或逻辑形式”、“一种模型、设计或制作某物的说明”或“一个很好的例子”。在软件开发中，所有这些含义都适用。

Defining a pattern is one of those deliciously difficult exercises that challenges the easy boundaries we all usually want to place around ideas. According to the Oxford English Dictionary, a pattern is "a regular or logical form," "a model, design or instructions for making something," or "an excellent example." In software development, all of these meanings apply.

作为“一种规则或逻辑形式”，模式现在是包装软件设计经验（特别是面向对象的软件设计经验）的一种公认方式。即使模式编写者使用了多种格式，也存在将所有软件模式绑定在一起的潜在相似性。

As "a regular or logical form," patterns are now an accepted way of packaging software design experience (specifically, object-oriented software design experience). Even with the variety of formats that have been used by pattern writers, there's an underlying similarity that binds all software patterns together.

解释模式有用性的最简单方法体现在第二个定义中，尤其是制作某物的指令的想法。从根本上说，图案是关于制作事物——想想缝纫图案和食谱，每一种都可以由有经验的用户进行调整。模式与工程无关，工程需要蓝图、建筑计划和其他特定且（最终）具有法律约束力的常规文档。相反，它们启发了普通工匠制作事物的设计和建造的正常过程。

The simplest way of explaining the usefulness of patterns is embodied in the second definition, especially the idea of instructions for making something. Fundamentally, patterns are about crafting thingsthink of sewing patterns and recipes, each of which are open to adaptation by experienced users. Patterns are not about engineering, which requires blueprints, building plans, and other conventional documents that are specific and (ultimately) legally binding. Instead, they enlighten the normal processes of designing and buildingthe ways ordinary craftspeople make things.

然而，正如我之前建议的那样，它们以两种非常实用的方式补充了模型和其他工程工具。首先，他们解释所解决问题的逻辑，然后提供解决问题的指导方针。如果使用得当，图案可以帮助普通工匠做出非凡的事情。

However, as I suggested earlier, they complement models and other engineering tools in two very practical ways. First, they explain the logic of the problem being solved, and then they provide the guidelines for solving the problem. Used properly, patterns help ordinary craftspeople to do extraordinary things.

对于本书，我关注的是制作软件以及制作软件所需的组织、架构和流程——使此类构建成为可能的基础设施。但是，与方法论不同的是，这些说明并不是定义明确的活动的逻辑顺序中的硬性规定。相反，它们更接近于开放实验的烹饪食谱，以创造性的方式组合起来做一顿饭。

For this book, I'm concerned with crafting software and the organization, architecture, and processes needed to craft itthe infrastructure that makes such building possible. But, unlike a methodology, these instructions are not hard and fast rules in a logical sequence of well-defined activities. Rather, they're closer to cooking recipesopen to experimentationto be combined in creative ways to make a meal.

对模式力量的理解来自第三个定义——模式是“一个优秀的例子”，它为启动和指导软件开发的创造性方面提供了一个非规范性的来源。它们为新手开发人员提供起点，为有经验的开发人员提供提醒，以及分享经验教训的方式。

An understanding of the power of patterns comes from the third definitionpatterns as "an excellent example," providing a non-prescriptive source for initiating and guiding the creative aspects of software development. They provide starting points for novice developers, reminders for experienced developers, and a way of sharing lessons learned.

还有其他非正式定义也有助于理解为什么模式在软件开发中如此重要：

There are other informal definitions that also help round out an understanding of why patterns are so important in software development:

  • 从广义上讲，模式可以看作是记录最佳实践的一种形式。在一个缺乏数百年经验和工程或建筑科学基础的行业中，最佳实践已成为确保了解风险和使用普遍接受的技术和技术的试金石。模式为它们提供了标准格式和存储库，取代了迄今为止关于最佳做事方式的轶事报告和文档。

  • From a broad perspective, a pattern can be seen as a form for documenting best practices. In a profession that lacks centuries of experience and scientific underpinnings of engineering or architecture, best practices have become a touchstone for ensuring that risks are understood and that commonly accepted techniques and technologies are used. Patterns provide a standard format and repository for themreplacing what has been, until now, anecdotal reporting and documentation of the best ways to do things.

  • 从狭义的角度来看，模式可以被视为经验法则：一种启发式的快速方法，为解决问题提供起点。软件开发工艺在其短暂的历史中产生了许多经验法则。模式可以为他们提供一个正式而不挑剔的家。

  • From a narrower perspective, a pattern can be seen as a rule of thumb: a heuristicquick way of providing a starting point for solving a problem. The craft of software development has generated many rules of thumb in its brief history. Patterns can provide a home for them that is formalized without being fussy.

  • 最后，甚至更狭义地说，可以将模式视为模板并将其用作模板。这个定义抓住了模式的一个关键方面：它们可以在不同的情况下一遍又一遍地应用。它们不是具体的解决方案，而是解决方案的基础。而且，在软件开发中，它们源于软件解决方案本身往往是重复的这一事实。对于信息系统中的任何设计问题，无论是软件架构问题还是开发组织问题，都只有一小部分解决方案。

  • Finally, and even more narrowly, a pattern can be viewed and used as a template. This definition captures a critical aspect of patterns: they can be applied over and over again, in different situations. They are not specific solutions, but rather the basis for a solution. And, in software development, they derive from the fact that software solutions themselves tend to be repetitive. There is only a small set of solutions for any design problem in information systems, whether the problem is in software architecture or in development organization.

这些定义直接来自系统社区。他们认为，模式通过取代以前存在的分享经验和知识的方法，在许多方面提供了一种更有条理和一致的交流方式。简而言之，他们认为模式只是一种比传统方法更有效的捕获和表达开发人员隐性知识的方法，方法是让这些知识以方便和通用的形式显式地提供给所有人。

These definitions are drawn directly from the systems community. They suggest that patterns, in many ways, provide a more organized and consistent way of communicating by replacing previously existing methods for sharing experience and knowledge. In short, they suggest that patterns are simply a more effective way of capturing and expressing the developer's tacit knowledge than, for example, traditional methodologies, by making such knowledge explicit and available for all in a convenient and general form.

当然，模式社区中所做的工作对模式有更全面和正式的定义。我将在第 9 章详细讨论这些内容。更正式的定义和相关的哲学有一席之地，但它们对于为普通用户评估和应用模式并不重要。

Of course, there are more comprehensive and formal definitions of a pattern that come out of the work done in the patterns community. I'll discuss these in detail in Chapter 9. The more formal definitions and associated philosophies have a place, but they are not critical to evaluating and applying patterns for the average user.

在本书中，我不会盲目地支持模式的任何一种定义。我认为所有非正式定义都是有用的，因为它们可以提供一种开始思考和使用模式的方法。然而，需要有一个更严格的工作定义来帮助制作这本书有用。

In this book, I don't slavishly support any one definition of a pattern. I consider all of the informal definitions to be useful, because they can provide a way to start thinking about and using patterns. However, there needs to be a more rigorous working definition to help make this book useful.

1.2 模式元素

1.2 Elements of Patterns

模式为指导设计和开发的经验法则和模型解决方案可以在对象出现之前以及在对模式进行任何有纪律的考虑之前很久就可以在系统社区中找到。

Patterns as rules of thumb and model solutions for guiding design and development could be found in the systems community before objects appeared and long before any disciplined consideration of patterns.

在结构化分析和设计等活动中，耦合和内聚等概念，七加或减二的视觉规则，或者基于主模块的程序架构的概念都提供了模式所提供的那种打包的洞察力。然而，构成软件模式基础的模式的特殊概念来自另一个领域：架构和 Christopher Alexander 的工作在 60 年代和 70 年代。

In activities such as structured analysis and design, concepts such as coupling and cohesion, the visual rule of Seven Plus or Minus Two, or the notion of a program architecture based around a main module all provided the kind of packaged insight that patterns offer. However, the special notion of patterns that formed the basis for software patterns came out of another field: architecture and the work of Christopher Alexander in the '60s and '70s.

在尝试为设计建立数学基础时，Alexander 开始使用图表来捕捉良好设计解决方案应解决的力之间的关系。虽然这些他后来称之为模式的图表只是最终书中的一小部分，但他后来决定它们而不是数学才是关键思想。

While trying to establish a mathematical basis for design, Alexander started using diagrams to capture the relationships between forces that a good design solution should resolve. Although these diagrams, which he later dubbed patterns, were only a small part of the resulting book, he decided afterward that they, not the mathematics, were the key ideas.

他看到他的图的独立性、模块化和抽象性使它们能够为各种设计本身提供一个起点，特别是通过根据需要组合它们。他们以一种简单、易于使用且易于理解的方式做到了这一点。

He saw that the independence, modularity, and abstractness of his diagrams enabled them to provide a starting point for a variety of designs by themselves, in particular, by combining them as needed. And they did this in a simple, easy to use, and easy to understand way.

Alexander 和他的合作伙伴随后出版的书籍将重点转移到了模式上。他们为架构模式的正式定义和软件开发模式思想的核心奠定了概念基础。语言中的每个模式：

Subsequent books by Alexander and his partners switched the focus to patterns. They established the conceptual basis for a formal definition of patterns in architecture and the core of the idea of patterns for software development. Each pattern in the language:

“描述一个反复出现的问题”，然后描述该问题解决方案的核心，您可以使用该解决方案一百万次，而无需重复使用相同的方法。（Alexander、Ishikawa 和 Silverstein 1977，x）

describes a problem which occurs over and over againand then describes the core of the solution to that problem in such a way that you can use this solution a million times over, without doing it the same way twice. (Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977, x)

顺便说一下，这不是Alexander对模式的正式定义，但它是一个活生生的工作描述。亚历山大对图案的定义具有极简主义特征。引用最多的一句话是这样的：

By the way, this is not Alexander's formal definition of a pattern, but it is a working description that lives and breathes. Alexander's definitions of pattern have a minimalist character. The one most often quoted is this:

每个模式都是一个由三部分组成的规则，它表达了特定上下文、问题和解决方案之间的关系。(1979, 247)

Each pattern is a three-part rule, which expresses a relation between a certain context, a problem, and a solution. (1979, 247)

简短、甜美、简单——它确定了基本元素。值得注意的是，模式由三个部分组成，而不仅仅是两个部分。添加的部分上下文对于适合问题的解决方案至关重要。上下文包含一个 在问题解决之前，力量系统是不平衡的。

Short, sweet, simpleand it identifies the basic elements. What's noticeable is the idea that a pattern has three parts, not just two. The added partthe contextis critical for fitting a solution to a problem. The context contains a system of forces that is unbalanced until the problem is resolved.

在 Alexander 的模式中，解决方案本身就是一种平衡行为。它成为一种构建必须制作的组件的方式，以便影响它们的力量和它们反过来影响的力量是协调的。真正的解决方案会考虑这些力量、压力、趋势、需求和约束，并在最终结果中平衡它们。

In Alexander's patterns, the solution itself is a balancing act. It becomes a way of structuring the components of what has to be crafted so that the forces that affect them and that they affect in turn are harmonized. A real solution takes into account these forcespressures, trends, needs, and constraintsand balances them all in the end result.

最后，亚历山大发现单独的模式是不够的；需要的是一种由模式编织而成的语言。这种特殊的语言将是他和他的同事们在规划和建设中获得的经验的升华。而且，为从当地社区改善到建造房屋的各个层面的规划、设计和建造提供指导和通用词汇将是切实可行的。

Finally, Alexander saw that individual patterns by themselves were not enough; what was needed was a language woven of patterns. This special language would be a distillation of the experience that he and his fellow authors acquired in planning and building. And, it would be practicalproviding guidance and a common vocabulary for planning, designing, and building at a variety of levels, from local neighborhood improvement to constructing a house.

通过这些概念，Alexander 确定了一个模式的所有关键元素——它们由什么组成以及如何组织它们。软件开发人员采纳了他的概念，对它们进行了阐述、增强，并对它们进行了争论。关键概念保持不变。在大多数方面，只有元素和包装与亚历山大的不同描述。

With these concepts, Alexander identifies all the critical elements of a patternwhat they're made of and how to organize them. Software developers have taken his concepts, elaborated them, enhanced them, and argued about them. The key concepts remain the same. In most ways, only the elements and packaging are different from what Alexander described.

在对模式的基本结构和模式的组织方式进行更实质性的描述之前，让我们先看一个模式示例，并提供目前可用的信息。想要更详细、更丰富多彩地了解图案的诞生和图案的多样性软件模式，请参阅第 9 章“上下文中的模式”。

Before getting into a more substantial description of the essential structure of patterns and the way patterns are organized, let's look at an example of a pattern, given the information available so far. For a more detailed and colorful account of the birth of patterns and the variety of software patterns, see Chapter 9, "Patterns in Context."

1.2.1 一个简单的例子

1.2.1 A Simple Example

这以下示例与建模密切相关，它说明了如何将经验法则解释为模式。经验法则是七加或减二。有趣的是，它很好地转化为不是一种模式，而是两种捆绑在一起的模式，就像一种微型模式语言。它说明了建模如何成为一项基本的人类活动。

The following example is closely related to modeling, and it illustrates how a rule of thumb can be interpreted as a pattern. The rule of thumb is Seven Plus or Minus Two. Interestingly, it translates nicely into not one pattern, but two patterns that are tied together, like a miniature pattern language. It illustrates how modeling is a fundamental human activity.

这是对问题、上下文和解决方案的非正式描述。

Here's an informal description of the problem, context, and solution(s).

从最早的软件建模开始，很明显，包含许多元素的图表不容易理解，也不能很好地传达信息。任何看过信息工程太平时期典型企业数据模型的人都会记得那些虚拟自我模仿的图表，看似无数的几何形状、线条和曲线似乎在为生存而战。

From the earliest days of software modeling, it was obvious that diagrams loaded down with many elements were not easy to understand and did not communicate well. Anyone who's seen the typical Enterprise Data Model from the halcyon period of information engineering will remember diagrams that were virtual self-parodies, on which seemingly numberless geometric shapes, lines, and squiggles seemed to be fighting for survival.

解决图表过载问题的标准方法是（现在仍然是）将模型本身分解成一组易于消化的部分。这种方法反映了人类已知的认知策略，称为组块：根据模式（这次是认知模式）将逻辑上相关的项目组织成组，并考虑组而不是单个项目。

The standard way of resolving the problem of diagram overload was (and still is) to break down the model itself into a set of digestible pieces. This approach reflected a known cognitive strategy among humans, which is called chunking: organizing logically related items into groups based on patterns (cognitive patterns this time), and thinking about the groups rather than the individual items.

模型元素本身就是块。它们抽象出与每个元素关联的多个属性。但是这种策略产生了另一个问题：如何分块？

Model elements are chunks themselves. They abstract the multiple properties associated with each element. But this strategy creates another problem: how to chunk?

这就是七加或减二的用武之地。模式识别本身取决于人类短期记忆的能力。潜在认知模式中的各个元素只有在短期记忆中才能关联和组织起来，而短期记忆只能管理有限数量的项目。事实证明，这个数字（根据情况略有不同）是（当然）七加或减二 (7±2)。

This is where Seven Plus or Minus Two comes in. Pattern recognition is itself dependent on the capabilities of human short-term memory. Individual elements in a potential cognitive pattern can be related and organized only if they are in short-term memory, and short-term memory can manage only a limited number of items. It turns out that this number, which varies only slightlydepending on the circumstances, is (of course) Seven Plus or Minus Two (7±2).

因此，理想的模型应该由许多图组成，每个图有 7±2 个主要元素。事实上，模型本身应该被组织成多个级别，以便每个级别有 7±2 个图表。当然，诸如 UML 之类的建模语言添加了可以扩展规则限制的语义和句法规则，但仅限于一定程度并且仅在适当的上下文中。

So, the ideal model should consist of a number of diagrams, each of which has 7±2 main elements. In fact, the model should itself be organized into a number of levels so that each level has 7±2 diagrams. Of course, a modeling language such as the UML adds semantic and syntactical rules that can stretch the limits of the rule, but only to an extentand only within an appropriate context.

那么，所有这些看起来如何表达为一种或多种模式？我将从一种模式开始，我们可以将其命名为七加或减二。

So, how does all of this look expressed as one or more patterns? I'll start with one pattern, which we can name Seven Plus or Minus Two.

上下文_正在构建软件图。在这种情况下，我们有各种力量我们必须平衡，例如：

The context is building diagrams of software. Within this context, we have a variety of forces that we have to balance, such as the following:

  • 模型由图表组成。

  • Models are made up of diagrams.

  • 图表必须传达对现实世界有用的看法。

  • Diagrams have to communicate useful views of the real world.

  • 模型必须全面但有重点。

  • A model must be comprehensive but focused.

  • 现实世界可能是复杂的、混乱的和没有重点的。

  • The real world can be complex, messy, and unfocused.

  • 图本身并不受它们可以包含的元素数量的限制。

  • Diagrams are not inherently limited in the number of elements they can contain.

  • 人类对图表的理解受到人类认知能力（例如短期记忆）的限制。人类的认知资源是有限的。也就是说，他们一次只能关注这么多的事情，只能进行这么多的活动。

  • Human understanding of diagrams is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities, such as short-term memory. Humans have limited cognitive resources. That is, they can attend to only so many things and perform only so many activities at once.

在这个上下文，问题是如何制作易于掌握的图表。

In this context, the problem is how to make diagrams that can be grasped easily.

解决方案是将任何给定图表中的元素数量限制为神奇数字 7，给定或采用两个元素。这些元素应该在逻辑上相关；图表结构应该表达连接图表元素的合理模式。

The solution is to limit the number of elements in any given diagram to the magic number of seven, give or take two elements. These elements should be logically related; the diagram structure should express a sensible pattern connecting the diagram elements.

在这种微型模式语言中，实际上还有另一种不同层次的模式。比建筑图更上一层楼正在建立模型。尽管在这个层面上存在许多相同的力量，但如何制作有效模型的具体问题增加了一些其他必须解决的问题。将名为 Digestible Chunks 的模式视为该问题的一种解决方案。

There's actually another pattern, at a different level, in this miniature pattern language. One level up from that of building diagrams is building models. Although many of the same forces are present at this level, the specific problem of how to make models that work adds a few others that have to be resolved. Look at the pattern called Digestible Chunks as one solution to this problem.

这次的上下文是构建模型（而不是图表）。在这种情况下，大多数力量看起来都很熟悉：

The context this time is building models (as opposed to diagrams). Within this context, most of the forces will look familiar:

  • 模型必须全面但有重点。

  • A model must be comprehensive but focused.

  • 现实世界可能是复杂的、混乱的和没有重点的。

  • The real world can be complex, messy, and unfocused.

  • 模型必须传达对现实世界有用的观点。

  • Models have to communicate useful views of the real world.

  • 人类对图表和模型的理解受到人类认知能力（例如短期记忆）的限制。

  • Human understanding of diagrams and models is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities, such as short-term memory.

  • 模型由一个或多个必须组织的连接图组成。

  • Models are made up of one or more connected diagrams that have to be organized.

  • 人类组织模型的能力也受到人类认知能力的限制。

  • Human ability to organize models is also constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities.

显着的区别是我添加了组织需求到我们的名单。

The significant difference is that I've added organizing needs to our list.

解决方案是将模型分块成图表，这些图表是可消化的位，这些位具有单独的意义并以合理的方式连接。一个有助于弄清楚如何构建这些可消化位的相关模式当然是七加或减二。

The solution is to chunk the models into diagrams that are digestible bits, which are individually meaningful and connected in a sensible fashion. A related pattern useful for figuring out how to build these digestible bits is, of course, Seven Plus or Minus Two.

当然，我可以定义其他模式来解决与建模软件相关的问题，稍后我将介绍其中一些更特定于使用 UML 进行建模的模式。然而，这两种模式不仅说明了模式的基本元素，而且还说明了一些独特且必要的特征模式。

Naturally, there are other patterns that I could define that solve problems related to modeling software, and later on I will present some of these that are more specific to modeling with the UML. However, these two patterns illustrate not just the basic elements of a pattern, but also some of the distinctive and necessary characteristics of patterns.

1.3 解读本书中的模式

1.3 Interpreting the Patterns in This Book

我格式化前面两个示例模式的方式，是我从7 Plus 或 Minus Two的想法中提取出来的，是 Alexander 格式化和编写模式的方式的一个版本。然而，最先推广模式的软件开发人员并没有采用他的格式。他们选择了一种更正式、更符合他们想要完成的目标的形式。Erich Gamma 和其他人所著的设计模式：可重用面向对象软件的元素一书帮助普及了他们的格式和软件模式（1995 年）。为简单起见，我将以本书的一位作者和此类模式的创始人的名字命名格式GammaForm 。

The way I formatted the two previous example patterns, which I squeezed out of the idea of Seven Plus or Minus Two, is a version of the way Alexander formats and writes patterns. However, the software developers who first popularized patterns didn't adopt his format. They opted for a form that was more formal and more precisely attuned to what they were trying to accomplish. The book, Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma and others helped to popularize their format as well as patterns for software (1995). For simplicity, I'll call the format GammaForm after one of the book's authors and the originator of this type of pattern.

自从设计模式出版以来，吉姆Coplien（另一位模式大师和面向对象的专家）已经成为一种更宽松的格式最引人注目的代言人，我将其称为CoplienForm (1995)。虽然比最小格式更扩展，但它仍然简洁；与 GammaForm 模式相比，结果往往不那么冗长和说教。许多软件模式都遵循这种通用格式或 GammaForm 格式的某些版本。

Since the publication of Design Patterns, Jim Coplien (another patterns guru and object-oriented expert) has become the most visible spokesperson for a looser format, which I'll call CoplienForm (1995). Although more extended than a minimal format would be, it is still succinct; the results tend to be less verbose and less didactic than GammaForm patterns. Many software patterns follow some version of this generic format or the GammaForm format.

GammaForm 的扩展解释格式可以在第 9 章找到。我的模式语言使用了 CoplienForm 的轻微修改。下面是七加或减二（上面的示例模式之一）如何以这种方式表达。我已将此模式包含在语言的正文中。模式部分的解释遵循模式。

An extended explanation of the GammaForm format can be found in Chapter 9. My pattern language uses a slight modification of CoplienForm. Here's how Seven Plus or Minus Two (one of the example patterns above) would look expressed this way. I've included this pattern in the body of the language. An explanation of the pattern's sections follows the pattern.

七加或减二（形式化）

Seven Plus or Minus Two (formalized)

姓名

NAME

七加减二

Seven Plus or Minus Two

问题

PROBLEM

如何制作易于掌握的图表。

How to make diagrams that can be grasped easily.

语境

CONTEXT

构建本身是整体模型一部分的图表。在这种情况下，我们特别关注软件模型，但该模式可以应用于使用标准化建模元素和语法的任何类型的潜在复杂模型。

Building diagrams that are themselves part of an overall model. In this case, we are specifically concerned with software models, but the pattern could apply to any type of potentially complex model using standardized modeling elements and syntax.

军队

FORCES

  • 模型由图表组成。

  • Models are made up of diagrams.

  • 图表必须传达真实世界的有用观点。

  • Diagrams have to communicate usefulviews of the real world.

  • 模型必须全面但有重点。

  • A model must be comprehensive but focused.

  • 现实世界可能是复杂的、混乱的和没有重点的。

  • The real world can be complex, messy, and unfocused.

  • 图本身并不受它们可以包含的元素数量的限制。

  • Diagrams are not inherently limited in the number of elements they can contain.

  • 人类对图表的理解受到人类认知能力（例如短期记忆）的限制。

  • Human understanding of diagrams is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities, such as short-term memory.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将任何给定图表中的元素数量限制为神奇的七，给定或取两个元素。这些元素应该在逻辑上相关；图表结构应该表达连接图表元素的合理模式。

Limit the number of elements in any given diagram to the magic number of seven, give or take two elements. These elements should be logically related; the diagram structure should express a sensible pattern connecting the diagram elements.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

图表一目了然，可以按逻辑方式组织成更复杂的模型。

Diagrams that are easy to understand at a glance and can be organized in a logical fashion into more complex models.

讨论

DISCUSSION

人类的认知资源是有限的。也就是说，他们一次只能关注这么多事情并进行有限数量的活动。图表中太多的元素可能会造成混淆，并且很难一次全部保留在短期记忆中。这种模式提供了一种简单的方法来确保元素的数量对大多数人来说是合理的。相关模式 Chunking 解释了如何以及为什么将模型分解为逻辑图的过程作品。

Humans have limited cognitive resources. That is, they can only attend to so many things and perform a limited amount of activities at once. Too many elements in adiagram can be confusing and are hard to retain in short term memory all at once. This pattern provides a simple way of ensuring that the number of elements is reasonable for most people. The related pattern, Chunking, explains how and why the process of decomposing a model into logical diagrams works.

1.3.1 本书的花样格式

1.3.1 This Book's Pattern Format

Coplien 建议模式的名称应该像第一个出生的孩子的名字一样谨慎选择。模式名称应该简洁、好记且相关。做起来自然比说起来难多了。至少，我试图让本书中模式的名称能够表达它们的可能用途。

Coplien suggests that the name for a pattern should be chosen with as much care as the name for a first born child. Pattern names should be succinct, memorable, and relevant. Naturally, this is much more difficult to do than to say. At the very least, I've tried to make the names of the patterns in this book expressive of their possible usage.

问题是模式响应什么的最简单陈述，为潜在用户提供了评估模式有用性的快速方法。（请记住，这种语言处理的问题类型是那些与建模、使用模型或管理模型相关的问题。）

The problem is the easiest statement of what the pattern is a response to, providing the potential user with a quick way of assessing the usefulness of the pattern. (Remember that the kind of problems this language deals with are those connected with modeling, using models, or managing models.)

上下文提供_更有助于确定模式的适用性。它定位模式，提供有关结果可能适合典型的基于 UML 的开发工作的位置的信息。

The context provides more help in determining the applicability of a pattern. It situates the pattern, providing information about where the results might fit into a typical UML-based development effort.

部队是可以解决有关模式适用性的任何剩余不确定性的地方。我试图明确说明该模式试图解决的条件、约束和注意事项。

Forces are where any remaining uncertainties about the applicability of a pattern may be resolved. I've tried to be explicit about the conditions, constraints, and considerations that the pattern tries to resolve.

解决办法是对使用 UML 的建模者如何解决问题、上下文和力所呈现的建模问题的直接解释。它导致 结果上下文，总结了应用模式的效果，并在 discussion，这也可能提供额外的模式和/或文献参考。

The solution is a straightforward explanation of how a modeler using the UML would solve the modeling problem that the problem, context, and forces present. It leads to the resulting context, summarizing the effects of applying the pattern, and it is explained in more detail in the discussion, which may also provide additional pattern and/or literature references.

在适当的情况下，将提供示例图来阐明模式。然而，就像 UML不仅仅关于图表一样，一些 UML 模式不适合图表示例。

Where appropriate, example diagrams will be provided to clarify a pattern. However, in the same way that the UML is not only about diagrams, some UML patterns do not lend themselves to diagram examples.

这种格式旨在以最少的开销使用。与下一章介绍的 UML 一样，它（以及本书中的模式）是理论和实践之间的方便折衷。

This format is meant to be useful with a minimum of overhead. As with the UML, which the next chapter introduces, it (and the patterns in this book) is a convenient compromise between the theoretical and the practical.

第 2 章统一建模语言

Chapter 2. The Unified Modeling Language

谁掌握了过去，谁就掌握了未来。

谁主宰了未来，谁就征服了过去。

归因于乔治奥威尔

Who controls the past commands the future.

Who commands the future conquers the past.

attributed to George Orwell

UML 使建模重新成为软件开发中值得尊敬的实践。事实上，它已将建模重新置于开发聚光灯下，并使其成为与编码作为一项基本技能的平等参与者。

The UML has resurrected modeling as a respectable practice within software development. Indeed, it has moved modeling back into the development spotlight and made it an equal player with coding as an essential skill.

UML 通过提供一种全面的建模语言来做到这一点。它与用于编码的编程语言一样具有表现力、灵活性和实用性，并且至少在类似方面同样复杂。更重要的是，UML 使将面向对象模型视为在代码生产领域之外合法存在成为可能，例如，在业务建模、工作流设计和企业架构中。到目前为止，这些领域一直由其他建模方法主导。

The UML has done this by providing a comprehensive language for modeling. It is every bit as expressive, flexible, and useful as programming languages are for codingand it is at least as complicated in a similar way. More to the point, the UML has made it possible to see object-oriented models as having a legitimate existence outside of the realm of code-productionin business modeling, workflow design, and enterprise architecture, for example. These are realms that have been dominated by other modeling approaches until now.

尽管具有进化性质，UML 与之前的建模工具和语言有很大不同。这些差异使 UML 的理解变得如此重要（更不用说 UML 取代它们的原因了）。

Despite its evolutionary nature, the UML is very different from the modeling tools and languages that preceded it. These differences are what make UML so important to understand (not to mention the reasons why the UML is superseding them all).

本章将探讨 UML 在软件开发传统中的根源。它将展示 UML 如何成为那些具有适当历史的传统的一部分，以证明基于模式的方法用于描述良好的 UML 建模实践使用基于实践传统和经验法则的模式，并允许有益地包含选定的 UML 特定习语。

This chapter will explore the roots of the UML within the traditions of software development. It will show how the UML is part of those traditions with appropriate history to justify a patterns-based approach for describing good UML modeling practicesusing patterns based on practical traditions and rules of thumb and allowing for the beneficial inclusion of selected UML-specific idioms.

第 10 章“上下文中的 UML” 将探索建模和 UML（模型和建模的本质），第 3 章“UML 要素、元素和工件” 将介绍 UML 的基本元素和工件UML 以及 UML 和模式之间的联系。本质上，它讨论了模式如何以一种适合 UML 使之成为可能的新型建模的方式有助于使用 UML。

Chapter 10, "The UML in Context," will explore modeling and the UML (the nature of models and modeling), and Chapter 3, "UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts," will provide an introduction to the basic elements and artifacts of the UML and the connections between the UML and patterns. Essentially, it discusses how patterns can contribute to working with the UML in a way that fits the new kind of modeling the UML makes possible.

因此，与其将 UML 仅仅视为另一种工具，您将能够看到它如何影响您作为软件开发人员的工作方式，以及它如何使思考建模的新方法成为可能。

So, rather than seeing the UML as just another tool, you will be able to see how it can affect the way you work as a software developerhow it makes possible a new way to think about modeling.

需要明确的是，这几章的目的并不是提供 UML 的最终指南。它们只会提供足够的上下文来使模式语言变得有用和有意义。与亚历山大从中编织模式语言的建筑世界不同，UML 是一种新结构。所以，我们都需要一些基础知识的帮助。

Just to be clear, the intention of these few chapters is not to provide the ultimate guide to the UML. They will only provide enough context to make the pattern language useful and meaningful. Unlike the built world from which Alexander wove a pattern language, the UML is new fabric. So, we all need a little help with the basics.

笔记

Note

我使用术语方法论、过程和方法。对于本书，意义如下：

I use the terms methodology, process, and method. For this book, the meanings are as follows:

  • 一种方法论是一组活动、技术和最终产品的正式包装。它通常具有潜在的理论基础和相关的建模语言。

  • A methodology is a formal packaging of a set of activities, techniques, and end products. It typically has an underlying theoretical basis and an associated modeling language.

  • 一种方法是一种更小、更不全面的方法论版本。它侧重于技术和工程元素，而较少强调特定活动的顺序。

  • A method is a smaller and less-comprehensive version of a methodology. It focuses on the techniques and engineering elements, and it puts less emphasis on the sequencing of specific activities.

  • 一个过程就像一种方法论的实例，不太强调技术，更强调活动的顺序，以及为支持使用该方法论的实际需要而添加的元素（例如管理、指标和部署）。

  • A process is like an instance of a methodology with less emphasis on techniques, more emphasis on sequencing of activities, and elements added to support the practical needs of using the methodology (such as management, metrics, and deployment).

2.1 UML，简述

2.1 The UML, Briefly Put

出于对忙碌读者的需求的敏感度，我将从一个定义的速记版本开始，该定义可用于考虑随后的风格和变体。

With some sensitivity to the needs of the busy reader, I'll start with a shorthand version of a definition that can be used to consider the flavors and variations that will follow.

简而言之，UML是一种正式定义的、面向对象的开发符号。正式定义是完整和一致的，足以使 UML 成为一种语言，但它是一种正式的语言（与自然语言相对）。面向对象方面是马车情况；在许多方面，指定 UML 的努力是为了提供思考面向对象本身的新方法。

Briefly, the UML is a formally defined, object-oriented development notation. The formal definition is complete and consistent enough to qualify the UML as a type of language, but it is a formal one (as opposed to a natural language). The object-oriented aspect is a horse-and-cart situation; in many ways, the effort to specify the UML is to provide new ways to think about object-orientation itself.

UML 涵盖了从需求到部署规划的典型开发过程的整个范围。此外，它还为记录软件产品的发布提供了基础，并且是有关该领域的关键知识库的基础。

The UML encompasses the entire scope of a typical development processfrom requirements to deployment planning. In addition, it offers the basis for documenting the releases of a software product and is the basis for a repository of critical knowledge about the domain.

它统一了当代软件领域三个主要参与者的建模方法：Grady Booch、Jim Rumbaugh 和 Ivar Jacobson（自称为 Rational Software 的“三个朋友”）和从当前活跃的许多其他主要参与者中添加大量块。它旨在为建模系统提供标准符号，特别是软件密集型系统，其中预期面向对象的实现。

It unifies the modeling approaches of the three key players in the area of contemporary software: Grady Booch, Jim Rumbaugh, and Ivar Jacobson (the self-described "Three Amigos" of Rational Software) and adds substantial chunks from a number of other major players who are currently active. It aims to provide a standard notation for modeling systemsin particular, software-intensive systems where an object-oriented implementation is anticipated.

这是同类产品中第一个成功的统一，而不仅仅是在面向对象的开发中, 但在更大的信息技术领域. 它作为标准的地位来自对象管理组 (OMG) 的机构认可，一个行业联盟和对象技术领域的自封标准机构。

It is the first successful unification of its kind, not just in object-oriented development, but within the larger arena of information technology. Its status as a standard comes from the institutional imprimatur of the Object Management Group (OMG), an industry consortium and self-appointed standards body in the area of object technology.

UML 是一种标准的建模语言，不是标准的建模方法。它独立于编程语言和开发技术和过程。因此，它的有用性取决于它是如何在方法论和/或开发过程中实施的。

UML is a standard modeling language, not a standard modeling method. It is independent of programming language and development techniques and processes. As a result, it is dependent for its usefulness on how it is implemented within a methodology and/or a development process.

另一方面，UML 允许（并且可能鼓励）工具和方法/流程供应商站出来支持它，并且它在提供特性和服务方面竞争，这些特性和服务将使他们的产品差异化。符号标准设想工具供应商在实施细节方面具有一定的灵活性；该语言本身假定可以使用现代工具软件来使其工作。

On the other hand, UML allows (and perhaps encourages) tool and methodology/ process vendors to step up to the plate to support it, and it competes in providing features and services that will differentiate their product offerings. The notation standards envisage tool vendors having some flexibility in implementingthe specifics; the language itself assumes that modern tool software will be available to make it work.

无论支持供应商提供何种变体，UML 都允许使用任何方法、过程和工具集的用户通过使用一组一致的模型元素和概念来交流和交换模型。

Whatever the variations provided by the supporting vendors, UML allows users of whatever method, process, and tool set to communicate and interchange models by using a consistent set of model elements and concepts.

最后，UML 是协作开发的、可扩展的、可扩展的和灵活的，最重要的是，它是不断发展的。什么都没有雕刻石头。

Finally, UML is collaboratively developed, extensible, scalable, and flexibleand, most important, it is evolving. Nothing is carved in stone.

2.2 根源

2.2 Roots

一点需要历史作为理解 UML 的序言，并作为介绍人物角色的一种方式。

A little history is needed as a preamble to understanding the UML and as a way to introduce a cast of characters.

随着 1990 年代的开始，UML 的开发背景是软件的复杂性不断增加。主流技术无法应对网络化和信息驱动的世界。面对桌面交互、虚拟连接和需要更多、更快的事件驱动的竞争环境，严格的组织边界开始像众所周知的堤坝一样泄漏。

The context for the development of the UML was the increasing complexity of software as the 1990s began. Mainstream technology couldn't cope with a networked and information-driven world. Rigid organizational boundaries started to leak like the proverbial dike in the face of desktop interactions, virtual connections, and an event-driven competitive environment that demanded more, faster.

1991 年，托马斯·马龙和约翰·洛克特提供了一张开始出现在各处的期望图：

In 1991, Thomas Malone and John Rockart provided a picture of the expectations that were beginning to appear everywhere:

工业经济体现在正处于另一场转型的早期阶段，最终可能至少与工业革命一样重要。今天正在进行的革命将不是由生产变化驱动，而是由协调变化驱动。每当人们一起工作时，他们必须以某种方式进行沟通、做出决策、分配资源，并在正确的时间将产品和服务送到正确的地方。这些新技术将使人们能够更有效地协调，进行更多的协调，并形成新的、协调密集的业务结构。(1991, 92)
