The industrial economies are now in the early stages of another transformation that may ultimately be at least as significant as the Industrial RevolutionThe revolution underway today will be driven not by changes in production but by changes in coordination. Whenever people work together, they must somehow communicate, make decisions, allocate resources, and get products and services to the right place at the right timeThese new technologies will enable people to coordinate more effectively, to do much more coordination, and to form new, coordination-intensive business structures. (1991, 92)

Malone 和 Rockart 专注于他们所谓的“联网计算机”，将其作为正在进行的革命的基础。他们强调计算机这个词正在变得具有误导性，因为它暗示了一种计算和处理信息的机器：

Malone and Rockart focused on what they called the "networked computer" as the basis for the revolution-in-progress. They emphasized that the term computer was becoming misleading because it suggested a machine for calculating and processing information:

[T]他的计算形象并没有抓住现在如何使用计算机以及将来如何更多地使用它们的本质。计算机和计算机网络可能不会作为主要用于计算的技术而被记住，而是作为协调技术. (1991, 92)

[T]his image of computing does not capture the essence of how computers are used now and how they will be used even more in the future computers and computer networks may well be remembered not as technology used primarily to compute, but as coordination technology. (1991, 92)

与此同时，面向对象的方法在起跑门处出现了问题——这是一个小引擎，可以，但通常不会。面向对象语言的场景是帮派战争的场景，到处都是首字母缩略词。与它们的结构化兄弟相比，面向对象的方法和开发过程充其量只是骨干的、不一致的和肤浅的。

Meanwhile, the object-oriented approach was sputtering at the starting gate it was the little engine that could, but usually didn't. The object-oriented languages scene was a gang war landscape, cluttered with acronyms. Compared to their structured brethren, object-oriented methods and development processes were skeletal at bestblinkered, inconsistent, and shallow.

面向对象兄弟会的成员喜欢将对象的成功视为命中注定，他们将 UML 视为必然成功的一个要素。从财富 500强定义的主流计算的更广泛角度来看，情况略有不同。对于大多数大型组织而言，面向对象一直是一种陌生的力量。

Members of the object-oriented fraternity like to see the success of objects as fated, and they view the UML as an element of that inevitable success. From the broader perspective of mainstream computing as defined in the Fortune 500, the picture is a little different. For most big organizations, object-orientation has been an alien force.

就在 20 世纪 90 年代初期，大型组织的经理们还习惯于使用几种通用语言、相对同质的技术和半标准的开发过程（“瀑布式”），这些过程即使非常出色也易于管理不成功。

As recently as the early years of the '90s, big organization managers were used to the comforts of a few common languages, a relatively homogeneous technology, and a semi-standard development process (the "waterfall"), which was manageable even if spectacularly unsuccessful.

对象没有提供任何这些舒适，而且人们认为，很少有重要的面向对象开发工作证明了面向对象比其他更主流的方法有任何真正的优势。迟至 1993 年，《斯隆管理评论》来自麻省理工学院的一篇论文宣称：“(O) 对象导向在大型内部 IS 组织中占据主导地位的可能性很小”（Fichman 和 Kemerer 1993，21）。只有一场大动荡才能改变他们的世界。

Objects provided none of these comforts, and the perception was that few of the significant object-oriented development efforts demonstrated any real advantages for object-orientation over other, more mainstream approaches. As late as 1993, the Sloan Management Review from MIT had a paper that proclaimed: "(O)bject orientation has low prospects for becoming dominant in large in-house IS organizations" (Fichman and Kemerer 1993, 21). Only a major upheaval would change their world.

以 Internet 为幌子分发应用程序和信息现象 Rockart 和 Malone 的“网络计算机”当然是扰乱发展世界进化平衡的彗星。它创造了古生物学家 Elizabeth Vrba 所说的“周转脉冲”（在 Eldredge 1999 年讨论过），它打破了信息技术已经陷入的静态陈规。它还引发了新技术的“物种形成”，包括语言和方法。它创造了需求和机会：客户想要新功能所承诺的功能，但旧的开发方式无法胜任。

The distribution of applications and information in the guise of the Internet phenomenonRockart and Malone's "networked computer"was, of course, the comet that disturbed the evolutionary equilibrium of the development world. It created what paleobiologist Elizabeth Vrba calls a "turnover pulse" (discussed in Eldredge 1999), which shattered the static rut that information technology had settled into. It also provoked the "speciation" of new technologies, including languages and methods. It created the need and the opportunity: customers wanted the capabilities promised by the new, but the old ways of development couldn't do the job.

当然，旧方法包括进行面向对象开发的旧方法。变化对面向对象社区的影响与对主流的影响一样大。然而，面向对象的机会主义物种形成具有深远的优势，并带来了实实在在的好处。Java 的迅速崛起、C++、组件的标准化、CORBA 的诞生和重生，以及软件设计模式语言的出现，都是随着 20 世纪 90 年代开始的技术和商业生态系统发生变化的结果UML。

Of course, the old ways included the old ways of doing object-oriented development. Change affected the object-oriented community just as much as the mainstream. However, the opportunistic speciation of object-orientation was profoundly advantageous and has resulted in real benefits. The meteoric rise of Java, the standardization of C++, components, the birth and rebirth of CORBA, and the emergence of pattern languages for software design are all results of the changed technological and business ecosystem that dawned with the '90sas is the UML.

2.2.1 主要参与者

2.2.1 Key Players

其他了解 UML 发展的方法是根据关键参与者及其角色。与模式的开发不同，商业利益而非个人利益推动了 UML 的发展。因此，构成背景的个人互动对我们的目的来说意义不大。（对于任何感兴趣的人，由 Martin Fowler、Kendall Scott 和 Ivan Jacobson [1997] 撰写的UML Distilled对 UML 从茧中脱颖而出的方式进行了非常讽刺、非常个性化的描述。）

Another way to understand the development of the UML is in terms of the key players and their roles. Unlike the development of patterns, commercial rather than personal interests drove the development of the UML. Therefore, the personal interactions that formed the backdrop are less significant for our purposes. (For anyone interested, UML Distilled, by Martin Fowler, Kendall Scott, and Ivan Jacobson [1997] has a terrifically wry, wonderfully personalized account of the way the UML emerged from its cocoon.)

不过，有一个个人因素值得一提。它顺便提供了与主流的进一步比较。结构化方法及其竞争者和变体是 60 年代和 70 年代计算机行业技术和人员日益成熟的结果。到那时，大型机世界有了自己的英雄黑客和牛仔编程时代。当软件设计是一件粗略的事情时，拥有个人的编码风格是一件值得骄傲的事情；安非他明驱动的通宵工作会议得到了代码；并且文档不存在。

There is one personal factor that warrants mentioning, though. It incidentally provides a further comparison with the mainstream. Structured Methods, plus its competitors and variants, resulted from the growing maturity of both the technology and the people in the computer industry in the '60s and '70s. By then, the mainframe world had its own period of heroic hacking and cowboy programming. When software design was a back-of-the-envelope affair, having a personal coding style was a matter of pride; amphetamine-driven, all-night work sessions got the code out; and documentation was non-existent.

埃德加·迪克斯特拉的作品在与结果作斗争时，意大利面条式代码和不可维护的程序以及结构化编程的概念是大型机软件开发走向成熟的里程碑。业界发现，牛仔编程产生的下游维护成本，都与原来的开发成本不成比例。

The work of Edgar Djykstra in combating the resultsspaghetti code and unmaintainable programsand the notion of structured programming were milestones in the maturing of mainframe software development. The industry discovered that cowboy programming produced downstream maintenance costs, which were all out of proportion to the original development costs.

与核能一样，最初对新技术的迷恋被对长期成本和收益的更成熟的评估所取代。与此同时，随着编程和程序员的成熟，程序员的数量也在增长和扩大；沟通、培训和控制成为企业管理的关注点。对更严格的开发方法的需求鼓励了方法论和建模系统的创建，但尚未鼓励建模语言。

As with nuclear power, the initial infatuation with a new technology was replaced by a more seasoned assessment of the long-term costs and benefits. At the same time, as programming and programmers matured, the population of programmers grew and broadened; and communication, training, and control became concerns for business management. The need for a more disciplined approach to development encouraged the creation of methodologies and modeling systemsbut not yet modeling languages.

类似地，在整个 80 年代，面向对象的开发被牛仔心态所主导，交互式编程工具的可用性以及缺乏可以提供纪律的可行、一致的开发过程进一步强调了这种心态。年轻的“技术人员”，在未知领域开拓，主导着面向对象的开发。

Similarly, through the '80s, object-oriented development was dominated by a cowboy mentality, which was further emphasized by the availability of interactive programming tools and the lack of a workable, consistent development process that could provide discipline. Young "techies," pioneering in unknown terrain dominated object-oriented development.

但是，正如在大型机世界中发生的那样，开发的商业现实，加上该领域知名玩家的个人成熟度不断提高，引发了态度的巨大变化。而且，与结构化方法的情况一样，一些关键参与者将变革人格化并发挥了领导作用。在所有这一切中最引人注目的三位球员当然是 UML 的“三个朋友”：Grady Booch、James Rumbaugh 和 Ivar Jacobson。Booch 可以说是这群人中方法论的鼻祖。（我已经提到他是模式出现的一股力量。）

But, as happened in the mainframe world, the commercial realities of development, combined with an increasing personal maturity on the part of the high-profile players in the field, provoked a sea change in attitude. And, as was the case with Structured Methods, a few key players personified the change and provided its leadership. The three players who are most visible in all this are, of course, the "Three Amigos" of the UML: Grady Booch, James Rumbaugh, and Ivar Jacobson. Booch is arguably the methodology granddaddy of the bunch. (I have already mentioned him as a force in the emergence of patterns.)

在 80 年代初期，Booch 引入了“面向对象设计”这一短语”，尤其是在他的书《Ada 软件工程》中（Booch、Bryan 和 Petersen 1993）。该书还介绍了后来的面向对象方法将挖掘和提炼的许多主题。基于培训课程，当时的 Booch 上尉和美国空军少校 Dick Bolz 的同事这本书是 1979 年为空军学院开发的，主要针对编程语言问题而不是系统设计，但它有一个软件工程味道。

In the early '80s, Booch introduced the phrase "object-oriented design," notably in his book called Software Engineering with Ada(Booch, Bryan, and Petersen 1993). The book also introduced many of the themes that later object-oriented methods would mine and refine. Based on training courses, which then-Captain Booch and a fellow member of the US Air Force Major Dick Bolz developed for the Air Force Academy in 1979, the book was primarily aimed at programming-language issues rather than system design, but it had a software engineering flavor.

即便如此，Booch 还是结合了许多关于如何开发软件使用对象的更好的想法，并将它们与符号和指南打包到“生命周期过程”中。他的模型是新出现的结构化设计方法，这种方法正在变得流行（Berard 1998）。

Even then, Booch combined many of the better ideas, which were floating around about how to develop software-using objects, and packaged them with a notation and guidelines into a "lifecycle process." His models were the newly minted Structured Design approaches, which were becoming popular (Berard 1998).

到 80 年代后期，Booch 离开了空军并最终加入了 Rational Software Corporation. 他带来了一种进化的 Booch 方法与他一起，以及他对需要一种包括一致符号的形式化设计方法的理解。

By the late '80s, Booch had left the Air Force and eventually joined Rational Software Corporation. He brought an evolved Booch Method with him, along with his understanding of a need for a formalized approach to design that included a consistent notation.

伊瓦尔·雅各布森比 Booch 晚一点公开出现。1986 年和 1987 年，他根据自己在瑞典开发实时系统的经验，在 OOPSLA 发表了面向对象设计的论文。他思想的一个关键是采用黑盒方法来设计隐藏系统复杂性的概念，作为一种设计技术。在他的技术中，用例提供了最终的黑盒，允许行为规范，而不会被行为如何实现的描述所混淆。相反，用户的观点推动了建模。他们还提供了一种真实的方式来记录需求和规范开发，以便它可以追溯到用户想要的东西。

Ivar Jacobson surfaced publicly a little later than Booch. In 1986 and 1987, he presented papers on object-oriented design at OOPSLA, based on his experience in developing real-time systems in Sweden. A key to his thinking was the notion of taking a black-box approach to designhiding the complexities of the system as a design technique. In his technique, use cases provided the ultimate black box, allowing for a specification of behavior that didn't get muddled by a description of how the behavior was implemented. Instead, the view of the user drove the modeling. They also provided a real way to document requirements and discipline the development so that it was traceable back to what the user wanted.

到 1990 年代初期，Jacobson 的用例已经被纳入各种方法，填补了人们认为存在于标准设计方法（例如 Booch 方法）中的空白。雅各布森还强调将模型作为系统开发的核心。正如雅各布森所说，“系统开发是一个过程模型建筑”（1995，309）。

By the early 1990s, Jacobson's use cases were already being incorporated into a variety of methods, filling a gap that was perceived to exist in the standard design approaches (such as the Booch Method). Jacobson was also contributing an emphasis on models as the core of systems development. As Jacobson put it, "System development is a process of model building" (1995, 309).

在某些方面，James Rumbaugh 是晚会的后来者。在 80 年代为通用电气工作期间，他撰写了许多论文，这些论文通常与面向对象设计的以数据为中心的观点有关。然而，他的影响是巨大的。1991 年，他出版了（与不可避免的等人一起）这本关于面向对象开发的书,面向对象的建模与设计（Rumbaugh 等人，1991 年）。这本书是对象建模技术 (OMT) 的基础，这是 Rumbaugh 推广的。与 Booch 或当时出现的许多其他面向对象方法相比，它在结构化方法和面向对象设计之间提供了更多的中间地带。

James Rumbaugh was, in some ways, the latecomer to the party. While working for General Electric during the '80s, he authored a number of papers that were typically concerned with a data-centric view of object-oriented design. His influence was substantial, however. In 1991, he published (along with the inevitable et. al.) what became the book on object-oriented development,Object-Oriented Modeling and Design (Rumbaugh et al. 1991). The book was the basis for the Object Modeling Technique (OMT), which Rumbaugh popularized. It provided more of a middle ground between Structured approaches and object-oriented design, compared to Booch or many of the other object-oriented methods that were around at the time.

在 20 世纪 90 年代初期，偶尔会尝试实现某种方法的统一或标准化，但没有成功。1993 年和 1994 年初，OMG试图标准化这些方法，但因这种尝试而受到严厉批评。Booch 甚至尝试过非正式的和解，但也没有成功。他觉得时机成熟了：

Efforts to reach some sort of unification or standardization of methods had been attempted occasionally during the early '90s but without success. In 1993 and early 1994, the OMG tried to standardize the methods but was roundly criticized for the attempt. Booch even attempted an informal rapprochement but was also unsuccessful. He felt the time was ripe:

标准化是否可取？出于两个原因，标准化与面向对象方法领域的考虑相关。首先，现有的多样性分散了市场，除了通常的早期采用者之外，其他所有人都进入了市场，并且阻碍了创建第三方供应商行业以帮助养活核心行业。其次，即使考虑到面向对象方法的多样性，在分析和设计过程中应该建模什么方面也存在明显的共识。（Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1996）

Is standardization desirable? Standardization is relevant to consider in the domain of object-oriented methods for two reasons. First, the existing diversity fragments the market and is a barrier to entry by all others than the usual early adopters and is a barrier to creating an industry of third-party vendors that help feed the core industry. Second, even given the diversity of object-oriented methods, there is apparent consensus in what should be modeled during analysis and design. (Booch and Rumbaugh 1996)

不过，他提出了一些重要的警告：

He threw in a couple of significant caveats, though:

什么可以标准化？最明显的机会目标是通用的面向对象分析和设计符号。试图标准化过程是完全不合适的。标准化应该如何进行？完善标准的正确途径是通过正式的标准机构，但通过该机构来制定标准是完全错误的。由这些非个人团体制定的标准通常与实际问题完全无关的软件开发。（Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1996）

What than can be standardized? The most obvious target of opportunity is a common object-oriented analysis and design notation. It is entirely inappropriate to try to standardize upon process. How should standardization proceed? The right way to consummate a standard is through a formal standards body, but using that body to hammer out a standard is entirely wrong. Standards wrought by such impersonal bodies are often entirely void of relevance to the real problems of software development. (Booch and Rumbaugh 1996)

就在 OOPSLA 之前，Rumbaugh他戏剧性地宣布他将离开通用电气公司，前往 Rational 与 Booch 一起工作。正如他解释的那样，他这样做是为了统一他们的两种方法，尽管 Booch 表达了明显的疑虑。

Just before that OOPSLA, Rumbaugh made the dramatic announcement that he was leaving General Electric to work with Booch at Rational. He did this, as he explained, to unify their two methodsand despite the apparent qualms expressed by Booch.

Rumbaugh 表达了他自己对 OOPSLA 标准化的疑虑：“我‘赞成’融合而‘反对’标准化。我认为面向对象方法论的‘标准化’现在是不可取和不必要的。” 他认为市场会解决方法之战并补充说，“两年后尘埃落定，一些方法将成为明确的领导者，并且将对某些核心建模概念达成一般（如果不是普遍）共识”（ 1996). 他特别批评通过委员会所做的任何事情，他说这“可能会产生一个不雅的大杂烩，从每一种方法中剔除核心。即使是一组方法学家仍然是委员会的主题承受同样的压力”（1996 年）。

Rumbaugh expressed his own version of qualms about standardization at OOPSLA: "I am 'for' convergence and 'against' standardization. I think 'standardization' of object-oriented methodologies now is undesirable and unnecessary." He felt the marketplace would sort out the methods wars and added, "In two years the dust will have settled, a few methods will be clear leaders, and there will be a general (if not universal) consensus about certain core modeling concepts" (1996). He was particularly critical of anything done via committee, which he said would "likely produce an inelegant hodgepodge that cuts the heart out of each methodology. Even a panel of methodologists is still a committee subject to the same pressures" (1996).

Rumbaugh 承认，这两种方法之间的差异并不像它们自身的利益使它们看起来那么大（Rational Software Corporation 1995）。他们的自身利益是巨大的。到 1994 年，Booch 和 Rumbaugh 占据了大部分（可能是 85%）面向对象方法的市场份额，而 Rumbaugh 的 OMT 无疑是领先者。然而，Jacobson 也有一个方法，他的流行和有影响力的用例被许多方法采用，包括 Booch 和 OMT。

Rumbaugh admitted that the differences between the two methods were in no way as great as their own self-interests had made them appear (Rational Software Corporation 1995). And their self-interests were substantial. Booch and Rumbaugh had the majority (possibly 85 percent) of the object-oriented method market share by 1994, with Rumbaugh's OMT being the clear leader. However, Jacobson also had a method, and his popular and influential use cases were being adopted by a number of methods, Booch and OMT included.

他们最初的统一方法，确定为统一过程的 0.8 版，发布于哎呀。然后，Jacobson 加入了统一工作，因为 Rational 购买了他的 Objectory 过程。因此，在一个典型的男性结合行为中，三个好朋友诞生了（以 80 年代末一部令人难忘的喜剧和早期的迪士尼动画片命名）。

Their initial Unified Method, identified as version 0.8 of the unified process, was released at OOPSLA. Then, Jacobson joined the unification effort because Rational purchased his Objectory process. So, in a typical act of male bonding, the Three Amigos were born (named after a forgettable comedy of the late '80s and an earlier Disney cartoon).

合并这三个过程的困难和时间压力导致从产生统一方法转向 Booch 在 OOPSLA 上提出的更简单的目标：UML。有了这个新规则，Rational 于 1996 年 6 月发布了 0.9 修订版。经过又六个月的大量努力，包括公众反馈，UML 的 1.0 规范于 1997 年 1 月发布。

Difficulties in merging the three processes and time pressures resulted in a switch from producing a Unified Method to the easier target that Booch proposed at OOPSLA: a UML. With this new rubric, Rational released the 0.9 revision in June 1996. After another six months of intense effort involving public feedback, the 1.0 spec of the UML was released for publication in January 1997.

此时，UML 戏剧中的最后一个角色出现了：OMG 重新回到活动状态。他们独立地成立了一个工作组来标准化一种方法和一种符号，并且有几个组织提交了提案。一个由关键对象技术用户和供应商组成的联盟成立，以定义 1.0 规范。

At this point, the final character in the UML drama emerged: the OMG returned to active status. Independently, they formed a task force for standardizing a method and a notation, and several organizations submitted proposals. A consortium of key object technology users and vendors was formed to define a 1.0 specification.

最后，一个 UML 提案被敲定，结合了 1997 年 9 月发布的 Rational 的 UML 1.1 和 OMG 的一些修订。令人困惑的是，最终产品被命名为 UML 1.0。

In the end, a UML proposal was hammered out, combining the September 1997 release of Rational's UML 1.1 and some revisions by the OMG. Confusingly enough, the final product was named UML 1.0.

具有讽刺意味的是，UML 的持续发展现在掌握在许多 OMG 委员会的手中，其中一个修订任务组将 Jim Rumbaugh 作为一个非常引人注目和活跃的人参与者。

In an ironic twist, the ongoing evolution of the UML is now in the hands of a number of OMG Committees, one of whichthe Revision Task Force, has Jim Rumbaugh as a very visible and active participant.

2.3 理解 UML

2.3 Understanding the UML

根据对于 UML 规范，UML 是一种语言

According to the UML Specification, the UML is a language

用于指定、可视化、构建和记录软件系统的工件，以及用于业务建模和其他非软件系统。（对象管理组 1999，xi）

for specifying, visualizing, constructing, and documenting the artifacts of software systems, as well as for business modeling and other non-software systems. (Object Management Group 1999, xi)

这份官方描述出现在UML 规范文档的前言和摘要的开头，强调了 UML 的潜在用户必须牢记的几个关键品质。

This official description, which appears right at the beginning of both the Preface and the Summary of the UML Specification document, emphasizes a couple of key qualities that a prospective user of the UML has to keep in mind.

首先，它令人困惑。这个定义的预期阅读是工件实际上指的是建模工件，而 UML 是关于建模和构建模型的；它与构建代码、项目管理或生产支持无关。但是挪用建造这个词以这种方式和滥用术语人工制品提供了很少的心理问题，而不是一个强有力的声明。UML 的官方散文通常具有委员会构建的质量（有时会导致意图不明确和解释不一致）。例如，不止一本关于 UML 的书都偶然发现了这个特定的定义：第二个关键特征是它有些模糊不清。

First of all, it is confusing. The intended reading of this definition is that artifacts really refers to modeling artifacts, and that the UML is about modeling and building models; it is not about constructing code, project management, or production support. But appropriating the term constructing this way and abusing the term artifacts provide little mental hiccups instead of a strong declaration. The official prose of the UML frequently has a committee-built quality (sometimes resulting in unclear intentions and inconsistent interpretations). For example, more than one book on the UML has stumbled on this particular definition: the second key quality is that it is somewhat muddy and fuzzy.

规范是软件开发中的一项广为人知的活动。可视化有点软，只是作为一种技术而广为人知。正如我之前解释的那样，构建在这种情况下有点令人困惑，而且通常是一个过程。文档记录充其量似乎是平淡无奇的，并且考虑到软件开发中几乎任何人都不愿意实际做文档记录，因此在列表中名列最后。UML 可以而且应该用于业务建模和为非软件系统的系统创建模型的方向更加缺乏重点。

Specification is a well-understood activity within software development. Visualization is a little soft, well known only as a technique. Constructing is, as I explained previously, a little confusing in this context and is typically a process. Documenting seems prosaic at best and, given the reluctance of almost anyone in software development to actually do documentation, has a well-earned last place in the list. Adding to the lack of focus is the direction that the UML can and should be used for business modeling and for creating models for systems that are not software systems.

因此，除了是“委员会思考”的明显结果之外，本节中的缺点表明它是匆忙组成的，也许会在未来的某个日期重新编写。

So, aside from being an obvious result of "committee-think," the shortcomings in this section suggest that it was composed in haste, perhaps to be reworked at some future date.

所有这些文本上的挑剔强调的是，UML 本身首先是一个不断发展的项目，有很多泥泞的地方。它有一个正式的规范，以适应作为其诞生一部分的广泛兴趣，因此它偶尔会变得模糊。

What all of this textual nitpicking underlines is that the UML itself is first and foremost an evolving project with muddy areas. It has a formal specification written to accommodate the wide variety of interests that have been part of its birthing, and so it is occasionally fuzzy.

正式规范对于理解 UML 的含义至关重要，尤其是在面临相互矛盾和过时的解释时。然而，它本身可能是令人恼火的循环、自我参照、不透明、晦涩，并且可能在某些地方是错误的。

The formal specification is critical to understanding what the UML is about, especially when faced with contradictory and dated interpretations. And yet, it can itself be infuriatingly circular, self-referential, opaque, obscure, and possibly wrong-headed in spots.

考虑到所有这些，谨慎而灵活地解释规范是定义 UML 的最佳方式。太多关于 UML 的书籍和文章混合了关于 Rational Software 的开发过程、作者的方法论偏见或特定用途的信息，而没有明确 UML 的界限本身。

Given all of this, a cautious but flexible interpretation of the specification is the best way to approach defining the UML. Too many of the books and articles that have been written about the UML mix in information about, for example, Rational Software's development process, the author's methodological biases, or specific useswithout being clear about the boundaries of the UML itself.

2.4 统一：方法战争结束

2.4 Unification: The Methods Wars Are Over

在广泛的阅读Object杂志1998 年 4 月号的专栏，Ivar Jacobson在经历了一段混乱和不确定的时期之后，宣布“方法之战已经结束”，伴随着从结构化方法主导的世界过渡到对象范式成为冠军的世界（1998 年，72）。

In a widely read column in the April 1998 issue of Object magazine, Ivar Jacobson declared that "the methods war is over" after a period of confusion and uncertainty that accompanied the transition from a world dominated by structured approaches to one in which the object paradigm became champion (1998, 72).

Ivar 实际上是在以一种（希望是）半开玩笑的方式重复评论几年前，Booch 和 Rumbaugh 公开了这一点，这在面向对象社区中引起了相当大的异议。

Ivar was actually repeating in a (hopefully) tongue-in-cheek fashion a comment that Booch and Rumbaugh made publicly a couple of years earlierone that prompted sizeable dissent in the object-oriented community.

较早的战争呐喊早于雅各布森转向理性，因此它绝对为时过早，因为即使在那时雅各布森的反对论也有相当大的思想份额。然而，被统一的建模方法取代、辅助和教唆的方法不仅仅是面向对象的方法。相反，正如 Jacobson 在文章中解释的那样，“软件行业中的所有不同方法现在都在转向一种建模语言：UML”（1998 年，第 72 页）。

The earlier war cry predated Jacobson's conversion to Rational, and so it was definitely premature because Jacobson's Objectory had substantial mindshare even then. However, the methods being replaced, aided, and abetted by a unified approach to modeling aren't just the object-oriented ones. Rather, as Jacobson explained it in the article, "all the different methods in the software industry are now moving to one modeling language: UML" (1998, 72).

尽管 Jacobson 的观察可能为时过早（而且肯定是自私自利的），但它指出了 UML 背后最重要的意义：它将一切都统一在一个旗帜下。UML 规范明确指出：

Although Jacobson's observation may have been premature (and certainly self-serving), it points to the most significant meaning behind the UML: It unifies everything under one flag. The UML Specification makes it clear that:

[T]他 UML 是三种先前领先的面向对象方法（Booch、OMT 和 OOSE）的对象建模语言的适当继承者。UML 是这些建模语言和更多语言的结合。（Object Management Group 1999，xi）

[T]he UML is the proper successor to the object modeling languages of three previously leading object-oriented methods (Booch, OMT, and OOSE). The UML is the union of these modeling languages and more (Object Management Group 1999, xi)

除了收敛的理想之外，统一还有其他层次和深浅的含义，所有这些都有助于更好地理解 UML 的目的。

Beyond the ideal of convergence, unified has other levels and shades of meaning, all of which contribute to a better understanding of the purpose of the UML.

使用 UML，所有隐藏的非工程建模目的都被带到了最前沿，并变得可连接、一致和适用。UML 模型可用于帮助概念化应用程序的上下文。他们可以组织需求并打包工作。当然，它们可以体现设计。之后，它们可以提供生成可用结果的基础以及打包最终结果以进行部署的方法。软件架构师和经理可以使用与设计师和程序员相同的一组符号和约定来满足他们的目的以及工程目的。

With the UML, all of the hidden non-engineering purposes of modeling are brought to the forefront and made connectable, consistent, and applicable. UML models can be used to help conceptualize the context for an application. They can organize the requirements and package the work. They can, of course, embody the design. After that, they can provide the basis for generating usable results and the means to package the end result for deployment. Software architects and managers can use the same set of notations and conventions as designers and programmers to suit their purposes, as well as the purposes of engineering.

因此，UML 通过使建模成为相关部分，有助于统一开发、规划和管理软件开发的实践所有这些活动。

So, the UML helps to unify the practices of developing, planning, and managing software development by making modeling a pertinent part of all these activities.

2.4.1 最佳实践：在旁观者的眼中

2.4.1 Best Practices: In the Eye of the Beholder

从本质上讲，UML 汇集了日益成熟的软件开发社区的最佳实践。在关于 UML 的书籍和文章中反复使用的一个短语中，规范的介绍声称它“代表了对象技术行业中最佳实践的融合”（Object Management Group 1999，xi）。

Essentially, the UML brings together the best practices of an increasingly mature software development community. In a phrase used over and over again in books and articles about the UML, the introduction to the specification claims that it "represents the convergence of best practices in the object-technology industry" (Object Management Group 1999, xi).

当然，与所有最佳实践一样，许多最佳实践在旁观者眼中最为显着。它们是信念，而不是凭经验证实的现实，应该持保留态度。而且，与任何类型的信仰一样，它们受到通常的“宗教”争论和/或解释的影响。

Of course, as with all best practices, many are most notably so in the eyes of the beholder. They are beliefs rather than empirically substantiated reality and meant to be taken with a grain of salt. And, as with beliefs of any kind, they are subject to the usual "religious" squabbles and/or interpretations.

最佳实践的想法出现在制造业领域。在那里，它与基准测试流程和衡量的性能紧密结合。作为一个想法，它被用于软件开发，没有制造管理的严格性。几乎没有基准测试（在欧洲比在北美更多），并且考虑到软件开发中技术和流程的变动，在一段时间内几乎不可能有任何有意义的基准测试。在IT领域，最佳实践是一种传承的管理思想，具有多种含义。

The idea of best practices emerged in the manufacturing world. There, it is tightly coupled to benchmarking processes and measured performance. As an idea, it was adopted in software development with none of the rigor of manufacturing management. There is little benchmarking (more in Europe than North America) and, given the churn of technologies and processes within software development, there is little likelihood of any meaningful benchmarks for awhile. In IT, best practices is an inherited management idea with many meanings.

Shoshanna Zuboff 在她的书《智能机器时代》中描述了管理思想的演变。她使用了一个地质学比喻，为库恩关于范式转变运作方式的概念添加了一些有用的细微差别。Zuboff 建议“每个时期都会留下一层沉淀的信念”，就像在层状悬崖壁上可以看到的以前地质学的亿万年一样 (1988, 233)。范式转变不是彻底的改变。它封装了前几代人的信念，但随后继续前进。

Shoshanna Zuboff described the evolution of management ideas in her book, In the Age of the Smart Machine. She uses a geological metaphor that adds some useful nuances to Kuhn's notions of the way a paradigm shift works. Zuboff suggests that "each period leaves a layer of sedimented beliefs," like the eons of previous geologies that can be seen in layered cliff walls (1988, 233). A paradigm shift is not a complete change. It encapsulates the beliefs of previous generations, but then moves on.

软件工程思想的演变可以用同样的方式来看待。UML 带来了早期软件开发（特别是结构化分析和设计）和面向对象分析和设计初期的大量包袱。并非所有这些行李都是超重行李。

The evolution of software engineering ideas can be viewed the same way. The UML brings with it a great deal of baggage from earlier periods in software development (in particular, Structured Analysis and Design) and from the beginnings of object-oriented analysis and design. Not all of this baggage is excess baggage.

先前建模方法的大师们在他们的工作中阐述了许多合理、有价值的见解。最好的结果会产生超越其包装的共鸣，成为软件社区以非正式方式思考此类事情的最佳实践。

The gurus of previous modeling approaches articulated a number of sound, valuable insights into their work. The best results have a resonance that transcends their packaging, becoming best practices in the informal way that the software community thinks of such things.

我试图在模式本身中尽可能多地捕捉它们。在某些情况下，因为这些见解已直接转化为 UML，所以这些模式专门针对 UML 的使用。在其他情况下，我使用模式来展示这些见解如何塑造一般的建模实践，以及它们如何在UML。

I attempted to capture as many of them as possible in the patterns themselves. In some cases, because these insights have been translated directly into the UML, the patterns are specifically about using the UML. In other cases, I use patterns to show how these insights shape the practice of modeling in general, and how they work in the UML.

2.4.2 独立思考的建模语言

2.4.2 An Independent-Minded Modeling Language

奇迹UML 的最大优点是它可以统一，而不受规定的方法论或过程的束缚。这是 UML 的第二个显着特征：它独立于过程、编程语言和技术。

The miracle of the UML is that it unifies without being tied to a prescriptive methodology or process. This is the second significant characteristic of the UML: its independence of process, programming language, and technique.

由于独立于进程，它在建模语言中是独一无二的。以前存在的所有结构化建模技术和面向对象的建模语言都是方法论或过程的扩展。

By being process-independent, it is unique among modeling languages. All of the structured modeling techniques and object-oriented modeling languages that existed previously were extensions of a methodology or process.

最初，UML 的创建者希望将他们不同的面向对象开发方法统一到一个过程中。初步讨论表明，这项任务比他们想象的要困难。Booch、Rumbaugh 和 Jacobson确定合并他们的符号是首先要做的最好的事情。UML 的创建者的见解之一是，一种放之四海而皆准的过程是不可能的，甚至是不可取的。他们有意将流程的选择权留给 UML 的各个用户。因此，UML 是故意独立于过程的。

Originally, the creators of UML wanted to unify their different object-oriented development methods into one process. Initial discussions showed the task to be more difficult than they imagined. Booch, Rumbaugh, and Jacobson determined that merging their notations was the best thing to do first. One of the insights that the creators of the UML had was the notion that a one-size-fits-all process wasn't possible or even desirable. They intentionally left the choice of process up to the individual users of UML. Therefore, the UML is deliberately process-independent.

虽然现在 Rational 提供了一个统一过程，它举例说明了很好地映射到 UML 的过程类型，但它不一定是您使用的过程。为特定开发项目选择的过程取决于多种因素，例如项目规模、组织标准、工具支持、体系结构目标等。单个流程不太可能满足这些因素的所有可能变化的要求，并且开发人员可以使用任意数量的流程，它们都使用 UML 作为他们的建模语言。示例包括使用 UML 的对象、组件和框架： Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills 的催化方法(1998)，强调基于组件的开发和 Sally Shlaer 的产品和沃德梅勒, 他们倾向于实时系统 (1999)。

Although there is now a Unified Process available from Rational that exemplifies the type of process that maps well to the UML, it does not have to be the process that you use. The process chosen for a particular development project is determined by a variety of factors such as project size, organizational standards, tool support, architectural goals, and so on. It isn't likely that a single process can satisfy the requirements of all possible variations of these factors, and there is any number of processes available to a developer that all use the UML as their modeling language. Examples include Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach from Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998), with its emphasis on component-based development and the offerings of Sally Shlaer and Ward Mellor, with their slant toward real-time systems (1999).

UML 也是独立于编程语言的，它具有多个维度。一方面，UML 不会不必要地偏向于通过特定编程语言的任何实现，因此它可以反映程序员对以标准方式传达系统蓝图的一般需求。

The UML is also programming-language-independent, which has a number of dimensions. On the one hand, the UML is not unnecessarily biased toward any implementation via a particular programming language, so it can reflect the generic needs of programmers for a standard way of communicating the blueprint for a system.

另一方面，UML 中的许多结构并不映射到任何编程语言。它们是始终需要转换的建模抽象。

On the other hand, a number of the constructs in the UML do not map to any programming language. They are modeling abstractions that always need translation.

除此之外，尽管它是独立于语言的，但 UML 确实反映了面向对象的基本概念框架。正如已经在一些小方面得到承认的那样，它将需要重新设计以适应更新的方法，例如基于组件的开发。但是，值得赞扬的是，UML 在其短暂的发展过程中已经适应了模式和框架。

On top of this, although it is language-independent, the UML does reflect the underlying conceptual framework of object-orientation. As has been acknowledged in some small ways already, it will need to be reworked to accommodate more recent approaches, such as component-based development. But, to its credit, the UML has already accommodated patterns and frameworks during its brief evolution.

最后，UML 是独立于技术的。例如，一个要求用例作为传达功能需求的主要载体的过程可能会描述技术。然而，街头从业者认识到规定的技术在某些情况下效果很好，而在其他情况下则不然。在他们不这样做的情况下，最终结果才是最重要的。UML 不将工件与方法或过程联系起来。

Finally, the UML is technique-independent. For example, a process that calls for use cases as the primary vehicle for communicating functional requirements may describe techniques. However, the streetwise practitioner recognizes that prescribed techniques work well in some circumstancesand not in others. In situations where they don't, the end result is what's important. The UML does not tie artifacts to techniques any more than methods or processes.

敏捷建模者会欣赏 UML 的独立性。流程、语言和技术的中立性使得跨项目、环境和工具的边界交流设计成为一项相对容易的任务。UML 不是由不兼容的墙分隔的符号派别和模型，而是提供了一种通用的建模语言，它消除了人为的界限，并允许模型和设计信息以一种以前没有的方式自由流动可能的。

The agile modeler will appreciate the UML's independence. Process, language, and technique neutrality make it a relatively easy task for designs to be communicated across the boundaries of projects, environments, and tools. Instead of notational factions and models separated by walls of incompatibility, the UML provides a generalized language for modeling that eliminates artificial boundaries and permits the free flow of models and design information in a way that wasn't previously possible.

第 3 章 UML 本质、元素和工件

Chapter 3. UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts

没有足够的符号来涵盖我们想要表达的所有细微差别。

Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills (1998, 371)

There aren't enough symbols to cover all the subtly different things we want to say.

Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998, 371)

本章为您提供了 UML 的主要元素和工件的高级摘要，足以让您开始使用模式语言。

This chapter provides you with a high-level summary of the main elements and artifacts of the UMLenough to get started with the pattern language.

显然，仅仅一章就不足以开始学习 UML 的练习。但是有许多好书可以为那些还没有使用 UML 的人提供入门服务，而本书并不打算涵盖他们的领域。任何具有 UML 应用知识的人都可以略读本章，前提是本章提供的信息基于UML 规范的 1.3 beta 版本（理性软件公司1999)，因此它作为更新可能很有用。

Obviously, a single chapter is scarcely adequate to even begin the exercise of learning about the UML. But there are many good books out there that can provide an introductory service for those not already using the UML, and this book isn't meant to cover their territory. Anyone with a working knowledge of the UML can skim this chapter with the proviso that it provides information based on the 1.3 beta version of the UML Specification(Rational Software Corporation 1999), and so it may be useful as an update.

此外，我采用的方法与通常用于介绍的方法有所不同。一个区别是本章与本书和 UML 本身一样，是独立于过程的。而且，在说明过程可以解释 UML 的不同方式所产生的异常和差异很重要的地方，我使用 Rational 的统一过程和 Desmond D'Souza 和Alan Wills 的书，Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach (1998) 作为几乎正交过程的例子. 我试图区分特定于流程的用途和符号与那些“普通”UML。在有明显异常的地方，我提请注意它们。

Also, I take a somewhat different approach than is typical for introductions. One difference is that this chapter, like this book and the UML itself, is process-independent. And, where it's important to illustrate anomalies and differences that come from the different ways that processes can interpret the UML, I use Rational's Unified Process and Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills' book, Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach (1998) as examples of almost orthogonal processes. I've tried to distinguish between process-specific uses and notations and those that are "vanilla" UML. Where there are notable anomalies, I draw attention to them.

本章的另一个不同之处在于，我关注的是 UML 的包装和符号方面，而不是 UML 结构的详细语义。我这样做有两个原因：

The other way that this chapter is different is that I focus on the packaging and notational side of the UML rather than the detailed semantics of the UML constructs. I do this for two reasons:

  • UML 的包装、组织和绘图方面似乎在文献中没有得到充分体现。如何着手制作模型已退居二线，而不是使用 UML 创建开发工件——这是一个微妙但重要的区别。

  • The packaging, organizing, and drawing side of the UML seems to be underrepresented in the literature. How to go about making a model has taken a back seat to using the UML in creating development artifactsa subtle but significant difference.

  • 对于像这样一本旨在建模而不是编程的书，理解打包和符号对于有效地将 UML 作为工具使用至关重要，就像了解语法对于有效使用编程语言至关重要一样。本章旨在澄清在有关 UML 的著作中，该领域中存在的大量混淆。

  • For a book like this, which is aimed at modeling rather than programming, understanding packaging and notation is crucial to using the UML effectively as a tool, just as knowing the syntax is crucial to using a programming language effectively. This chapter aims to clarify what has been a notable amount of confusion in this area, in writings about the UML.

在大多数情况下，UML 的语义是充分面向对象的，对于任何具有任何面向对象语言的编程背景的人来说都没有什么困难。当然，需要解释特定于建模或 UML 惯用的 UML 语义的某些方面，我也将介绍这些内容。

For the most part, the semantics of the UML are sufficiently object-oriented to present little difficulty to anyone with a programming background in any of the object-oriented languages. Of course, some aspects of the UML semantics that are specific to modeling or that are idiomatic to the UML need to be explained, and I'll cover these as well.

与模式一样，像这样的摘要也不会受益于受启发的独创性或新颖的见解。因此，我依靠久经考验的来源，并重新编写了现有材料，而不是提供一种查看 UML 内部结构的新方法。下面的描述主要来自UML 规范，版本 1.3（Rational Software Corporation 1999），通过阅读UML Distilled：Applying the标准对象建模语言（Fowler、Scott 和 Jacobson 1997）和对象、组件和框架与 UML：催化方法（D'Souza 和 Wills 1998）。

Like patterns, a summary such as this one doesn't benefit from inspired originality or novel insights. So, I relied on tried-and-true sources, and I reworked existing material, rather than providing a new way of looking at the innards of the UML. The description that follows is primarily drawn from the UML Specification, Version 1.3(Rational Software Corporation 1999), fleshed out by readings from UML Distilled: Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language (Fowler, Scott, and Jacobson 1997) and Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach (D'Souza and Wills 1998).

3.1 元素、观点和观点

3.1 Elements, Viewpoints, and Views

一个想法 视图是 UML 中的关键视图：它为模型的 UML 概念提供了基础。但是，它不是UML中的正式构造（尽管它在Rational Unified Process 中[RUP]，一个通常被关于 UML 的作者混淆的区别）。相反，它充当一个非正式的概念，帮助定位建模者的角色和责任。

The idea of a view is a key one in the UML: It provides the basis for the UML notion of a model. However, it is nota formal construct in the UML (although it is in the Rational Unified Process [RUP], a distinction that is typically muddied by writers about the UML). Instead, it acts as an informal concept that helps situate the roleand responsibilitiesof the modeler.

在 UML 中，模型是从特定视角（即，从特定视角集合的一组视图）对系统的完整表示。同时，系统在逻辑上由许多几乎独立的模型组成，代表许多不同的观点；它们可以在物理上由许多独立的子系统组成，每个子系统也可以作为一个系统来建模。

In the UML, a model is a complete representation of a system from a particular viewpoint (that is, an aggregation of a set of views from specific perspectives). At the same time, systems are logically composed of many nearly independent models, representing many different viewpoints; and they can be physically composed of many independent subsystems, each of which can also be treated as a system for modeling purposes.

系统本身由顶层模型隐含地表示，子模型表示专门的视图。每个模型都由图表和文本组成。UML规范将图表描述为“模型的视图”，每个视图代表整个模型聚合和集成的特定视角（Rational Software Corporation 1999）。所有这些也递归地适用于子系统。

A system itself is implicitly represented by a top-level model with subsidiary models representing specialized views. Each model is made up of diagrams and text. The UML Specification describes diagrams as "views of a model," each representing a particular perspective that the overall model aggregates and integrates (Rational Software Corporation 1999). All of this applies recursively to subsystems as well.

模型表示的视角是模型的目的和它提供的详细程度的组合。任何系统都可以包含无数的观点和模型，这取决于每个观看者的角色、他或她带给观看的概念立场以及观看的最终目的。任何观点都可以通过无数的观点和图表来表达，这取决于所讨论的听众的兴趣。

The perspective that a model represents is a combination of the model's purpose and the level of detail it provides. Any system can contain a myriad of viewpoints and models, which depend on the role of each viewer, the conceptual stance he or she brings to the viewing, and the ultimate purpose of the view. Any viewpoint can be expressed by a myriad of views and diagrams, depending on the interests of the audience being addressed.

建模者代表这些观点，轮流戴着不同的帽子，采用不同的观点。根据听众是高级管理人员还是技术人员，用户的观点最终会得到不同的表达。管理视角可能会导致强调体系结构并最小化技术细节的管理模型。

The modeler represents these views, wearing different hats in turn, and adopting different viewpoints. A user's view will end up being expressed differently depending on whether the audience is senior management or a technical person. A management perspective might result in a management model that emphasizes architecture and minimizes technical detail.

在最抽象的情况下，系统应该至少从两个角度建模：

At the most abstract, a system should be modeled from at least two viewpoints:

  • 看外面的世界——被解释的现实

  • Looking at the outside worldan interpreted reality

  • 看产品构建的现实

  • Looking at the producta constructed reality

作为建模者，为了构建一个系统，我们对我们对上下文、需求、实践和约束的理解进行建模，以确保我们有正确的问题和问题设置。然后，我们对构建者应该构建的架构、规范、设计、实现和部署进行建模。第二种观点提供了构建者可以使用的蓝图和管理人员构建产品、保持产品运行并使其有用所需的文档。

As modelers, in order to build a system, we model our understanding of the context, requirements, practices, and constraints to ensure that we have the problem and problem setting right. We then model the architecture, specifications, design, implementation, and deployment of what the builders should build. The second viewpoint provides a blueprint that builders can work from and the documentation that management needs to get the product built, keep it working, and make it useful.

面向对象方法给建模带来的优势在于，它允许建模者通过提供语义一致的概念框架在分析和设计模型之间“架起桥梁”（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998a，7），而不管涉及的观点。现实世界中的事物被表示为对象，就像构建世界中的事物一样。建模模式仍然不同，但语言非常相似。

The advantage an object-oriented approach brings to modeling is that it allows a modeler to "bridge the chasm" (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998a, 7) between the analysis and design models by providing a semantically consistent conceptual framework, regardless of the viewpoint involved. Things in the real world are represented as objects, in the same way that things in the constructed world are. The modeling modes are still distinct, but the language is very much the same.

自然地，在迭代的开发过程中，即使是建模模式之间的障碍也是可以渗透的，并且有一个不断的来回，而不是严格的区分。事实上，正如我将在第 11 章“综合考虑：反思设计工作”中所讨论的那样， 正确的设计实践需要这两种模式的交织。

Naturally, in an iterative development process, even the barrier between modeling modes is permeable, and there's a constant to-and-fro, as opposed to rigid distinctions. In fact, as I will discuss in Chapter 11, "Putting It All Together: Reflecting on the Work of Design," proper design practice requires the interweaving of these two modes.

除了对最少两个视点的简单需求之外，还可以将其他视点添加到图片中，具体取决于建模者认为需要的表达粒度。各个过程将以不同的方式对待视图的想法，使它们成为正式的构造（例如，RUP）或将它们作为非正式的概念（例如，对象、组件和框架与 UML：催化方法[D'Souza 和 Wills 1998]） . UML 还假定您可能希望创建自己的图表和模型，并且可能希望以各种方式扩展 UML 以建立自己的本地建模方言。

Beyond the simple need for a minimum of two viewpoints, additional viewpoints can be added to the picture, depending on the expressive granularity the modeler feels is warranted. Individual processes will treat the idea of views differently, making them formal constructs (for example, RUP) or leaving them as informal concepts (for example, Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach [D'Souza and Wills 1998]). The UML also assumes that you may want to create your own kinds of diagrams and your own kinds of models, and you may want to extend the UML in various ways to establish your own local modeling dialect.

3.1.1 模型和模型元素

3.1.1 Models and Model Elements

重复一遍：UML 模型是一种抽象，是物理系统的完整表示。模型是关于系统中的事物、关系、行为和交互的。同样重要的是，模型是关于如何组织这些信息的，因为概念组块是成功抽象的重要工具。

To repeat: A UML model is an abstraction, a complete representation of a physical system. Models are about things, relationships, behaviors, and interactions in a system. Equally important, models are about how to organize this information because conceptual chunking is an important tool for successful abstracting.

UML 本身区分了两种类型楷模：

The UML itself distinguishes two types of models:

  • 结构模型 

    代表系统的各个部分及其关系。

  • Structural models 

    Represent the pieces of a system and their relationships.

  • 动态模型 

    表示系统元素的行为及其交互。

  • Dynamic models 

    Represent the behavior of the elements of the system and their interactions.

模型制作的模型元素。模型元素在给定命名空间（通常是包）的上下文中被唯一命名并且具有可见性，它定义了它们如何被其他模型元素使用（和重用）。

Models are made up of model elements. Model elements are named uniquely in the context of a given namespace (usually a package) and have visibility,which defines how they can be used (and reused) by other model elements.

可见性决定了各个元素相互连接的方式。因此，它是通过信息隐藏来管理模型复杂性的关键部分。关于可见性的决策可能是影响模型逻辑组织决策的强大因素。通过利用和扩展面向对象语言的可见性概念，它是 UML 与前几代建模语言和工具截然不同的方式之一他们自己。

Visibility determines the way individual elements can connect with each other. Therefore, it is a critical part of managing the complexity of models via information hiding. Decisions about visibility can be powerful factors influencing decisions about the logical organization of models. It is one of the ways in which the UML is distinctly different from previous generations of modeling languages and toolsby leveraging and extending the notion of visibility from object-oriented languages themselves.

在 UML 中，模型元素可以通过以下三种方式之一显示：

In the UML, model elements may be visible in one of three ways:

  • 民众 

    任何外部模型元素可以看到模型元素。

  • Public 

    Any outside model element can see the model element.

  • 受保护 

    任何后代可以看到模型元素。

  • Protected 

    Any descendent can see the model element.

  • 私人的 

    仅有的模型元素本身、它的组成部分以及嵌套在其中的模型元素都可以看到它。

  • Private 

    Only the model element itself, its constituent parts, and the model elements nested within it can see it.

笔记

Note

UML 的各个部分调整这种一般的可见性概念以适应特定情况。 请参阅本文后面第 3.2 节“包”中对包可见性的讨论 章。

Individual parts of the UML adjust this general notion of visibility to suit specific circumstances. See the discussion of package visibility in Section 3.2, "Packages," later in this chapter.

模型和模型元素在图表中以图形方式呈现，在规范中以文本方式呈现，并且它们以包的形式组织。

Models and model elements are rendered graphically in diagrams and textually in specifications, and they are organized in packages.

在 UML 符号中，模型事物被表示为符号或图标，关系和交互通常使用各种修饰线来表示。线路本身不仅仅是无源的、经过装饰的连接器；在 UML 中，它们也是具有语义内容和基本规则的符号。而且，作为组织元素，模型和图表都没有特定的符号形式（即 UML 符号），只有包有。

In UML notation, model things are expressed as symbols or icons, and relationships and interactions are typically expressed by using various kinds of adorned lines. The lines themselves aren't just passive, decorated connectors; in the UML, they're also symbols with semantic content and underlying rules. And, as organizational elements, neither models nor diagrams have a specific notational form (that is, the UML symbol)only packages do.

当然，为模型提供意义和内容的不是单个元素的渲染，而是它们的连接方式。模型、图表及其部件之间的联系——观点和表达的观点之间的联系几乎是修辞性的。意图、注意力和重点提供了细节层次、形式、内容和表达方式的差异。

Of course, it's not the rendering of the individual elements that provides the meaning and meat to a model, but the way they all connect. The connection between a model, its diagrams, and their partsthe connection between a viewpoint and expressed viewsis almost rhetorical. Intention, attention, and focus provide differences in level of detail, formality, content, and manner of presentation.

模型不仅仅是图表；在 UML 中，图表只是模型的视觉呈现。模型图形的基础是模型元素的规范。这些由文本组成，可能是正式和非正式的混合。文本与图表一样重要，在某些情况下更重要：用例就是一个例子（请参阅 本章后面的第 3.6.2 节“用例图” ）。UML规范 本身就是一个模型的例子（虽然不是一个好模型，如果从它的清晰度来判断和交际效能）。

Models aren't just diagrams; in the UML, the diagrams are only the visual rendering of the model. Underlying the graphics of a model are the specifications of the model elements. These are composed in text, and may be a mix of the formal and the informal. The text is as important as the diagrams and in some cases more so: use cases are an example (see Section 3.6.2, "Use Case Diagram," later in this chapter). The UML Specification itself is an example of a model (although not a good one, if judged by its clarity and communicative effectiveness).

3.1.2 图

3.1.2 Diagrams

在语义上，图表表达模型的观点（即每个模型代表的观点的子集）。单个模型元素可以在模型的一个或多个图表中显示；换句话说，一个模型元素可以用许多不同的方式和许多图表来表示，但它必须至少以一种方式在一个图表中表示。

Semantically, diagrams express views of a model (that is, subsets of the viewpoint that each model represents). An individual model element can be presented in one or many of the diagrams for a model; in other words, a model element can be presented in many different ways and in many diagramsbut it must be presented in at least one diagram in one way.

图表没有分配给它们任何特殊形状；它们可以自由浮动、由盒子包围或包含在包裹中。其他一些注意事项如下：

Diagrams don't have any special shape assigned to them; they can be free-floating, bounded by a box, or contained within a package. Some other considerations are as follows:

  • 几何学和“地理”在 UML 图中都没有多大意义。在大多数情况下，符号的大小或相对位置通常没有语义内容，具有时间维度的图表除外。

  • Neither geometry nor "geography" has much significance in a UML diagram. For the most part, a symbol's size or relative location generally has no semantic content, except for diagrams that have a time dimension.

  • 由于现有技术和工具的当前限制，图表都是二维的，尽管有些形状名义上是三维的，以二维呈现（例如立方体）。

  • Diagrams are all two-dimensional because of the current limits imposed by available technology and tools, although some shapes are nominally three-dimensional, rendered in two dimensions (cubes, for example).

  • 可以在图表中自由使用文本。示例包括表达规则和在符号内识别属性。

  • Text can be used liberally within a diagram. Examples include expressing rules and, within symbols, identifying attributes.

最后（对于本介绍），UML 规范（Rational Software Corporation 1999）强调图表中的三种视觉关系：

Finally (for this introduction), the UML Specification (Rational Software Corporation 1999) highlights three kinds of visual relationships in diagrams:

  • 联系 

    线条连接图标和符号，形成连接路径。路径始终附加到两端的符号（即不允许有悬垂线）。

  • Connection 

    Lines connect icons and symbols, forming connecting paths. Paths are always attached to symbols at both ends (that is, no dangling lines are allowed).

  • 遏制 

    方框、圆圈和其他完全封闭的形状包含符号、图标和线条。

  • Containment 

    Boxes, circles, and other fully enclosed shapes contain symbols, icons, and lines.

  • 视觉依恋 

    靠近在一起的元素可能具有由它们的接近度暗示的关系。例如，在线上方或框旁边的名称可能被解释为适用于该行或框。

  • Visual attachment 

    Elements that are close together may have a relationship suggested by their proximity. For example, a name above a line or next to a box may be interpreted as applying to the line or box.

3.2 包

3.2 Packages

一个包是一组 UML 元素，可以包括图表，也可以包括从属包和其他类型的模型元素。根据UML 规范，包“可用于出于任何目的组织元素；用于将元素分组到一个包中的标准未在 UML 中定义”（Rational Software Corporation 1999）。从建模的角度来看，包可能是 UML 中最重要的方面；它们在 UML 建模中扮演的角色类似于类在编程中扮演的角色。

A package is a grouping of UML elements, which can include diagrams and may include subordinate packages and other kinds of model elements. According to the UML Specification, packages "can be used for organizing elements for any purpose; the criteria to use for grouping elements together into one package are not defined within UML" (Rational Software Corporation 1999). Packages are probably the most important aspect of the UML from a modeling perspective; they play a role in UML modeling that is similar to the role classes play in programming.

大多数 UML 书籍都轻视包。由于它们的重要性和其他地方缺乏关注，我将在这里提供比其他 UML 符号和工件更多的细节。

Most UML books treat packages lightly. Because of their importance and this lack of attention elsewhere, I'll provide more details on them here than I will for the other UML symbols and artifacts.

包可以嵌套并且可以引用其他包。它们为配置控制、存储和访问控制提供了基础。它们还为命名模型元素提供了基础。它们为模型元素定义名称空间；嵌套包创建命名层次结构。因为包不能被实例化，名义上它们唯一的正式功能（在系统中）是提供这个名称空间。

Packages can be nested and can reference other packages. They provide the basis for configuration control, storage, and access control. They also provide the basis for naming model elements. They define the namespacefor model elements; nested packages create a naming hierarchy. Because packages can't be instantiated, nominally their only formal function (in a system) is to provide this name space.

包中的每个元素都必须具有唯一的名称。不同包中的元素可能具有相同的名称，但它们通过包名作为附加标识符来区分。随着组件、重用以及系统变得越来越大，这种能力变得很重要。组件之间的名称冲突可以通过将它们放入单独的包并引用它们的完全限定名称来解决：

Each element in a package must be uniquely named. Elements in different packages may have the same name, but they are differentiated by the package name as an additional identifier. This capability becomes significant with components, with reuse, and as systems grows larger. A name collision between components can be resolved by placing them into separate packages and referencing their fully qualified name:

					
包名::元素名
					
packageName::elementName

个别包裹直接拥有模型元素；一个元素只能属于一个包。如果从模型中删除拥有的包，则拥有的模型元素也将被删除。包是“开发产品的基本单元——您可以单独创建、维护、交付、销售、更新、分配给团队并通常作为一个单元进行管理”（D'Souza 和 Wills 1998，285）。

Individual packages own model elements directly; an element can belong only to one package. If the owning package is removed from the model, the owned model elements are removed as well. A package is "the basic unit of development productsomething you can separately create, maintain, deliver, sell, update, assign to a team and generally manage as a unit" (D'Souza and Wills 1998, 285).

包含在同一包中的元素可以相关，并且可以与任何级别的包含包中的元素相关。包含的包中的元素是不可见的；正如UML 规范所说的那样，“包看不到内部” （Rational Software Corporation 1999）。其他包（包含的或单独的）中的元素可以通过导入或访问包或通过泛化来提供。

Elements contained in the same package can be related, and can be related to elements in a containing package at any level. Elements in contained packages are not visible; "packages do not see inwards," as the UML Specification puts it (Rational Software Corporation 1999). Elements in other packages (contained or separate) can be made available by importing or accessing the package(s) or by generalization.

包可以导入或访问其他包的内容。当一个包导入另一个包时，它会导入所有在第二个包中可见的元素。导入的元素成为导入包命名空间的一部分（也就是说，它们可以在没有路径名限定的情况下被引用），并且可以在包拥有的关系中使用。访问关系使命名空间保持分离，要求被访问包中的访问包引用元素使用完全限定名称（包括路径名的名称）。包还可以在与类之间的继承并行的泛化关系中“专门化”其他包。

Packages can import or access the contents of other packages. When one package imports another, it imports all those elements that are visible in the second package. Imported elements become part of the importing package's namespace (that is, they can be referenced without the qualification of a pathname), and may be used in relationships owned by the package. An access relationship keeps the namespaces separate, requiring that the accessing package reference elements in the accessed package use fully qualified names (ones that include the pathname). Packages can also "specialize" other packages in a generalization relationship that parallels inheritance among classes.

包含和可见性是模型元素的关键特征包裹。包封装了它们包含的模型元素，并将它们的可见性定义为私有、受保护或公共：

Containment and visibility are key characteristics of model elements in packages. Packages encapsulate the model elements they contain and define their visibilityas private, protected, or public:

  • 私人的 

    在包含包之外根本不可用的元素

  • Private 

    Elements that are not available at all outside the containing package

  • 受保护 

    仅对包具有泛化到拥有元素的包可用的元素

  • Protected 

    Elements that are available only to packages with generalizations to the package owning the elements

  • 民众 

    也可用于导入和访问包的元素（请参阅以下部分）

  • Public 

    Elements that are available also to importing and accessing packages (see the following sections)

包可见性是 UML 为模型元素的可见性提供的标准方法的变体。Martin Fowler 正确地警告不要过于轻率地使用 UML 的标准版本的可见性，因为它是妥协的大杂烩，不一定与您的编程语言中使用可见性的方式相对应。对于面向对象的开发，他建议依靠您正在使用的语言所支持的可见性风格 (1997, 99)。另一方面，对于基于组件的开发，尤其是在包构成使用组件的基础的情况下（如 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书中），UML 包可见性是一个关键工具。对于组件，UML 可见性是一个重要的建模问题，而不仅仅是一个具有传递性的问题，作为编程问题的反映。看Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach for an example (D' Souza and Wills 1998, 259296)。

Package visibility is a variation on the standard approach that the UML provides for the visibility of model elements. Martin Fowler rightly cautions against using the UML's standard version of visibility too glibly because it is a mishmash of compromises that don't necessarily correspond to the way visibility is used in your programming language. For object-oriented development, he suggests relying on the flavor of visibility supported by the language you're using (1997, 99). For component-based development, on the other hand, especially where packages form the basis for working with components (as in D'Souza and Wills' book), UML package visibilities are a critical tool. For components, UML visibility is a significant modeling concern, not just one that has a transitive interest, as a reflection of programming concerns. See Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach for an example (D' Souza and Wills 1998, 259296).

尽管包可以映射到编程结构，但 UML 版本比任何可用的编程翻译都更丰富、更细微。正是核心建模概念将 UML 与以前的面向编程的建模方法区分开来。反映其重要性的是，包的概念在 UML 短暂的生命周期中经历了重大转变，导致用户混淆。

Although package can be mapped to programming constructs, the UML version is far richer and more nuanced than any of the available programmatic translations. It is the core-modeling concept that distinguishes the UML from previous programming-oriented modeling approaches. Reflecting its importance, the idea of a package has undergone significant shifts during the brief life of the UML, contributing to user confusion.

UML 0.8 不包含包；相反，类别和子系统提供了逻辑和物理组织机制。UML 0.9 将类别和子系统组合到一个称为包的通用结构中，最初仅限于对类进行分组。使用UML 规范 1.3 版，包可用于对范围更广的模型元素进行分组。包作为一种建模构造似乎很可能会继续得到改进和重构，特别是考虑到它在管理组件复杂性方面的实用性。

UML 0.8 did not include packages; instead, category and subsystem provided logical and physical organizing mechanisms. UML 0.9 combined categories and subsystems into an all-purpose construct called package, initially limited to grouping classes. With UML Specification, Version 1.3, packages can be used to group a much broader range of model elements. It seems likely that package, as a modeling construct, will continue to be refined and refactored, especially given its utility in managing the complexity of components.

所有这一切的不利之处在于，关于 UML 的文献在处理包方面各不相同，这取决于所引用的UML 规范的年份。然而，不断演变的包概念及其不断演变的用法可能是理解不断变化的建模（和开发）环境的关键，也是 UML 在后面向对象世界中取得成功的关键的系统开发。

The downside of all this is that the literature on the UML varies in its treatment of packages, depending on the vintage of the UML Specification being referenced. However, the evolving notion of a package and its evolving usage is probably a key to understanding the changing environment of modeling (and development), and it is a key to the success of the UML in the post-object- oriented world of systems development.

3.2.1 模型：视图包

3.2.1 Models: Packages of Views

型号是UML 元模型中明确标识的一种包类型。因此，它是如何使用包的一个很好的例子。从概念上讲，包提供了一种组织模型的方式，类似于文件夹和文件的分层目录结构。

Models are one type of package explicitly identified in the UML metamodel. Therefore, it is a good example of how to use packages. Conceptually, packages provide a way of organizing models that is analogous to a hierarchic directory structure of folders and files.

使用 UML，您使用的过程（和工具集）将决定您用来组织模型的结构。通常，单个顶级包为视图和模型的层次结构提供起点（在包中组织并表示为图表）。Rational 的 Rose CASE 工具就是以这种方式组织的，但它的方法充其量只是一种反映 RUP 的有用约定。D'Souza 和 Wills 的书结合了一种更具想象力的方法，该方法基于以各种方式对系统进行分解（1998 年），从而最大限度地利用打包。这些可以符合用户类别，表达系统中的不同架构层次，包含构成系统架构风格的规则，持有驱动设计的模式，并提供组织工作和配置的手段工作产品。

With the UML, the process you use (and the toolset) will dictate the structure you use to organize your models. Generally, a single top-level package provides the starting point for a hierarchy of views and models (organized in packages and expressed as diagrams). Rational's Rose CASE tool is organized this way, but its approach is at best a useful convention that reflects the RUP. D'Souza and Wills' book incorporates a more imaginative approach that leverages packaging to the hilt, based on factoring the system in a variety of ways (1998). These can accord with the categories of user, express the different architectural layers in a system, contain the rules that constitute a system's architectural style, hold the patterns that drive the design, and provide the means of organizing work and configuring the work products.

3.2.2 子系统：行为和操作包

3.2.2 Subsystems: Packages of Behavior and Operations

子系统是 UML 元模型中明确标识的另一种类型的包。子系统分解系统，而模型划分描述系统的逻辑抽象。模型应该是“近乎独立的”，而每个子系统应该是独立和完整的——不同子系统的各部分之间应该有最小的耦合。

Subsystems are the other type of package explicitly identified in the UML metamodel. Subsystems decompose systems, whereas models partition the logical abstractions that describe a system. Models should be "nearly independent," whereas each subsystem should be independent and completethere should be a minimum of coupling between the parts of different subsystems.

已纳入UML 规范1.3 版的子系统概念具有增强的风格，暗示了模型和类之间的交叉。子系统不再是模块或类的集合，就像 Grady Booch 在Object-Oriented Analysis and Design with Applications (1994, 221) 或 Ivar Jacobson 在Object-Oriented Software Engineering (1994, 148) 中那样。现在，一个子系统是一种表示“物理系统中的行为单元”和模型元素集合的方法。从根本上说，它是一种划分待实施系统的方法，因此在物理上比逻辑上或概念上更重要。虽然它是一种类似于模型的分块机制，但最简单的说，它旨在解决可执行文件和生产工件的组织问题，而不是想法。

The notion of subsystems that has been incorporated in the 1.3 version of the UML Specification has an enhanced flavor that hints at a cross between model and class. A subsystem is no longer a collection of modules or classes as it was for Grady Booch in Object-Oriented Analysis and Design with Applications (1994, 221) or Ivar Jacobson in Object-Oriented Software Engineering (1994, 148). Now, a subsystemisa means of representing "a behavioral unit in the physical system" and a collection of model elements. It is fundamentally a way of partitioning the system-to-be-implemented, and so is more physical than logical or conceptual. Although it is a chunking mechanism like a model, at its simplest it is meant to address the organization of executables and production artifacts rather than ideas.

一个模型可以分为子系统；子系统可以包括一个或多个模型。从概念上讲，整个物理系统在顶层由单个模型表示。然后可以根据需要对该模型进行细分，以适应建模练习的目的。普通的从属模型被打包成模型是逻辑上的便利。子系统本身就是微型系统，不重叠。在开发过程中，随着建模的重点转向构建和物理架构变得稳定，子系统提供了一种组织工作产品的方法，这些工作产品可​​以转化为实际的物理实现。

A model can be divided into subsystems; subsystems can include one or more models. Conceptually, the whole physical system is represented at the top level by a single model. This model can then be subdivided as needed to suit the purposes of the modeling exercise. Ordinary subordinate models that are packaged as models are logical conveniences. Subsystems are miniature systems themselves, ones that do not overlap. In the course of development, as the focus of modeling shifts towards construction and the physical architecture becomes stabilized, subsystems provide a way of organizing work products that can be translated into real physical implementations.

子系统继承包的所有命名、访问和依赖属性。然而，与类不同的是，子系统提供接口并具有操作。其内容可分为规范和实现子集：

A subsystem inherits all the naming, access, and dependency properties of a package. However, like a class and unlike a model, a subsystem provides interfaces and has operations. Its contents can be separated into specification and realization subsets:

  • 规格 

    操作和/或功能，以及用例和状态机等元素

  • Specification 

    Operations and/or features, together with such elements as use cases and state machines

  • 实现 

    标识那些物理上实现规范的元素

  • Realization 

    Identifies those elements that physically implement the specification

子系统是 UML 中明显不一致和混乱的领域之一。例如，在第 2-180 页，UML 规范声明子系统“可以实例化也可以不实例化”。然而，在第 2-181 页上，它表示子系统“无法实例化”，同时声明可实例化的子系统具有复合类的某些语义，而不可实例化的子系统具有包的语义（Rational Software Corporation 1999 ).

Subsystems are one of those areas in the UML that are notably inconsistent and muddy. For example, on page 2-180, the UML Specification declares that a subsystem "may or may not be instantiable." On page 2-181, however, it says that subsystems "cannot be instantiated" while declaring that an instantiable subsystem has some of the semantics of a composite class, whereas one that is not instantiable has the semantics of a package (Rational Software Corporation 1999).

当下一次重大修订发生时，子系统可能会变得更加清晰。同时，子系统的重要性在很大程度上取决于您正在使用的流程。RUP 严重依赖于子系统；对于 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书，它们主要是一种方便的方式包基础设施服务。

Subsystems are probably going to become much clearer when the next major revision happens. Meanwhile, the importance of subsystems is very much a matter of the process that you're using. The RUP relies on subsystems heavily; for D'Souza and Wills' book, they're mostly a convenient way to package infrastructural services.

3.2.3 框架：模式包

3.2.3 Frameworks: Packages of Patterns

一个框架也可以通过使用一个包来表达，一个“主要由模式组成，其中模式被定义为模板协作”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，2-174）。通用包充当模板，其中包含一些参数化元素（即，充当相当于软件模式的元素的占位符），例如四人组模式或 Martin Fowler 的分析模式。

A framework can also be expressed by using a package, one "consisting mainly of patterns, where patterns are defined as template collaborations" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 2-174). The generic package acts as a template with some elements parameterized (that is, acting as placeholders for elements in what amounts to a software pattern) such as the Gang of Four patterns or Martin Fowler's analysis patterns.

尽管不是 UML 的知名成员（也就是说，他们没有作为单独的 ModelElement 的规范，例如 Model 和 Subsystem），框架是包的第三种合法用途。

Although not high-profile members of the UML (that is, they don't have a specification as a separate ModelElement, such as Model and Subsystem), frameworks are the third legitimate use for packages.

D'Souza 和 Wills 的书使用框架作为提供一致机制的一种方式，用于在所有开发阶段组织和重用模型元素（1998 年）。实现模型可以由代码框架组成，这些代码框架反映了在分析模型中出现并在设计模型中得到改进的框架。将组件视为协作，将系统视为组件之间的协作，这使得实例化为框架的模式成为传统面向对象设计的模型和子系统方法的有效替代方案。

D'Souza and Wills' book uses frameworks as a way of providing a consistent mechanism for organizing and reusing model elements across all stages of development (1998). An implementation model can be composed of code frameworks that reflect the frameworks that emerged in the analysis model and were refined in the design model. Seeing components as collaborations and systems as collaborations between components makes the use of patterns that are instantiated as frameworks an effective alternative to the models-and-subsystems approach of traditional object-oriented design.

与包从类分组演变而来的方式相同，在 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书中，框架提供了一种更精细的模式使用方式，尤其是作为一种增强重用的方式。尽管在 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书中协作仍然是模式和框架的核心，但催化框架超越了对模式的简单理解，将其理解为对象之间的协作，这是模式当前体现在统一机器学习 (1998)。

In the same way that packages have evolved from groupings of classes, in D'Souza and Wills' book, a framework provides a more refined means of using patterns, especially as a way of enhancing reuse. Although collaboration remains the core of patterns and frameworks in D'Souza and Wills' book, catalysis frameworks go beyond the simplistic understanding of patterns as a collaboration between objects that underlies the way patterns are currently embodied in the UML (1998).

3.3 扩展

3.3 Extensions

UML 的关键功能之一是它可以根据需要使用多种扩展机制进行定制和剪裁. 扩展不仅仅是一种本地化 UML 以提供项目或组织方言的方法。它们还提供了一种谨慎发展语言的方法。

One of the key capabilities of the UML is that it can be customized and tailored as needed with a number of extension mechanisms. Extensions aren't just a means of localizing the UML to provide a dialect for a project or organization. They also provide a means of cautiously evolving the language.

扩展可以作为对一般需求的非正式解决方案作为一个整体添加到该语言中，然后（可能）被翻译成该语言的完整且独特的成员。例如，Framework 目前是通过扩展来处理的，而不是像 Model 和 Subsystem 那样拥有与成为 ModelElement 相关的全部好处。

Extensions can be added to the language as a whole as an informal solution to a general need, and later (possibly) being translated into a full and distinctive member of the language. For example, Framework is currently handled by means of an extension, rather than having the full blessing associated with being a ModelElement, the way Model and Subsystem are handled.

目前有三种可用的扩展机制，以及一种以标准化形式打包 UML 扩展方言的方法。下面是一个基本的介绍。

There are three extension mechanisms currently available, and one way of packaging extended dialects of the UML in standardized form. The following is a basic introduction.

3.3.1 标记值

3.3.1 Tagged Values

标记值是明确定义的元素的属性。它们是关于模型或模型元素的信息，而不是系统本身。标签及其相关值使用以下形式定义：

Tagged values are properties of elements that are explicitly defined. They are information about the model or model element, not the system itself. The tag and its associated value are defined using the following form:

						
{标签 = “价值”}
						
{tag = "value"}

例如：

For example:

						


{modeler = "L. DaVinci"}
						


{modeler = "L. DaVinci"}

用大括号包围标记值。标记值可以放置在容器内或靠近被标记的模型元素。UML中有一些预定义的标签，比如invariant, precondition , and postcondition , 可用于（例如）支持使用合同。

with braces surrounding the tagged value. The tagged value can be placed inside a container or in close proximity to the model element being tagged. There are some predefined tags in the UML, such as invariant, precondition, and postcondition, which can be used (for example) to support the use of contracts.

3.3.2 约束

3.3.2 Constraints

约束是模型元素的语义限制本质上是规则或条件语句。它们通常可以是用户定义的或 UML 的一部分。与标记值一样，它们出现在大括号内，通常包含在它们相关的模型元素中，或者出现在附近。例如：

Constraints are semantic restrictions on a model elementessentially, rules or conditional statements. They can be user-defined or part of the UML generally. Like tagged values, they appear within braces, typically contained within the model element they relate to, or appear close by. For example:

						


{年龄 >= 21}
						


{age >= 21}

有大量的 UML 提供约束。

There are a substantial number of UML-provided constraints.

3.3.3 刻板印象

3.3.3 Stereotypes

刻板印象是最强大和最常用的扩展机制。它们提供了通过创建新模型来专门化现有模型元素的方法。这样，可以解决限制或特殊需求，而不必对 UML 本身进行正式更改（尽管，与标记值和约束一样，UML 包含许多官方原型，需要谨慎处理本地原型生成).

Stereotypes are the most powerful and used of the extension mechanisms. They provide the means to specialize existing ModelElementsin effect, by creating new ones. This way, limitations or special needs can be addressed without having to get an official change to the UML itself (although, as with tagged values and constraints, the UML includes a number of official stereotypes, and local stereotype generation needs to be handled with caution).

目前，比如framework是package的构造型，actor是class的构造型。构造型是通过将构造型的名称添加到被扩展的模型元素来表达的。该名称包含在 guillemets 中。因此，框架如图3.1所示。

Currently, for example, framework is a stereotype of package, and actor is a stereotype of class. A stereotype is expressed by adding the name of the stereotype to the model element being extended. The name is enclosed in guillemets. Therefore, the framework looks like Figure 3.1.

图 3.1。一个被定型为框架的包。

3.3.4 配置文件

3.3.4 Profiles

UML提供了一种称为配置文件的机制，作为一种包装一组预定义的构造型、标记值、约束和符号图标的方式，以便为特定域或过程定制 UML。因为它们是扩展，概要文件不会改变基本的 UML。相反，它们旨在帮助创建和管理或多或少具有地方特色的方言。

The UML provides a mechanism called a profile to act as a way of packaging a predefined set of stereotypes, tagged values, constraints, and notation icons to customize the UML for a specific domain or process. Because they are extensions, profiles don't alter the basic UML. Instead, they are intended to help in the creation and management of dialects that can be more or less local.

1.3规范中包含两个示例；一个用于 RUP（称为统一过程），以及三个朋友的业务建模：Ivar Jacobson、Grady Booch 和 James Rumbaugh。已经提出了其他建议，特别是用于工作流和过程建模，以及处理持久性。

Two samples are included in the 1.3 Specification; one for the RUP (referred to as the Unified Process), and Business Modeling a la the Three Amigos: Ivar Jacobson, Grady Booch, and James Rumbaugh. Others have been proposed, notably for workflow and process modeling, and to handle persistence.

尽管不是这样设计的，但组织或过程配置文件也可能是一种记录 UML 大量提供的正式约束、标记、构造型和关键字中哪些是合法的方式，提供过滤功能和扩展功能。然后，配置文件将作为开发的架构风格文档的一部分包含在内努力。

Although not intended this way, an organization or process profile might also be a way to document which of the UML's copious supply of formal constraints, tags, stereotypes, and keywords are legalproviding a filtering capability as well as an extending capability. A profile would then be included as part of the documentation of the architectural style for a development effort.

3.4 符号

3.4 Symbols

作者们UML 已经努力避免用太多独特的符号让用户不知所措，并且还试图在概念上相关的符号（例如包和类）之间提供符号相似性。

The authors of the UML have made an effort to avoid overwhelming the user with too many distinctive symbols, and have also tried to provide notational similarities among conceptually related symbols (packages and classes, for example).

UML 符号可以有内容或只是图标。实际上，UML 区分了它所谓的笨拙的二维符号和图标：

UML symbols can have content or just be iconic. Actually, the UML distinguishes between what it calls, awkwardly, two-dimensional symbols and icons:

  • 图标 

    大小和形状固定，图标不必附加到路径（但可以是终止符：路径末尾的图标限定路径符号的含义）。它们可能位于符号内。

  • Icons 

    Fixed in size and shape, icons do not have to be attached to paths (but can be terminators: icons on the end of a path that qualify the meaning of the path symbol). They may be located within symbols.

  • 二维符号 

    具有收缩或增长的能力，二维符号也可以有隔间。一些二维符号也是图形——它们包含节点由路径连接。

  • Two-dimensional symbols 

    Having the capability to shrink or grow, two-dimensional symbols can have compartments as well. Some two-dimensional symbols are also graphsthey contain nodes connected by paths.

3.4.1 演员

3.4.1 Actor

一个演员是系统外部直接与之交互的某物或某人，通常是系统或另一个系统/子系统的用户（参见图 3.2）。参与者参与用例，并且可以在系统模型的任何位置以其他类型的图表表示。

An actor is something or someone outside the system that interacts directly with ittypically, a user of the system or another system/subsystem (see Figure 3.2). An actor participates in use cases and may be represented in other types of diagrams anywhere in the system model.

图 3.2。演员。

3.4.2 用例/协作

3.4.2 Use Case/Collaboration

一个用例 是参与者与系统进行的一系列交互，这会为参与者产生可观察到的价值（见图3.3）。顺便说一下，这不是 UML 定义，它令人遗憾地繁琐和技术化，并且似乎是在努力将用例变成一种类以及 UML 称之为“行为的东西”。

A use case is a sequence of interactions by an actor with the system, which yields observable value to the actor (see Figure 3.3). By the way, this is not the UML definition, which is deplorably fussy and technical, and seems to be an effort to make use cases into a type of class and what the UML calls a "behavioral thing."

图 3.3。用例。

一次合作 一组交互以实现行为的对象（参见图 3.4）。通常，协作可用于指定用例或操作的实现。一个协作也可以用来指定一个软件模式，一个参数化的协作（即，具有在使用模式时被替换的抽象参与者的参与者）可以指定架构模式。

A collaboration a collection of objects that interact to implement behavior (see Figure 3.4). Typically, a collaboration can be used to specify the realization of a use case or an operation. A collaboration can also be used to specify a software pattern, and a parameterized collaboration (that is, one with abstract participants that are replaced when the pattern is used) can specify an architectural pattern.

图 3.4。合作。

3.4.3 类/对象/类型/活动类

3.4.3 Class/Object/Type/Active Class

A类 是共享相同属性、操作、方法、关系和语义的一组可能对象的抽象（见图3.5）。一个类可以使用一组接口来指定它向其环境提供的操作集合。Atype是对象集合的表示，没有将物理实现指定为类。类和类型在 UML 中使用相同的符号。

A class is an abstraction of a set of possible objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and semantics (see Figure 3.5). A class may use a set of interfaces to specify collections of operations it provides to its environment. A type is a representation of a collection of objects without specifying the physical implementation as a class. Class and type use the same symbol in the UML.

图 3.5。班级。

一个对象是类的实例或类型的示例——与类相同的符号，但名称带有下划线（见图3.6）。

An object is an instance of a class or an example of a typethe same symbol as class, but with the name underlined (see Figure 3.6).

图 3.6。目的。

一个活跃的班级是一组对象，每个对象都拥有一个控制线程（也就是说，它可以启动、控制和终止一个进程或线程）。（见图3.7。）

An active class is a set of objects, each of which owns a thread of control (that is, it can initiate, control, and terminate a process or thread). (See Figure 3.7.)

图 3.7。活跃类。

3.4.4 接口

3.4.4 Interface

一个接口 描述类、组件或包的可见操作（见图3.8）。它定义了可从实施元素获得的服务。

An interface describes the visible operations of a class, component, or package (see Figure 3.8). It defines the services available from the implementing element.

图 3.8。界面。

3.4.5 组件

3.4.5 Component

一个组件是一个系统的物理、可替换部分，它打包实现并提供一组接口的实现（见图3.9）。组件表示系统的物理实现部分，包括软件代码（源代码、二进制代码或可执行文件）或等效项，例如脚本或命令文件（Rational Software Corporation1999，B-5）。

A component is a physical, replaceable part of a system that packages implementation and provides the realization of a set of interfaces (see Figure 3.9). A component represents a physical piece of implementation of a system, including software code (source, binary, or executable) or equivalents such as scripts or command files (Rational Software Corporation1999, B-5).

图 3.9。成分。

3.4.6 节点

3.4.6 Node

一个节点代表存在于运行时的处理资源，至少具有内存，通常还具有处理能力（见图3.10）。节点包括计算设备和系统中使用的任何其他物理资源，例如人或机器。

A node represents a processing resource that exists at run time, with at least a memory and often processing capability as well (see Figure 3.10). Nodes comprise computing devices and any other physical resources used in a system, such as people or machines.

图 3.10。节点。

3.4.7 包

3.4.7 Package

一个包裹 （参见图 3.11）是一个用于组织模型元素的 UML 容器（参见 本章前面的第 3.2 节“包” ）。

A package (see Figure 3.11) is a UML container used to organize model elements (refer to Section 3.2, "Packages," earlier in this chapter).

图 3.11。包裹。

3.4.8 状态

3.4.8 State

一个状态是对象的条件、状态或情形，作为其生命周期的一部分和/或作为交互的结果（参见图 3.12）。状态也可用于模拟正在进行的活动。

A state is the condition, status, or situation of an object as part of its lifecycle and/or as the result of an interaction (see Figure 3.12). A state may also be used to model an ongoing activity.

图 3.12。状态。

3.4.9 注意事项

3.4.9 Note

一个注释是用于提供解释性文本，例如模型中的注释（参见图 3.13）。注释也可以以特定方式使用，具体取决于您采用的建模方言（需求就是一个很好的例子）。

A note is used to provide explanatory text, such as comments in a model (see Figure 3.13). A note can also be used in specific ways, depending on the modeling dialect you adopt (requirements are a good example).

图 3.13。笔记。

3.5 行

3.5 Lines

在 UML 中，行 用于表达消息（模型元素之间的动态连接）、“链接”（模型元素之间的关系——术语链接在 UML 中也具有正式含义）和交互。通常，消息不会出现在结构模型中；链接不会出现在动态模型中。但这也可以在方言中发生变化。以下部分将解释一组基本的基于行的 UML 符号。

In the UML, lines are used to express messages (dynamic connections between model elements), "links" (relationships between model elementsthe term link also has a formal meaning within the UML), and interactions. Generally, messages don't appear in structural models; links don't appear in dynamic models. But this, too, can be varied within a dialect. A basic set of line-based UML notation is explained in the following sections.

笔记

Note

请记住（正如我在第 3.1.2 节“图表”中讨论视觉关系时提到的），在 UML 中，线条必须以某种方式终止，可以使用模型元素图形或 图标。

Remember (as I mentioned when discussing visual relationships in Section 3.1.2, "Diagrams" ), lines must be terminated in some fashion in the UML, either with a model element graphic or an icon.

3.5.1 消息

3.5.1 Messages

消息被使用动态模型中模型元素之间的交互，那些代表系统中的行为。例如，消息在对象之间传递信息并触发活动。消息有四种类型（如图3.14所示）：

Messages are used in interactions between model elements in dynamic models, those that represent the behavior in a system. Messages convey information between objects, for example, and trigger activities. There are four types of messages (as shown in Figure 3.14):

图 3.14。消息的四种类型。

  • 简单的信息 

    控制在不提供详细信息的情况下从一个对象传递到另一个对象。

  • Simple message 

    Control is passed from one object to another without providing details.

  • 同步消息 

    这发送对象暂停等待结果。

  • Synchronous message 

    The sending object pauses to wait for results.

  • 异步消息 

    发送对象不会暂停以等待结果。

  • Asynchronous message 

    The sending object does not pause to wait for results.

  • 返回消息 

    这条信息表示过程调用的返回。

  • Return message 

    This message indicates a return from a procedure call.

3.5.2 一般关系

3.5.2 Relationships in General

关系用于结构模型显示模型元素之间的语义连接。

Relationships are used in structural models to show semantic connections between model elements.

一个依赖是《统一建模语言用户指南》称之为“使用”关系（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998a），在这种关系中，两件事之间的联系意味着如果一件事发生变化，就会影响另一件事（见图 3.15 ）。依赖关系可用于识别各种模型元素之间的联系，包就是一个典型的例子。这些是单向关系。

A dependency is what The Unified Modeling Language User Guide calls a "using" relationship (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998a), one in which the connection between two things means that if one changes, it affects the other (see Figure 3.15). Dependencies can be used to identify connections between a variety of model elements, packages being a notable example. These are unidirectional relationships.

图 3.15。依赖性。

概括_是两个元素之间的关系，其中一个是另一个的更一般形式（见图3.16）。类继承是这样表示的，但是可以更一般地使用泛化。同样，包就是一个例子。

A generalization is a relation between two elements, in which one is a more general form of the other (see Figure 3.16). Class inheritance is represented this way, but generalization can be used more generally. Again, packages are an example.

图 3.16。概括。
