协会_就是 UML 所说的结构关系，将一个对象映射到另一组对象（见图3.17）。它还用于识别参与者和用例之间的通信路径。统一建模语言参考手册将关联描述为“将系统联系在一起的粘合剂”（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998b，47）。在 UML 中，关联也具有导航意义（您可以从这里到达那里，从一个对象到另一个对象），这可能会在一些对象方法论纯粹主义者中引起胃灼热。

An association is what the UML calls a structural relationship, mapping one object to another set of objects (see Figure 3.17). It is also used to identify the communication path between an actor and a use case. The Unified Modeling Language Reference Manual describes associations as "the glue that ties systems together" (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998b, 47). In the UML, an association has a navigational sense to it as well (you can get there from here, from one object to another), which can cause heartburn among some object methodology purists.

图 3.17。协会。

实现是一种标识合同链接的依赖关系元素之间一个实现元素。例如，一个类实现了指定元素中的行为；在本例中，它是一个接口（见图3.18）。实现还链接用例和协作。（参见第 3.5.4 节，“关系：依赖的一些用途。”）

A realization is a type of dependency relationship that identifies a contractual link between elementsa realizing element. For example, a class implements the behaviors in a specifying element; in this case, it is an interface (see Figure 3.18). A realization also links use cases and collaborations. (See Section 3.5.4, "Relationships: Some Uses of Dependency." )

图 3.18。实现。

3.5.3 关系：某些类型的关联

3.5.3 Relationships: Some Types of Associations

UML 将聚合和组合视为具有独特符号的特殊关联形式。不用说，聚合和组合的语义受到很多争论。

The UML considers aggregations and composites to be special forms of association with distinctive notations. Needless to say, the semantics of aggregates and composites is subject to much debate.

合格的协会是一个简单的关联，指示在关联对象集中识别目标对象时使用什么信息。在图 3.19中，银行账户#用于标识其所属的客户。

A qualified association is a plain association with an indication of what information to use when identifying a target object in the set of associated objects. In Figure 3.19, bank account # is used to identify the customer it belongs to.

图 3.19。合格的协会。

聚合_表示整体-部分关系。这与普通关联形成对比，普通关联显示了对等方之间的关系，具体取决于数量（参见图 3.20）。在聚合中，一个元素是整体，其他元素是部分。

An aggregation represents a whole-part relationship. This contrasts with a plain association, which shows a relationship among/between peers, depending on the number (see Figure 3.20). In an aggregation, one element is the whole and the other(s) are the parts.

图 3.20。聚合。

一个组合是一个对其部分拥有强大所有权的聚合。因此，如果整个元素消失，部分也会消失（见图3.21）。

A composition is an aggregation that has strong ownership of its parts. Therefore, if the whole element disappears, the parts do, too (see Figure 3.21).

图 3.21。作品。

3.5.4 关系：依赖的一些用途

3.5.4 Relationships: Some Uses of Dependency

依赖关系在 UML 中经常被原型化以支持特定类型的图表或模型元素的需要。以下是一些示例：

Dependency relationships are frequently stereotyped in the UML to support the needs of particular types of diagrams or model elements. The following are some examples:

延伸提供一种在用例中可选的处理行为的方法（参见图 3.22）。可选行为打包在扩展用例中，并通过<<extends>>依赖项连接。

Extends provides a way of handling behavior that is optional in a use case (see Figure 3.22). The optional behavior is packaged in an extending use case and connected via an <<extends>> dependency.

图 3.22。扩展依赖。

包括提供了一种处理许多用例共有的行为的方法（参见图 3.23）。可选行为被分解出来，打包在一个包含的用例中，并通过<<includes>>依赖关系连接。

Includes provides a way of handling behavior that is common to a number of use cases (see Figure 3.23). The optional behavior is factored out, packaged in an included use case, and connected via an <<includes>> dependency.

图 3.23。包括依赖性。

进口是一个包之间的依赖关系（见图3.24）。接收包可以访问正在接收的包的公开可见元素进口。

Imports is a dependency between packages (see Figure 3.24). A receiving package can access the publicly visible elements of the package being imported.

图 3.24。导入依赖。

3.5.5 抽象：依赖的其他用途

3.5.5 Abstraction: Other Uses of Dependency

UML 包括一个各种明确的抽象表达：

The UML includes a variety of explicit expressions of abstraction:

细化指示不同抽象级别的两个元素之间的依赖关系（见图3.25）。这方面的一个例子是不同类型模型中的相关元素，例如分析模型和设计模型，这些在 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书中非常重要，但在 RUP 中几乎没有提到。

Refinement indicates a dependency between two elements at different levels of abstraction (see Figure 3.25). An example of this is related elements in different types of models, such as an analysis model and a design model, which are very important in D'Souza and Wills' book, but are hardly mentioned in the RUP.

图 3.25。细化。

实现 早先作为成熟的重要关系引入，值得拥有自己的线条符号。也可以使用构造型来表示（见图3.26）。UML规范说，“实现可用于建模逐步细化、优化、转换、模板、模型综合、框架组合等”（Rational Software Corporation 1999）。

Realization was introduced earlier as a full-blown significant relationship meriting its own line symbol. It can also be indicated by using a stereotype (see Figure 3.26). The UML Specification says, "Realization can be used to model stepwise refinement, optimizations, transformations, templates, model synthesis, framework composition, and so on" (Rational Software Corporation 1999).

图 3.26。实现。

推导 表示可以从关系中的其他元素计算元素（派生元素）的实例（参见图 3.27）。

Derivation indicates that an instance of an element (the derived element) can be computed from the other element in the relationship (see Figure 3.27).

图 3.27。推导

一丝_关系显示表示不同模型中相同概念的模型元素或模型元素集之间的联系（参见图 3.28）。跟踪主要用于跟踪需求和跨模型的变化。

A trace relationship shows connections between model elements or sets of model elements representing the same concept in different models (see Figure 3.28). Traces are mainly used for tracking requirements and changes across models.

图 3.28。痕迹。

3.6 图

3.6 Diagrams

UML 图在哪里这一切都在一起。正如我已经提到的，在 UML 中没有正式的方式来界定或包含图表（也就是说，图表本身没有符号），因此图表之间没有关系。相反，图表是模型各个方面的图形表示工具。它们不是独立存在的，而是要成为提供模型规范的文本叙述的一部分。

UML diagrams are where it all comes together. As I already mentioned, in the UML there is no formal way of bounding or containing a diagram (that is, no notation for the diagram itself), so there are no relationships between diagrams. Instead, diagrams are the graphical presentation vehicles for aspects of a model. They don't stand alone, but are meant to be part of the textual narrative that provides the model specification.

UML 在其文档中特别包含九种不同的图表，我将在此处简要讨论。然而，这些图表类型是依赖于过程的和暗示性的，而不是规定性的。UML 允许建模者根据手头的建模需要将任何和所有元素组合到图表中。当然，在实践中，只有特定的元素组合是合理的，这九种类型几乎是面向对象编程的“规范”类型。

The UML specifically includes nine different diagrams in its documentation, which I'll discuss briefly here. However, these diagram types are process-dependent and suggestive, rather than prescriptive. The UML allows the modeler to combine any and all elements into diagrams, depending on the modeling needs at hand. In practice, of course, only certain combinations of elements are sensible, and these nine types are pretty much the "canonical" ones for object-oriented programming.

然而，所有这些确实需要在流程和所使用的工具的背景下加以考虑。尽管 RUP 包括所有这些图表，但 D'Souza 和 Wills 的书（例如）没有。

However, all of this really needs to be considered in the context of the process and the tool being used. Although the RUP includes all of these diagrams, D'Souza and Wills' book (for example) doesn't.

详述这些图表和备选方案本身就可以成为一本书。大多数关于 UML 的文献都集中在这些图上，因此已经有很多好书可供选择。因为这本书与 UML 一样独立于过程，所以我将把对这些图的详细讨论留给许多其他更面向编程的书籍。

Detailing these diagrams and the alternatives can be a book by itself. Most of the literature on the UML focuses on these diagrams, so there are already many good books to choose from. Because this book is as process-independent as the UML, I'll leave detailed discussions of these diagrams to the many other more programming-oriented, books out there and to come.

3.6.1 类图

3.6.1 Class Diagram

对于传统的面向对象开发，类图是系统模型的基石。在 UML 术语中，它是静态结构模型的视图。它不是模型的正式划分；因此，单独的类图“不代表底层模型中的划分”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，3-33）。

For traditional object-oriented development, the class diagram is the keystone for the system model. In UML terms, it is a view of the static structural model. It is not a formal partitioning of the model; therefore, individual class diagrams "do not represent divisions in the underlying model" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3-33).

除了类之外，类图还可以包含接口、包、关系和实例（例如对象和链接）。UML规范建议“更好的名称是静态结构图”，但坚持使用类图(1999) 是为了传统和简洁。

Aside from classes, a class diagram can also contain interfaces, packages, relationships, and instances (such as objects and links). The UML Specification suggests that "a better name would be static structural diagram," but bows to tradition and brevity in sticking with class diagram (1999).

UML 识别类和类型之间的区别；类的本质在概念上会发生变化，这取决于建模工作所处的开发阶段。对于那些感兴趣的人，Martin Fowler、Kendall Scott 和 Ivar Jacobson 在捕捉和解释类的建模细微差别方面做了令人钦佩的工作， UML中的类型和对象Distilled: Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language (Fowler, Scott,和雅各布森 1997 年）。

The UML recognizes the distinction between class and type; the nature of what is meant by class changes conceptually, depending on the development stage that the modeling effort is in. For those interested, Martin Fowler, Kendall Scott, and Ivar Jacobson do an admirable job of capturing and explaining the modeling nuances of class, type and object in UML Distilled: Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language (Fowler, Scott, and Jacobson 1997).

3.6.2 用例图

3.6.2 Use Case Diagram

为了在用例驱动开发中，用例图是建模工作的基石。用例图显示参与者和用例，以及它们之间的关系。其中包括：

For use case-driven development, the use case diagram is the keystone of the modeling effort. Use case diagrams show actors and use cases, together with their relationships. These include the following:

  • 之间的关联参与者和用例

  • Associations between the actors and the use cases

  • 参与者之间的概括

  • Generalizations between the actors

  • 泛化、扩展和包含用例之间的关系

  • Generalizations, extends, and includes relationships among the use cases

用例可能被矩形包围，以显示包含系统的边界，等等。正如在 UML 模式中显而易见的那样，用例图本身本质上是微不足道的。用例的真正内容在文本（叙述）中。

The use cases may be enclosed by a rectangle to show the boundary of the containing system, and so on. As will be evident in the UML patterns, use case diagrams by themselves are essentially trivial. The real substance of a use case is in the text (narrative).

用例捕获定义范围、上下文和需求的参与者与系统或系统的某些部分交互的重要部分。在整个开发过程中可以以多种方式使用用例（例如，作为设置测试环境的基础和作为用户手册的起点）。

A use case captures the significant parts of an interaction with the system or some part of the system by the actor(s) defining the scope, context, and requirements. Use cases can be used in a variety of ways throughout the development effort (for example, as the basis for setting up the test environment and as a starting point for a user manual).

下面是一个基本用例的例子，它描述了打电话，先是文本格式，然后是图表（见图3.29）。调用者发起用例，接收者是次要参与者。调用者和参与者交互的系统当然是电话系统。备用流没有完整描述，但指示备用流处理的条件类型。

The following is an example of a basic use case, which describes making a phone call, in text format first and then the diagram (see Figure 3.29). The caller initiates the use case, and the receiver is a secondary actor. The system that the caller and actor interact with is, of course, the phone system. The alternate flows aren't completely described, but indicate the kind of conditions that alternate flows handle.

图 3.29。电话呼叫用例图。

演员：

呼叫者

接收者

正常流量：

当呼叫者拿起电话听筒时，用例开始。

来电者听拨号音。

（备用流程：无拨号音）

来电者拨了一个电话号码。

电话系统使接收者的电话响铃。

（备用流程：错误号码）

接收者回答。

（备用流程：无人接听）

来电者进行对话。

当呼叫者挂断电话时用例结束。

备用流程：

没有拨号音

错号码

没有答案

Actors:

Caller

Receiver

Normal Flow:

The use case begins when Caller picks up the handset of telephone.

Caller listens for dial tone.

(Alternate flow: no dial tone)

Caller dials a phone number.

Phone System rings Receiver's phone.

(Alternate flow: Wrong number)

Receiver answers.

(Alternate flow: no answer)

Caller conducts conversation.

The use case ends when Caller hangs up phone.

Alternate Flows:

No dial tone

Wrong number

No answer

3.6.3 交互图

3.6.3 Interaction Diagrams

交互图用于系统的动态建模。有两种：顺序图和协作图。

Interaction diagrams are used in the dynamic modeling of the system. There are two kinds: sequence diagrams and collaboration diagrams.

时序图

时序图显示按时间顺序排列的交互：对象（不是类）和交互发生时在它们之间传递的消息。这些就是 Ivar Jacobson 用来称呼交互图的东西。

A sequence diagram shows an interaction arranged in time sequence: the objects (not classes) and the messages that pass between them when an interaction occurs. These are what Ivar Jacobson used to call interaction diagrams.

序列图在其顶部有一个参与对象列表，显示为矩形。每个对象矩形至少包含一个名称，名称始终带有下划线以指示该矩形是一个对象而不是类。在每个对象矩形下方（用虚线显示）是对象生命线，即对象之间（以及与系统）进行消息交换的按时间排序的可视化框架。称为激活的窄垂直矩形表示对象实际执行操作的时间段（直接或通过中介，例如另一个对象）。对象消息显示为带有文本描述的箭头。图 3.30显示了序列图的基本元素。

A sequence diagram has a list of participating objects across its top, shown as rectangles. Each object rectangle contains at least a name, always underlined to indicate that the rectangle is an object and not a class. Below each object rectangle, shown with a dotted line, is the object lifeline, the time-ordered visual framework for message exchanges between the objects (and with the system). A narrow vertical rectangle called the activation represents the period of time an object is actually performing an action (directly or through an intermediary, such as another object). Object messages appear as arrows with a text description. Figure 3.30 shows the basic elements of a sequence diagram.

图 3.30。简单的序列图。
协作图

还有合作图显示了对象之间的消息传递，但关注的是对象和消息及其顺序，而不是时间顺序。交互序列和并发线程使用序列号标识。协作图显示了围绕交互中的角色及其相互之间的链接组织的交互，并显示了扮演不同角色的对象之间的关系。UML规范建议协作图比序列图更适合实时规范和复杂场景。

A collaboration diagram also shows the passing of messages between objects, but focuses on the objects and messages and their order instead of the time sequence. The sequence of interactions and the concurrent threads are identified using sequence numbers. A collaboration diagram shows an interaction organized around the roles in the interaction and their links to each other, and shows the relationships among the objects playing the different roles. The UML Specification suggests that collaboration diagrams are better for real-time specifications and for complex scenarios than sequence diagrams.

图 3.31显示了用协作图表示的电话呼叫示例。

Figure 3.31 shows the telephone call example expressed as a collaboration diagram.

图 3.31。协作图显示了对象的静态结构和它们之间流动的消息。

3.6.4 状态图

3.6.4 State Diagrams

状态图显示系统的状态、事件、转换和活动，描述为状态机. 它们是动态建模而不是结构建模的一部分。它们用于描述模型元素（例如对象或交互）的行为，描述“可能的状态和动作序列，元素在其生命周期中由于对离散事件（例如，信号，信号，操作调用）”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，3-131）。

State diagrams show the states, events, transitions, and activities for the system, depicted as state machines. They're part of dynamic modeling rather than structural modeling. They are used to describe the behavior of a model element such as an object or an interaction, describing "possible sequences of states and actions through which the element can proceed during its lifetime as a result of reacting to discrete events (for example, signals, operation invocations)" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3-131).

UML中的正式名称是状态图，但是状态图在UML 规范和大部分文献中随处可见。状态图一词反映了它在 Harel Statecharts 中的起源，Harel Statecharts 是一种长期使用的实时系统建模工具，UML 对其进行了修改以适应面向对象的开发。

The official name in the UML is statechart diagram, but state diagram pops up all over the place in the UML Specification and in much of the literature. The term statechart reflects its origins in Harel Statecharts, a long-used tool for modeling real-time systems, which the UML has modified to fit object-oriented development.

状态图通常用于对需要对其离散状态进行完整描述的对象的行为建模。标准业务系统中的许多对象可能没有重要状态，在这种情况下，它们将不需要状态图。（另一方面，对于那些开发实时系统的人来说，状态图和状态建模的讨论本身就可以成为一本书。）状态图通常与一个且仅与一个类相关联，并列出所有状态特定对象可以在系统期间手术。

A state diagram is typically used to model the behavior of an object that needs a complete description of its discrete states. Many objects in standard business systems may not have significant states, in which case they will not need state diagrams. (On the other hand, for those developing real-time systems, a discussion of state diagrams and state modeling can be a book by itself.) A state diagram is typically associated with one and only one class, and lists all the states that a particular object can have during system operation.

每个圆角矩形代表一个对象可能处于的一种状态。状态图必须表示对象可以找到自己的所有状态，并定义对象将处于的初始状态。初始状态 显示为实心黑色圆圈。如果对象没有最终状态，则不需要对象的最终状态，例如在始终运行的系统中。

Each rounded rectangle represents one state that an object can be in. A state diagram must represent all the states in which an object can find itself, as well as define an initial state the object will be in. An initial state is shown as a filled-in black circle. The final state of an object is not required if the object has nofinal state, such as in a system that is always running.

对象在转换后从一种状态传递到另一种状态 由系统内的事件触发（通常是方法调用）。通过绘制从一种状态到另一种状态的箭头来显示转换，并与触发转换的事件相关联。

An object passes from one state to another following a transition triggered by an event within the system (typically, a method invocation). A transition is shown by drawing an arrow from one state to another and is associated with an event that triggers the transition.

图 3.32显示了灯开关的状态图，其中显示了过渡线和事件。

Figure 3.32 shows the state diagram for a light switch that shows both transition lines and events.

图 3.32。显示电灯开关两种状态的状态图。

3.6.5 活动图

3.6.5 Activity Diagrams

一个活动图是“状态图的特例，其中所有（或至少大多数）状态都是动作或子活动状态，并且其中所有（或至少大多数）转换都是由源中的动作或子活动完成触发的状态”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，3-151）。事实上，它们基本上是流程图的复杂版本。它们旨在涵盖工作流程和过程，并且具有流程图的大部分风格，没有负面的“包袱”。它们作为状态图版本的描述受到很多批评，但至少它有助于使它们成为 UML 家族的一致成员。

An activity diagram is a "special case of a state diagram in which all (or at least most) of the states are action or subactivity states and in which all (or at least most) of the transitions are triggered by completion of the actions or subactivities in the source states" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3-151). In fact, they're basically sophisticated versions of flowcharts. They're intended to cover workflows and processes, and have much of the flavor of flowcharts without the negative "baggage." Their depiction as versions of state diagrams is subject to much criticism, but at least it helps to make them a consistent member of the UML family.

活动图附加到类（包括 UML 的用例）、包或操作的实现。UML规范说他们“关注由内部处理驱动的流程（而不是外部事件）”（1999，3-151）。它建议在所涉及的事件表示内部生成的操作完成时使用它们（用于程序控制流）。

An activity diagram is attached to a class (which includes a use case for the UML), to a package, or to the implementation of an operation. The UML Specification says that they "focus on flows driven by internal processing (as opposed to external events)" (1999, 3-151). It recommends using them where the events involved represent the completion of internally generated actions (for procedural flow of control).

在活动图中，泳道用于包装活动模型中的组织边界：它们用于显示活动模型中谁在做什么。

In an activity diagram, swimlanes are used to package the organizational boundaries within an activity model: they are used to show who is doing what in an activity model.

当需要指示两个或多个操作并行发生时，称为同步条的线显示并行操作中的每个线程停止的位置，等待其他线程到达同一点。

When it is necessary to indicate that two or more actions occur in parallel, a line called a synchronization bar shows where each thread in the parallel actions halts, waiting until the other threads reach the same point.

图 3.33显示了订单系统工作流的活动模型。泳道围绕客户、销售和仓库的职责组织，是划分图表并确定每个活动职责的垂直线。

Figure 3.33 shows an activity model for the workflow of an order system. Organized around the responsibilities of the customer, sales, and the warehouse, swimlanes are the vertical lines partitioning the diagram and identifying the responsibilities for each activity.

图 3.33。具有三个泳道的订单流程，每个泳道显示流程中业务部门的职责。

3.6.6 实现图

3.6.6 Implementation Diagrams

实施图模型实现工件和注意事项，包括源代码的结构方式以及可执行文件的可用方式（以及在何处）。UML规范建议它们也可以在更广泛的意义上应用于业务建模。组件是业务程序和文档，运行时结构是业务的组织单元和资源（人力和其他）(1999, 3-165)。有两种类型的实现图：组件图和部署图。

Implementation diagrams model implementation artifacts and considerations, including how the source code is structured and how (and where) the executables are made available. The UML Specification suggests that they also can be applied in a broader sense to business modeling. Components are the business procedures and documents, and the run-time structure is the organization units and resources (human and other) of the business (1999, 3-165). There are two types of implementation diagrams: component diagrams and deployment diagrams.

组件图

组件图显示代码结构（见图3.34）。根据UML 规范，它们是“软件组件之间的依赖关系，包括源代码组件、二进制代码组件和可执行组件”（1999）。组件的细微差别使得它似乎与体系结构和抽象一样具有可塑性。

Component diagrams show the structure of the code (see Figure 3.34). According to the UML Specification, they are "the dependencies among software components, including source code components, binary code components, and executable components" (1999). The nuances of component are such that it seems to be as malleable a term as architecture and abstraction.

图 3.34。显示支付处理系统组件之间依赖关系的组件图
部署图

部署图显示运行时系统的结构（参见图 3.35），包括“运行时处理元素的配置以及软件组件、进程和运行在它们之上的对象”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，3-166）。对于业务建模，UML 规范表示运行时元素包括工作人员和组织单位，软件组件包括工作人员和组织单位使用的过程和文档。

Deployment diagrams show the structure of the runtime system(see Figure 3.35), including the "configuration of runtime processing elements and the software components, processes, and objects that live on them" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3-166). For business modeling, the UML Specification says runtime elements include workers and organizational units, and the software components include procedures and documents used by the workers and organizational units.

图 3.35。显示基于浏览器的三层帐户管理系统的运行时节点和组件的部署图

3.7 延伸阅读

3.7 Further Reading

Martin Fowler、Kendall Scott 和 Ivar Jacobson 的书UML Distilled：Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language (1997) 仍然是 UML 最实用的介绍，尽管它几乎是第一本。它在斑点上显示了它的年龄，但结合了建模和编程问题，并将庞大的野兽削减到易于消化的大小。

Martin Fowler, Kendall Scott, and Ivar Jacobson's book, UML Distilled: Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language(1997), is still the best practical introduction to the UML, despite having been pretty much the first out of the chute. It shows its age in spots, but combines modeling and programming concerns and cuts the huge beast down to a digestible size.

Three Amigos 的所有 UML 书籍都很有用，尽管对 RUP 有不同程度的偏向（通常未说明）。Unified Modeling Language User Guide在您尝试实际使用时似乎组织得不好，但它有大量现实生活中有用的建议和想法，其中许多为本书中的模式提供了起点（Jacobson、Booch 和Rumbaugh 1999a). Unified Modeling Language Reference Manual有时在内容上有些特殊，至少与UML 规范 1.3 版相比是这样，但它是最新的并且受 RUP 影响最小的（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998b）。凭借其百科全书/词典类型的方法，它有时提供了获取有关当前含义细微差别的正确信息的唯一途径，最终导致UML 规范中的一些不一致之处。Unified Software Development Process是其中最好的，但是，当然，它比其他两个更偏向于 Rational 的过程……但至少它是注定的（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1999a）。

All of the UML books by the Three Amigos are useful, although with varying degrees of often-unstated bias towards the RUP. The Unified Modeling Language User Guide seems badly organized when you try to actually use it, but has a wealth of real-life, useful suggestions and ideas, a number of which provided the starting point for patterns in this book (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a). The Unified Modeling Language Reference Manual is occasionally idiosyncratic in content, at least when compared with the UML Specification, Version 1.3, but it is the most up-to-date and least influenced by the RUP (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998b). With its encyclopedia/dictionary-type approach, it sometimes provides the only way to get the right information on nuances of current meaning that end-run some of the inconsistencies in the UML Specification. The Unified Software Development Process is the best of the bunch, but, of course, is even more biased toward Rational's process than the other two but at least it's meant to be (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a).

Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach by Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998) 是对 RUP 偏见的最好解毒剂，这种偏见不仅出现在 Three Amigos 书中，而且出现在几乎所有的 UML 书中. 第一章几乎是难以理解的，但是您会逐渐了解催化方法以及它（和基于组件的开发）与传统面向对象思维真正不同的原因。

Objects, Components and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach by Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998) is the best antidote to the bias towards the RUP that shows up not just in the Three Amigos books, but in almost all the UML books. The first chapter is almost impenetrable, but gradually you get the sense of the catalysis approach and why it (and component-based development) really is different from traditional object-oriented thinking.

不过，可能需要阅读 D'Souza 的任何数量的短文中的一篇作为开始这本书的序言。或者，先尝试模式，然后再阅读文本的其余部分。我在本书中重新设计了一些来自催化的模式，因为它们表达了来自主流建模的真实最佳实践。尽管本书的其余部分需要在思维上进行真正的范式转换才能正确吸收，但这些模式是很好的基本思想，表达得简单而好。

One of any number of short articles by D'Souza is probably required reading as a preamble to undertaking the book, though. Alternatively, try the patterns first and then read the rest of the text. I've reworked a number of the patterns from catalysis in this book because they express real best practices from mainstream modeling. Although the rest of the book requires a real paradigm shift in thinking to absorb properly, the patterns are good fundamental ideas expressed simply and well.

最后，UML Specification, Version 1.3（1999 年 7 月发布）是该库的必要部分，尽管不是用来阅读的。由于已经做出的更改和一些预先准备好的更改，1.3 版本需要偶尔提供咨询。语言常常是不可能的，奇怪的不一致令人沮丧，但它是最终判断的来源。并且可以从 OMG 和 Rational Software 网站免费下载。

Finally, the UML Specification, Version 1.3 (released in July 1999) is a necessary part of the library, although not one meant to be read. Because of the changes that have been made and some that are presaged, the 1.3 version needs to be available for occasional consultation. The language is frequently impossible, the odd inconsistencies are frustrating, but it is the source of final judgment. And it's free for downloading from the OMG and Rational Software Web sites.

第二部分：模式语言

Part II: The Pattern Language

II 模式语言

4 种风格模式

4 Patterns of Style

5种物质模式

5 Patterns of Substance

6 域模式

6 Domain Patterns

7种产品模式

7 Product Patterns

8个组件模式

8 Component Patterns

第 4 章风格模式

Chapter 4. Patterns of Style

目录

Catalogue

4.1属性作为类型的组合

4.2提供焦点

4.3显式省略

4.4树路由

4.5墓碑包

4.6继承向上

4.7旋转文本

4.8双重关联

4.9广告牌包

4.10文本解决方法

4.11七加减二

4.1 Attributes as Compositions to Types

4.2 Providing Focus

4.3 Explicit Elision

4.4 Tree Routing

4.5 Tombstone Packages

4.6 Inheritance Goes Up

4.7 Rotated Text

4.8 Dual Associations

4.9 Billboard Packages

4.10 Text Workarounds

4.11 Seven Plus or Minus Two

语境

Context

本章为建模者提供了一组 UML 风格的习语这将有助于提高 UML 图的图形质量。它们是通过仔细检查许多 UML 图而收集到的。这里介绍的习语是最明显的，代表了具有持久特征的方法，在他们的解决方案中明显有效，并且在许多不同类型的模型和建模者中重复出现。

This chapter provides the modeler with a set of UML style idioms that will contribute to the graphical quality of UML diagrams. They were gleaned from a careful examination of many UML diagrams. The idioms presented here are the ones that most clearly stood out, represented approaches that had enduring traits, were clearly effective in their solutions, and recurred across many different types of models and modelers.

幸运的是，UML 已经存在了足够长的时间，以至于风格方法开始以非正式的、清晰可见的方式出现。风格不仅仅是装饰品，它结合了智慧和个性。有效的风格为用户增添了永恒的品质，例如优雅、品味和敏感性。

Fortunately, the UML has been around long enough for stylistic approaches to begin emerging in informal, clearly observable ways. Style is more than cosmeticit combines intelligence with personality. Effective style adds timeless qualities such as grace, taste, and a sensitivity to the user.

图是 UML 模型的核心；视觉吸引力和表现力是关键品质。有效的图表样式会区分有效的图表和无效的图表。

Diagrams are the heart of UML models; visual appeal and expressiveness are critical qualities. An effective diagramming style makes the difference between diagrams that work and those that don't.

共同力量

Common Forces

  • 也很多细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 杂乱无章。

  • Clutter confuses.

  • 图表通过使用语义信息而不是句法来抽象。

  • Diagrams abstract by using semantic information, not syntax.

  • 好的图表尽可能简单，但不能更简单。

  • A good diagram is as simple as possible, but no simpler.

  • 标准的视觉约定很容易理解。

  • Standard visual conventions are easily understood.

  • 图表中晦涩的约定和不寻常的布局使它们更难理解。

  • Obscure conventions and unusual layouts in diagrams make them more difficult to understand.

  • 设计或展示中的惊喜应该是令人愉快的。

  • Surprises in design or presentation should be pleasant.

  • 创造力和新颖性对于创造更好的解决方案很有价值。

  • Creativity and novelty are valuable for creating better solutions.

  • 遵循众所周知的标准并使用正交表示规则的图表更易于理解。

  • Diagrams adhering to well-known standards and using orthogonal presentation rules are more comprehensible.

  • 标准、清晰度和可用性是集成工作和团队协作的驱动力。

  • Standards, clarity, and usability are driving forces for integrating work and group collaboration.

  • 奥卡姆剃刀说最简单的解释通常是正确的（一个版本保持简单，StupidKISS）。

  • Occam's Razor says that the simplest explanation is usually the right one (a version of Keep It Simple, StupidKISS).

讨论

Discussion

锻炼创造力和独创性是软件开发团队的基本任务之一。创造力和独创性应仅限于正在开发的产品，而不是图表。

Exercising creativity and ingenuity is one of the essential tasks of a software development team. The creativity and ingenuity should be limited to the product being developed, however, not the diagrams.

UML 建模者面临着创建模型的责任，这些模型对于预期使用它们的普通人来说很容易访问。沉迷于过于原始但不熟悉的表示实践，或者在众所周知的 UML 模型元素可以工作时使用晦涩的 UML 模型元素，会导致 UML 模型无法发挥应有的可用性。深奥的设计和演示选择也会导致开发团队的混乱，并且随着模型的更改或方法进行了解释。

The UML modeler is faced with the responsibility of creating models that are easily accessible by the average person who is expected to use them. Indulging in excessively original but unfamiliar presentation practices, or using obscure UML model elements when well-known ones can work, results in UML models that aren't as usable as they can be. Esoteric design and presentation choices can also cause confusion in the development team, and they will inevitably result in wasted time and resources as the models are changed or the approach is explained.

4.1 属性作为类型的组合

4.1 Attributes as Compositions to Types

问题

Problem

一个大的或重要的类具有关键属性，其重要性需要明显或明确。

A large or important class has key attributes whose significance needs to be obvious or clear.

语境

Context

UML 类图，尤其是描述系统中复杂或中心类的图，其属性作为行项目包含在类的属性隔间中。

A UML class diagram, especially one that depicts a complex or central class in a system whose attributes are contained as line items in the class's attribute compartment.

军队

Forces

  • 过多的细节掩盖了意义。

  • Excessive detail obscures meaning.

  • 杂乱无章。

  • Clutter confuses.

  • 对关键细节的视觉强调不足会导致设计失去平衡。

  • Insufficient visual emphasis on key details can cause loss of design balance.

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaningsimply and clearly.

  • 类符号属性隔间允许有限的表达。

  • Class symbol attribute compartmentallows limited expression.

  • 类符号外部的关系控制更具表现力。

  • Relationship control external to the class symbol is more expressive.

解决方案

Solution

通过为每个需要特别强调的属性类型添加一个类符号，将属性移出属性隔间的范围。然后，从包含属性的类到表示属性类型的类符号绘制组合线。从那里，在包含属性的适当名称的聚合端添加角色。表示属性类型的类可以放置在距主类一定距离的位置，以便聚合线可以足够长，以便为要添加的注释和约束留出空间，以描述属于复合属性的特殊信息和条件。

Move the attribute out of the confines of the attribute compartment by adding a class symbol for each attribute type that needs special emphasis. Then, draw composition lines from the class containing the attributes to the class symbols denoting the attribute types. From there, add roles on the aggregate side that contain the appropriate names of the attributes. The classes representing the attribute types can be positioned some distance fromthe primary class so that the aggregation lines can be long enough to allow room for notes and constraints to be addedto describe special information and conditions belonging to the Composite attributes.

原始类类型和真实类类型都可以用这种方式描述，类类型允许描述选定的属性和操作，这些属性和操作可以进一步详细说明主类中属性的功能。

Both primitive and true class types can be depicted in this waywith class types allowing the depiction of selected attributes and operations that can further elaborate on the function of the attribute within the primary class.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个 UML 类图，其中的类在视觉上强调了它们的重要属性。

A UML class diagram with classes that have theirimportant attributes visually emphasized.

讨论

Discussion

UML 类符号的属性隔间用作列出类属性清单的有用位置，但在识别和详细说明特定属性时它相当有限。使用 UML 强大的关系描述符，例如约束、多重性（仅在复合材料的非聚合端）、限定关联、排序信息以及改进的注释和约束空间，是对属性进行复杂描述的更好位置依恋。

The attribute compartment of a UML class symbol serves as a useful place to list the inventory of the class's attributes, but it is rather limited when it comes to identifying and elaborating on particular attributes. A better place for a sophisticated description of attributes is physically external to the class using UML's powerful relationship descriptors such as constraints, multiplicity (only on the non-aggregate end for composites), qualified associations, ordering information, and improved room for note and constraint attachment.

UML 规范中的“符号指南”部分特别指出“属性实际上是类与其属性的类之间的组合关系”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，3-75）。换句话说，所有属性实际上都是由值实现的组合的特定实例。组合还意味着在聚合方面对单一多重性的约束。因此，一个属性实际上是一个0或1重数类型的组合在源端。

The "Notation Guide" section in the UML Specification specifically observes that "attributes are, in effect, composition relationships between a class and the classes of its attributes" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3-75). In other words, all attributes are really a particular instance of composition implemented by value. Composition also implies a constraint to single multiplicity on the aggregate side. Therefore, an attribute is actually the composition of a type with a 0 or 1 multiplicity on the source end.

图 4.1是一个简单的类图，显示了一个在内部列出描述汽车的属性的类。

Figure 4.1 is a simple class diagram, showing a class that internally lists the attributes describing a car.

图 4.1。简单的类图，显示描述汽车的属性。所有属性都显示在隔间中，包括原始属性和类。

应用此模式，您可以看到生成的类图更加详细且更具表现力（参见图 4.2）。通过将属性作为属性类型的类符号的组合从属性隔间中分离出来，您可以更清楚地识别用注释标识和/或由约束参与的属性。

Applying this pattern, you can see that the resulting class diagram is more detailed and expressive (see Figure 4.2). By breaking the attributes out of the attribute compartment as compositions to classsymbols of the attribute type, you can more clearly identify the attribute identified with notes and/or engaged by constraints.

因为它是 Car 类中属性的类型，所以 Engine 类被添加到图中，它允许附加约束来描述 Engine 和 Car 之间的重要条件关系。尽管在初始建模期间很可能会在同一图表上使用 Engine 和 Car，但是在使用类库或存储库中的类时，类类型出现在属性隔间中并不罕见。

Because it is the type of an attribute in the Car class, the Engine class was added to the diagram, which allows constraints to be attached that describe important conditional relationships between Engine and Car. Although having Engine and Car on the same diagram is likely to occur during initial modeling, it isn't unusual for class types to appear in attribute compartments when using classes from a class library or repository.

图 4.2中显示的两个约束还演示了如何将约束直接连接到属性而不是类。

The two constraints shown in Figure 4.2 also demonstrate how constraints can be connected directly to attributes instead of classes.

使用此模式的优点是能够使用使类图中的类在视觉上引人注目的相同表示法来显示属性。以这种方式显示的属性获得与协作类组具有的相同表达范围。这为您提供了更高的灵活性和对属性定义的控制，并允许您执行以下操作：

The advantage of using this pattern is the capability to show attributes using the same notation that makes classes in a class diagram so visually compelling. An attribute shown this way gains the same range of expression that groups of collaborating classes have. This gives you improved flexibility and control over attribute definition and allows you to do the following:

  • 将 UML 关系（关联、泛化等）连接到组合

  • Connect UML relationships (association, generalization, and so on) to the composite

  • 显示特殊属性类型的详细信息，例如模板和实用程序

  • Show details of special attribute types, such as templates and utilities

  • 向复合属性添加排序或排序约束

  • Add ordering or sorting constraints to composite attribute

  • 使用限定关联来控制组合目标的子​​集对象

  • Use qualified associations to control subset objects of the composition target

  • 更明确地指定目标多重性

  • More clearly specify target multiplicity

图 4.2。显示的汽车类，其属性显示为属性类型的组合。

4.2 提供焦点

4.2 Providing Focus

问题

Problem

在混乱的图表中丢失中心项目（类、用例）。

Losing central item (class, use case) in diagram clutter.

语境

Context

包含许多项的任何 UML 图。

Any UML diagram containing many items.

军队

Forces

  • 图表必须清楚地传达给观众。

  • A diagram must clearly communicate to its viewers.

  • 过度简化的图表不足以表达复杂的主题。

  • Oversimplified diagrams are insufficient to express sophisticated subjects.

  • 杂乱无章。

  • Clutter confuses.

  • 视觉强调可以将注意力吸引到关键概念或元素上。

  • Visual emphasis can draw attention to keyconcepts or elements.

  • 密集或重复的图表会降低可接近性。

  • Dense or repetitive diagrams reduce approachability.

  • 标准化的视觉提示增强了可读性和理解力。

  • Standardized visual cues enhance readability andcomprehension.

解决方案

Solution

应用粗线和字体，或阴影区域来强调关键细节。使用彩色元素也变得越来越频繁。根据图表类型，重点目标可能会有所不同。（请参阅下一页的表 4.1 。）

Apply bold lines and fonts, or shaded areas to emphasize key details. Using colored elements is also becoming increasingly frequent. Depending on the diagram type, the target of emphasis may vary. (See Table 4.1 on next page.)

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个 UML 图表，其中适当地吸引了图表的关键元素。

A UML diagram in which attention is appropriately drawn to the key elements of the diagram.

讨论

discussion

以标准化方式突出显示重要信息片段的视觉提示有助于将用户的注意力吸引到重要元素并强调图表中的中心或关键概念。

Visual cues that highlight important pieces ofinformation in a standardized way help draw users' attention to important elements and emphasizecentral or key concepts in a diagram.

UML 图的整体可读性和清晰度可以通过使用标准突出显示机制（例如粗线和文本、阴影和颜色区域）以及空间强调技术（例如关键元素居中）来提高（见表4.1）。

The overall readability and clarity of a UML diagram can be improved by using standard highlighting mechanisms such as bold lines and text,shaded and color areas, and spatial emphasis techniques such as key element centering(see Table 4.1).

表 4.1。

图表

Diagram

粗线

Bold lines

字体

Fonts

阴影/颜色

Shading/Color

空间重点

Spatial emphasis

班级

Class

类框，关系

Class box, relationships

类名、关键属性和操作、角色名、构造型

Class names, key attributes and operations, role names, stereotypes

类箱或特定隔间、包裹

Class box or specific compartment, packages

将中心项目放在图表的中间

Put central item in middle of diagram

顺序

Sequence

对象框，关键消息痕迹（尤其是通过关键序列的整个路径）

Object box, key message traces (especially the entire path through key sequence)

对象名称/类型、操作说明

Object names/types, operation descriptions

对象框、激活框

Object box, activation boxes

大小对象框，取决于对象的粒度

Size object boxes, depending on granularity of object

合作

Collaboration

对象框

Object box

对象名称/类型、操作说明

Object names/types, operation descriptions

对象框

Object box

将中心项目放在图表的中间

Put central item in middle of diagram

状态

State

状态框，转换

State box, transitions

状态名称、动作、事件、守卫文本

State name, actions, events, guard text

状态框

State box

活动

Activity

活动箱

Activity box

活动名称、条件文本、泳道文本

Activity name, condition text, swimlane text

活动框、起点和终点、泳道

Activity box, start and end points, swimlanes

将关键活动放在最左侧的泳道中

Put key activities in swim lane on leftmost side

成分

Component

组件符号、流程符号、依赖项、子系统包、接口符号

Component symbol, process symbol, dependencies, subsystem packages, interface symbols

组件名称、构造型、接口名称

Component name, stereotypes, interface names

组件盒、过程盒、子系统盒

Component box, process box, subsystems boxes

部署

Deployment

节点符号，

Node symbol,

节点名称、构造型

Node name, stereotypes

节点符号

Node symbol

分组节点以显示区域的责任沟通或物理上的 com 关系地点

Group nodes to show areas communication of responsibility or com relationship mon physical locations

4.3 显式省略

4.3 Explicit Elision

问题

Problem

一个图表变得过于混乱，包含不相关的属性、属性和关系。

A diagram becomes too cluttered with irrelevant attributes, properties, and relationships.

语境

Context

任何提供焦点的 UML 图。

Any UML diagram that provides focus.

军队

Forces

  • 杂乱使人困惑。

  • Clutter confuses and obfuscates.

  • UML 图必须呈现模型的关键概念。

  • A UML diagram must present a key conceptof a model.

  • 必须省略描述概念不需要的细节。

  • Detail not required to describe a concept mustbe omitted.

  • 图表应该在包含和排除的元素之间具有平衡的张力。

  • Diagrams should have a balanced tension between elements included and excluded.

  • 尽可能简单，但不能更简单。

  • As simple as possible, but no simpler.

  • UML 图必须干净且组织良好。

  • A UML diagram must be clean and wellorganized.

解决方案

Solution

当元素不是所呈现的设计思想的中心时，有意省略图中的属性、操作、关系、类、组件或任何 UML 元素。在可能的情况下，明确指出任何项目列表何时不完整。

Intentionally omit attributes, operations, relationships, classes, components, or any UML element in a diagram when the element is not central to the design idea being presented. Where possible, indicate explicitly when any list of items is not complete.

在 UML 中，模型元素不必出现在以图形方式表达模型视图的图表中。这称为省略。省略的元素被称为省略。

In the UML, a model element does not have to be present in a diagram that graphically expresses a view of the model. This is called elision. Omitted elements are said to be elided.

图表中元素的省略对其在模型本身中的状态没有影响。例如，可以在不显示类的属性和操作隔间的情况下显示类，而不暗示这些属性和操作不存在。

Elision of an element in a diagram has no impact on its status in the model itself. For example, classescan be shown without their attribute and operation compartments without implying that thoseattributes and operations don't exist.

然而，当您不能真正确定任何给定的图表是否显示了整个图片时，省略本身会使理解 UML 模型变得棘手。因此，请使用显式省略。也就是说，清楚地说明模型元素已被省略。

However, elision by itself can make understanding UML models tricky when you can't really be sure that any given diagram is displaying the entire picture. For that reason, use explicit elision. That is, clearly state that model elements have been omitted.

例如，使用省略号（“. . .”）来指示任何项目列表何时不完整，如在仅显示属性子集的属性隔间中一样。UML完全约束也可以附加到一组元素（例如派生类）以指示显示的类（在模型和图表中）包含列表中的全部元素。最后，在省略号或完整约束不适合指示显示的元素是完整列表还是部分列表的情况下，可以使用注释。

For example, use an ellipsis (" . . .") to indicate when any list of items is not complete, as in an attribute compartment where only a subset of the attributes is presented. A UML complete constraint can also be attached to a group of elements (such as derived classes) to indicate that the classes shown (both in the model and diagram) comprise the total elements in the list. Finally, a note can be used where the ellipsis or complete constraint are inappropriate to indicate when the elements shown are complete or partial listings.

显式省略的另一个方面是细节只出现一次。建模时，只将细节放在一个地方，然后在其他地方引用它。例如，如果将静态模型分块成多个图表，则完整的类详细信息仅出现在一个图表中，而在其他图表中被省略。否则，您最终会在维护方面头疼不已，并且您的图表缺乏重点。

A different aspect of explicit elision is detail appears once. When you model something, put the detail in only one place, and then reference it in others. For example, if you chunk your static model into several diagrams, the complete class detail appears in only one diagram and is elided in the others. Otherwise, you end up with a maintenance headache, and your diagrams lack focus.

当您在不同的工具中捕获不同类型的信息时，这将成为一个真正的挑战，例如一个工具中的业务规则（例如，规则引擎或其他可以检查一致性的工具）和引用它们的用例在另一个工具中（例如，文本编辑）。在此示例中，您通过对用例中的业务规则引用进行编号和/或为它们提供描述性名称以将它们键入规则引擎来省略它们。

This becomes a real challenge when you capturedifferent types of information in different tools, such as business rules in one tool (for example, a rules engine or other tool that can check consistency) and use cases referencing them in another (for example, a text editor). In this example, you elide the business rule references in the use cases by numbering them and/or giving them descriptive names to key them into the rules engine.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个 UML 图，它只包含对准确呈现视图背后的概念绝对必要的元素。

A UML diagram that contains only the elements that are absolutely essential to accurately present the concept behind the view.

讨论

Discussion

通常，请记住，必须对图表中模型元素的存在和不存在做出的假设数量会提高 UML 图表中内容的价值。决定在给定图表中包含什么和排除什么总是很困难，但可以使用以下标准：

As a rule, keep in mind that the number of assumptions that have to be made about the presence and absence of model elements in a diagram will raise the value of the content in a UML diagram. Deciding what to include and what to exclude in a given diagram is always difficult, but the following criteria can be used:

包括：

Include:

  • 有助于描述图中传达的中心概念的模型元素

  • Model elements that aid in describing the central concept conveyed in the diagram

  • 列表中应始终保持在一起的元素（例如，图 4.3中所示的帐户类中的提款操作不应包含或排除在没有存款操作的图中）

  • Elements in lists that should always be kept together (for example, the withdraw operation in the Account class shown in Figure 4.3 should not be included or excluded in a diagram without the deposit operation)

  • 相关上下文信息，例如包、透视图描述、构造型、约束和标记值

  • Relevant context information such as packages, perspective descriptions, stereotypes, constraints, and tagged values

排除：

Exclude:

  • 多余的或不重要的细节，当被遗漏时，不会降低图表的信息价值

  • Extraneous or unimportant details that, when left out, do not reduce the information value of the diagram

  • 不必要的依赖关系、工件痕迹、实现细节、注释、泛化分支、子类型和非省略形式（例如，接口类矩形而不是接口棒棒糖）

  • Unnecessary dependency relationships, artifact traces, implementation detail, notes, generalization branches, subtypes, and non-elided forms (for example, interface class rectangles instead of interface lollipops)

图 4.3。显式省略使图表用户清楚模型元素的存在和不存在。

4.4 树路由

4.4 Tree Routing

问题

Problem

如何以有效的方式将许多相似的 UML 关系连接到一个类。

How to connect many similar UML relationships to a class in an efficient way.

语境

Context

在静态图中对相同类型的复杂关系进行建模。

Modeling complex relationships of the same type in a static diagram.

军队

Forces

  • 相关的关系在 UML 元模型中是基本相连的。

  • Relationships that are related are fundamentally connected in the UML metamodel.

  • 更简单、更清晰的布局可以创建更清晰的 UML 图。

  • Simpler, cleaner layouts create more lucid UML diagrams.

  • 更少的线条更容易在视觉上区分。

  • Fewer lines are easier to distinguish visually.

  • 重载的关系线必须在语义上有意义。

  • Overloaded relationship lines must make sense semantically.

解决方案

Solution

将指向一个类的相同类型的 UML 关系滚动到一行中（即，与目标类建立一个单一的联系点）。这称为树路由。之所以这样命名，是因为关系线在中央干线中从班级分支出来。它特别适用于显示聚合和泛化关系。

Roll UML relationships of the same type pointing to a class up into a single line (that is, establish a single point of contact with the target class). This is called tree routing. It is so named because the relationship lines branch out from the class in a central trunk line. It is especially appropriate for displaying aggregation and generalization relationships.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

通过节省空间的线路路由控制图表混乱。

Controlled diagram clutter by means of space-efficient line routing.

讨论

Discussion

除了时序图之外，UML 图的布局通常没有或只有很少的语义价值。然而，UML 图中固有的许多交流价值仍然取决于建模者的布局技巧。当必须在 UML 图的元素之间绘制大量关系时，尤其如此。

With the exception of time-sequenced graphs, a UML diagram's layout generally has little or no semantic value. However, a lot of the communication value inherent in a UML diagram is still due to the layout skill of the modeler. This isparticularly true when a large number of relationships must be drawn between the elements of a UML diagram.

树路由是最有效和最干净的关系线路由策略，可用于静态图中。树路由不仅减少了图表空间的总量和使用的线条复杂性，而且还极大地减少了目标类上的锚点空间，尤其是在大型继承层次结构和复杂聚合中（参见图 4.4 ）。

Tree routing is the most efficient and cleanest-looking relationship line routing strategy that can be used in static diagrams. Not only does tree routing reduce the overall amount of diagramspace and line complexity used, but it also provides a tremendous reduction in anchor space on the target class, especially in large inheritance hierarchies and complex aggregates (see Figure 4.4).

树路由有一些在使用前必须满足的基本要求，但它们很容易记住：

Tree routing has some basic requirements that must be met before it can be used, but they are easy to keep in mind:

  • 要连接到单个中继的关系必须属于同一类型。

  • The relationships to be connected to a single trunk must be of the same type.

  • 泛化和聚合关系比其他 UML 关系类型（如依赖和实现）更好地形成树。

  • Generalization and aggregation relationships form trees better than other UML relation shiptypes, such as dependency and realization.

  • 关联和聚合必须具有相同的多重性行李箱端。

  • Associations and aggregations must have the same multiplicity on the trunk end.

图 4.4。树路由方法（底部）通常会产生更清晰的图表，尤其是当必须连接到类的关系数量增加时。

4.5 墓碑包

4.5 Tombstone Packages

问题

Problem

单调的、信息量最少的顶级包列表，尤其是在工具生成的模型中；特别是，没有对它们之间的关系进行任何解释的包的行和列列表。此类列表（看起来像一排排墓碑）通常缺乏对包之间（相互）依赖性、泛化和可追溯性的任何解释，但这通常是模型最高层特别需要的地方。

The monotonous, minimally informative top-level package list, especially in models that are tool-generated; in particular, a row and column list of packages that is without any explanation of the relationships between them. Such listings (which look like rows of tombstones) often lack any explanation of (inter)dependencies, generalization, and traceability between packages, yet this is often where it's particularly neededat the highest level of the model.

语境

Context

在系统级别（全局模型范围）或任何包级别图中，非平凡模型将包含模型元素分组到的包列表。

At the system level (global model scope) or any package level diagram, where a non-trivial model will have the list of packages into which model elements are grouped.

军队

Forces

  • 永远不要浪费在模型中指定相关信息的机会。

  • Never waste an opportunity to specify relevant information in a model.

  • 不要让工具做出省略的决定。

  • Don't let tools make elision decisions.

  • 始终为关系图的目的建模关键。

  • Always model relationships key to the diagram's purpose.

  • 密集或重复的图表会降低可接近性。

  • Dense or repetitive diagrams reduce approachability.

解决方案

Solution

创建有意义的包图，始终清楚地说明它们之间的关系。对包之间的依赖关系建模要特别小心。将包分层，以反映在系统设计中做出的架构决策。这可能是三层或四层结构，或者完全不同的结构，具体取决于模型的领域（见图4.5）。

Create meaningful package diagrams that always have the relationships between them clearly stated. Be especially careful to model dependencies between packages. Layer the packages into tiers that reflect the architectural decisions made in the design of the system. This may be a three- or four-tier structure, or something altogether different, depending on the domain of the model (see Figure 4.5).

对于将规范和实现分开的模型，请确保始终在规范和实现之间放置实现线。包也可以相互继承。发生这种情况时，请确保泛化关系在包及其子包出现的图表中始终清晰可见。

For models that separate specification andimplementations, be sure to always placerealization lines between the specification andthe implementation. Packages can also inherit from each other. When this occurs, make sure the generalization relationship is always clearly visible in diagrams where the packages and their subpackages appear.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个图表，其中列出了包以及它们之间的关系，尤其是依赖关系和概括。跟踪关系应该用在描述包之间的先行依赖关系的图表中。

A diagram in which the packages are listed as well as the relationships between them, especially dependencies and generalizations. Trace relationships should be used in diagrams depicting the antecedent dependencies between packages.

讨论

Discussion

很多时候，尤其是在建模工具环境中，自动生成的包列表被转储到包类图中，并且创建了无用的包网格页面。然而，通常情况下，包之间会有重要的关系，这些关系应该被记录下来。包图对于传达模型中元素组之间的关系很重要精明的建模者明智地避免使用工具绘制图表，这些图表随后没有经过仔细检查和修改以适应体系结构的样式、形式、和使用规则。

Too often, especially in modeling-tool environments, automatically generated lists of packages are dumped in package class diagrams, and pages of unhelpful grids of packages are created. Typically, however, packages will have important relationships between them that should be documented. Package diagrams are important for conveying the relationships between the groups of elements in your models The savvy modeler is wise to avoid having tools draw diagrams that aren't then carefully examined and modified to suit the architecture's style, form,and usage rules.

图 4.5。这两张图显示了 Tombstone 包和经过适当重构的包图之间的巨大差异。

4.6 继承向上

4.6 Inheritance Goes Up

问题

Problem

如何以业界公认的方式绘制 UML 泛化关系图。

How to diagram the UML generalization relationship in an industry-wide, accepted way.

语境

Context

包含泛化关系的 UML 用例和类图。

UML use case and class diagrams that contain generalization relationships.

军队

Forces

  • 遵循众所周知的符号约定可以提高图表的可读性。

  • Adhering to well-known notational convention improves diagram readability.

  • 有限的图表空间对图表自由度施加了限制。

  • Limited diagram space imposes constraints on degrees of diagramming freedom.

  • 标准化的视觉提示增强了可读性和理解力。

  • Standardized visual cues enhance readability and comprehension.

解决方案

Solution

大多数 UML 图都描述了泛化关系，其中更一般的元素位于顶部。尽管可以找到例外情况，但一般化箭头应指向页面顶部。因此，在力量平衡中，只要有可能，就将更一般的元素放在更具体的元素之上，并在它们之间画出概括箭头。不太常见的是，泛化关系可能被视为一条水平线，尤其是当被描述为实现时。但是，请谨慎使用它以增加风格的一致性。避免将更一般的元素放在更具体的元素之下。

The majority of all UML diagrams depict the generalization relationship with the more general element on top. Although exceptions can be found, the generalization arrow is expected to point toward the top of the page. So, wherever possible within the balance of forces, place the more general element above the more specificelements, and draw the generalization arrow between them. Less frequently, the generalization relationship may be seen as a horizontal line, especially when depicted as realization. Use it sparingly, however, to increase stylistic consistency. Refrain from placing the more general element under the more specific element.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个 UML 图，显示了泛化，箭头指向水平线上方更一般的元素（参见图 4.6）。

A UML diagram that shows generalization with the arrow pointing above the horizontal line toward the more general element (see Figure 4.6).

讨论

discussion

  • 泛化表示一般和更具体之间的关系。

  • Generalization represents a relationship between the general and the more specific.

  • 泛化源被认为具有更高的抽象层次。

  • The source of generalization is considered to have a higher level of abstraction.

尽管一致性不是自动的好事，直立的泛化约定是面向对象建模中较早的约定之一，并且传统已经延续到 UML，其中大多数泛化关系都以这种方式显示。尽管应用此模式未改变图表的语义，但总体可读性和可用性得到了增强它的使用。

Although conformity is not automatically a good thing, the upright generalization convention is one of the older ones in object-oriented modeling, and the tradition has carried through to UML in which the majority of generalization relationships are shown this way. Although the semantics of a diagram are unchanged by the application of this pattern, overall readability and usability are enhanced by its use.

图 4.6。UML 泛化关系的规范图表形式。

4.7 旋转文本

4.7 Rotated Text

问题

Problem

大文本标签，尤其是那些附加到垂直和对角线 UML 关系路径的文本标签，很麻烦并且水平突出会浪费空间。

Large text labels, especially those attached to vertical and diagonal UML relationships paths, are cumbersome and waste space by sticking out horizontally.

语境

Context

任何需要文本标签的 UML 图元素。

Any UML diagram element that requires a text label.

军队

Forces

  • 有限的图表空间对图表自由度施加了限制。

  • Limited diagram space imposes constraints on degrees of diagramming freedom.

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 更简单、更清晰的布局可以创建更清晰的 UML 图。

  • Simpler, cleaner layouts create more lucid UML diagrams.

  • 杂乱使人困惑。

  • Clutter confuses and obfuscates.

  • 横向文本（尤其是很多）比水平文本更难阅读。

  • Sideways text (especially a lot of it) is harder to read than horizontal text.

解决方案

Solution

将文本旋转 45 度或 90 度，使其沿着必须保留空间的关系线或模型元素对齐。请务必将图表中的所有垂直文本标签定向在同一方向。对角文本标签可以沿着对角线，除非它们的线非常陡。

Rotate text 45 or 90 degrees so that it is aligned along the relationship line or model element near which space must be conserved. Be sure to orient all vertical text labels in the diagram in the same direction. Diagonal text labels can follow the diagonal line unless they line is very steep.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

一个 UML 图，其中文本标签的方向与它们所附加的模型元素的长边方向相同（参见图 4.7）。

A UML diagram in which the text labels areoriented in the same direction as the long side of the model element to which they are attached (see Figure 4.7).

讨论

discussion

带有水平文本标签的垂直线，尤其是长文本标签，会造成布局问题，因为标签会向任一方向溢出，浪费宝贵的图表空间，并且在视觉上显得笨拙。尽管许多建模工具可能不提供此选项，但将文本旋转 90 度可以解决布局问题，但存在使图表更难阅读的轻微风险。然而，与从垂直关系线和模型突出的宽文本标签相比，结果更简单、更清晰元素。

A vertical line with a horizontal text label,especially a long one, creates a layout problem because the label will spill over in either direction, waste valuable diagram space, and appear visually ungainly. Although many modeling tools may not provide this option, rotating the text 90 degrees solves the layout problem with a slight risk of making the diagram a bit harder to read. The result, however, is simpler and cleaner than having wide text labels protruding from vertical relationship lines and model elements.

图 4.7。横向文本可以帮助建模者更有效地利用空间。请注意，Sale 和 Receipt 之间关联的文本标签比水平标签所允许的要紧凑得多。

4.8 双重关联

4.8 Dual Associations

问题

Problem

关联关系可能会因多重性、角色名称、关联名称、阅读方向箭头、关联类附件等装饰而在视觉和语义上超载。

Association relationships can become visually and semantically overloaded with adornments such as multiplicity, role names, association names, reading direction arrows, association class attachments, and so on.

语境

Context

UML 类图中描述的复杂双向关联。

A complex bi-directional association depicted in a UML class diagram.

军队

Forces

  • 有限的图表空间对图表自由度施加了限制。

  • Limited diagram space imposes constraints on degrees of diagramming freedom.

  • 过多的细节掩盖了意义。

  • Excessive detail obscures meaning.

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 更简单、更清晰的布局可以创建更清晰的 UML 图。

  • Simpler, cleaner layouts create more lucid UML diagrams.

  • 更少的线条更容易在视觉上区分。

  • Fewer lines are easier to distinguish visually.

  • 重载的关系线必须在语义上有意义。

  • Overloaded relationship lines must make sense semantically.

解决方案

Solution

将关联拆分为两个单向关联。确保多重性匹配。使用附加关联线提供的重复空间附加一个额外的阅读方向文本和箭头，连接一个附加关联类，添加约束和构造型，并将两个关联连接到一个共享关联类。

Split the association into two one-way associations. Make sure that the multiplicities match.Use the duplicate space provided by the additional association line to attach an extra reading direction text and arrow, connect an additional association class, add constraints and stereotypes, and connect the two association with a shared association class.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

两个单向关联关系代替单个双向关联（见图4.8）。

Two one-way association relationships in the place of a single bi-directional association(see Figure 4.8).

讨论

discussion

只要稍加注意，两个单向关联就可以等同于一个双向关联，但路径和装饰空间是原来的两倍。这为建模者提供了额外的空间来附加必要的装饰，这在使用单个关联时并不容易甚至不可能。两个单向关联的语义也可以表达比单一关系更丰富的一组含义，例如只允许在一个方向上附加约束。尽管必须小心确保由此产生的联想不会让读者感到困惑，但双重联想是一种强大的文体技巧，可以表达重要的细节，否则难以表达语义模型。

As long as some care is taken, two one-way associations can be equivalent to a single bi-directional associationbut with twice the path and adornment space. This provides extra room for the modeler to attach necessary adornments that would not be easy or even possible when using a single association. The semantics of the two one-way associations can also express a richer set of meanings than a single relationship, such as allowing a constraint to be attached in one direction only. Although care must be exercised to ensure that the resulting associations are not confusing to the reader, the dual association is a powerful stylistic technique that can express important details that add otherwise difficult to express semantics to a model.

图 4.8。底部的图表显示了如何使用双重关联模式来提供额外的装饰空间以及对 Insurance Policy 和 Person 之间关联的语义控制。

4.9 广告牌包

4.9 Billboard Packages

问题

Problem

在 UML 图中为用例和类提供上下文，尤其是当它们与开发阶段、透视图和视图相关时。

Providing context for use cases and classes in a UML diagram, especially as they relate to development phase, perspective, and view.

语境

Context

一般的 UML 用例图和类图。

UML use case and class diagrams in general.

军队

Forces

  • 过多的细节掩盖了意义。

  • Excessive detail obscures meaning.

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 上下文提示定位图表用户。

  • Context cues orient diagram users.

解决方案

Solution

在它们来自的包中实际显示用例和类，尤其是在导入用例和类时。请务必显示完整的包名称和其他上下文信息，例如包构造型。始终对关系图的目的进行建模。

Physically display the use cases and classes within the packages they come from, especially when the use cases and classes are imported. Be sure to display the full package names and other context information such as package stereotypes. Always model relationships keyed to the diagram's purpose.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

UML 用例和类图，其中上下文由包装外部（本地包）用例和类的显示包提供。

UML use case and class diagrams in which context is provided by the display packages that wrap external (to the native package) use cases and classes.

讨论

Discussion

包是一种管理和分组机制，它提供了一种构建模型的强大方法。包可用于通过使用建模者需要的任何标准（例如开发阶段、抽象、视图、模型类型等）来创建相关模型元素的集合。因此，包根据已应用于包的语义（通常通过诸如 <<use case model>、<<analysis> 等的构造型）来描述关于它们包含的模型元素的重要上下文信息。

Packages are a management and grouping mechanism that provides a powerful way to structure models. Packages can be used to create collections of related model elements by using any criteria the modeler requires, such as development phase, abstraction, view, model type, and so on. Consequently, packages describe important context information about the model elements that they contain by virtue of the semantics that have been applied to the package (usually through stereotypes such as <<use case model>, <<analysis>, and so on).

Billboard Packages 帮助解决的一个问题是可追溯性，显示模型元素如何在开发的各个阶段和相关模型中传播。但是，仅允许在不同包中的模型元素之间进行追溯；这是广告牌包有效的地方。通过将用例和类连同它们的原型一起放置在省略的包图标中，Billboard Packages 可以为图表用户提供重要的上下文提示。这有助于用户理解元素与图表甚至与模型其余部分的关系（参见图 4.9）。请注意，存货控制广告牌包的存在提供了关键的上下文信息，例如哪个版本的正在实现这些类型。

One concern that Billboard Packages help with is traceabilityshowing how model elements are propagated through the various stages of development and associated models. However, traceability is allowed only between model elements in different packages; this is where Billboard Packages are effective. By placing use cases and classes within elided package icons along with their stereotype, Billboard Packages can offer important context cues to the diagram user. This helps the user understand the element's relation to the diagram and even to the rest of the model (see Figure 4.9). Note that the presence of the Inventory Control Billboard Package supplies crucial context information, such as which version of the types are being realized.

图 4.9。该类图显示控件和实体类如何实现在单独包中保存的分析模型中定义的接口。

4.10 文本解决方法

4.10 Text Workarounds

问题

Problem

UML 中的许多符号并不是所有必须查看图表的环境都直接支持的。尽管如此，对于这些媒体（例如电子邮件、简单的绘图工具和 HTML，仅举几例），图表仍然必须以无需大量解释即可理解的方式呈现。

Many of the notations in the UML are not directly supported by all the environments in which diagrams have to be viewed. Nevertheless, for these media (such as e-mail, simple drawing tools, and HTML, to name a few) the diagrams must still be rendered in a way that is understandable without significant interpretation.

语境

Context

在不直接支持 UML 符号结构的环境中查看 UML 图，包括直线、矩形、菱形、箭头、guillemets 等。

Viewing UML diagrams in environments that do not directly support UML's notational constructs, including lines, rectangles, diamonds, arrows, guillemets, and so on.

军队

Forces

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 更简单、更清晰的布局可以创建更清晰的 UML 图。

  • Simpler, cleaner layouts create more lucid UML diagrams.

  • 更少的线条更容易在视觉上区分。

  • Fewer lines are easier to distinguish visually.

  • 标准的视觉约定很容易理解。

  • Standard visual conventions are easily understood.

  • 图表中晦涩的约定和不寻常的布局更难理解。

  • Obscure conventions and unusual layout in diagrams are more difficult to understand.

  • 标准、清晰度和可用性是集成工作和团队协作的驱动力。

  • Standards, clarity, and usability are driving forces for integrating work and group collaboration.

解决方案

Solution

尽可能对 UML 模型元素使用文本替换（参见表4.2）。遵守 ASCII 中可用的符号；并使用 ASCII 字符集合构造框、线、箭头和其他模型元素。如果可用，请使用等宽字体，尝试使用回车控制托管环境中的自动换行，并使用较小的字体尽可能多地在屏幕上显示图表可能的。

Use textual substitutions for UML model elements wherever possible (see Table 4.2). Adhere to symbols available in ASCII; and construct the boxes, lines, arrows, and other model elements using collections of ASCII characters. Use a monospace font if available, try to control the word wrapping in the hosting environment by using carriage returns, and use smaller fonts to keep as much of the diagram onscreen as possible.

表 4.2。以 ASCII 显示 UML 模型的非正式规则集

结果上下文

Resulting Context

在不支持的环境中可用的 UML 图UML图形直接。

A usable UML diagram in an environment that does not support UML graphics directly.

4.11 七加减二

4.11 Seven Plus or Minus Two

问题

Problem

如何制作易于掌握的图表。

How to make diagrams that can be grasped easily.

语境

Context

构建本身是整体模型一部分的图表。在这种情况下，您特别关注软件模型，但该模式可以应用于使用标准化建模元素和语法的任何类型的潜在复杂模型。

Building diagrams that are themselves part of an overall model. In this case, you are specifically concerned with software models, but the pattern could apply to any type of potentially complex model using standardized modeling elements and syntax.

军队

Forces

  • 模型由图表组成。

  • Models are made up of diagrams.

  • 图表必须传达对现实世界有用的看法。

  • Diagrams have to communicate useful views of the real world.

  • 模型必须全面但有重点。

  • A model must be comprehensive but focused.

  • 现实世界可能是复杂的、混乱的和没有重点的。

  • The real world can be complex, messy, and unfocused.

  • 图本身并不受它们可以包含的元素数量的限制。

  • Diagrams are not inherently limited in the number of elements they can contain.

  • 人类对图表的理解受到人类认知能力（例如短期记忆）的限制。

  • Human understanding of diagrams is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities, such as short-term memory.

解决方案

Solution

将任何给定图表中的元素数量限制为神奇的七，给予或接受两个元素。这些元素应该在逻辑上相关；图表结构应该表达连接图表元素的合理模式。

Limit the number of elements in any given diagram to the magic number of seven, give ortake two elements. These elements should be logically related; the diagram structure should express a sensible pattern connecting the diagram elements.

结果上下文

Resulting Context

图表易于一目了然，并且能够以逻辑方式组织成更复杂的模型。

Diagrams that are easy to understand at a glance and able to be organized in a logical fashion into more complex models.

讨论

discussion

人类的认知资源是有限的。也就是说，他们一次只能关注这么多的事情和进行这么多的活动。图表中的元素太多可能会造成混淆，并且很难一次性全部保留在短期记忆中。这种模式提供了一种简单的方法来确保元素的数量对大多数人来说是合理的。称为可消化块的相关模式（参见第 5 章，“物质模式”）解释了将模型分解为逻辑图的过程的方式和原因作品。

Humans have limited cognitive resources. That is, they can attend to only so many things and perform so many activities at one time. Too many elements in a diagram can be confusing and are hard to retain in short-term memory all at once. This pattern provides a simple way of ensuring that the number of elements is reasonable for most people. The related pattern called Digestible Chunks (see Chapter 5, "Patterns of Substance" ) explains how and why the process of decomposing a model into logical diagrams works.

概括

Summary

根据任何估计，这些模式并不代表 UML 的完整风格规范。而且，作为模式，不应将它们视为规定性的。相反，它们为建模者提供了经过验证的、广泛适用的 UML 图表技术的核心。建模者可以将这些作为个人建模风格的起点，或者在组织或项目中作为整体架构风格的一部分。在开发项目中，风格通常不应该是个人选择的问题；相反，它应该是项目级别或组织决策。然而，任何标准化的风格都应该解决这些模式所解决的问题。

By any estimation, these patterns don't represent a complete canon of style for the UML. And, being patterns, they shouldn't be considered prescriptive. Rather, they give the modeler a core of proven, broadly applicable UML diagramming techniques. The modeler can use these as a starting point for a personal modeling style, or within an organization or project as part of an overall architectural style. In a development project, style shouldn't normally be a matter of personal choice; instead it should be a project level or organizational decision. However, any standardized style should address the problems that these patterns tackle.

系统的架构风格为设计方言提供了基础，而设计方言将成为开发工作的通用词汇。Jacobson、Griss 和 Jonsson 将建筑风格描述为“可以建造的所有（好的）模型的集合”（1997 年，第 51 页）。D'Souza 和 Wills 提供了一个单独的包，用于包含组合起来提供架构风格的规则和“经验法则”(1998)。

The architectural style for a system provides the basis for a design dialect that will be the common vocabulary for the development effort. Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson describe architectural style as "the set of all (good) models that can be built" (1997, 51). D'Souza and Wills provide a separate package for containing the rules and "rules-of-thumb" that combine to provide an architectural style (1998).

有关其中一些要点的更详细讨论，请参阅第 10 章“上下文中的 UML”。

For a more detailed discussion of some of these points, see Chapter 10, "The UML in Context."

第 5 章物质的模式

Chapter 5. Patterns of Substance

目录

Catalogue

5.1标准图

5.2实现或表示

5.3可消化块

5.4附加演员

5.5业务规则总是约束

5.6动态对象类型

5.7多对多类三重奏

5.8建模接缝

5.9打包分区

5.10让工具完成工作

5.11不透明包

5.1 Standard Diagrams

5.2 Implementation or Representation

5.3 Digestible Chunks

5.4 Attach the Actor

5.5 Business Rules Invariably Constrain

5.6 Dynamic Object Types

5.7 Many-to-Many Class Trio

5.8 Model the Seams

5.9 Packaging Partitions

5.10 Let the Tools Do the Work

5.11 Opaque Packages

语境

Context

模型的实用性和意义源于它们的构建方式，而不仅仅是内容。建模语言必须超越其结构和约定所提供的表达能力和形式规则。实质模式与模型意义和形状有关，关于在以创造性方式使用 UML 时如何正确。它们描述了如何确保您的 UML 模型是有效的、有效表达的、有用的和有意义的。他们应该以适当的形式提供信息，而不仅仅是空洞的图形修辞或令人困惑的符号夸张。

Models have a usefulness and meaning that derive from the way they are constructed, not just from the content. A modeling language must go beyond the expressive capabilities and formal rules provided by its structure and conventions. Patterns of substance are concerned with model meaning and shapeabout how to be correct when using the UML in a creative way. They describe how to ensure that your UML models are valid, efficiently expressive, useful, and meaningful. They should provide information in an appropriate form, not just empty graphical rhetoric or confusing symbolic bombast.

正如正确说话不仅仅意味着遵循语法规则，使用 UML（或任何建模语言）需要一种本身必须正确的创造力。然而，创造力受到限制，但通常不会以任何明显的方式受到限制。模式提供了一种解释如何正确发挥创造力的方法。

Just as speaking correctly means more than following the rules of grammar, using the UML (or any modeling language) requires a creativity that must itself be correct. However, creativity is constrained but not usually in any ways that are obvious. Patterns provide a way of explaining how to be correctly creative.

本章利用习语建模和启发式的力量提供一个起点。实质模式描述了用 UML 表示有用信息的非正式和实际可能性。它们扩展了使 UML 使用合理化的规则。

This chapter harnesses the power of modeling idioms and heuristics to provide a starting point. Patterns of substance describe the informal and practical possibilities of representing useful information with the UML. They extend the rules rationalizing the use of the UML.

共同力量

Common Forces

建模构造不应妨碍建模过程。它们应该尽可能直观，易于建模者使用，并且易于读者理解。但是结构的选择决定了你了解问题的方式和解决方案的可能性（透明度）。

Modeling constructs should not get in the way of the modeling process. They should be as nearly intuitive as possible, easy to use for the modeler, and easy to understand for the reader. But the selection of constructs shapes the way you can know the problem and the possibilities for solutions(transparency).

地图不是领土。但意义发生在上下文中，需要地图和领土之间的语义一致性（外部一致性）。

The map is not the territory. But meaning happens in context and requires semantic consistency between the map and the territory (external consistency).

符号是模型元素的表达。模型元素由 UML 分类为连贯的语义域（例如，静态和动态）。符号组合需要尊重这些语义划分。同时，建模是一种创造性的练习，UML 的类别和区别可能需要调整（内部连贯性）。

Symbols are expressions of model elements. Model elements are categorized by the UML into coherent semantic domains (for example, Static and Dynamic). Symbol combinations need to respect these semantic divisions. At the same time, modeling is a creative exercise, and the UML's categories and distinctions may need adjustment (internal coherence).

设计语言既要标准又要有适应性；由于既定标准与设计工作的直接需求（辩证唯物主义）之间存在差距，地方方言不可避免地会出现。

The language of design needs to be standard and adaptable at the same time; local dialects materialize inevitably as a result of gaps between established standards and the immediate needs of a design effort(dialectical materialism).

建模语言 80% 的效用来自 20% 的结构；然而，属于最有用的 20% 的构造因开发工作而异（80/20 规则）

80 percent of the utility of a modeling language comes from 20 percent of the constructs; however, the constructs that fall within the most useful 20 percent vary from development effort to development effort (the 80/20 rule)

讨论

Discussion

您选择的模型塑造了您对问题空间和解决方案的世界观。模型和技术一样，从来都不是中立的。最好的模型简化了现实，但他们建模的现实本身是构建的，并且是世界观的一部分（定位简单）。

The models you choose to make shape the worldview you have of the problem space and the solution. Models, like technology, are never neutral. The best models simplify a reality, but the reality they model is itself constructed and part of a worldview (situated simplicity).

5.1 标准图

5.1 STANDARD DIAGRAMS

问题

PROBLEM

如何组织模型信息的呈现以最小化开销并最大化透明度。

How to organize the presentation of model information to minimize overhead and maximize transparency.

语境

CONTEXT

使用 UML 构建模型。

Building models with the UML.

军队

FORCES

  • 图表表示模型的视图，应该对查看者具有语义意义；也就是说，内部和外部都是一致的（所表示的信息既符合问题又符合解决方案）并且符合观察者的观点）

  • Diagrams represent views of a model that should be semantically meaningful to the viewer; that is, both internally and externally consistent (the information represented fits both the problem and solution)and fitted to the viewpoint of viewer)

  • 有文化的模型查看者将从经验中期望应该如何表示常见的语义域。在查看图表时，不成熟的模型用户需要尽可能多的帮助来理解。

  • A literate model viewer will have expectations from experience about how common semantic domains should be represented. When looking at a diagram, an immature model user needs as the much help as possible in understanding.

  • 跨越语义类别的信息表示可能会令人困惑且难以解释。

  • Information representation, which crosses semantic categories, can be confusing and difficult to interpret.

  • 在一个典型的项目中只需要 UML 元素的一个子集。

  • Only a subset of UML elements is needed in a typical project.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将 UML 中可用的图形元素组合成一组有限且可重复的具有语义意义的图表类型。这些类型应该代表对查看者有用的信息类别。一般来说，与其发明自己的图表类型，不如坚持使用 UML 明确支持的标准图表类型（如第 3 章“UML 要素、元素和工件”中所述）。

Combine the graphical elements available in the UML into a limited and repeatable set of semantically meaningful diagram types. These types should represent categories of information that are useful to the viewer. In general, rather than inventing your own diagram types, stick with the standard diagram types that are explicitly supported by the UML (as described in Chapter 3, "UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts" ).

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

依赖约定来提供大量含义的可共享图表。

Shareable diagrams that rely on conventions to provide a significant amount of meaning.

讨论

DISCUSSION

在 UML 中，表示元素的任意组合是允许的，UML 的图形组件可以在图中组合是没有限制的，并且图的含义主要由语义提供。

In the UML, any combination of presentation elements is permittedthere are no limits to which graphical components of the UML may be combined in a diagram, and diagram meaning is mainly provided by semantics.
 

图在语义域和模型中组织信息，因此它们必须在内部保持一致（所有元素表示相同类型的信息）并且与语义范围一致领域。

Diagrams organize information within a semantic domain and within a model, and so they must be internally consistent (with all elements representing the same type of information) and consistent with the scope of the semantic domain.

5.2 实施或表示

5.2 IMPLEMENTATION OR REPRESENTATION

问题

PROBLEM

造型以有目的和专注的方式。

Modelingin a purposeful and focused way.

语境

CONTEXT

一般的建模活动，尤其是项目的早期阶段，在概念化和分析期间。

The modeling activity in general, but especially the early stages of a project, during conceptualization and analysis.

军队

FORCES

  • 模型就是文档。

  • The model is the documentation.

  • 如果不写下来，它就不存在。

  • If it isn't written down, it doesn't exist.

  • 分析不是编程。

  • Analysis isn't programming.

  • 模型的许多方面不会直接转化为编程结构。

  • Many aspects of models don't translate directly into a programming construct.

  • 各种观众和观点。

  • A variety of audiences and views.

  • 各种用途。

  • A variety of purposes.

  • 草图不是蓝图，也不是规范。

  • A sketch isn't a blueprint, and neither is a specification.

解决方案

SOLUTION

建模时要区分实现模型和表示模型。特别是，区分旨在记录您对领域的理解的模型（表示模型）和更接近解决方案蓝图计划的模型（实施模型）。对于您构建的每个模型，确定受众是谁以及它将服务于什么目的。

Distinguish between implementation models and representation models when doing modeling. In particular, distinguish between models that are meant to document your understanding of the domain (representation models) and those that are closer to blueprintsplans for the solution (implementation models). For each model that you build, determine who the audience is and what purpose it will serve.
 

尽管不再期望问题空间和解决方案空间在开发过程中保持密封分离（并按顺序解决），但避免过早或不恰当地添加实现细节仍然很重要。同样重要的是要意识到，编程语言通常不具备将模型直接转换为代码所需的灵活性或结构。

Although it is no longer expected that the problem space and the solution space will be kept hermetically separated during development (and addressed sequentially), it is still important to avoid adding implementation details in too early or inappropriately. It is also important to stay aware that programming languages usually don't have the flexibility or the constructs needed to translate a model directly into code.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

反映其受众和预期用途的重点模型。

Focused models that reflect their audience and intended use.

讨论

DISCUSSION

随着面向对象方法的成熟，它们越来越多地应用于设计和构建以外的系统开发领域。特别是，它们被用于分析和规范、建模领域和业务领域、组织需求和描述业务流程。虽然许多对象概念在表示和实现的需要之间重叠，但有些（例如模块化）可能不是（帕森斯和万德，1997）。

As object-oriented approaches have matured, they have been increasingly applied to areas of systems development other than design and construction. In particular, they are being used for analysis and specification, modeling domains and business areas, organizing requirements, and describing business processes. Although many object concepts overlap between the needs of representation and implementation, some (such as modularity) may not (Parsons and Wand, 1997).

5.3 可消化块

5.3 DIGESTIBLE CHUNKS

问题

PROBLEM

如何使模型有效。

How to make models that work.

语境

CONTEXT

建立反映人们大脑和感知能力工作方式的模型。

Building models that reflect the way people's brains and perceptive faculties work.

军队

FORCES

  • UML 模型必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML models must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 模型必须全面但有重点。

  • A model must be comprehensive but focused.

  • 模型由一个或多个必须组织的连接图组成。

  • Models are made up of one or more connected diagrams that have to be organized.

  • 现实世界可能是复杂的、混乱的和没有重点的。

  • The real world can be complex, messy, and unfocused.

  • 模型必须传达对现实世界有用的观点。

  • Models have to communicate useful views of the real world.

  • 人类对图表和模型的理解受到人类认知能力（例如短期记忆）的限制。

  • Human understanding of diagrams and models is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities, such as short-term memory.

  • 人类组织模型的能力受到人类认知能力的限制。

  • Human ability to organize models is constrained by the limits of human cognitive capabilities.

解决方案

SOLUTION

在构建模型时利用人类感知和记忆的认知局限性。不要构建包含厨房水槽（甚至可能是厨房水槽）以外所有东西的模型，而是将模型分成图表。它们应该是易于消化的位，具有单独的意义并以合理的方式连接。一个有助于弄清楚如何构建这些可消化位的相关模式当然是七加或减二。

Leverage the cognitive limitations of human perception and memory in building models. Instead of building models that include everything but the kitchen sink (and maybe even that), chunk your models into diagrams. They should be digestible bits that are individually meaningful and connected in a sensible fashion. A related pattern that is useful in figuring out how to build these digestible bits is, of course, Seven Plus or Minus Two.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

更容易理解和管理的个人模型。

Individual models that are easier to understand and manage mentally.

讨论

DISCUSSION

过去 20 年左右的各种研究表明，有一定的认知模式限制了我们能够理解和吸收的内容。这些模式之所以存在，是因为我们人类是天生的模式构建生物，如果没有认知模式所暗示的限制，我们就会被过度和错误的模式识别所束缚。因此，认知模式不是限制人类能力，而是一种利用人类偏好和能力的手段图案制作。

A variety of research over the last 20 years or so has indicated that there are definite cognitive patterns that constrain what we can understand and assimilate. These patterns seem to be there because we humans are natural pattern-building creatures, and without the limits suggested by cognitive patterns, we would be hamstrung by excessive and faulty pattern-recognition. So, rather than limits to human capability, cognitive patterns are a means to leverage the human predilection and capability for pattern making.

5.4 附加演员

5.4 ATTACH THE ACTOR

问题

PROBLEM

清楚地识别系统中的类或组件负责向其提供服务的最终用户角色。

Clearly identifying the end-user roles to which a class or component in a system is responsible for providing services.

语境

CONTEXT

用例驱动模型的任何部分，尤其是实现模型（其中特别缺乏用例可追溯性）。

Any portion of use-case driven model, especially implementation models (in which use case traceability is particularly lacking).

军队

FORCES

  • 用例必须在开发的所有阶段都是可见的。

  • Use cases must be visible through all stages of development.

  • 所有模型都必须追溯到原始用例。

  • All models must trace back to the original use cases.

  • 模型应该识别他们向其提供服务（满足要求）的用户。

  • Models should identify the users to which they provide services (satisfy requirements).

  • 必须在模型中指定角色标识，以维护角色可追溯性、范围控制和适当分区的体系结构。

  • Role identities must be specified in models to maintain role traceability, control of scope, and appropriately partitioned architecture.

  • 谁满足需求几乎与需求本身一样重要。

  • Who is satisfied by a requirement is nearly as important as the requirement itself.

  • 角色产生需求。

  • Roles generate requirements.

  • 参与者追究用例实施者的责任。

  • Actors hold use cases implementers accountable.

解决方案

SOLUTION

给定 UML 模型中的系统元素（类、对象、组件、状态机、交互、节点等），附加将用于满足参与者涉及的用例的参与者.

Given a system element (a class, object, component, state machine, interaction, node, and so on) in a UML model, attach the actor(s) for which it will be used to satisfy the use cases the actor is involved in.

图 5.1是第 4 章“样式模式”中的简单图形部署图示例，并添加了适当的参与者。（它们可以是图形图标而不是简笔画！）

Figure 5.1 is the example of a simple graphic deployment diagram from Chapter 4,"Patterns of Style," augmented with appropriate actors. (They could be graphical icons instead of stick figures!)

讨论

DISCUSSION

通过系统地将参与者附加到负责实现用例的系统元素上，模型将能够直接识别他们所属的最终用户负责任的。

By systematically attaching the actor to the system elements that are responsible for realizing the use case, the model will be able to directly identify the end-users to which they are accountable.

图 5.1。部署中的参与者。

5.5 商业规则总是约束

5.5 BUSINESS RULES INVARIABLY CONSTRAIN

问题

PROBLEM

哪里可以UML 模型持有指导系统运行的业务规则？具体来说，如何明确记录描述领域中基础知识的规则？

Where can a UML model hold the business rules that guide system operation? Specifically, how can rules that describe fundamental knowledge in the domain be explicitly documented?

语境

CONTEXT

UML 分析和设计模型，其中建模者拥有关于域本身的重要信息，这些信息无法使用标准 UML 模型元素进行建模。

UML analysis and design models in which the modeler has significant information about the domain itself that cannot be modeled using standard UML model elements.

军队

FORCES

  • 基本的 UML 构造（类、关联和依赖项）无法捕获业务规则。

  • Basic UML constructs (classes, associations, and dependencies) are unable to capture business rules.

  • 业务规则可以表述为声明性语句；也就是说，作为要做什么的形式化陈述，而不是程序算法。

  • Business rules can be formulated as declarative statements; that is, as formalized statements of what is to be done rather than as procedural algorithms.

  • 完整的模型包括业务规则。

  • Complete models include business rules.

解决方案

SOLUTION

使用 UML 约束来描述表示应用程序域各个方面的模型元素之间的条件和限制。对于在分析和设计过程中发现的每条业务规则，应该将声明性约束附加到规则所涉及的模型元素上。约束必须根据始终为真的语句来描述规则。

Use UML constraints to describe conditions and limits between model elements that represent aspects of your application domain. For each business rule discovered during analysis and design, a declarative constraint should be attached to the model elements involved in the rule. The constraint must describe the rule in terms of a statement that is always true.
 

图 5.2显示了如何使用约束来捕获业务规则的典型示例。显示的图表包含单个类 Account，它表示问题域中的银行帐户。业务规则是在开发过程中捕获的，可能是用例或规范文档交替流动的结果。在此示例中，它表示如果帐户中的余额低于零，则必须将 Account 类中的 Overdrawn 属性设置为 true。

Figure 5.2 shows a typical example of how a constraint can be used to capture a business rule. The diagram shown contains a single class, Account, which represents a bank account in the problem domain.
