Business rules are captured during the course of the development process, perhaps as a result of the alternate flow of a use case or specification document. In this example, it says that the Overdrawn attribute in the Account class must be set to true if the balance in the account falls below zero.
 

描述此业务规则的约束显示为 UML 注释（带弯角的矩形），它通过虚线附加到 Account 类。当系统被实施时，约束可以被实现为不变的或其他强制机制。UML 规范建议（但不要求）根据对象约束语言定义约束。约束也可以根据底层实现语言来定义，尽管出于清晰性和可移植性的原因不鼓励这样做。

The constraint that describes this business rule is shown as a UML note (rectangle with bent corner) that is attached through a dotted line to the Account class. When the system is implemented, the constraint can be realized as an invariant or other enforcement mechanism. The UML specification recommends (but does not require) that the constraint be defined in terms of the Object Constraint Language. The constraint can alternatively be defined in terms of the underlying implementation language, although is discouraged for reasons of clarity and portability.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

UML 分析和设计模型，其中业务规则以一致且可访问的方式建模。

UML analysis and design models where business rules are modeled in a consistent and accessible manner.

讨论

DISCUSSION

约束是建模元素之间的关系，在系统运行期间必须始终为真。因为约束描述了真/假关系，所以它们提供了一种以确定性方式指定和控制系统运行时语义的方法。因为 UML 约束直接映射到实现工件，通常是编程代码，所以它们可用于验证系统是否符合设计期间定义的业务规则阶段。

Constraints are relationships between modeling elements that must always be true for the duration of system operation. Because constraints describe true/false relationships, they allow a means for specifying and controlling, in a deterministic fashion, the runtime semantics of systems. Because UML constraints map right into implementation artifacts, typically programming code, they can be used to verify whether the system complies with the business rules defined during the design phase.

图 5.2。附加业务规则。

5.6 动态对象类型

5.6 DYNAMIC OBJECT TYPES

问题

PROBLEM

一个对象必须通过在不同时间表示不同但相似的事物来改变类型。

An object must change types by representing different but similar things at different times.

语境

CONTEXT

对在系统中角色随时间变化的任何对象建模。

Modeling any object whose role in a system changes over time.

军队

FORCES

  • 静态类型会造成刚性并使系统变得脆弱。

  • Static types create rigidity and make systems brittle.

  • 动态多重分类难以实现。

  • Dynamic multiple classification is difficult to implement.

  • 动态分类类更准确地反映了现实世界的领域角色。

  • Dynamically classifying classes reflects real-world domain roles more accurately.

  • 动态分类最适合概念模型。

  • Dynamic classification works best for conceptual models.

  • 静态分类非常适合实现模型。

  • Static classification is ideally suited for implemen- tation models.

解决方案

SOLUTION

利用泛化关系枚举对象可以承担的不同类型，然后指定UML提供的重叠约束来描述对象的类型在系统运行期间可以变化。参见图 5.3，其中“重叠”约束意味着对象可以在其生命周期内更改其类型。

Enumerate the different types that the object can assume by using the generalization relationship, and then specify the overlapping constraint provided by the UML to describe that the object's type can vary during system operation. See Figure 5.3, in which an "overlapping" constraint implies that an object can change its type during its lifetime.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

准确反映对象可以假定的不同类型的对象描述。

A description of the object that accurately reflects the different types the object can assume.

讨论

DISCUSSION

Fowler 和 Odell 都对动态分类问题做了很多研究，这个问题在概念模型中一次又一次地出现，但在大多数面向对象的编程语言 (OOPL) 中却得不到很好的支持。这种脱节对许多建模者都有影响，因为 OOPL 倾向于将它们的语义限制强加于生成的实现模型。

Both Fowler and Odell have made much of the dynamic classification issue, which surfaces time and again in conceptual models, but has poor support in most object-oriented programming languages (OOPLs). This disconnect has ramifications for many modelers because OOPLs have a tendency to impose their semantic limitations on the resulting implementation models.
 

实际上，大多数编程语言只能支持静态分类：对象及其类型具有一对一的映射。然而，在现实中，域的语义可能要求一个对象（例如人对象）随着时间的推移具有多种类型（例如，学生、居民和医生）。因此，在语义上，尽管实体随着时间的推移保持不变，但可能具有不同的行为甚至不同的接口，UML 提供了一种机制来使用泛化的预定义约束来描述此类行为关系。

Practically speaking, most programming languages can't support anything other than static classification: an object and its type have a one-to-one mapping. However, in reality the semantics of the domain may require that an object (such as a person object) have multiple types over time (for example, student, resident, and doctor). Therefore, semantically, although the entity stays the same over time but may have different behaviors and even different interfaces, the UML provides a mechanism for describing such behavior using a predefined constraint on the generalization relationship.

图 5.3。员工可以随时间改变类型。

5.7 多对多类三重奏

5.7 MANY-TO-MANY CLASS TRIO

问题

PROBLEM

如何对彼此具有多对多关联的两个类之间的关系建模。

How to model the relationship between two classes that have a many-to-many association with each other.

语境

CONTEXT

在系统设计期间使用 UML 建模类。

Modeling classes using the UML during system design.

军队

FORCES

  • 多对多关系在现实世界中经常发生。

  • Many-to-many relationships occur often in the real world.

  • 在某些面向对象的编程语言中很难实现多对多关联。

  • It can be difficult to implement many-to-many associations in some object-oriented program- ming languages.

  • 多对多关系在可能必须保留的关系数据库系统中没有直接实现。

  • Many-to-many relationships have no direct implementation in relational database systems in which they may have to be persisted.

  • 类之间的直接多对多关联无法描述比对另一个类的引用更有意义的任何内容：关联没有属性或行为。

  • Direct many-to-many associations between classes can't describe anything more meaningful than a reference to another class: associations don't have attributes or behavior.

  • 奥卡姆剃刀。

  • Occam's Razor.

  • 多对多关系通常非常复杂，足以保证完整类的支持来捕获语义。

  • A many-to-many relationship is usually complicated enough to warrant the support of a full class to capture the semantics.

解决方案

SOLUTION

通过创建具有两个一对多关系的中间类，将两个类之间的多对多关联转换为三个类（参见图5.4）。中间类的名称应该描述被捕获的关系类型。

Transform the many-to-many association between two classes into a trio of classes by creating an intermediary class with two one-to-many relationships (see Figure 5.4). The name of the intermediary class should describe the type of relationship being captured.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

一个 UML 模型，其中两个类由一个中间类链接，该中间类与前两个类中的每一个都具有一对多关系。由此产生的三个类将匹配关系模型，更容易实现，并提供更丰富的方式来捕获关系的细节。

A UML model with two classes linked by an intermediary class that has a one-to-many relationship to each of the first two classes. The resulting trio of classes will match the relational model, be easier to implement, and provide a richer way to capture the details of the relationship.

讨论

DISCUSSION

多对多关系对于建模者来说看似简单，甚至似乎具有直观意义：许多人可以在许多银行拥有帐户，许多网页可以存储在多台计算机上。中介类不仅在忠实地表示多对多关系方面提供了额外的灵活性，而且该构造得到了许多实现技术的更好支持。复杂的多对多关系通常需要完整类的支持来捕获语义。

Many-to-many relationships look deceptively simple to the modeler and even seem to make intuitive sense: Many people can have accounts at many banks and many Web pages can be stored on many computers. Not only does an intermediary class provide additional flexibility in representing the many-to-many relationship faithfully, but also the construct is better supported by many implementing technologies. And a complicated many-to-many relationship usually warrants the support of a full class to capture the semantics.
 

至少从关系建模的黎明以来，这是建模者的一个古老而古老的问题。幸运的是，在面向对象环境中有意义的解决方案也是在关系世界中行之有效的解决方案。因此，经过验证的解决方案在建模技术之间提供了一个方便的桥梁，并指出了一种已证明有效的实施方法。

This is an old and hoary concern of modelers since at least the dawn of relational modeling. Fortunately, the solution that makes sense in an object-oriented environment is also the proven one that worked in the relational world. So, the proven solution provides a convenient bridge between the modeling technologies as well as pointing to an implementation approach that has demonstrated effectiveness.
 

多对多类三重奏解决方案依赖于这样一个事实，即两个类之间的多对多关系在逻辑上等同于让一个中间类与两个主要类中的每一个具有一对多关联。中间类在详细说明和管理多对多关系方面提供了许多优势：两个主要类之间的每个关联都存在一个中间对象。

The Many-To-Many Class Trio solution relies on the fact that the many-to-many relationship between two classes is logically equivalent to having an intermediary class with a one-to-many association going to each of the two primary classes. The intermediary class provides many advantages in elaborating and managing a many-to-many relationship: An intermediary object exists for each association between the two primary classes.
 

这允许将属性和方法添加到关系中，例如上一个示例中的 Employment 类的日期范围。可以在中间类的任一侧调整多重性，以更精确地定义关系的确切性质。例如，示例中 Employment 类左侧的重数可以从多对一更改为多对一，以反映一个人可能失业或一次只有一份工作的事实. 中间类通常比使用关联类来解决多对多问题更好，因为它允许对多重性进行更高级别的控制，并且中间类不限制类之间相同关联的实例数，例如关联类做。

This allows attributes and methods to be added to the relationship, such as a date range to the Employment class in the previous example. The multiplicity can be tweaked on either side of the intermediary class to more precisely define the exact nature of the relationship. For example, the multiplicities on the left side of the Employment class in the example could be changed from many-to-one to many-to-one to reflect the fact that a person many be unemployed or have only a single job at a time. The intermediary class is often better than using an association class to solve the many-to-many problem because it permits a greater level of control over the multiplicities, and the intermediary class does not constrain the number of instances of the same association between classes like the association class does.

图 5.4。建模多对多关联。

5.8 接缝建模

5.8 MODEL THE SEAMS

问题

PROBLEM

如何识别并记录系统中独立组件之间的“接缝”或边界。

How to identify and document the "seams" or boundaries between independent components in a system.

语境

CONTEXT

基于组件的系统模型。

A model of a component-based system.

军队

FORCES

  • 界面边界形成系统的接缝。

  • Interface boundaries form the seams of a system.

  • 定义明确的接口依赖关系提供了对系统的洞察力和控制力。

  • Well-defined interface dependencies provide insight and control over a system.

  • 接口导入和导出都包含组件的依赖项。

  • Both interface imports and exports comprise a component's dependencies.

  • 不完整的接口模型会降低可插拔性。

  • Incomplete interface models reduce plugability.

解决方案

SOLUTION

识别和建模系统中的接口依赖关系。与其他类和组件组相比，紧密耦合的类和组件是很好的候选者。通常，系统组件之间的接缝可以通过识别它们公开的所有接口和它们使用的接口来找到和建模。

Identify and model the interface dependencies in the system. The classes and components that are tightly coupled when compared to other groups of classes and components are good candidates. In general, the seams between the components of a system can be found and modeled by identifying all the interfaces they expose and the interfaces they use.
 

对于每个类或组件，清楚地标识它使用的接口（导入）和它提供给其他人的接口（导出）。使用依赖关系对导入的接口进行建模，使用实现关系对接口的导出进行建模。UML 接口符号（棒棒糖图标）等同于接口原型类的依赖关系。参见图 5.5，它显示了一个股票交易者组件及其提供的接口和它所依赖的接口。

For each class or component, clearly identify the interfaces it uses (imports) and the interfaces it provides to others (exports). Model the interfaces imported using the dependency relationship and the exporting of interfaces using the realization relationship. The UML interface notation (the lollipop icon) is equivalent to the dependency relationship on an interface-stereotyped class. See Figure 5.5, which shows a stock trader component with the interface that it provides and the interfaces that it is dependent on.

图 5.5。清晰识别的接缝。

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

基于组件的系统模型，使用接口之间的依赖关系和实现关系，清楚地识别了组件周围的“接缝”。通过使用 Model the Seams，基于组件的开发的关键方面得以维持，包括可插入重用、互操作性标准化和独立配置控制单元的实施。

A component-based system model that has clearly identified "seams" around the components, using dependency and realization relationships between the interfaces. By using Model the Seams, the key aspects of component-based development are sustained, including plugable reuse, interoperability standardization, and the enforcement of independent units of configuration control.

讨论

DISCUSSION

任何重要的软件都是类、组件和 UML 关系的迷宫。在基于组件的开发环境中，当组件之间的界限模糊并且它们之间的关系不精确地指定时，组件的优势就会丧失。通过对协同创建系统的组件之间的接缝进行建模，建模者可以清晰地保持组件的身份和语义。这种对边界的强调反映了基于组件的开发的中心主题：接口/实现分离。

Any non-trivial software is a maze of classes, components, and UML relationships. In a component-based development environment, the advantages of components are lost when the boundaries between components are blurred and the relationships between them imprecisely specified. By modeling the seams between the components that collaborate together to create a system, the modeler keeps the identities and semantics of the components in sharp relief. This emphasis on boundary is a reflection of a central theme in component-based development: interface/implementation separation.
 

Model the Seams 的首要目标是识别接口两侧的组件。通过这样做，建模者完全解耦了组件，从而提供了如何为组件提供支持（根据它需要的接口）甚至完全替换组件的完整概念。成分。

The overriding goal in Model the Seams is to identify the components on both sides of an interface. By doing this, the modeler completely decouples the component, thereby providing a complete conception of how to provide support for the component (in terms of the interfaces it requires) or even to completely replace the component.

5.9 包装分区

5.9 PACKAGING PARTITIONS

问题

PROBLEM

组织基于通用指导原则的 UML 模型的元素。

Organizing the elements of a UML model based on a common guiding principle.

语境

CONTEXT

基于多层架构的分布式软件系统模型，将系统的职责划分为分布式分区。

The model of a distributed software system based on a multi-tiered architecture that divides the responsibilities of the system into distributed partitions.

军队

FORCES

  • 分区必须由模型强制执行。

  • Partitioning must be enforced by the model.

  • 分布式系统必须清晰明了地分区。

  • Distributed systems must be clearly and crisply partitioned.

  • 系统的组织是由其主要的架构结构驱动的。

  • The organization of systems is driven by their predominant architectural structure.

  • 对关键细节的视觉强调不足会导致设计失去平衡。

  • Insufficient visual emphasis on key details can cause loss of design balance.

  • UML 图必须简单明了地表达意思。

  • UML diagrams must convey meaning simply and clearly.

  • 可以使用多种有效的方法来组织 UML 模型。

  • UML models can be organized using a variety of effective methods.

解决方案

SOLUTION

每层或分区一个包；也就是说，通过为系统中的每个主要分区或层提供包来组织分布式系统的模型元素。这些包由跨分区边界通信的元素之间定义的依赖关系链接。例如，分层系统的常见分区方案是将表示服务（用户界面层）与应用程序逻辑（业务服务层）隔离开来，并将信息访问保留在第三层（数据服务层）中。图 5.6显示了使用 UML 包组织这三个分区的一种可能方式。

One package per tier or partition; that is, organize the model elements of the distributed system by providing packages for each major partition or tier in the system. The packages are linked by defined dependency relationships between elements that communicate across the partition boundaries. For example, a common partitioning scheme for tiered systems is to isolate the presentation services (user interface tier) from the application logic (business service tier) and to keep access of information in a third tier (data service tier). Figure 5.6 shows one possible way to organize these three partitions using UML packages.

图 5.6。将元素建模到分区包中。

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

反映系统的逻辑或物理分布式结构的 UML 模型。

A UML model that reflects the logical or physical distributed structure of the system.

讨论

DISCUSSION

UML 中包的概念纯粹是组织性的；包本身并不直接在实现中实现。然而，通过使用包来实施多层架构，模型通过防止不同分区中的元素以它们不应该的方式混合来实施系统分区。使用分区作为包来组织分布式系统的元素鼓励松散耦合，增强系统的分布式特性。

The notion of packages in UML is purely organizational; a package itself is not directly realized in the implementation. By using packages to enforce multi-tier architecture, however, a model enforces system partitioning by preventing elements in different partitions from intermixing in ways they shouldn't. Using partitions-as-packages to organize the elements of a distributed system encourages loose coupling, reinforcing the distributed nature of the system.
 

应注意将包元素组织到分区中，以便小心地公开可见性（通过依赖关系），同时向其他分区隐藏不必要的实现细节。

Care should be taken to organize package elements into partitions so that visibility (via dependency relationships) is carefully exposed while unnecessary implementation detail is hidden from other partitions.
 

通常，每个分区都被构建为一个单独的单元，用于配置和构建目的。每个分区包可以独立变化，并且可以由负责的每个团队独立地签入和签出模型它。

Typically, each partition is constructed as a separate unit for configuration and construction purposes. Each partition package can vary independently, and it can be checked in and out of the model independently by each team responsible for it.

5.10 让工具完成工作

5.10 LET THE TOOLS DO THE WORK

问题

PROBLEM

A建模者很容易被细节淹没，无法专注于手头的工作。如何解决？

A modeler can easily be overwhelmed by the detail and prevented from focusing on the job at hand. How can this be resolved?

语境

CONTEXT

使用软件工具创建模型。

Creating models using a software tool.

军队

FORCES

  • 工具根据它们对 UML 的了解来约束模型。

  • Tools constrain models based on what they know about the UML.

  • 过多的细节掩盖了意义。

  • Excessive detail obscures meaning.

  • 缺乏模型实施会导致模型不准确和不同步。

  • Lack of model enforcement leads to inaccurate and out-of-sync models.

  • 增加建模者在基本活动上的时间是很有价值的。

  • Increasing the modeler's time on essential activities is valuable.

  • 创建和参数化自动化模型任务既费时又昂贵。

  • Creating and parameterizing automated model tasks is time-consuming and expensive.

解决方案

SOLUTION

始终让该工具尽可能多地完成 UML 建模工作。依靠该工具完成日常和重复性任务。但是，如果结果不佳或者需要进行比手动操作更多的返工，则不要让工具执行特定的建模任务。

Always let the tool do as much of the UML modeling work as possible. Rely on the tool for routine and repetitive tasks. However, don't let the tool perform a particular modeling task if the results are poor or if more rework has to be done than would result by doing it by hand.
 

根据经验，如果您的建模工具支持它，请始终让该工具执行以下工作，如表 5.1中所述。

As a rule of thumb, and if your modeling tool supports it, always let the tool do the following work, as outlined in Table 5.1.

表 5.1。建模工具

类型

Type

描述

Description

模型执行

Model enforcement

元素重命名和删除、元素搜索（和替换）以及完整性检查。示例：使用该工具重命名一个类，并在出现该类的每个图表中更改它。反例：更改包的名称然后必须访问每个包，导入它并手动更改引用。

Element renaming and deleting, element search (and replace), and completeness checking. Example: Using the tool to rename a class and having it change in every diagram in which the class appears. Anti-example: Changing the name of a package and then having to visit each package, importing it and manually changing the reference.

UML 执行

UML enforcement

确保模型遵循 UML 元模型是一个好的建模工具的一个关键作用。检查模型是否以正确的 UML 表示是建模工具执行的持续验证过程。示例：确保类不会从自身继承，或者相同的标识符不会在同一名称空间中出现多次。

Making sure that the model adheres to the UML meta-model is the one key role of a good modeling tool. Checking that a model is expressed in proper UML is a continuous validation process performed by the modeling tool. Example: Making sure that a class doesn't inherit from itself or that the same identifier doesn't appear more than once in the same namespace.

代码生成

Code generation

将模型实现为可执行代码。示例：通过使用存储在与每个设计模型元素关联的标记值中的信息，将设计模型转换为 Java。

Realizing the model into executable code. Example: Converting a design model into Java by using information stored in tagged values associated with each design model element.

逆向工程

Reverse engineering

将程序源代码转换为 UML 模型。示例：获取用 C++ 编写的组件的源代码并生成反映组件结构的 UML 模型。

Converting program source code into a UML model. Example: Taking the source code for a component written in C++ and generating a UML model that reflects the structure of the component.

配置管理

Configuration management

跟踪 UML 模型的更改和发布。示例：支持配置管理的工具允许协调多个建模者所做的更改并将其合并为一个更改并重新签入该模型。

Keeping track of the changes and releases of a UML model. Example: A tool supporting configuration management allows the changes made by multiple modelers to be reconciled and merged into a single change and checked back in to the model.

巫师

Wizards

这些是交互式引导任务，通过这些任务，该工具通过自动完成大部分繁琐的工作来帮助建模者完成标准化的重复性任务。示例：引导建模者完成使 UML 类符合组件标准（如 COM 或 CORBA）的过程的向导。

These are interactive guided tasks through which the tool assists the modeler in a standardized repetitive task by doing most of the tedious work automatically. Example: A wizard that guides the modeler through the process of making a UML class adhere to a component standard, such as COM or CORBA.

脚本

Scripting

重复但耗时的任务应该编成脚本，可以自动快速地执行工作。可以将参数传递给脚本以指导工作。一般而言，任何每周或更频繁地发生且持续时间超过 510 分钟的重复性任务都适合编写脚本。

Tasks that are repetitive but time-consuming should be codified into scripts that can perform the work automatically and quickly. Parameters can be passed to the scripts to direct the work. In general, any recurring task that occurs on a weekly basis or more frequently and takes longer than 510 minutes is a good candidate for scripting.

塑造“帮手”

Modeling "helpers"

帮助建模者更快、更准确地工作的自动化例程。它们包括键入时元素名称自动完成、图表自动排列、分层模型浏览器、模型元素拖放等。示例：当将一个类拖到包含另一个与第一个类有关系的图上时，一个好的建模工具会询问是否应该显示或删除预先存在的关系。

Automated routines that help the modeler work more quickly and accurately. They include element name auto-completion when typing, diagram auto-arrangement, hierarchical model browsers, model element drag and drop, and so on. Example: when dragging a class onto a diagram that contains another class that already has a relationship with the first, a good modeling tool will ask whether the pre-existing relationships should be shown or elided.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

一个建模环境，它通过减少花在琐碎和重复性任务上的时间来利用建模者的独特能力。

A modeling environment that capitalizes on the modeler's unique capabilities by reducing the amount of time spend on menial and repetitive tasks.

讨论

DISCUSSION

创建和管理 UML 模型涉及同时管理大量因素：检查 UML 语法、遵守建模规则、遵循内部和外部建模标准、强制执行模型本身的语义等。

Creating and managing UML models involves managing a large number of factors simultaneously: checking the UML syntax, adhering to modeling rules, following internal and external modeling standards, enforcing the semantics of the model itself, and so on.
 

管理模型细节并帮助建模者执行日常任务是一个好工具的基本作用。管理非平凡模型所需的手动工作量非常可观，并且与模型的大小成正比。模型越大，相互依赖的网络就越大，这将使可管理性变得复杂。通过让建模者专注于只有他才能解决的关键问题，该工具可以减轻用户处理工具本身可以解决的问题的成本。该工具还可以通过脚本执行许多其他任务，这些任务通常会切入建模者的宝贵空间时间。

Managing the model minutiae and helping the modeler perform routine tasks is one essential role of a good tool. The amount of manual work required to manage a non-trivial model is very considerable and is in direct proportion to the size of the model. The larger a model is, the larger the web of interdependencies that will complicate manageability. By letting the modeler focus on key issues that only he can resolve, the tool can relieve its user from the cost of dealing with issues that can be taken care of by the tool itself. The tool can also perform many other tasks through scripts that would normally cut into the modeler's valuable time.

5.11 不透明包装

5.11 OPAQUE PACKAGES

问题

PROBLEM

怎么能建模者确保客户将适当地引用包内的元素？如何通过定义良好的接口最好地实现松散耦合？最重要的是，如何通过 UML 传达这些信息并在实践中强制执行？

How can the modeler ensure that clients will reference elements inside a package appropriately? How is loose-coupling through well-defined interfaces best achieved? And most importantly, how can this information be communicated via UML as well as enforced in practice?

语境

CONTEXT

由分解成包的服务组成的 UML 模型。

A UML model consisting of services decomposed into packages.

军队

FORCES

  • 减少依赖性促进了松散耦合并增加了可插拔性。

  • Dependency reduction promotes loose coupling and increases plugability.

  • 增加包数会增加依赖项的数量。

  • Increasing package count increases the number of dependencies.

  • 包内的依赖性随着包含的元素数量的增加而增加。

  • Dependencies within packages increase with the number of elements contained.

  • 网关或外观通过提供用一个替换多个依赖来减少依赖。

  • Gateways or facades reduce dependency by providing replace multiple dependencies with one.

解决方案

SOLUTION

通过将包成员的可见性降低为私有或受保护，使包尽可能不透明。只公开必要的元素，例如接口、门面、桥接器、代理等。在图表中显示包图标时，请确保始终只显示其中的公共元素。这将统一传达一个清晰的概念，即什么可以在包中直接使用，什么是隐藏的实现信息。如果必须显示受保护或私有元素，请为包元素使用颜色/阴影方案，以显示可见的和不可见的。图 5.7显示包含使用配色方案的公共和私有元素的包。阴影显示哪些类在包外部不可见。订单处理只能通过 Customer 类依赖于 Customer 包。

Make packages as opaque as possible by reducing the visibility of members of the package to private or protected. Make only essential elements public such as interfaces, facades, bridges, proxies, and so on. When displaying packages icons in diagrams, be sure to consistently display only the public elements inside them. This will uniformly communicate a clear sense of what is directly usable in the package and what is hidden implementation information. If protected or private elements must be shown, use a color/shading scheme for the package elements that shows what is visible and what isn't. Figure 5.7 shows a package containing public and private elements that use a color scheme. The shading shows which classes are not visible externally to the package. Order Processing is able to depend on the Customer package only through the Customer class.

图 5.7。一个不透明的包，带有一个公开导出的类：Customer。

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

包含包的 UML 模型，其内容在很大程度上对模型的结果是不透明的。只有设计用于与模型其余部分交互的元素才会被指定为可公开访问的。

A UML model with packages whose contents are largely opaque to the result of the model. Only the elements designed to interact with the rest of the model will be designated as publicly accessible.

讨论

DISCUSSION

不加区别地导入包元素会产生不需要的依赖关系和紧密耦合。包访问控制是 UML 提供的用于控制元素之间依赖关系的关键机制之一。包内的任何私有内容都不能在包外引用，即使包是导入的也是如此。

The indiscriminant importing of package elements creates unwanted dependencies and tight coupling. Package access control is one of the key mechanisms provided by the UML for controlling dependencies between elements. Anything made private within a package cannot be referenced outside of it, even if the package is imported.
 

必须存在两个关键因素以确保不透明包成功控制依赖性：

Two key factors must be present to ensure that opaque packages are successful in controlling dependencies:
 

  • 在模型中清楚地传达什么是可见的，什么是不可见的。这是通过将公共元素（并且仅是公共元素）物理放置在包图标中来直观地完成的。这为模型用户强化了他们可以合理期望依赖的内容以及他们明智地避免的实现细节。

  • The clear communication in the model of what is visible and what is not. This is done visually by physically placing the public elements (and only the public elements) within the package icon. This reinforces for the model user what they can legitimately expect to depend upon and what implementation details they would be wise to avoid.

  • 通过建模工具、底层语言或两者的实际执行访问，而没有实际导致不适当的依赖项失败的方法。在直接意义上没有真正的惩罚来阻止某人规避包的不透明性并使用受保护或私有元素。通过在模型和面向对象语言中显式指定包元素的导出可见性，将在物理上防止违反导出规则的人破坏建模者指定的依赖性约束。尽管大多数 UML 建模工具都提供了一种检查访问冲突的方法，但只有在面向对象语言的可见性语言结构中，包含无效依赖项的程序的编译才是可靠的。阻止。

  • The actual enforcement of access via the modeling tool, the underlying language, or bothwithout a means for actually causing inappropriate dependencies to fail. There is no real penalty in the immediate sense to prevent someone from circumventing the opacity of a package and using protected or private elements. By explicitly designating the export visibility of package elements, both in the model and in an object- oriented language, the violator of the export rules will be physically prevented from breaking the dependency constraints specified by the modeler. Although most UML modeling tools provide a means for checking access violations, it is only in the visibility language constructs of object- oriented languages that the compilation of programs containing invalid dependencies will reliability be prevented.

概括

Summary

本章中的模式帮助您有效地使用 UML 来构建和管理模型。与第 4 章“样式模式”中的内容一样， 它们是建模习语，是专门针对建模细节的低级模式。它们中的大多数可以应用于多种类型的图表，适用于各种建模情况。它们是具有特定 UML 风格的建模问题的通用解决方案。

The patterns in this chapter help you make effective use of the UML in building and managing models. Like those in Chapter 4, "Patterns of Style," they're modeling idioms, lower-level patterns that are specifically about the details of modeling. Most of them can be applied to many types of diagrams, in all kinds of modeling situations. They're general solutions to modeling problems with a specific UML flavor.

当您在组织内创建自己的 UML 方言时，其他和更多的地方习语可能会变得显而易见。随着时间的推移，这些应该被记录和审查，成为开发过程本身词汇的一部分。其中一些模式甚至可以替代或改进本书中的模式。

As you create your own local dialect of the UML within your organization, additional and more local idioms may become obvious. These should be documented and reviewed over time, becoming part of the vocabulary of the development process itself. Some of these patterns may even replace or refine the ones in this book.

本章和第 4 章只是嵌入在 UML 本身或有关 UML 的更好书籍中的建模习语的一个示例。特别好的来源是Objects, Components, and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach by Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998)；以及Ivar Jacobson、Grady Booch 和 James Rumbaugh (1998a) 的统一建模语言用户指南。D'Souza 和 Wills 提供了关于一般文档的良好材料，值得参考以从不同的角度看待应如何管理模型。UML 用户指南提供了有关标准建模问题的解决方案的提示，在许多情况下，这些问题有助于将其自身概括为模式。

This chapter and Chapter 4 are just a sampling of the modeling idioms that are embedded in the UML itself, or the better books written about it. Particularly good sources are Objects, Components, and Frameworks with UML: The Catalysis Approach by Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998); and The Unified Modeling Language User Guideby Ivar Jacobson, Grady Booch, and James Rumbaugh (1998a). D'Souza and Wills provide good material on documentation in general, which is worth consulting for a different look at how models should be managed. The UML User Guide has tips about solutions to standard modeling problems that in many cases lend themselves to being generalized as patterns.

以下章节中的模式通常不是习语。他们关心的是应用 UML 构建不同级别的系统模型。在考虑使用这些模式时，应牢记最后两章中的模式。

The patterns in the following chapters are usually not idioms. They're concerned with applying the UML in constructing system models at various levels. The patterns in the last two chapters should be kept in mind when considering the use of these patterns.

第 6 章领域模式

Chapter 6. Domain Patterns

目录

Catalogue

6.1领域模型必不可少

6.2演员扮演重要角色

6.3因素因素

6.4基本行动

6.5基本词汇

6.6客观化内部角色

6.7未来模型

6.8原样模型

6.1 Domain Model Is Essential

6.2 Actors Play Essential Roles

6.3 Factor the Actor

6.4 Essential Actions

6.5 Essential Vocabulary

6.6 Objectify Internal Roles

6.7 ToBe Model

6.8 AsIs Model

语境

Context

域是最高级别的这种模式语言。它们对应于曾经作为分析起点的问题空间的企业或业务视图。但是，域不受组织的正式限制的限制，而是灵活且实际地定义。

Domains are the highest level of this pattern language. They correspond to the enterprise or business view of the problem space that used to be the starting point for analysis. However, rather than being bounded by the formal limits of an organization, domains are flexibly and practically defined.

出于我的目的，它们是一个感兴趣的领域（域的典型字典定义），具有以下内容：

For my purpose, they are an area of interest (a typical dictionary definition of domain) with the following:

  • 业务抽象（事件、概念和事物）的共享词汇表

  • A shared vocabulary of business abstractions (events, concepts, and things)

  • 一系列应用程序可以解决的一组共同需求

  • A common set of needs that can be addressed by a family of applications

域还为这些应用程序的模型提供上下文和组织结构；用于指导其设计、实施和管理的模型。

Domains also provide the context and organizing structure for the models of those applications; the models that are used in guiding their design, implementation, and management.

域定义了上下文和环境，用于理解驱动一组软件产品开发的共同需求。它确定了在这些需求的特定范围内合理且可解决的问题。

A domain defines the context and environment for understanding the common needs that drive the development of a set of software products. It identifies the problems that are legitimate and that are solvable within the specific scope of those needs.

领域是严肃建模的起点，它将导致真正的、实质性的软件。有两种类型的域是感兴趣的软件开发人员：

Domains are the starting point for serious modeling that will lead to real, substantial software. There are two types of domain that are of interest to a software developer:

  • 业务领域： 

    业务感兴趣的领域，包含以对业务有意义的方式打包业务服务的想法、实体和事件的基本业务抽象

  • Business domains: 

    Areas of interest to the business, containing fundamental business abstractions that are the ideas, the entities, and the events that package business services in a way that is meaningful to the business

  • 技术领域： 

    必须具备的基础设施、技术愿景和技术限制受到尊重

  • Technical domain: 

    The infrastructure, technology vision, and technological constraints that must be respected

共同力量

Common Forces

  • 业务领域必须是对其最终用户有意义的业务现实块。

  • A business domain must be a meaningful chunk of business reality to its end users.

  • 领域模型必须能够被利益相关者直接验证和解释。

  • A domain model must be capable of being directly validated and explained by its stakeholders.

  • 用户知道他们在做什么，但可能不知道他们知道什么。

  • Users know what they do, but may not know what they know.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 用户可能不了解他们的环境或他们想要追求的方向。

  • Users may not understand their environment or the direction they want to pursue.

  • 领域对技术人员来说是复杂的抽象。

  • Domains are complex abstractions to technologists.

  • 共同语言可以帮助团队成员定义共同愿景。

  • A common language can help members of a group define a common vision.

  • 共同的语言可以帮助群体外的成员理解共同的愿景。

  • A common language can help members outside a group understand the common vision.

讨论

Discussion

大多数信息技术人员使用词域表示可识别的应用程序系列。更精明的观察者更喜欢在他们的定义中包含上下文；例如，Jim Coplien 将领域分析定义为“对基本业务抽象的研究”（1998a）。在本书中，域是对组织有意义的某种抽象级别的业务特性和服务的包装。

Most information technologists use the word domainto mean an identifiable family of applications. More astute observers prefer to include the context in their definition; for example, Jim Coplien defines domain analysis as "the study of fundamental business abstractions" (1998a). For this book, a domain is a packaging of business features and services at some level of abstraction that is meaningful to an organization.

当前大多数撰写领域建模视图的作者都将领域模型视为美化的信息模型。这在某种程度上反映了近几年来面向对象的边缘地位。领域工程（领域建模的源头）出现在与面向对象相同的时期，以响应类似的需求（重用和结构），但走的是不同的路线。

Most current writers who write about the domain-modeling view see domain models as glorified information models. To some extent, this reflects the marginal status of object-orientation until the last few years. Domain engineering (the source of domain modeling) emerged during the same period as object- orientationin response to similar needs (reuse and structure), but following a different route.

更新版本的域建模将包含对行为和交互的考虑。Ivar Jacobson 在统一软件开发过程中代表三个朋友建议，仅包含感兴趣领域内的类的域模型“实际上只是 (a)“业务模型”的特例，开发业务模型是一个强大的替代方案”（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1999a，122）。

A more up-to-date version of domain modeling would incorporate considerations of behavior and interaction. Ivar Jacobson, speaking for the Three Amigos in The Unified Software Development Process, suggests that a domain model that only includes the classes within an area of interest "is really just a special case of (a)business modeldeveloping a business model is a powerful alternative" (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a, 122).

我认为领域建模是对使用 UML 中可用的所有适当结构的业务的特定方面进行建模的活动。

I've taken the view that domain modeling is the activity of modeling a particular aspect of a businessone that uses all of the appropriate constructs available within the UML.

域不必包含在组织中。特别是，随着网络化组织的出现以及企业间合作、伙伴关系和数据共享等趋势，传统的组织利益界限正在消失。在这些情况下，一个域可以包括来自多个组织的元素，例如供应链。

A domain does not have to be contained within an organization. In particular, with the emergence of the networked organization and such trends as cooperation, partnering, and data sharing among companies, the traditional boundaries of organizational interest are dissolving. In these circumstances, a domain can include the elements from a number of organizations, such as a supply chain.

汽车分销领域的一个简单示例可能是资产生命周期管理。这是支持分销商与其经销商之间关系的功能和服务包。经销商从融资和控制客户流失中获得最大利润：汽车在其整个生命周期内的转售。经销商，而不是购车者，才是经销商真正的客户，他们既是代理商，又是利润最大化的合作伙伴。经销商与经销商合作，为他们提供服务和支持系统，以保留对每辆车作为资产的控制权尽可能多地使用它的生命。在这个业务领域内，各种应用程序提供了重点服务，例如，租赁服务和系统，最大限度地提高车辆在其生命周期内的持续控制。

One simplistic example of a domain from automobile distribution might be Asset Lifecycle Management. This is a package of features and services that support the relationship between a distributor and its dealers. A distributor makes the most profit from financing and from controlling churn: the reselling of the car throughout its life. Dealers, not car buyers, are the distributor's real customers, and so they are both the agents and the partners in maximizing profit. Distributors work with the dealers to provide them with services and supporting systems to retain control of each car as an asset for as much of its life as possible. Within this business domain, a variety of applications provides focused servicesfor example, leasing services and systems that maximize ongoing control of a vehicle during its lifecycle.

领域模型对于界定领域是必不可少的，因此它对软件规划和管理很有用。软件开发人员对领域进行建模，为一系列应用程序提供基础。域模型捕获并定位一组高级需求，这些需求对于已识别的感兴趣区域中的应用程序是常见的。这个感兴趣的领域可能像一个组织一样广泛（希望不是），也可能像一个功能领域一样狭窄。该模型可以包括以下内容：

Domain models are essential for bounding a domain so that it is useful for software planning and management. Software developers model domains to provide the basis for a family of applications. A domain model captures and situates the set of high-level requirements that are common to applications within an identified area of interest. This area of interest may be as broad as an organization (hopefully not) or as narrow as a functional area. The model can include the following:

  • 域范围的定义

  • A definition of scope for the domain

  • 概念层面的信息或对象

  • Information or objects at the conceptual level

  • 功能或用例，包括再次导致变化的因素，高层和面向业务

  • Features or use cases, including factors that lead to variationagain, high-level and business-oriented

  • 操作/行为特征

  • Operational/behavioral characteristics

需要明确的是，此级别的建模具有足够的概念性，因此我们努力的唯一最终结果就是模型。但是因为这些模型为理解和使用所有其他开发工件提供了基础，所以它对我们所有级别的模型的价值尤为重要。

To be clear, modeling at this level is sufficiently conceptual so that the only end result of our efforts is models. But because these models provide the basis for understanding and using all the other development artifacts, it is especially critical to the value of our models at all levels.

为支持规划和管理而构建的更高级别模型是新建模方法与传统方法最明显的不同之处。这些明显的差异最清楚地说明了我们工艺的成熟，特别是在我们建模的原因和我们的内容方面模型。

Higher-level models built to support planning and management are where the new modeling approaches are most starkly different from the traditional ones. These obvious differences most clearly illuminate the maturing of our craft, especially in the areas of why we model and what we model.

6.1 领域模型必不可少

6.1 DOMAIN MODEL IS ESSENTIAL

问题

PROBLEM

如何对域的重要元素进行建模。

How to model the important elements of a domain.

语境

CONTEXT

理解和记录用于构建或重构系统或组织的域上下文。

Understanding and documenting the domain context for use in building or refactoring a system or organization.

军队

FORCES

  • 域模型必须能够被最终用户直接验证和解释。

  • A domain model must be capable of being directly validated and explained by the end users.

  • 用户知道他们在做什么，但可能不知道他们知道什么。

  • Users know what they do, but may not know what they know.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 领域信息是设计决策的关键上下文。

  • Domain information is the critical context for design decisions.

  • 设计决策必须可追溯到领域。

  • Design decisions must be traceable to the domain.

解决方案

SOLUTION

用最少的实现细节记录域的组件。业务活动应与基本业务用例一起记录。实际上，这些脚本描述了与参与者在其中扮演重要角色的企业或组织的交互。现实世界中的事物和服务被表示为基本业务对象。

Document the components of the domain with a minimum of implementation detail. Business activities should be documented with essential business use cases. These are, in effect, scripts that describe interactions with the business or organization in which actors play essential roles. Things and services in the real world are represented as essential business objects.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

基本的活动、事物和服务被识别、打包、标记和商定。它们以图表形式提供，允许在改进整体领域模型时进行进一步处理。

The essential activities, things, and services are identified, packaged, labeled, and agreed upon. They are made available in diagrammatic form that allows for further massaging as the overall domain model is refined.

讨论

DISCUSSION

McMenamin 和 Palmer (1984)介绍了基本模型的概念在结构化分析的末日。为了降低在分析对新系统的需求时生成的信息的复杂性，基本模型将仅包含代表理想系统的元素，而无需考虑任何实施。最近，基本模型的概念被拉里·康斯坦丁（他帮助开发首先是这个想法）。他的基本用例思想得到了 Jacobson 和其他人（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh1999).

McMenamin and Palmer (1984) introduced the idea of essential models backin the dying days of structured analysis. In order to reduce the complexity of the information generated when analyzing the need for a new system, an essential model would contain only elements that represented the ideal system, free of any implementation considerations. Recently, the notion of essential models has been revived by writers such as Larry Constantine (who helped develop the idea in the first place). His idea of essential use cases is championed by Jacobson and others (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999).

6.2 参与者扮演重要角色

6.2 ACTORS PLAY ESSENTIAL ROLES

问题

PROBLEM

如何确定域中的重要交互，以便可以成功地对它们进行建模。

How to identify the important interactions in a domain so that they can be modeled successfully.

语境

CONTEXT

理解和记录用于构建或重构系统或组织的域上下文。

Understanding and documenting the domain context for use in building or refactoring a system or organization.

军队

FORCES

  • 域模型必须能够被最终用户直接验证和解释。

  • A domain model must be capable of being directly validated and explained by the end users.

  • 用户交互构成了系统事件的基础。

  • User interactions form the basis for system events.

  • 域工作和用户头衔可能与职责不匹配。

  • Domain jobs and user titles may not match responsibilities.

  • 域工作和用户头衔可能会更改。

  • Domain jobs and user titles may change.

  • 领域模型不应该只反映当前的现实。

  • A domain model should not only reflect current realities.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 领域信息是设计决策的关键上下文。

  • Domain information is the critical context for design decisions.

  • 设计决策必须可追溯到领域模型。

  • Design decisions must be traceable to the domain model.

解决方案

SOLUTION

首先检查域外部的定型角色（域用户类型的示例），而不是真实用户或域外部与其交互的任何其他角色。每个角色都是在您的模型中被表示为演员的候选人。通过将这些角色重构为参与者在域脚本中扮演的基本角色通用部分而不是工作名称或头衔来建立参与者。

Start by examining stereotypical roles that are external to the domainexamples of types of users of the domain, rather than real users or anything else that is external to the domain that interacts with it. Each role is a candidate for being represented as an actor in your model. Establish the actors by refactoring these roles into essential rolesgeneric parts played by participants in the domain script, rather than job names or titles.

目的是确定与域和系统交互的用户类型，作为列出和分析交互本身的起点。避免粒度太细：ATM_Customer（通常）优于存款人、提款客户、余额检查员等的单独角色。这些角色应该对您的用户有意义，并且它们应该反映企业或组织实际与外部交互的方式。

The intent is to establish the types of users who are interacting with the domain and the system as a starting point for listing and analyzing the interactions themselves. Avoid being too fine-grained: ATM_Customer is (normally) preferable to separate roles of Depositor, Withdrawing Customer, Balance Checker, and so on. These roles should be meaningful to your user, and they should reflect the way the business or organization actually interacts with the outside.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

领域内的主要角色被识别、打包、标记和商定。它们以图表形式提供，允许在改进整体领域模型时进行进一步处理。每个角色还有助于定义领域的边界和范围。每个角色都为列出基本领域活动提供了一个起点。

The main roles within the domain are identified and packaged, labeled, and agreed-upon. They are made available in diagrammatic form that allows for further massaging as the overall domain model is refined. Each role also helps to define the bounding and scope the domain. And each role provides a starting point for listing essential domain activities.

讨论

DISCUSSION

在Software Reuse: Architecture, Process and Organization for Business Success中，Jacobson、Griss 和 Jonsson (1997) 使用短语“参与者模型角色”来表示如何思考参与者。McMenamin 和 Palmer 的Essential Systems Analysis (1984) 也提供了关于如何思考参与者的另一种见解——即尽可能与实施细节（例如，职位）或技术（外部系统）分开。这种模式具有极强的可扩展性，适用于系统参与者以及与系统交互的任何事物。但是，基本质量对于确定领域中的参与者最为重要本身。

In Software Reuse: Architecture, Process and Organization for Business Success, Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson (1997) use the phrase "Actors model roles" to signify how to think about actors. McMenamin and Palmer's Essential Systems Analysis (1984) also provides another insight into how to think of actorsthat is, separated as much as possible from implementation details (for example, job titles) or technology (external systems). This pattern is eminently scalable and applies to system actors as wellanything that interacts with the system. However, the essential quality is most important in determining the actors in the domain itself.

6.3 因素因素

6.3 FACTOR THE ACTOR

问题

PROBLEM

如何建模以有用的方式定义系统的用户和用途的角色。

How to model the roles that define the users and uses of the system in a useful way.

语境

CONTEXT

对产品的边界和上下文进行建模，并在较小程度上对域进行建模。

Modeling the boundary and context of a product, and to a lesser extent, a domain.

军队

FORCES

  • 用户可以有多个角色。

  • Users can have multiple roles.

  • 一个角色可以由多个用户执行。

  • A role can be performed by multiple users.

  • 角色需要通用但有重点。

  • Roles need to be generic but focused.

  • 演员是环境的。

  • Actors are environmental.

  • 演员是上下文相关的。

  • Actors are contextual.

  • 演员识别是迭代的。

  • Actor identification is iterative.

解决方案

SOLUTION

确定参与者反复使用角色。在处理用例时，通过从具体到抽象或从具体到抽象的方式不断完善它们。查看与触发每个参与者与域或系统交互的事件相关的功能和职责。具有共同职能或共同责任的角色可以合并。另一方面，表面上相同的角色之间的显着差异可能必须被识别为不同的演员。Customer 的变体是简单的例子。

Identify actors use roles iteratively. As you work through use cases, continually refine them either by moving from the specific to the abstract, or vice versa. Look at the functions and responsibilities associated with the events that trigger interactions with the domain or system by each actor. Roles that have common functions or shared responsibilities may be combined. On the other hand, significant variations between roles that are superficially the same may have to be identified as distinct actors. Variations on Customer are simple examples.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

具有适当粒度的参与者可以帮助提供定义常见变体的起点。

Actors with appropriate granularity that can help provide a starting point for defining common variations.

讨论

DISCUSSION

参与者是建立用例的关键起点，用例是域中产品的功能需求。必须以有纪律的方式识别它们。

Actors are a critical starting point for establishing the use cases that are the functional requirements for products in a domain. They must be identified in a disciplined fashion.

具有既定边界和丰富历史的领域将具有明确定义的功能和可以启动该过程的隐性领域专家。使用他们和他们的角色作为开始。

A domain with established boundaries and substantial history will have clearly defined functions and tacit domain experts who can kick-start the process. Use them and their roles as a beginning.

另一方面，如果您正在引入新技术或流程，或者涉及某种形式的重组或重新设计，您可能需要查看技术或目标业务模型以获取识别抽象角色、用户类型、或潜力工作职能。

On the other hand, if you are introducing new technology or processes, or involved in some form of reorganization or re-engineering, you may need to look at the technology or the target business model for guidance in identifying abstract roles, types of users, or potential job functions.

6.4 基本行动

6.4 ESSENTIAL ACTIONS

问题

PROBLEM

如何代表一个领域的活动，以提供对记录需求和分析模型的关注。

How to represent the activities of a domain to provide focus in documenting the requirements and analysis model.

语境

CONTEXT

理解和记录领域。

Understanding and documenting the domain.

军队

FORCES

  • 域模型必须能够被最终用户直接验证和解释。

  • A domain model must be capable of being directly validated and explained by the end users.

  • 用户知道他们在做什么，但可能不知道他们知道什么。

  • Users know what they do, but may not know what they know.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 不必要的复杂性可能会产生误导。

  • Unnecessary complexity can be misleading.

  • 活动是原子的且不相关的。

  • Activities are atomic and unconnected.

  • 流程是普遍理解的域操作包。

  • Processes are commonly understood packages of domain actions.

解决方案

SOLUTION

通过构建一组业务用例来记录域内的基本操作。重点描述用户熟悉的典型流程的正常流程。重新设计这些用例以反映用户的真实需求。使用业务用例图来帮助重构领域本身；也就是说，重新组织您对域中发生的事情的理解，并最终可能重新组织域本身。

Document the essential actions within a domain by building a set of business use cases. Focus on describing the normal flow of the typical procedures that users are familiar with. Rework these use cases to reflect the real needs of the users. Use business use case diagrams to help refactor the domain itself; that is, to reorganize your understanding of what happens in the domain, and ultimately to perhaps reorganize the domain itself.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

对基本活动进行识别、打包、标记和商定。它们以图表形式提供，允许在改进整体领域模型时进行进一步处理。

The essential activities are identified, packaged, labeled, and agreed-upon. They are made available in diagrammatic form that allows for further massaging as the overall domain model is refined.

讨论

DISCUSSION

业务用例是简单但有效的工具，可以由最终用户开发，通常无需技术类型的任何明确指导。在明确了对正常流程的关注之后，这些案例提供了一种方便的机制，用于挖掘关于域中发生的操作的讨论的本质和关键。这些图表提供了一种简洁、简短的方式来直观地包装结果，而没有过多的形式主义或句法开销。同样，这非常适合支持一个领域的联合迭代分析用户。

Business use cases are simple but effective tools that can be developed by end users, frequently without any explicit guidance from technical types. After the focus on normal flow is made clear, these cases provide a convenient mechanism for unearthing the essential and the critical in discussions about the actions taking place in a domain. The diagrams provide a concise, short-form way of visually packaging the results, without excessive formalism or syntactical overhead. Again, this is ideal for supporting the joint iterative analysis of a domain with users.

6.5 基本词汇

6.5 ESSENTIAL VOCABULARY

问题

PROBLEM

如何以捕获基本信息并为您的用户/客户提供通用词汇的方式记录您对该领域的理解。

How to document your understanding of the domain in a way that captures the essential information and provides a common vocabulary with your users/customers.

语境

CONTEXT

理解和记录领域。

Understanding and documenting the domain.

军队

FORCES

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 言语必须双向发挥作用。

  • Words must work both ways.

  • 一个领域的许多方面可能被默认理解并且缺乏正式表达。

  • Many aspects of a domain may be understood tacitly and lack formal expression.

  • 词汇构建提供了对领域的洞察力。

  • Vocabulary-building provides insight into a domain.

  • 技术语言会使用户感到困惑或恐吓。

  • Technical language can confuse or intimidate users.

  • 对象不仅仅适用于系统。

  • Objects are not just for systems.

解决方案

SOLUTION

开发一个由业务用例和业务对象的初步目录组成的领域模型。

Develop a domain model that consists of business use cases and a preliminary catalog of business objects.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

域操作和交互（用例）和对象（目录和初步业务对象模型）的词汇表，结合了图形和高级文本信息以便于讨论。

A vocabulary of domain actions and interactions (use cases) and objects (a catalog and preliminary Business Object model) that combines graphical and high-level textual information for ease of discussion.

讨论

DISCUSSION

领域的基本分析既是迭代的又是增量的。在架构师和用户的共同努力下，可以轻松快速更改的粗线条图片效果最好。业务用例为活动提供标签，而业务对象为基本词汇表提供名称。与用户协作定义用例和对象提供了对词汇表元素含义的共同理解。

The essential analysis of a domain is both iterative and incremental. Broad stroke pictures that can be changed easily and quickly work best in a joint effort by the architect and users. Business use cases provide labels for activities, and business objects provide names for a basic vocabulary. Defining the use cases and objects in collaboration with the users provides a common understanding of the meaning of the elements of the vocabulary.

设计域模型就是 Donald Schon (1983) 所说的参与“与情境的反思性对话”，涉及“空间动作语言”，一种“结合绘图和说话”的语言。UML 本身为业务建模的空间动作语言提供了通用词汇表的基础。随着大局的出现，对模型元素的本地实验表明需要新元素或需要改变现有模型。

Designing the domain model is what Donald Schon (1983) refers to as engaging in a "reflective conversation with a situation" involving "spatial action language," a language that "combines drawing and speaking." The UML itself provides the basis for a common vocabulary for a spatial action language for business modeling. As the big picture emerges, local experiments with model elements reveal the need for new elements or the need to change the existing model.

6.6 对象化内部角色

6.6 OBJECTIFY INTERNAL ROLES

问题

PROBLEM

如何模拟域内人员、系统和组织所扮演的角色。

How to model the roles played by people, systems, and organizations within a domain.

语境

CONTEXT

构建领域模型并提供用于定义产品需求的上下文。

Building a domain model and providing a context for defining product requirements.

军队

FORCES

  • 组织与外部世界的交互可以通过人或系统来调解。

  • An organization's interactions with the outside world can be mediated by people or systems.

  • 域模型必须能够被最终用户直接验证和解释。

  • A domain model must be capable of being directly validated and explained by the end users.

  • 内部角色与人或系统交互。

  • Internal roles interact with people or systems.

  • 域工作和用户头衔可能与职责不匹配。

  • Domain jobs and user titles may not match responsibilities.

  • 域工作和用户头衔可能会更改。

  • Domain jobs and user titles may change.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

  • 域交互是系统设计决策的关键上下文。

  • Domain interactions are the critical context for system design decisions.

  • 设计决策必须可追溯到领域模型。

  • Design decisions must be traceable to the domain model.

解决方案

SOLUTION

这与将基本角色确定为演员非常相似。从检查定型角色开始，但这次要检查领域内部的角色。每个角色都是在域模型中表示为对象的候选者。通过将这些角色重构为参与者在域脚本中扮演的基本角色通用部分而不是工作名称或头衔来建立人员对象。目的是确定与参与者和域系统交互的用户类型，作为列出和分析交互本身的起点。

This is very similar to identifying essential roles as actors. Start by examining stereotypical roles, but examine those that are internal to the domain this time. Each role is a candidate for being represented as an object in your domain model. Establish the people objects by refactoring these roles into essential rolesgeneric parts played by participants in the domain script, rather than job names or titles. The intent is to establish the types of users who are interacting with actors and the domain's systems as a starting point for listing and analyzing the interactions themselves.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

领域内的主要角色被识别并打包、标记和商定为对象。每个“对象”将作为定义产品需求的系统用例中的潜在参与者依次可用于进一步分析。

The main roles within the domain are identified and packaged, labeled, and agreed-upon as objects. Each "object" will in turn be available for further analysis as potential actors in the system-use cases that define the requirements for the product.

讨论

DISCUSSION

在使用 UML 建模时，只有外部角色可以建模为参与者。域内提供域参与者所需的域服务的人和物可以从域本身的角度建模为对象。在一个基本模型中，ATM 和出纳员都为称为银行客户的参与者提供银行服务。后来，作为域内对象的工作者本身成为构成应用程序的参与者的主要候选人。产品。

In modeling with the UML, only external roles can be modeled as actors. People and things within a domain that provide the domain services required by a domain actor can be modeled as objects from the perspective of the domain itself. In an essential model, both an ATM and a teller provide banking services to an actor called Bank Customer. Later on, workers as objects within the domain themselves become prime candidates for actors of the application that constitutes the product.

6.7 待定模型

6.7 TOBE MODEL

问题

PROBLEM

如何记录有关域应如何工作的重要信息。

How to document important information about the way the domain should work.

语境

CONTEXT

域的基本模型可用。

An essential model of the domain is available.

军队

FORCES

  • 产品需求需要可追溯到领域的理想化状态。

  • Product requirements need to be traceable to an idealized state of the domain.

  • 域的理想化状态应该反映基本模型。

  • The idealized state of the domain should reflect the essential model.

  • 领域愿景是战略性的。

  • Domain visioning is strategic.

  • 在域级别可能需要重新设计。

  • Re-engineering may be necessary at the domain level.

  • 愿景需要被锚定。

  • Visioning needs to be anchored.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

解决方案

SOLUTION

在开发基本领域模型之后做一个 ToBe 模型。ToBe 模型改进了基本领域模型，以突出反映应该如何做事的共同愿景的实践。它应该专门针对 AsIs 模型中确定的问题确定潜在的有远见的解决方案。与 AsIs 模型一样，基本的业务用例可能会被扩展和详细化，而初步的业务对象模型可能有远见的对象。但是，请避免不必要的细节，并且不要包括任何不会为机会或产品需求分析增加价值的用例，避免使用行话、市场术语或理念。模式或反模式可用于压缩需要额外突出显示和讨论的特定和重复元素。

Do a ToBe model after developing the essential domain model. The ToBe model refines the essential domain model to highlight practices that reflect a common vision of how things should be done. It should specifically identify potential visionary solutions to problems identified in the AsIs model. As with the AsIs model, the essential business use cases may be extended and detailed, and the preliminary Business Object model may have visionary objects. Avoid unnecessary detailing, however, and do not include any use cases that don't add value to the analysis of either opportunities or product requirementsavoid jargon, market-speak, or philosophy. Patterns or anti-patterns can be used to compress specific and repeating elements that need additional highlighting and discussion.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

记录了可追溯到领域的基本模型的领域愿景。产品愿景和要求应可追溯到该愿景。ToBe 模型扩展了基本模型并且可以直接追溯到它。以用户可以理解的方式探讨危险信号情况。重新设计的机会被强调。注意：如果基本模型捕获领域的关键底层元素，并且如果突出当前问题的 AsIs 模型表明需要改进而不是重新设计，则 ToBe 模型不需要很大。

A domain vision is documented that is traceable to the essential model of the domain. The product vision and requirements should be traceable to this vision. The ToBe model extends the essential model and is directly traceable to it. Red flag situations are explored in terms that are understandable to the user. Opportunities for re-engineering are highlighted. Note: the ToBe model does not need to be large if the essential model captures the critical underlying elements of the domain and if the AsIs model that highlights current problems indicates that improvement rather than re-engineering is needed.

讨论

DISCUSSION

传统的系统分析和业务再造的重点是首先了解组织的现状，然后制定理想的愿景作为替代。然而，由于执行 AsIs 模型耗尽了时间和资源，管理层经常会缩短 ToBe 愿景的建模，加强由 AsIs 模型中“做事方式”构成的快速解决方案。无论如何，两个独立模型（AsIs 和 ToBe 模型）的存在会给维护带来问题并阻碍可追溯性。

Traditional systems analysis and business re-engineering have focused on understanding the current situation in an organization as a first step, followed by the development of an ideal vision as a replacement. Frequently, however, because of the time and resources depleted doing the AsIs model, management cuts short the modeling of the ToBe vision, reinforcing the quick solutions framed by "the way things are done" in the AsIs model. Regardless, the existence of two separate models (the AsIs and the ToBe models) creates problems for maintenance and impedes traceability.

6.8 ASIS模型

6.8 ASIS MODEL

问题

PROBLEM

如何记录有关该域当前工作的重要信息。

How to document important information about the domain as it currently works.

语境

CONTEXT

域的基本模型可用。

An essential model of the domain is available.

军队

FORCES

  • 问题和机会可能需要追溯到领域的当前状态。

  • Problems and opportunities may need to be traceable to the current state of the domain.

  • 域的当前状态应该反映基本模型。

  • The current state of the domain should reflect the essential model.

  • 专注于“做事的方式”可能会妨碍对领域的基本方面的清晰理解。

  • Focusing on "the way things are done" can impede a clear understanding of the essential aspects of a domain.

  • 在域级别可能需要重新设计。

  • Re-engineering may be necessary at the domain level.

  • 实现细节可能有问题。

  • Implementation details may be problematic.

解决方案

SOLUTION

在开发基本领域模型之后做一个 AsIs 模型。通过这种方式，AsIs 模型改进了基本领域模型以突出当前实践。例如，基本业务用例可能会被扩展和详细化，初步的业务对象模型可能会添加当前正在使用的特定对象（例如，纸质文档）。但是，请避免不必要的细节，并且不要包括任何不会为问题和机会分析增加价值的用例。模式或反模式可用于压缩需要额外突出显示和讨论的特定和重复元素。

Do an AsIs model after developing the essential domain model. This way, an AsIs model refines the essential domain model to highlight current practices. For example, the essential business use cases may be extended and detailed, and the preliminary Business Object model may have specific objects added that are currently in use (for example, paper documents). Avoid unnecessary detailing, however, and do not include any use cases that don't add value to the analysis of problems and opportunities. Patterns or anti-patterns can be used to compress specific and repeating elements that need additional highlighting and discussion.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

当前问题的根源被建模以扩展基本模型，并直接追溯到它。红旗情况是可见的，并以用户可以理解的方式进行解释。重新设计的机会被强调。

Sources of current problems are modeled to extend the essential model and is directly traceable to it. Red flag situations are made visible and explained in terms that are understandable to the user. Opportunities for re-engineering are highlighted.

讨论

DISCUSSION

传统的系统分析和业务再造的重点是首先了解组织的现状，然后制定理想的愿景作为替代。然而，通常情况下，将重点放在对当前情况进行建模既过于昂贵（在时间和资源上）又具有误导性，这会鼓励以“做事的方式”为框架的快速解决方案。此外，两个独立模型（AsIs 和 ToBe 模型）的存在给维护带来了问题并阻碍了可追溯性。通过从基本模型开始并仅添加查明问题和机会所需的那些改进，AsIs 模型可以帮助围绕重新设计和重构需求集中讨论。但是请注意，AsIs 用例不是要求。

Traditional systems analysis and business re-engineering have focused on understanding the current situation in an organization as a first step, followed by the development of an ideal vision as a replacement. Frequently, however, the focus on modeling the current situation turns out to be both overly expensive (in time and resources) and misleading, which encourages quick solutions framed by "the way things are done." Also, the existence of two separate models (the AsIs and the ToBe models) creates problems for maintenance and impedes traceability. By starting from the essential model and adding only those refinements needed to pinpoint problems and opportunities, an AsIs model can help focus discussion around re-engineering and refactoring requirements. Note, however, that AsIs use cases are not requirements.

概括

Summary

在本章中，我探讨了如何以简单的方式使用用例、参与者和对象（或更准确地说，类型）的基本 UML 构造来捕获域的关键方面。正确建模领域是成功建模系统的第一步。

In this chapter, I've explored how the basic UML constructs of use cases, actors, and objects (or more properly, types) can be used in a simple fashion to capture the critical aspects of a domain. Modeling the domain properly is the first step to modeling a system successfully.

我在这里使用的领域定义可以构成应用领域概念的基础，超越领域工程中术语的原始狭义技术含义。同时，它允许开发人员利用领域分析带到前沿的一些见解和技术：特别是，共性和可变性的概念作为从一开始就考虑重用的基础，以及处理的想法应用程序作为一个家庭的潜在一部分。

The definition of domain I've used here can form the basis for applying the idea of domain beyond the original narrow technical meanings of the term found in domain engineering. At the same time, it allows the developer to leverage some of the insights and techniques that domain analysis brought to the forefront: in particular, the notions of commonality and variability as a basis for thinking about reuse from the start, and the idea of treating applications as potentially part of a family.

使用 UML 的域建模与作为业务流程改进的一部分进行的业务建模明显不同，避免了与流程顾问之间偶尔会破坏业务分析的混乱和地盘争夺战。同样，来自流程改进领域的想法可以有效地用于查看域，即使用 ToBe 和 AsIs 模型来帮助集中理解用户需要（和想要）的内容。

Domain modeling using the UML is a visibly different activity from the business modeling done as part of business process improvement, avoiding the confusion and turf wars with process consultants that occasionally mar business analysis. Again, ideas from the process improvement world can be usefully appropriated in looking at domainsnamely, the use of ToBe and AsIs models to help focus the understanding of what the user needs (and wants).

尽管它们可能重叠，但业务和领域是不同的；软件密集型系统开发人员感兴趣的是领域，而不是业务。在对超出业务边界的系统进行初步思考时，这一点尤为关键，例如对供应链管理的支持。

Although they may overlap, a business and a domain are different; it's the domain, not the business, that is of interest to the software-intensive system developer. This point is particularly critical when doing the preliminary thinking about systems that go beyond the boundaries of the business, such as support for supply chain management.

除了复兴领域本身的思想并为业务建模的各个方面提供新的归宿之外，领域模型（如本章所述）还强调了系统中另一个备受推崇的思想的必要性：用于分析的基本模型。在以架构为中心的迭代开发过程中，在理解问题空间时保持独立于实现的视角变得更加重要，这会在早期引起架构决策。开发参与者、用例甚至业务对象的基本视图有助于平衡规模，避免基于现有情况过于短视的架构。

Aside from reviving the idea of domains itself and providing a new home for aspects of business modeling, domain models, as described in this chapter, emphasize the need for another well-respected idea in systems: essential modelsfor analysis. Maintaining an implementation-independent perspective in understanding the problem space becomes even more important in an iterative and architecture-centric development process, which gives rise to architectural decision-making early on. Developing essential views of actors, use cases, and even business objects helps balance the scales in avoiding an architecture that is too shortsightedly based on existing circumstances.

有许多资源可用于进一步探索这些想法，作为增强您对 UML 的使用的一种方式。Software Reuse: Architecture, Process and Organization for Business Success (Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson 1997) 对领域工程进行了很好的讨论，并提供了一个批判性的观点，只是略微偏向于特定的开发过程。卡内基梅隆大学软件工程研究所 (SEI) 在其网站 ( http://www.sei.cmu.edu ) 上有许多关于领域工程的重要论文。Jim Coplien 的书，Multi-Paradigm Design Using C ++ (1998a)，对域有一个有趣的倾向，它是我定义的基础。

There are a number of resources available for exploring these ideas further, as a way of enhancing your use of the UML. Software Reuse: Architecture, Process and Organization for Business Success(Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson 1997) provides a good discussion of domain engineering and a critical perspective that is only slightly skewed by a bias toward a particular development process. The Software Engineering Institute (SEI) at Carnegie-Mellon University has a number of important papers about domain engineering on its Web site (http://www.sei.cmu.edu). Jim Coplien's book, Multi-Paradigm Design Using C++ (1998a), has an interesting slant on domains and is the basis for my definition.

从 IT 的角度来看，目前唯一值得一读的关于业务建模的书籍是 D'Souza 和 Wills 的Objects, Components and Frameworks with the UML: The Catalysis Approach (1998)。它特别有用，因为它包含有关业务建模的模式，其中许多模式在我此处包含的模式中发挥了作用。D'Souza 的模式是模式文献中唯一真正对业务建模有用的模式。

From an IT perspective, the only current book worth reading about business modeling is D'Souza and Wills' Objects, Components and Frameworks with the UML: The Catalysis Approach (1998). It is especially useful because of the patterns it includes about business modeling, many of which had a role in the patterns I include here. D'Souza's patterns are the only really useful ones on business modeling in the patterns literature.

最后，任何对本质模型感兴趣的人都应该看看 McMenamin 和 Palmer 的经典著作《本质系统分析》（Essential Systems Analysis，1984 年）。它不仅是关于本质思考的最佳著作，而且它对基于事件的分析（用例的前身）的讨论也是无价的。

Finally, anyone interested in essential models should take a look at McMenamin and Palmer's classic Essential Systems Analysis (1984). Not only is it the best work on thinking essentially, but it is also invaluable for its discussion of event-based analysisthe precursor to use cases.

第 7 章产品模式

Chapter 7. Product Patterns

目录

Catalogue

7.1可管理产品

7.2产品利益相关者是模范客户

7.3上下文中的产品事件

7.4用例代表需求

7.5边界控制实体（BCE）

7.6轻松消化产品块

7.7产品跟踪支持稳健性

7.8用例：作为包工作

7.9测试需要模型

7.10配置管理模型

7.1 Manageable Product

7.2 Product Stakeholders Are Model Clients

7.3 Product Events in Context

7.4 Use Cases Represent Requirements

7.5 Boundary-Control-Entity (BCE)

7.6 Product Chunks Digest Easily

7.7 Product Traces Support Robustness

7.8 Use Cases: Work as Packages

7.9 Tests Need Models

7.10 Configuration Management Model

语境

Context

产品为这种语言中的模式提供了二级结构。产品是软件密集型系统开发的最终结果，打包为一个单元，例如应用程序、实用程序或工作流。产品组织软件开发的工件以供交付和管理，而项目管理工作。

Products provide the second level of structure for patterns within this language. A product is the end result of software-intensive systems development packaged as a unit, such as an application, a utility, or a workflow. Products organize the artifacts of software development for delivery and management while projects manage the work.

回到过去，软件开发项目是漫长而一心一意的，专注于“推出”尽可能完整的应用程序。维护是为了增强功能和修复缺陷。最终的结果是永远服役；应用程序不仅在功能上是单一的，而且它们似乎天生就是完整的，并且永远存在。

Back in the old days, software-development projects were long and single-minded, focused on getting an application that was as complete as possible "out the door." Maintenance was for enhancements and fixing defects. The end result was to be in service forever; not only were applications functionally monolithic, but they were seemingly born whole and lived forever.

UML 专门设计用于支持替代方法：迭代和增量开发，结合​​增量和演化部署。但是，为了利用与这种较新的开发方法相关的好处，需要一种组织机制。该机制为管理需求、协调工作和重用、控制版本、打包发布以及支持公司 IT 资产所需的所有其他管理和规划活动提供了持续的基础。

The UML is especially designed to support an alternative approach: iterative and incremental development, combined with incremental and evolutionary deployment. But, in order to leverage the benefits associated with this newer development approach, an organizing mechanism is required. This mechanism provides an ongoing basis for managing requirements, coordinating work and reuse, controlling versions, packaging releases, and all the other management and planning activities required to support corporate IT assets.

在给定的领域内，产品是对一组需求的完整解决方案，包括解决方案生命周期内的所有管理需求。构成产品的工件包括用于开发和维护它的所有模型。

Within a given domain, products are the complete solution to a set of requirements, including all the management needs over the life of the solution. The artifacts that comprise a product include all the models used to develop and maintain it.

军队

Forces

  • 模型抽象复杂性。

  • Models abstract complexity.

  • 模型是可管理的。

  • Models are manageable.

  • 模型代理有形性。

  • Models proxy tangibility.

  • 信息技术不是有形的，而是（相反）可操作的。

  • Information technology isn't tangible, but is (instead) operational.

  • 信息技术具有战术性和战略性，也具有操作性。

  • Information technology is tactical and strategic, as well as operational.

  • 信息技术是一种资产，而不仅仅是一种支出。

  • Information technology is an asset, not just an expense.

  • 信息技术是企业资产。

  • Information technology is a corporate asset.

  • 资产有生命。

  • Assets have lives.

  • 资产应该被拥有和管理，以及被建造和支持。

  • Assets should be owned and managed, as well as built and supported.

  • 资产管理会有所不同，具体取决于产品所处的生命周期阶段。

  • Asset management will vary, depending on the lifecycle stage the product is in.

  • 在产品的整个生命周期中，所有权应该是一致的和可识别的。

  • Ownership should be consistent and identifiable throughout the product's life.

讨论

Discussion

长期以来，产品设计和开发一直是软件开发之外的一门定义明确的学科。然而，将内部开发的系统视为组织内部产品的想法最近才开始作为管理公司发展的一种方式出现。最近，Microsoft 等组织和 Brian Henderson-Sellers 等面向对象方法学家已经认识到需要通过以下方式组织开发 产品（最终结果），而不是只关注项目（工作本身）。

Product design and development has long been a well-defined discipline outside of software development. However, the idea of treating internally developed systems as products within organizations has only recently started to emerge as a way of managing corporate development. Recently, organizations such as Microsoft and object-oriented methodologists such as Brian Henderson-Sellers have recognized the need to organize development by product (the end result), rather than just focusing on projects (the work itself).

微软解决方案框架(MSF) 特别有趣。MSF 是 Microsoft 公开可用的开发过程，它是 Rational 统一过程和 Catalysis 的替代品，用于开发基于组件的系统。它结合了许多可以被认为是 UML 友好的特性，包括对体系结构的强调、使用小团队进行开发、迭代和增量开发周期，当然还有作为基石的产品（详情见http : / /www.oteam.com/msf）。

The Microsoft Solution Framework (MSF) is particularly interesting. MSF is Microsoft's publicly available development processits alternative to Rational's Unified Process and Catalysis for developing component-based systems. It incorporates a number of features that can be considered UML-friendly, including an emphasis on architecture, the use of small teams for development, an iterative and incremental development cycle, and, of course, product as a cornerstone (details at http://www.oteam.com/msf).

模型是产品的一个关键元素，它是打包软件密集型系统以增强其长期管理的连贯方式。它们不再仅仅是系统部署后的存档；相反，它们成为在系统作为产品的整个生命周期中管理和发展系统的基础。

Models are a critical element of product as a coherent way of packaging software-intensive systems to enhance their long-term management. They are no longer merely archival after a system is deployed; instead, they become the basis for managing and evolving a system throughout its life as a product.

我在讨论产品在第 10 章“上下文中的 UML”中更深入。

I discuss product in more depth in Chapter 10, "The UML in Context."

7.1 可管理产品

7.1 MANAGABLE PRODUCT

问题

PROBLEM

如何确保开发工作的最终结果是可管理的、适当的和可持续的。

How to ensure that the end result of a development effort is manageable, appropriate, and sustainable.

语境

CONTEXT

使用 UML 进行规划和管理。

Planning and managing using the UML.

军队

FORCES

  • 可以从管理角度对产品进行建模

  • Products can be modeled from a management perspective

  • 建模必须支持管理和工程。

  • Modeling must support management as well as engineering.

  • 项目有一组预定义的边界——范围边界和时间边界。

  • Projects have a predefined set of boundariesboth scope boundaries and time boundaries.

  • 一个软件的生命周期比创建或维护它的任何单个项目都要长。

  • The life of a piece of software is longer than any of the individual projects that create or maintain it.

  • 软件是一种组织资产，需要作为资产进行管理。

  • Software is an organizational asset that needs to be managed as an asset.

  • 软件开发的管理需要比项目更广阔的视野和更长的时间框架。软件为正在发生和变化的业务和技术问题提供解决方案。

  • The management of software development needs a broader perspective and longer timeframe than a project. Software provides solutions to business and technical problems that are ongoing and changing.

  • 冗余和重复的项目和烟囱系统可能是由于项目概念化和规划的重点过于狭窄或狭隘地反映了组织的记忆。

  • Redundant and duplicate projects and stovepipe systems can result from project conceptualization and planning with too narrow a focus or that narrowly reflects the memory of an organization.

解决方案

SOLUTION

专注于正在开发的产品，而不是产品模型作为开发和管理的支点。从整体上确定产品的要求。将整体解决方案建模为具有自己的生命周期（从出生到死亡）的产品。

Focus on the product being developed, not the Make the product model the fulcrum for development and management. Identify the requirements for the product as a whole. Model the overall solution as a product with a lifecycle of its own, from birth to death.

从一个产品定义开始，该定义捕获解决方案的想法，而不受日期和时间表的限制。将产品集成到共享服务的域框架中。除了可能需要的任何开发项目之外，定义产品本身的管理方式。确定产品的要求和指标。建立一套结束产品寿命的标准。

Start with a product definition that captures the idea of the solution without being constrained by dates and schedules. Integrate the product within a domain framework of shared services. Define how the product itself will be managed, apart from any development projects that may be required. Identify requirements and metrics with the product. Establish a set of criteria for ending the product life.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

管理开发和开发结果的总体框架，与客户和业务管理的需求相一致，而不仅仅是技术人员的关注点和项目经理的优先级。

An overall framework for managing development and the results of development that aligns with the needs of customers and business management, rather than just the concerns of technical staff and the priorities of project managers.

讨论

DISCUSSION

这是解释为什么模型很重要，而不是如何建模的模式之一。

This is one of those patterns that explains why models are important, rather than how to model.

开发的项目重点强调解决眼前的问题并在最后期限前完成。项目管理的重点是解决与在项目规划确定的时间范围和范围内提供一组切实的最终结果相关的项目问题。

A project focus for development emphasizes solving immediate problems and meeting a deadline. Project management has a narrow focussolving project problems associated with providing a set of tangible end results within the timeframe and scope established by project planning.

要使软件产品得到有效管理、主动规划并提供持续价值，就需要对其进行持续管理。基于产品的方法允许软件的关键组件在单个项目（尤其是需求和质量度量）持续时间之外进行管理，并允许在更有用的情况下获取经验形式。

For a software product to be managed effectively, to be planned proactively, and to provide ongoing value, it needs to be continually managed. A product-based approach allows key components of software to be managed beyond the duration of individual projects (especially requirements and quality measures), and allows for capturingexperience in a more useful form.

7.2 产品利益相关者是模范客户

7.2 PRODUCT STAKEHOLDERS ARE MODEL CLIENTS

问题

PROBLEM

如何使用产品模型帮助管理产品。

How to help manage a product using a product model.

语境

CONTEXT

确定关键参与者在产品有组织的生命周期中的角色。

Identifying the roles of key players in the organized life of a product.

军队

FORCES

  • 产品是域的一部分。

  • Products are part of a domain.

  • 必须计划和管理产品。

  • Products must be planned and managed.

  • 产品经过组织和设计。

  • Products are organized as well as engineered.

  • 如果要计划和管理产品，则必须定义产品组织。

  • The product organization must be defined if the product is to be planned and managed.

  • 利益相关者有一个角色，就像用户一样（利益相关者是领域中的参与者）。

  • Stakeholders have a role, just as users do (stakeholders are actors in the domain).

  • 产品对利益相关者负有责任。

  • The product has responsibilities to stakeholders.

  • 利益相关者对产品负有责任。

  • Stakeholders have responsibilities to the product.

  • 合同规定了相互的责任。

  • Contracts define mutual responsibilities.

  • 组织是一种架构抽象。模型代表抽象。组织是模型。

  • Organization is an architected abstraction. Models represent abstractions. Organizations are models.

解决方案

SOLUTION

使用 UML 捕获使产品随着时间的推移可管理所需的组织模型。该模型可以替代组织结构图，也可以对其进行补充，具体取决于组织结构图反映工作和职位而非角色的程度。

Use the UML to capture the organization model needed to make the product manageable over time. This model can be an alternative to an organizational chart or can complement it, depending on the extent to which the organization chart reflects jobs and positions, rather than roles.

组织模型应该反映角色，而不是工作或职位。这是定义产品的一个关键方面，也是另一种类型的上下文图。尤其要确定利益相关者及其角色。利益相关者与产品的关系比产品所有者更普遍。一些利益相关者是产品所有者（控制使持续开发成为可能的资金的人）。有些提供其他资源（例如，网络带宽、处理时间或支持人员）。

The organization model should reflect roles, not jobs or positions. This is a critical aspect of defining a product, and is another type of context diagram. In particular, identify stakeholders and their roles. A stakeholder has a more general relationship to a product than the product owner(s). Some stakeholders are product owners (the people who control the money that makes ongoing development possible). Some provide other resources (for example, network bandwidth, processing time, or support staff).

可以为利益相关者识别和绘制各种产品职责。应该预先了解的典型职责包括“建议”（保持知情）和“同意”（批准），以及传统的“提供资源”。当然，责任类型的范围可能比这更细微，但需要将责任范围纳入对组织文化和政治以及组织架构有意义的类型中。

A variety of product responsibilities can be identified and diagrammed for stakeholders. Typical responsibilities that should be understood up front include "advise" (keep informed) and "consent" (approve), as well as the traditional "provide resources." The range of responsibility types may be more nuanced than this, of course, but the range of responsibilities needs to be factored into types that make sense for the organizational culture and politics, as well as for the organizational architecture.

当然，组织模型还应该确定开发团队的角色。但是，请记住，此模型的客户是利益相关者，而不是用户，也不是工人。实际上，您正在创建组织的架构视图以提供管理上下文。

The organization model should also, of course, identify the development team roles. However, remember that the client for this model is the stakeholdersnot the users and not the workers. In effect, you're creating an architectural view of the organization to provide management context.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

涉众可以轻松地查看和验证产品的组织架构，并且它以与其他产品管理工件一致的方式呈现。

The stakeholders can see and validate the organization architecture for the product easily, and it is presented in a fashion that is consistent with the other product management artifacts.

讨论

DISCUSSION

Ivar Jacobson 在统一软件开发过程中解决了组织建模的更大问题（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1999a）。UML 的业务建模配置文件反映了对组织进行建模的统一过程方法，提供了一组有助于使用 UML 描述组织架构的扩展。David Taylor 在使用对象技术的业务工程中提供了一个非 UML 的视角来建模组织作为开发业务系统（和重新设计业务）的一部分 （泰勒 1995）。

Ivar Jacobson addresses the larger issues of modeling an organization in The Unified Software Development Process (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a). The UML's business modeling profile reflects the unified process approach of modeling an organizationproviding a set of extensions that facilitate using the UML in describing organizational architecture. David Taylor provides a non-UML perspective on modeling an organization as part of developing business systems (and re-engineering business) in Business Engineering with Object Technology (Taylor 1995).

7.3 上下文中的产品事件

7.3 PRODUCT EVENTS IN CONTEXT

问题

PROBLEM

如何确定范围并绑定产品。

How to scope and bound the product.

语境

CONTEXT

规划产品和开发工作。

Planning the product and the development effort.

军队

FORCES

  • 产品是域的一部分。

  • Products are part of a domain.

  • 产品提供的服务必须明确定义。

  • Products provide services that must be clearly defined.

  • 产品必须与其客户签订合同。

  • A product must have a contract with its customers.

  • 服务必须有用户。

  • Services must have users.

  • 必须计划和管理产品。

  • Products must be planned and managed.

  • 开发工作必须有范围。

  • Development work must be scoped.

  • 范围和边界可能是难以捉摸和多变的。

  • Scope and boundaries can be elusive and changeable.

  • 工作产品必须是可追溯的。

  • Work products must be traceable.

解决方案

SOLUTION

创建上下文图作为产品与外界交互的模型。这可以采取将产品作为一个包进行黑盒化的形式，附加系统的参与者并注释他们的交互（见图7.1）

Create a context diagram as a model of the product's interaction with the outside world. This can take the form of black-boxing the product as a package, with the system's actors attached and their interactions annotated (see Figure 7.1)

图 7.1。一个简单的上下文图。
.

在域模型中建模的工作人员和外部系统提供了一个起点。还包括将与系统交互的任何业务参与者。在某些情况下，客户可以直接与系统交互。在其他情况下，域模型中的业务交互可能由与产品交互的工作对象来调解。注释参与者以记录对产品至关重要的用户角色、交互和关键业务抽象。

The workers and external systems modeled in the domain model provide a starting point. Any business actors that will interact with the system are also included. In some cases, customers may interact directly with the system. In other cases, a business interaction in the domain model may be mediated by a worker object interacting with the product. Annotate the actors to document the user roles, interactions, and key business abstractions that are central to the product.

每个交互都应该作为一个事件进行解释——它应该由相关参与者的一个动作触发，并且应该由系统完成。确保它是有形的并为演员提供价值。

Each interaction should be explainable as an eventit should be triggered by an action on the part of the actor involved, and it should be completed by the system. Make sure that it's tangible and provides value for the actor.

Desmond D'Souza 和 Wills 在他们的书 (1998, 592) 中提供了一种对系统上下文进行建模的综合方法。催化方法扩展了协作的概念，利用各种 UML 工件来详细说明上下文动态，并使用包和参与者来定义边界。

Desmond D'Souza and Wills provide a comprehensive approach to modeling a system's context in their book (1998, 592). The Catalysis Approach extends the notion of collaborations, makes use of a variety of UML artifacts to detail the context dynamics, and uses packages and actors to define the boundaries.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

管理层可以很容易地看到产品的边界和范围，这对他们来说是有意义的。开发团队可以理解产品必须满足的业务契约。

Management can see the boundaries and scope of the product easily, in terms that are meaningful to them. The development team can understand the business contract that the product must meet.

讨论

DISCUSSION

上下文图是系统开发领域中古老而受人尊敬的工具。尽管从未以所有人都同意的方式形式化，但建立环境和与外部世界的关键交互（以及与外部世界的边界）的图表类型的需求正在建模中运行。包和参与者，以及用例和业务对象提供了一个 UML 等效于数据/过程建模“单一气泡”，它将应用程序封装在内部并位于外部世界外部。

Context diagrams are old and honorable tools in the arena of systems development. Although never formalized in a way agreeable to all, the need for a diagram type that establishes the environment and key interactions with the outside world (and the boundaries with that outside world) are running themes in modeling. Packages and actors, and use cases and business objects provide a UML equivalent to the data/process modeling "single bubble" that encapsulated the application inside and situated the outside world outside.

7.4 用例代表需求

7.4 USE CASES REPRESENT REQUIREMENTS

问题

PROBLEM

如何以对产品用户有意义且对产品开发人员有效的方式记录产品需求。

How to document product requirements in a way that is meaningful to the product user and efficient for the product developer.

语境

CONTEXT

域内不断发展的产品，使用 UML 建模。

An evolving product within a domain, modeled by using the UML.

军队

FORCES

  • 需求是基本的，为任何开发活动提供了理由。

  • Requirements are fundamental and provide the justification for any development activity.

  • 需要组织和管理需求。

  • Requirements need to be organized and managed.
