  • 产品进化需要稳健（即能够以可管理的方式整合变化）。

  • Product evolution needs to be robust (that is, able to incorporate change in a managed fashion).

  • 产品管理需要能够组织开发工作。

  • Product management needs to be able to organize development work.

  • 在理想情况下，更改不应导致返工或扭曲产品提供的解决方案。

  • In an ideal world, changes should not cause rework or distort the solution provided by the product.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

解决方案

SOLUTION

以用例的形式记录产品的业务需求。如果您正在使用需求管理工具，请将各个详细需求映射到实现它们的用例，但将用例用作计划工作和增量的组织结构。初步分析期间确定的所有需求都应映射到一个或多个用例。未映射到任何用例的需求可能定义不当或多余。

Document your product's business requirements in the form of use cases. If you're using a requirements management tool, map the individual detailed requirements to the use case(s) that realize them, but use the use cases as your organizing structure for planning work and increments. All requirements identified during preliminary analysis should map to one or more use cases. Requirements that don't map to any use cases may be badly defined or redundant.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

一个连贯的、有组织的业务需求模型，可以为组织工作和规划产品增量（产品生命周期）提供一个起点，以直观的图形和文本的形式。

A coherent organized model of the business requirements that can provide a starting point for organizing work and planning product increments (the product lifecycle) in a visually graphic and textually straightforward form.

讨论

DISCUSSION

对于此模式，要记住用例的重要方面是它们代表与产品的交互，并且交互为用户提供附加值。通过以图形和文本方式呈现交互并确保每个交互确实提供价值，使产品需求变得明确。用例提供了一个框架，用于打包和管理对用户有意义并且对开发人员和规划人员都有益的需求。

For this pattern, the important aspects of use cases to remember are that they represent an interaction with the product, and that the interaction provides added value to the user. The product requirements are made explicit by rendering the interactions pictorially and textually, and ensuring that each interaction does provide value. Use cases provide a framework for packaging and managing requirements that are meaningful to the user and beneficial to both the developer and planner.

同样重要的是要记住，用例不会详细说明产生结果的底层过程或算法。它们不是过程模型，过程模型是规范工件而不是分析工件。

It is also important to remember that use cases do not detail the howthe underlying processes or algorithms that produce the results. They are not process models, which are specification artifacts rather than analysis artifacts.

正确定义的用例模型是与用户签订的合同，其中详细说明了用户将提供什么产品。

A properly defined use case model is a contract with the user that spells out what will be provided by the product.

7.5 边界控制实体 (BCE)

7.5 BOUNDARY-CONTROL-ENTITY (BCE)

问题

PROBLEM

如何组织初始对象列表，以便于进一步分析、设计和实施。

How to organize the initial list of objects to facilitate further analysis, design, and implementation.

语境

CONTEXT

分析产生了一组初步的用例，并且已经对这些用例进行了审查以确定候选对象列表。

Analysis has produced a preliminary set of use cases, and these have been reviewed to identify a candidate list of objects.

军队

FORCES

  • 所有的对象都不相同。

  • All objects are not alike.

  • 并非所有对象都是平等的。

  • All objects are not equal.

  • 不同类型的对象具有特征性的行为和职责。

  • Different types of objects have characteristic behaviors and responsibilities.

  • 分析需要有重点。

  • Analysis needs to be focused.

  • 界限需要明确。

  • Boundaries need to be clear.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将每个分析对象刻板化为边界对象、控制对象或实体对象，以提供每个分析对象在被分析域中扮演的角色的逻辑视图（见图 7.2 ）。边界对象负责系统与其周围环境之间的通信。

Stereotype each analysis object as either a boundary object, a control object, or an entity object to provide a logical view of the roles played by each in the domain being analyzed (see Figure 7.2). A boundary object is responsible for communication between the system and its surroundings.

根据 Jacobson (1994)，每个边界对象应该（理想情况下）只关注与参与者（包括系统多样性）的通信和交互。最初，Jacobson 称它们为“接口对象”，这可能更能表达它们的目的，但接口是一个用词过多的术语。典型示例是 ATM 接口。

According to Jacobson (1994), each boundary object should (ideally) be concerned only with communications and interactions with actors (including the system variety). Originally, Jacobson called them "interface objects," which is probably more expressive of their purpose, but interface is an overworked term. The canonical example is an ATM interface.

控制对象执行与用例关联的所有排序和控制功能。实际上，它充当用例的管理器。控制对象单独负责流程（或系统）内的操作顺序和控制流，不应与参与者交互，也不应关心管理持久性。一个用例应该至少有一个控制对象（尽管它们可以像其他对象一样共享）。

A control object performs all of the sequencing and control functions associated with a use case. In effect, it acts as a manager for a use case. Control objects, being solely responsible for the sequencing of operations and flow of control within a process (or system), should neither interact with the actor nor be concerned with managing persistence. There should be at least one control object for a use case (although they may be shared like the others).

实体对象应该是任何持续时间超过用例生命周期的信息的所在地。在完善您的分析时，重点关注每种类型的具体特征。

Entity objects should be the home for any information that lasts longer than the life of a use case. Focus on the specific characteristics of each type in refining your analysis.

当出现在 UML 模型图中时，边界/控制/实体构造型可以使用标准尖括号符号（<< 和 >>）或 guillemets 来表示。UML 还提供了可用于代替 guillemets 的图形图标。这些适用于在分析模型中使用或不需要有关所表示类的详细信息的情况。当必须显示类详细信息时，在类名隔间中使用文本构造型。小心在图表中一致地使用原型以避免混淆。另外，做不脱离边界/控制/实体原型的语义。

When appearing in diagrams of UML models, the boundary/control/entity stereotypes can be represented by using the standard angled brackets notation (<<and >>) or guillemets. The UML also provides graphical icons that can be used in place of guillemets. These are suitable when used within analysis models or where detailed information about the class that is represented isn't needed. Use the textual stereotype in the class name compartment when class details must be shown. Be careful to use the stereotypes consistently within diagrams to avoid confusion. Also, donot depart from the semantics of the boundary/control/entity stereotypes.

图 7.2。边界控制实体模式作为协作。

图 7.3显示了如何使用类中的 UML 构造型以及使用图形图标来描述边界-控制-实体协作。通过使用一个或另一个来保持一致。

Figure 7.3 shows how the boundary-control-entity collaboration can be depicted with UML stereotypes in the classes as well as by using graphical icons. Be consistent by using one or the other.

图 7.3。BCE 的替代 UML 符号。
结果上下文 一个更精确定义的模型，它在开发周期迭代创建的对象之间建立关系，可用于探索领域的细节。这对于获取用户反馈和验证以及记录类旨在展示的行为类型特别有价值。
讨论

BCE 原型是一种使用可能对用户有用的信息来丰富 UML 模型的简单方法。此外，它与前面的用例分析密切相关，并提供了建立可追溯性的附加方法。

BCE stereotyping is a simple way of enriching UML models with information that may be useful to users. Also, it is closely related to the preceding use case analysis and provides an additional means of establishing traceability.

Jacobson 在他的每本书中都讨论了 BCE 模式，并将其应用于业务用例和系统用例。在对象优势（1995 年）中，他还解释了如何将使用 BCE 模式表达的业务模型转化为定义支持每个业务用例的系统交互的起点。这是在软件中改进的重用（Jacobson、Griss 和 Jonsson 1997）。

Jacobson has discussed the BCE pattern in each of his books, and applied it to both business use cases and system use cases. In The Object Advantage (1995), he also explains how to translate a business model expressed using the BCE pattern into the starting point for defining system interactions that support each business use case. This is refined in Software Reuse (Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson 1997).

7.6 产品块很容易消化

7.6 PRODUCT CHUNKS DIGEST EASILY

问题

PROBLEM

如何范围增量开发产品。

How to scope incremental development of a product.

语境

CONTEXT

规划和管理基于模型的产品。

Planning and managing a model-based product.

军队

FORCES

  • 产品是逐步开发的。

  • A product is incrementally developed.

  • 需求随时间变化。

  • Requirements change over time.

  • 在产品的生命周期中可能会确定新的要求。

  • New requirements may be identified during the life of a product.

  • 用例定义产品需求。

  • Use cases define product requirements.

  • 用例驱动产品规范。

  • Use cases drive product specification.

  • 开发人员通常喜欢成就感。

  • Developers like a feeling of accomplishmentoften.

  • 用户喜欢结果。

  • Users like results.

  • 经理喜欢控制感。

  • Managers like the feeling of control.

解决方案

SOLUTION

以高级系统用例作为规划的基础，规划具有频繁增量发布的短开发周期。每次发布后，重新规划产品生命周期的剩余部分，包括未来增量的优先级和范围（重构剩余部分）。但请记住，用例不会构建产品本身，只有开发工作架构会构建产品。

With high-level system use cases as the basis for planning, plan for short development cycles with frequent incremental releases. After each release, replan the remaining portions of the product life-cycle, including the prioritization and scope of future increments (refactor the remainder). But remember that use cases do not structure the product itself, only the development workarchitecture structures product.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

结构良好的用例，支持在产品的发展和维护中进行最少的返工。

Well-formed use cases that support minimal rework in the evolution and maintenance of a product.

讨论

DISCUSSION

UML 隐含地支持增量和迭代开发风格。Barry Boehm 的螺旋生命周期是最接近于将管理（控制和沟通）需求与现实规划相结合的开发方法的近似值。用例为分块开发工作提供了最合理的方法，以便工作边界对用户有意义并且增量功能可追溯到实际需求。

The UML is implicitly supportive of an incremental and iterative development style. Barry Boehm's spiral lifecycle is the closest approximation available to a development approach that combines the needs of management (control and communication) with realistic planning. Use cases provide the most reasonable approach to chunking development work so that work boundaries are meaningful to the user and incremental functionality is traceable to real requirements.

然而，用例不是架构。因为用例是分析工件而不是设计工件，所以它们提供了与域管理和用户一起工作的通信工具。它们不提供构建产品的方法；产品架构确实那。

However, use cases are not architecture. Because use cases are analysis artifacts and not design artifacts, they provide a communication tool for working with domain management and users. They do not provide a way to structure the product; the product architecture does that.

7.7 产品跟踪支持稳健性

7.7 PRODUCT TRACES SUPPORT ROBUSTNESS

问题

PROBLEM

如何随着产品的发展，确保产品变更始终如一地集成并与产品需求保持一致。

How to ensure that product changes are consistently integrated and aligned with product requirements as the product evolves.

语境

CONTEXT

使用 UML 模型指定、设计和实施的不断发展的产品。

An evolving product specified, designed, and implemented with UML models.

军队

FORCES

  • 产品进化需要稳健（即能够以可管理的方式整合变化）。

  • Product evolution needs to be robust (that is, able to incorporate change in a managed fashion).

  • 随着产品的发展，需要维护产品知识。

  • Product knowledge needs to be maintained as the product evolves.

  • 这些要求是基本的，并为任何开发活动提供了理由。

  • The requirements are fundamental and provide the justification for any development activity.

  • 用例模型要求。

  • Use cases model requirements.

  • 在理想情况下，更改不应导致返工或扭曲产品提供的解决方案。

  • In an ideal world, changes should not cause rework or distort the solution provided by the product.

  • 过多的细节可能会让人眼花缭乱。

  • Too much detail can be blinding.

解决方案

SOLUTION

使用 UML 的 <<traces>> 构造型来突出工件之间的联系，支持在整个产品模型本身内扩展的可追溯性。迹线用于表示不同模型（如分析模型和设计模型）中元素之间的联系；它们在模型中是不允许的。连接可以来自开发和改进，例如从需求到实现（反之亦然），也可以来自版本控制（版本和版本元素之间的跟踪）。

Support extended traceability within the overall product model itself, using the <<traces>>stereotype of the UML to highlight connections between artifacts. Traces are used to denote connections between elements in different models (such as the analysis model and the design model); they are not allowed within a model. The connections can either result from development and refinement, such as from requirement to implementation (and vice versa), or they can result from versioning (traces between versions and version elements).

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

产品模型特别包括以可视化图形形式显示的关键可追溯性信息，可以在出现变更请求或新要求时提供明确的指导。

The product models specifically include key traceability information in a visually graphic form that can provide clear guidance when change requests or new requirements occur.

讨论

DISCUSSION

Jacobson 从早期就在 Objectory 之前的 OOSE 方法中强调了稳健性和可追溯性作为面向对象开发的主要优势。强调可追溯性作为健壮性的一个促成因素是 OOSE 为 UML 提供的贡献之一。

Jacobson emphasized robustness and traceability as key benefits of object-oriented development from early on, in the OOSE methodology that preceded Objectory. And an emphasis on traceability as a contributing factor to robustness was one of the contributions OOSE offered to the UML.

短周期开发和渐进式产品演进的重要性（和成功）日益增加，这使得稳健性和可追溯性成为通过模型进行良好设计和良好管理的关键方面。UML 的其他部分也可以做出贡献（例如，指定接口与实现它的类/组件之间关系的“实现”关联）。

The increasing importance (and successes) of short-cycle development and incremental product evolution make robustness and traceability critical aspects of good designand good management via models. Other parts of the UML can also contribute (for example, the "realizes" association that specifies the relationship between an interface and the class/component that actualizes it).

UML 的优势之一是它的适应性和广度。关键跟踪的图形表示只是整个可跟踪性策略的一部分，该策略包括开发期间的配置管理和可跟踪性数据收集。然而，尽管可追溯性因其对产品质量和可管理性的积极影响而备受青睐，但通过图表过度使用可追溯性会降低其清晰度。UML参考指南建议使用模型元素之间的超链接来识别可追溯性，而不是在模型开发过程中作为人类助手所需的关键链接，作为需要跨模型传播的更改的提醒，例如（Jacobson、Booch 和Rumbaugh 1999b, 494).

One of the strengths of the UML is its adaptability and breadth. A diagrammatic representation of key traces is only part of an overall traceability strategy that includes configuration management and traceability data collection during development. However, although traceability is desirable for its positive impact on product quality and manageability, the overuse of traceability via diagrams can reduce their clarity. The UML Reference Guide suggests using hyperlinks between model elements to identify traceability other than critical links that are needed during model development as human helpers, as reminders of changes that need to be propagated across models, for example (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999b, 494).

7.8 用例：作为包工作

7.8 USE CASES: WORK AS PACKAGES

问题

PROBLEM

如何以有用的方式划分要完成的开发工作。

How to partition the development work to be done in a useful way.

语境

CONTEXT

在增量过程中管理开发。

Managing development in an incremental process.

军队

FORCES

  • 开发工作必须为客户提供可见和可用的结果。

  • Development efforts have to provide visible and usable results for the customer.

  • 增量开发需要轻松集成每个增量。

  • Incremental development requires easy integration of each increment.

  • 工作边界必须对开发人员和用户具有某种意义。

  • Work boundaries must have some meaning to the developer as well as the user.

  • 验收测试模型基于用例。

  • The acceptance-testing model is based on use cases.

  • 工作的粒度会影响规划和进度跟踪的难易程度。

  • Granularity of work impacts ease of planning and progress tracking.

  • 工作产品必须是可追溯的。

  • Work products must be traceable.

解决方案

SOLUTION

根据高级用例定义开发工作单元。打包将一起完成的用例。应分析用例的风险并相应地确定优先级，具体取决于开发方法是风险驱动的还是风险规避的。将发布策略映射到用例包，并通过用例包开发其他工件，例如手册。

Define units of development work according to high-level use cases. Package use cases that will be done together. The use cases should be analyzed for risk and prioritized accordingly, depending on whether the development approach is risk-driven or risk-aversive. Map the release strategy to the use case packaging, and develop other artifacts such as manuals by use case package.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

为客户提供价值的增量，对于开发人员来说是真正的功能块，并且对管理具有有意义的边界。

Increments that provide value to the customer, which are real chunks of functionality for the developer and have meaningful boundaries for management.

讨论

DISCUSSION

尽管 UML 本身并没有强加开发过程，但用例的概念和称为用例驱动开发的策略被编织到它的线程中。（此外，它们是有道理的。）

Although the UML does not, by itself, impose a development process, the notion of use cases and the strategy called use case-driven development are woven into its threads. (And besides, they make sense.)

需求的可追溯性是通过用例，组织测试的最明智的方式是围绕用例。它们提供了一种方便的方式来组织手头的工作，以便与客户和利益相关者进行沟通，以及方便的规划起点。然而，重要的是要记住，正如我在其他地方警告过的那样，作为分析工件，它们不会驱动架构。

Traceability back to requirements is via use cases, and the most sensible way to organize testing is around use cases. They provide a convenient way of organizing the work at hand for communicating with the customers and stakeholders, as well as a convenient starting point for planning. However, it is important to remember, as I've cautioned elsewhere, that as analysis artifacts, they do not drive the architecture.

7.9 测试需要模型

7.9 TESTS NEED MODELS

问题

PROBLEM

如何对齐测试与开发一起确保测试是有重点的、一致的和有意义的。

How to align testing with development to ensure that testing is focused, consistent, and meaningful.

语境

CONTEXT

支持基于模型的产品的生命周期。

Supporting the life of a model-based product.

军队

FORCES

  • 对象交互是复杂的，并且出于实际目的可能是不确定的。

  • Object interactions are complex and may be nondeterministic for practical purposes.

  • 测试应该是可重复的。

  • Testing should be repeatable.

  • 需要计划和设计测试。

  • Testing needs to be planned and designed.

  • 测试需要反映产品的目的和目标。

  • Testing needs to reflect the purpose and objectives of the product.

  • 用户需要基于需求的测试。

  • Users need requirements-based testing.

  • 设计师需要架构测试。

  • Designers need architected testing.

  • 开发人员需要详细的测试。

  • Developers need detailed testing.

  • 管理者需要安慰。

  • Managers need reassurance.

  • 测试资产的创建和维护成本很高。

  • Testing assets are expensive to create and maintain.

  • 测试资产可以重构和重用。

  • Testing assets can be refactored and reused.

  • 测试是昂贵的。

  • Testing is expensive.

  • 测试应该向所有人提供关闭，包括用户和利益相关者。

  • Testing should provide closure to all, including users and stakeholders.

解决方案

SOLUTION

构建一个与产品模型平行并重构的测试模型。例如，用户验收测试应该围绕用户验证的用例构建，基于为验证需求本身而开发的场景。

Fabricate a test model that parallels and refactors the product model. For example, user acceptance testing should be built around the use cases validated by the users, based on scenarios developed to validate the requirements themselves.

这些场景也可以用于可用性测试，并作为自动化压力测试的基础。

These scenarios can also be used for usability testing and as a basis for automated stress testing.

以与管理其他模型相同的方式管理产品测试模型的生命周期。

Manage the life of the test model for a product in the same way that the other models are managed.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

在整个产品生命周期以及开发生命周期的迭代中管理产品测试的基础。

A basis for managing product testing throughout the product lifecycle, as well as iterations of the development lifecycle.

讨论

DISCUSSION

测试不是一个阶段，而是一个持续的活动。与架构化和模型驱动过程的任何方面一样，测试需要基于与为产品的其他视图开发的模型一致的模型，但根据模型客户的特定需求和观点进行区分在这种情况下，测试员。

Testing is not a stage, but rather an ongoing activity. As with any aspect of an architected and model-driven process, testing needs to be based on models that are consistent with models developed for other views of the product, but differentiated according to the specific needs and perspective of the model clientin this case, the tester.

因为基于 UML 的建模的底层过程是由用例驱动的，并且因为用例提供了可追溯性和与最终用户的重要沟通的基础，所以产品的测试模型应该从它包含的用例中派生出来。

Because the underlying process for UML-based modeling is driven by use cases, and because use cases provide the basis for traceability and significant communication with the end user, the test model for a product should be derived from the use cases it includes.

这种方法还提供了一种关闭方式，因为每个版本的验收测试将基于从用例模型派生的初始场景，关闭循环验证。

This approach also provides a means of closure because the acceptance testing for each release will be based on the initial scenarios derived from the use case model, closing the loop of validation.

7.10 配置管理模型

7.10 CONFIGURATION MANAGEMENT MODEL

问题

PROBLEM

如何组织并在架构环境中控制可变模型。

How to organize and control changeable models in an architected environment.

语境

CONTEXT

随着时间的推移管理产品模型，更一般地说，以一致和统一的方式应用 UML。（注意：这是一种模式，表示我们对一切都使用模型。）

Managing product models over time and, more generally, applying the UML in a consistent and uniform fashion. (Note: this is a pattern that says we use models for everything.)

军队

FORCES

  • 产品需要包装。

  • Products need to be packaged.

  • 产品不断发展，因此需要及时分段包装。

  • Products evolve and so need to be packaged at slices in time.

  • 产品的好坏取决于它的架构。

  • A product is only as good as its architecture.

  • 架构的好坏取决于构建它的模型。

  • An architecture is only as good as the models from which it's made.

  • 产品型号可见。

  • Product models are visible.

  • 产品模型是管理工具。

  • Product models are management tools.

  • 产品组件不断变化和发展。

  • Product components change as well as evolve.

  • 开发工作分块进行。

  • Development work is done in chunks.

  • 需要组织和管理工作块。

  • Work chunks need to be organized and managed.

  • 无视历史的人注定要重蹈覆辙。

  • He who ignores history is doomed to repeat it.

  • 最后一分钟为时已晚。

  • The last minute is too late.

  • 链条的强度取决于其最薄弱的环节。

  • A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.

  • UML 应该在所有开发领域中一致和统一地使用。

  • The UML should be used consistently and uniformly across all domains of development.

解决方案

SOLUTION

建立一个产品在开发开始时的配置管理模型。从管理的角度来看，这是产品架构的动态等价物。

Establish a configuration-management model for the product at the start of development. From a management perspective, this is the dynamic equivalent of the product architecture.

首先确定需要作为一个整体进行管理并保持同步的关键工作产品。这些是产品的核心，它们需要对所有产品利益相关者都是最新的：高级管理人员、产品管理人员、开发团队和生产人员。

Start by establishing the key work products that need to be managed as a whole and kept in synch. These are the core of the product and they need to be up-to-date for all product stakeholders: senior management, product management, the development team, and production.

这些包裹称为配置，关键工作产品称为配置项。使用每个开发阶段的关键模型，从整个开发过程中识别需要作为一个整体进行管理的关键工作产品。对这些工作产品的静态和动态关系建模，作为记录开发生命周期和产品生命周期中配置管理的整体方法的起点。

These packages are called configurations, and the key work products are called configuration items. Using the key models from each stage of development, identify the key work products from the overall development process that will need to be managed as a whole. Model the static and dynamic relationships of these work products as a starting point for documenting the overall approach to configuration management over the development lifecycle and product lifecycle.

使用 UML 模型定义和记录配置管理过程。这必须与变更管理、测试和发布管理集成（参见下面的示例）。

Define and document a configuration-management process using a UML model. This must be integrated with change management, testing, and release management (see example that follows).

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

用于管理产品演变的过程，该过程被一致地记录下来并且与与该产品相关的其他文档工件保持一致。

A process for managing the evolution of a product that is documented consistently and that is consistent with the other documentation artifacts associated with the product.

讨论

DISCUSSION

用于处理产品版本和配置的已定义且清晰传达的模型是成功产品管理的核心要求，而不仅仅是项目管理。各种 SCM 工具提供了关于如何处理配置管理的标准主题的变体，但需要根据在给定组织和开发文化中有效的方法来评估它们的方法。配置模型可以作为一个可以重用的目标从公司模型中派生出来。或者，产品可能需要特殊配置模型以满足特殊需求。

A defined and clearly communicated model for handling the versions and configurations of a product is a core requirement for successful product management, not just project management. Various SCM tools provide variations on standard themes for how to handle configuration management, but their approaches need to be evaluated against what works in a given organization and development culture. A configuration model can be derived from a corporate model as one target that can be reused. Alternatively, a product may require a special configuration model to suit special needs.

有越来越多的可用模式来处理配置管理的细节。一个值得注意的是 Brad Appleton、Steve Berczuk 和其他人称为流线：并行软件开发的分支模式http://www.enteract.com/~bradapp/acme/branching/branch-structs.html (1999)。

There are an increasing number of patterns available that deal with the specifics of configuration management. A notable one is by Brad Appleton, Steve Berczuk, and others calledStreamed Lines: Branching Patterns for Parallel Software Development at http://www.enteract.com/~bradapp/acme/branching/branch-structs.html (1999).

概括

Summary

本章为了解如何使用 UML 帮助从产品角度对系统建模提供了一个起点。识别上下文、为维护和测试提供支持以及管理产品都是需要用模型处理的活动，就像实际设计本身一样。

This chapter has provided a starting point for seeing how the UML can be used to help model a system from a product perspective. Identifying the context, providing support for maintenance and testing, and managing the product are all activities that need to handled with modelsjust as much as the actual design itself.

第 6 章“领域模式”中的许多模式 也适用于产品级别，感兴趣区域的边界从业务转移到系统。

Many of the patterns in Chapter 6, "Domain Patterns," are also applicable at the product level, with the boundary of the area of interest shifting from the business to the system.

设计产品时，您将使用其他模式的一些主要来源。Martin Fowler 的分析模式（1997 年）、四人组的设计模式（Gamma 等人，1995 年）和模式系统（Buschmann 等人，1996 年）是有用模式的主要来源。

Designing the product is when you'll use some of the major sources of other patterns. Martin Fowler's Analysis Patterns(1997), theGang of Four's Design Patterns (Gamma et al. 1995), and A System of Patterns (Buschmann et al. 1996) are the prime sources for useful patterns.

第 8 章组件模式

Chapter 8. Component Patterns

目录

Catalogue

8.1关注点分离

8.2整体组件

8.3图标说明组件

8.4图片描绘节点

8.5背板规格

8.6组件管理变更

8.7配置和发布的包

8.8维护模型

8.1 Separation of Concerns

8.2 Whole Components

8.3 Icons Clarify Components

8.4 Pictures Depict Nodes

8.5 Specification Backplane

8.6 Components Manage Change

8.7 Configured and Released Packages

8.8 Model for Maintenance

语境

Context

图案本章处理与部署软件相关的建模问题。这些问题与设计或施工问题不同，问题域通常是一组给定的，包括物理元素，例如组织的网络架构；以及软元素，例如人的组织结构。即使对于商业软件产品，目标平台和开箱即用体验的意图也需要考虑到作为交付包一部分的系统模型中。

The patterns in this chapter deal with the modeling problems connected to deploying a piece of software. These problems are different from design or construction problemsthe problem domain is typically a set of givens, including physical elements, such as the network architecture of an organization; as well as soft elements, such as the human organizational structure. Even for a commercial software product, both the target platforms and the intent of the out-of-the-box experience need to be factored into the system model that is part of the delivered package.

物理系统的模型具有不同的抽象级别和与分析或设计模型不同的受众。与设计概念相比，它们与用户和操作实用性的联系更为紧密。它们更直接，更像是一种描述而不是一种表现。应提供易于掌握的图片和地图；他们应该直截了当；它们应该与用户的需求、利益相关者的价值观和管理目标联系起来。

Models of the physical system have a different level of abstraction and a different audience from analysis or design models. They are more closely tied to user and operational practicalities than to designed concepts. They are more direct, more like a depiction than a representation. They should provide easy-to-grasp pictures and maps; they should be blunt and straightforward; and they should be connected to the needs of users, the values of stakeholders, and the goals of management.

从编程的角度来看，组件很有趣，因为它具有“可插入性”、“可替换性”和可重用性。从建模的角度来看，组件是更简单的东西：组件就是部署的东西。它们是可执行交付的原子元素；在处理器和设备上交付给最终用户的物理现实是在 UML 中称为节点。它们也是使可执行解决方案有用和所需的文档和任何其他支持可维护的。

From a programming perspective, components are interesting because of "pluggability," "replaceability," and reuse. From a modeling perspective, components are simpler things: components are what are deployed. They are the atomic elements of executable delivery; the physical reality that is delivered to the end user on processors and devices are called nodesin the UML. They are also the documentation and any other support needed to make the executable solution useful and maintainable.

讨论

Discussion

该设计部署团队面临的情况与开发人员的情况有点相似。给定一个产品，他们的挑战仍然是了解他们的用户，但他们这样做是为了更好地沟通和管理解决方案，而不是为了从用户的角度看待问题并解决用户的问题。

The design situation that a deployment team faces is a bit of a mirror image to that of the developers. Given a product, their challenge is still to understand their users, but they do this to be better at communicating and managing the solution, not in order to see the problem as the users see it and solve the users' problems.

部署团队使用模型不是为了概念化和构建，而是将其作为一种抽象复杂性的方法，以便将其转化为解决方案。相反，部署模型是实用的抽象，旨在帮助管理并在必要时进行更改。甚至变化也有不同的含义——目的是最小化创新，并最大化与原始愿景的一致性和一致性。

The deployment team uses models not in order to conceptualize and buildas a means of abstracting a complexity in order to make it amenable to translation into a solution. Instead, deployment models are practical abstractions that are meant to help manage and, if necessary, change. Even change has a different meaningthe intent is to minimize innovation, and maximize consistency and congruence with the original vision.

尽管部署团队面临的问题可能比设计/开发团队面临的问题在概念上的细微差别更少，但他们的解决方案的影响同样重要。

Although the problems a deployment team faces may have fewer conceptual nuances than those facing a design/development team, the impact of their solutions is no less significant.

大多数开发过程并没有过多关注在系统可用后将要管理系统的人员的需求。许多开发组织鼓励生产、运营和支持领域推出自己的文档标准，完全独立于任何现有的开发标准。尽管这在过去是有道理的，但考虑到部署组织的不同关注点，对于将 UML 作为标准建模语言的组织来说，这不再是必要的，甚至是不可接受的。通过组件、部署图和包及其关联关系，UML 提供了一种方法来捕获，至少，部署的一般有用方面，足以提供任何通用文档需要。

Most development processes don't pay a lot of attention to the needs of the people who will be shepherding a system after it is made available. Many development organizations encourage production, operations, and support areas to roll their own standards for documentation, quite independently of any that exist for development. Although this made some sense in the past, given the different concerns that deployment organizations have, this is no longer warranted or even acceptable for organizations that embrace the UML as a standard modeling language. With components, deployment diagrams, and packages with their associated relationships, the UML provides the means to capture, at least, the generally useful aspects of deployment well enough to provide any generic documentation needed.

8.1 关注点分离

8.1 SEPARATION OF CONCERNS

问题

PROBLEM

如何确保部署的文档对所有利益相关者有效且有用。

How to ensure that the deployed documentation is effective and useful for all stakeholders.

语境

CONTEXT

规范已经结束，橡胶遇到了道路。开发人员在实施，部署需要模型来帮助系统交接后的规划和管理。

Specification is over, and the rubber meets the road. Developers are implementing, and deployment needs models to help with planning and management after the system is turned over.

军队

FORCES

  • 实施和部署使操作和生产环境用户更加可见，他们的需求更加重要。

  • Implementation and deployment make operations and production environment users more visible and their needs more important.

  • 用户是部署环境的一部分，也是建模和设计思想的来源。

  • Users are part of the deployment environment, as well as a source of ideas for modeling and design.

  • 管理和运营应该使用与开发团队相同的模型。

  • Management and operations should use the same models as the development team.

  • 模型应该以驱动开发的方式通知部署。

  • Models should inform deployment the same way that they drive development.

  • 一刀切与复杂性相冲突。

  • One-size-fits-all collides against complexity.

  • 糟糕的文档有助于架构熵。

  • Poor documentation contributes to architectural entropy.

  • 系统比它们的创造者活得更久（至少在组织上）。

  • Systems outlive their creators (organizationally, at least).

  • 建筑是学习，而不仅仅是思想的具体化和联想的巩固。

  • Architecture is learning, not just the concretization of ideas and the cementing of associations.

  • 文档接缝需要信念和理解的飞跃，就像设计接缝一样。

  • Documentation seams require leaps of faith and understanding, just as design seams do.

解决方案

SOLUTION

了解系统部署中的利益相关者与开发中的利益相关者并不完全相同。确保以与处理开发的方式一致的方式解决他们各自关心的问题。

Understand that the stakeholders in the deployment of a system are not exactly the same as the stakeholders in the development. Ensure that their separate concerns are addressed in a fashion that is consistent with the way that development was handled.

遵循与开发软件相同的方法来记录软件：

Follow the same approach to documenting software as developing it:

  • 识别您的用户。

  • Identify your users.

  • 定义他们的需求。

  • Define their needs.

  • 记录他们与它的互动。

  • Document their interactions with it.

  • 建立通用词汇表和架构。

  • Establish a common vocabulary and an architecture.

  • 详细说明他们需要的功能和信息。

  • Detail the functions and information they need.

  • 确定再利用和回收的机会。

  • Identify the opportunities for reuse and recycling.

  • 计划如何提供功能和信息。

  • Plan how to provide the functions and information.

  • 生产和包装。

  • Produce and package.

文档的用户可能有很多和系统的用户重名的，但是会更多，他们的需求也会不同。

The users of the documentation may have many of the same names as the users of the system, but there will be more and their needs will be different.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

一个已部署的系统，具有用户驱动的基于模型和架构的文档。

A deployed system with model-based and architected documentation that is user-driven.

讨论

DISCUSSION

实施不仅仅是编码，部署也不仅仅是进程和访问机制的物理分区。每个利益相关者都有持续的需求，一个完整的系统必须满足这些需求。

Implementation isn't just about coding, and deployment isn't just about the physical partitioning of processes and access mechanisms. Each stakeholder has ongoing needs that a complete system must address.

UML 隐含地认识到将一致的文档作为整个系统包的一部分的重要性。组件不仅仅是开发人员的实现问题；相反，它们包含使系统可用所需的支持文档和其他工件。部署图也是如此：节点是设备、附加进程的处理器、必须建立和管理的拓扑，而不仅仅是设计。用户需要帮助使用该系统。需要管理变更。

The UML implicitly recognizes the importance of including consistent documentation as part of a total system package. Components are not just implementation concerns of the developers; instead, they encompass the supporting documentation and other artifacts required for making a system available. The same is true for deployment diagrams: nodes are devices, processors with processes attached, topologies that have to be established and administerednot just designs. Users need help using the system. Changes need to be managed.

因此，需要从长远角度记录实施和部署工件（它们可以被使用和维护），而不仅仅是作为存档文档。做到这一点的简单方法是最大化重用并最小化开发、实现和部署之间信息打包中的“接缝”转换。

So, implementation and deployment artifacts need to be documented with a long-term perspective (they can be used and maintained), not just as archival documentation. The easy way to do this is to maximize reuse and minimize "seams"transitions in the packaging of informationbetween development, implementation, and deployment.

请参阅以下模式“整体组件”，了解一些关于如何做到这一点的想法。

See the following pattern, "Whole Components," for some ideas on how to do this.

8.2 整体组件

8.2 WHOLE COMPONENTS

问题

PROBLEM

如何定义一个组件以最大化其可管理性并反映其所有利益相关者的需求。

How to define a component to maximize its manageability and reflect the needs of all its stakeholders.

语境

CONTEXT

使用组件作为长期文档和变更管理的模型容器。

Using components as model containers for long-term documentation and change management.

军队

FORCES

  • 组件可以包含组件。

  • Components can contain components.

  • 组件不一定是可执行文件。

  • Components are not necessarily executables.

  • 运营用户需要知道组件的组成和依赖关系。

  • Operational users need to know the composition and dependencies of components.

  • 组件不会在真空中运行；他们几乎是独立的。

  • Components don't operate in a vacuum; they are only nearly independent.

  • 组件不是凭空制造的；它们是设计工件的实现。

  • Components aren't built in a vacuum; they are realizations of design artifacts.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将与可执行组件相关的所有额外内容（文档、测试文件、源代码、更改历史记录）捆绑到一个整体组件中：一个整体组件。将每个附加项记录为一个组件，并以符合 UML 的方式绘制关系图（通常使用依赖关系和实现关系）。

Bundle all of the extras associated with an executable component (documentation, test files, source code, change history) into an overall component: a whole component. Document each of the extras as a component and diagram the relationships in UML-compliant fashion (typically, by using depends and realizes relationships).

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

需要一起管理的构成元素和支持工件的符合 UML 的包装。

UML-compliant packaging of the constituent elements and supporting artifacts that need to be managed together.

讨论

DISCUSSION

根据 UML规范，“组件类型表示系统的可分配实现部分，包括软件代码（源代码、二进制代码或可执行文件），还包括人类系统中的业务文档等”（Rational Software公司 1999, 3170)。

According to the UML Specification, "a component type represents a distributable piece of implementation of a system, including software code (source, binary, or executable), but also including business documents, and so on, in a human system" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3170).

D'Souza 和 Wills (1998) 以及 Rational Unified Process 都以这种方式看待组件：作为通过实现交付的可执行文件，以及使实现和部署成功所需的所有附加内容的打包。

D'Souza and Wills (1998) and the Rational Unified Process both see components this way: as the executables that are delivered via implementation, and the packaging of all the additional stuff that's needed to make the implementation and deployment successful.

我将模拟所有支持材料的包含的组件称为整体组件，这是 Geoffrey Moore 的整体产品概念和软件工程研究所版本的他的想法的扩展。我在第 10 章“上下文中的 UML”中讨论了这两个问题 ，但整个产品概念表明，任何产品都需要的不仅仅是它本身提供的东西才能成功和可用。

I call components that model the containment of all the supporting material whole components, which is an extension of both Geoffrey Moore's notion of whole products and the Software Engineering Institute's version of his idea. I discuss both of these in Chapter 10, "The UML in Context," but the whole product notion says that any product needs more than simply what it provides by itself in order to be successful and usable.

还需要什么取决于产品本身。然而，鉴于处于 UML 核心的以体系结构为中心和迭代开发的原则，组件需要（至少）用户文档和生产文档，以及与指定模型的连接，这些模型为定义它的功能提供了基础.

What else is needed depends on the product itself. Given the principles of architecture-centric and iterative development that's at the core of the UML, however, a component needs (at least) user documentation and production documentation, as well as connections to the specifying models that provide the basis for defining what it does.

这些都需要在组件的持续部署中提供给利益相关者（各种经理、支持人员、维护程序员等），并且需要清晰可见和可访问。一个完整的组件提供了一种将所有这些作为一个整体结合在一起的方法。

These all need to be available to the stakeholders in the ongoing deployment of a component (various managers, support staff, maintenance programmers, and so on), and need to be clearly visible and accessible. A whole component provides a way of holding all of these together as a piece.

相关模式包括以下内容：“图标清晰组件”和“组件管理改变。”

Related patterns include the following: "Icons Clarify Components" and "Components Manage Change."

8.3 图标明确组件

8.3 ICONS CLARIFY COMPONENTS

问题

PROBLEM

如何以易于掌握的方式以图形方式呈现组件的所有方面和组成部分。

How to graphically present all the aspects and constituent parts of a component in an easy-to-grasp way.

语境

CONTEXT

使用组件作为长期文档和变更管理的模型容器。

Using components as model containers for long- term documentation and change management.

军队

FORCES

  • 与用户不同的模型元素需要在视觉上加以区分。

  • Model elements that are different to the user need to be differentiated visually.

  • 文本刻板印象不是用户友好的。

  • Textual stereotypes are not user-friendly.

  • 组件可以包含组件。

  • Components can contain components.

  • 组件不一定是可执行文件。

  • Components are not necessarily executables.

  • 运营用户需要知道组件的组成和依赖关系。

  • Operational users need to know the composition and dependencies of components.

解决方案

SOLUTION

对需要与可执行组件保持同步的不可执行组件使用标准化图标。这些可以包括源代码文件、业务文档、数据库表、帮助文件等。

Use standardized icons for nonexecutable components that need to be kept in synch with an executable component. These can include source code files, business documents, database tables, help files, and so on.

这些图标取代了组件的标准 UML 符号上的原型标记的使用。UML 提供了一些内置的构造型，The Unified Modeling Language User Guide (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a) 为它们推荐了一些图标：

The icons replace the use of stereotype tags on the standard UML notation for component. The UML provides some built-in stereotypes, and The Unified Modeling Language User Guide (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999a) recommends some icons for them:

“文档”

«document»

一个文件

A document

«可执行»

«executable»

可以在节点上运行的程序

A program that may be run on a node

“文件”

«file»

包含源代码或数据的文档

A document containing source code or data

“图书馆”

«library»

静态或动态库

A static or dynamic library

“桌子”

«table»

数据库表

A database table

当然，可用于组件的所有关系都可用于这些组件类型，但在大多数情况下，您只想显示依赖关系（参见图8.1）。

All the relationships that are available for use with a component are, of course, available with these component types, but for the most part you'll want to show only dependencies (see Figure 8.1).

图 8.1。具有帮助文件和 DLL 支持工件的可执行组件，需要作为一个组进行更改，因此需要作为一个整体进行配置。

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

对需要一起管理的组成元素和支持工件的清晰描述。

A clear depiction of the constituent elements and supporting artifacts that need to be managed together.

讨论

DISCUSSION

有关系统组件的信息的受众是开发团队和部署团队。使用原型组件的标志性形式有助于弥合它们之间的差距，提供更易于访问的格式，清楚地区分组件类型视觉上。

The audience for the information about the system components is both the development team and the deployment team. Using iconic forms of stereotyped components helps to bridge the gap between them, providing a more accessible format that clearly distinguishes types of components visually.

8.4 图片描绘节点

8.4 PICTURES DEPICT NODES

问题

PROBLEM

如何以图形方式呈现有关硬件环境的信息，以最大限度地提高部署中所有利益相关者的可理解性。

How to graphically present information about the hardware environment to maximize comprehensibility by all stakeholders in a deployment.

语境

CONTEXT

使用部署图来支持系统物理架构的文档。

Using deployment diagrams to support documentation of the physical architecture of a system.

军队

FORCES

  • 与用户不同的模型元素需要在视觉上加以区分。

  • Model elements that are different to the user need to be differentiated visually.

  • 文本刻板印象不是用户友好的。

  • Textual stereotypes are not user-friendly.

  • 节点有类型和连接。

  • Nodes have types and connections.

  • 运营用户需要对物理架构的资源和资源依赖性进行建模。

  • Operational users need to model the resources and resource dependencies of the physical architecture.

解决方案

SOLUTION

使用剪贴画作为位于节点上的非组件元素的图标。与组件图标一样，这些图标取代了原型标签的使用，但在这种情况下，它们取代了非常本地化的原型。创建一个节点原型库，其中包含反映实际使用中的机器的图标。例如：

Use clip art as icons for non-component elements that sit on nodes. As with component icons, these icons replace the use of stereotype tags, but in this case, they replace very localized stereotypes. Create a library of node stereotypes with icons that reflect the actual machines in use. For example:

«惠普服务器»

«HPserver»

HP UNIX 资源

A HP UNIX resource

“个人电脑”

«PC»

标准工作站

A standard workstation

“路由器”

«router»

WAN 上的集线器

A hub on a WAN

图 8.2显示了一个使用图形图标的非常简单的部署图示例。

Figure 8.2 shows an example of a very simple deployment diagram that uses graphic icons.

图 8.2。带有剪贴画图片图标的部署图。

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

物理架构拓扑的本地化描述，可以作为物理系统中所有利益相关者的地图，以他们的视觉语言表达。

A localized depiction of the topology of the physical architecture that can act as a map for all the stakeholders in the physical system, expressed in their visual language.

讨论

DISCUSSION

根据UML 规范，“节点是表示处理资源（包括）计算设备以及人力资源或机械处理资源的物理对象”（Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3168）。

According to the UML Specification, "A node is a physical object that represents a processing resource(including) computing devices but also human resources or mechanical processing resources" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 3168).

由于每个组织的基础设施和物理环境的独特性，根据统一建模语言用户指南（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998a，267），节点“可能是 UML 中最典型的构建块”。然而，即使它们仅供本地使用，节点仍需要标准化为组织架构风格的一部分。然而，与组件不同的是，它们更好地以特定和本地的熟悉方式表示，而不是使用更通用的图标成分。

Because of the unique nature of each organization's infrastructure and physical environment, nodes are "probably the most stereotyped building block in the UML," according to The Unified Modeling Language User Guide (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998a, 267). However, even though they're intended only for local consumption, nodes still need to be standardized as part of an organization's architectural style. Unlike components, though, they are better represented in a familiar way that is specific and local, rather than the more generic icons used for components.

8.5 规格背板

8.5 SPECIFICATION BACKPLANE

问题

PROBLEM

记录模型中的详细信息。

Documenting detailed information in a model.

语境

CONTEXT

决定如何在避免信息过载的同时提供信息。

Making decisions about how to make information available while avoiding information overload.

军队

FORCES

  • 模型将文本信息与该信息的图形再现相结合。

  • Models combine textual information with graphical renditions of that information.

  • 某些信息可能无法从图形表示中获益。

  • Some information may not benefit from graphical presentation.

  • 图表中的详细程度取决于在给定图表的目的和受众时所需的抽象级别。

  • The level of detail in a diagram depends on the level of abstraction that's needed when given the purpose and audience for the diagram.

  • 图表旨在显示在上下文中有意义的信息，而不是所有信息。

  • Diagrams are meant to show information that's meaningful in a context, not all the information.

解决方案

SOLUTION

在模型的规格部分留下太详细或不需要突出显示的信息，而不是图片。这与省略不同：没有必要指出信息丢失，因为它是查找信息而不是关键信息。在某些情况下，例如组件到节点的分布式部署，它可能是一个冗长的列表。

Leave information that is too detailed or that does not need to be highlighted in the specification part of the modelthe text, rather than the pictures. This is different from elision: There's no need to indicate that the information is missing because it's lookup information rather than critical information. In some cases, such as the distributed deployment of components to nodes, it may be a lengthy list.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

清晰的图表强调关键信息，同时确保模型用户知道在哪里寻找细节。

Clean diagrams that emphasize critical information while ensuring that model users know where to look for the details.

讨论

DISCUSSION

背板是一种电子电路板，包含电路和插座，用于插入其他电路板或卡上的附加电子设备；它是计算机主板的一部分。在The Unified Modeling Language User Guide中，该术语用于描述模型的文本元素，在图形插入的骨干意义上（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998a，68）。

A backplane is an electronic circuit board containing circuitry and sockets for plugging in additional electronic devices on other circuit boards or cards; it is part of the motherboard in a computer. In The Unified Modeling Language User Guide, the term is used to describe the textual elements of a model, in the sense of a backbone that the graphics plug into (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998a, 68).

Desmond D'Souza 区分了两种对创建成功模型很重要的文本信息：正式文本和他所谓的“叙述”。催化包有一本字典，用于弥合正式和非正式之间的差距；它的叙述包括“文本、图片、插图、轶事、脚注”(D'Souza and Wills 1998, 291) 以及帮助人类用户从模型。

Desmond D'Souza distinguishes between two types of textual information that are important for creating successful models: formal text and what he calls "narrative." A catalysis package has a dictionary for bridging the gap between the formal and the informal; its narrative includes "text, pictures, illustrations, anecdotes, footnotes" (D'Souza and Wills 1998, 291) and any other material needed to help human users make sense from amodel.

8.6 组件管理变化

8.6 COMPONENTS MANAGE CHANGE

问题

PROBLEM

如何管理系统模型的生命周期更改，以便系统更改反映在模型本身中。

How to manage lifetime changes to a system model so that system changes are reflected in the model itself.

语境

CONTEXT

在部署后维护 UML 建模系统。

Maintaining a UML-modeled system after it is deployed.

军队

FORCES

  • 迭代开发就是改变（Booch 1994, 223）。

  • Iterative development is all about change (Booch 1994, 223).

  • 系统自然会随着时间发生变化。

  • A system naturally changes over time.

  • 非架构驱动的更改会导致系统熵。

  • Changes that aren't architecture-driven result in system entropy.

  • 维护系统时必须维护架构。

  • The architecture must be maintained when the system is maintained.

  • 模型是系统的一部分。

  • Models are part of the system.

  • 模型是建筑的唯一有形表达。

  • Models are the only tangible expressions of architecture.

  • 系统维护是在物理组件上执行的。

  • System maintenance is performed on physical components.

  • 文档应该对其用户有用，而不仅仅是存档。

  • Documentation should be useful to its user, not merely archival.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将变更请求与整个组件联系起来。使它们成为变更请求的工作单元。要求对变更请求的任何分析都包括对与整个组件中的可执行文件关联的任何文档、模型等可能需要的变更的审查。

Tie change requests to whole components. Make them the unit of work for a change request. Require any analysis of a change request to include a review of changes that might be needed to any of the documents, models, and so on associated with the executable in the whole component.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

整个组件为调查变更请求所需的所有信息提供了一个清晰明了的位置。注意：部分信息可能保存在背板规格中。

The whole component provides a clear and obvious location for all the information needed to investigate a change request. Note: some of this information may be kept in the specification backplane.

讨论

DISCUSSION

系统部署后收到的更改请求不同于系统开发期间请求的更改。最值得注意的是，它们引用现有的可执行文件，无论是直接（对可执行文件的功能或性能的更改）还是间接（例如，对帮助文件的更改）。

Change requests that are received after a system is deployed are different from changes requested during the development of a system. Most notably, they reference existing executables, whether directly (for a change to an executable's functionality or performance) or indirectly (for example, a change to a help file).

在架构系统环境中，影响的可追溯性和变更在所有受影响的工件中的一致性是变更成功的关键因素。然而，变更管理总是给管理层带来一个问题：确定“软件工作的原子单元”的粒度，正如 Walker Royce 所描述的那样 (1999, 125)。组件，尤其是整个组件，提供了一个简单的解决方案。

In an architected system environment, the traceability of impact and the consistency of a change across all impacted artifacts are critical factors in the success of a change. However, change management has always presented management with a problem: determining the granularity of the "atomic unit of software work," as Walker Royce describes it (1999, 125). Components, especially whole components, offer an easy solution.

8.7 配置和发布的包

8.7 CONFIGURED AND RELEASED PACKAGES

问题

PROBLEM

建立一个模型框架，它将提供一种易于使用、可靠的方法来组织和控制工件的修订。为项目管理、变更管理和发布管理流程提供支持和集成。

Establishing a model framework that will provide an easy-to-use, reliable means to organize and control revisions of artifacts. Providing support for and integration with project management, change management, and release management processes.

语境

CONTEXT

开发、部署和维护系统。

Developing, deploying, and maintaining a system.

军队

FORCES

  • 系统通过多个版本发展。

  • Systems evolve through multiple versions.

  • 一些版本发布给外部用户。

  • Some versions are released to external users.

  • 管理层需要知道哪些工件是同步的（即哪些工件构成了系统的整个版本）。

  • Management needs to know which artifacts are in synch (that is, which artifacts constitute a whole version of a system).

  • 开发人员（维护或其他）需要确保他们使用的是最新版本的系统。

  • Developers (maintenance or otherwise) need to be sure they're working with the latest version of a system.

  • 更改需要同步。

  • Changes need to be synchronized.

  • 架构系统使用模型作为约束开发和控制变更的手段。

  • Architected systems use models as a means of constraining development and controlling change.

解决方案

SOLUTION

使用包作为捆绑配置和（暗示）发布的一种方式。每个发行版和版本都应通过包在物理体系结构中标识，包可以包括所有模型元素（或对模型元素的引用）。版本号应作为配置中包含的每个元素的标记值包含在内。

Use packages as a way of bundling configurations and (by implication) releases. Each release and version should be identified in the physical architecture by means of a package, which can include all of the model elements (or references to model elements). Version numbers should be included as tagged values for each element included in the configuration.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

一种模型，其中包含一种规范的配置管理方法，包括内部和外部版本。

A model that includes a disciplined approach to configuration management that encompasses both internal and external releases.

包成为“版本控制”、配置管理、重用等的基础。所有产品工件都可以组合到一个或多个合适的包中，这些包代表不同目的的不同视图。这些工件可以而且应该包括测试模型、测试结果、业务规则、相关模式和任何其他内容，包括其他包。

A package becomes the basis for "versioning," configuration management, reuse, and so on. All the product artifacts can be assembled in one or more appropriate packages that represent different views for different purposes. These artifacts can and should include test models, test results, business rules, relevant patterns, and anything else, including other packages.

讨论

DISCUSSION

Unified Modeling Language Reference Guide明确指出包旨在“组织大型模型并发展它们”。它指出每个模型元素“必须恰好属于一个包或其他模型元素”（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1999b）。这种所有权机制加强了对基于组件的增量架构环境控制的适当控制，这在考虑重用对进行维护的影响时尤为重要。

The Unified Modeling Language Reference Guide says specifically that packages are intended to "organize large models and evolve them." It points out that every model element "must be owned by exactly one package or other model element" (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999b). This ownership mechanism reinforces appropriate control in a component-based, incrementally architected environmentcontrol that is especially important when considering the impact of reuse in doing maintenance.

配置管理并不局限于软件系统。理想情况下，所有电子公司文件都应进行配置管理：手册、文档、表单模板、文档模板、管理报告等。

Configuration management is not confined to software systems. Ideally, all electronic corporate files should be under configuration management: manuals, documentation, forms templates, document templates, management reports, and so on.

这些非软件对象和软件组件（如源代码、技术和用户手册以及其他系统相关组件）的配置管理之间的主要区别在于，它们通常不受正式项目经理的控制，因为它们不经常需要升级，只管理他们的版本。

The main difference between configuration management of these non-software objects and software components such as source code, technical and user manuals, and other system-related components is that they will often not be under the control of a formal project manager because they do not often need to be promoted, and only have their versions managed.

有关基于 UML 的开发环境中配置管理的详细信息，Walker Royce 提供了一个很好的概述（1998，174181），这与 D'Souza 和Wills (1998) 和 RUP。

For details about configuration management in a UML-based development environment, Walker Royce provides a good overview (1998, 174181) which is consistent with both D'Souza and Wills (1998) and the RUP.

8.8 维护模型

8.8 MODEL FOR MAINTENANCE

问题

PROBLEM

建筑支持持续开发和维护的模型。

Building models that support ongoing development and maintenance.

语境

CONTEXT

增量构建和交付的系统，其中在初始 Greenfield 版本之后部署的版本通常被视为维护版本并标记为维护版本。

Systems that are built and delivered incrementally, in which releases deployed after the initial Greenfield release are typically considered and labeled maintenance releases.

军队

FORCES

  • 模型就是文档。

  • The model is the documentation.

  • 如果它没有写下来，它就不存在（非正式地归因于比尔盖茨）。

  • If it isn't written down, it doesn't exist (informally attributed to Bill Gates).

  • 后 Greenfield 增量开发人员通常没有时间或需要了解整个产品模型。

  • Developers in post-Greenfield increments typically don't have the time or the need to understand the entire product model.

  • 进行实际维护的工人需要能够将需要修复或更改的特定元素归零。

  • Workers doing real maintenance need to be able to zero in on the specific elements that need to be fixed or changed.

  • 多年来，关于在系统中修复什么以及如何修复它的不知情或不正确的选择会导致产品熵。

  • Uninformed or incorrect choices about what to fix in a system and how to fix it contribute to product entropy over the years.

  • 产品 80% 的工作和 80% 以上的生命周期发生在首次发布之后。

  • Eighty percent of the work and more than eighty percent of the life of a product occurs after the initial release.

  • 需要对更改进行配置和版本控制。

  • Changes need to be configured and versioned.

解决方案

SOLUTION

从一开始就考虑维护建模，并对对维护工作有意义的关键模型元素进行打包。这些通常更具物理性，可能只是发布的生产文档。

Model from the beginning with maintenance in mind, and make a packaging of the critical model elements that are meaningful to a maintenance effort. These are typically more physical and may just be the production documentation for a release.

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

支持变更管理、问题管理和返工的一致组织和命名的产品工件集合。

A consistently organized and named collection of product artifacts that supports change management, problem management, and rework.

讨论

DISCUSSION

按照 Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills (1998, 287) 的说法，一种看待包的方法是将其作为“一个开发工作单元的命名容器”。D'Souza 和 Wills 进一步将包裹描述为“它自己的世界”，并建议“你只能知道和相信它里面的东西”（286）。

One way to look at a package is as a "named container for a unit of development work," according to Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills (1998, 287). D'Souza and Wills further describe a package as "its own world" and suggest that "you can know and believe only what is within it" (286).

包成为版本控制、配置管理、重用等的基础。所有产品工件都可以组合到一个或多个合适的包中，这些包代表不同目的的不同视图。这些工件可以而且应该包括测试模型、测试结果、业务规则、相关模式和任何其他内容，包括其他包。

A package becomes the basis for versioning, configuration management, reuse, and so on. All the product artifacts can be assembled in one or more appropriate packages that represent different views for different purposes. These artifacts can and should include test models, test results, business rules, relevant patterns and anything else, including other packages.

Unified Modeling Language Reference Guide明确指出包旨在“组织大型模型并改进它们”（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1999b）。它指出每个模型元素“必须恰好属于一个包或其他模型元素”。这种所有权机制加强了在基于组件的增量架构环境中的适当控制；在考虑重用对做事的影响时特别重要的控制维护。

The Unified Modeling Language Reference Guide says specifically that packages are intended to "organize large models and evolve them" (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1999b). It points out that every model element "must be owned by exactly one package or other model element." This ownership mechanism reinforces the appropriate control in a component-based, incrementally architected environment; control that is especially important when considering the impact of reuse in doing maintenance.

概括

Summary

本章中的模式有助于对系统的逻辑和物理现实进行建模。它们可用于架构和操作目的。

The patterns in this chapter help model the logical and physical reality of a system. They can be used both for architectural and operational purposes.

在有关使用 UML 建模的书籍中，部署和实现通常很少受到关注。虽然 UML 并非旨在处理专门的实施和部署建模工具可能提供的所有需求，但是，它足以满足在生产文档中交流基本要素以及为配置管理和支持提供支持的实际目的。发布策划。

Deployment and implementation typically get little attention in books about modeling with the UML. Although the UML is not intended to handle all the needs that a specialized implementation and deployment modeling tool might afford, however, it is more than adequate for the practical purposes of communicating the essentials in production documentation, as well as providing support for configuration management and release planning.

关于使用 UML 的组件和部署工件的附加信息的最佳来源是两个与 Rational 的统一过程特别相关的信息，Walker Royce 的软件项目管理：统一过程（1999 年）和 Phillipe Kruchten 的Rational 统一过程：简介（1998 年） . Royce 的书特别擅长解决系统开发的机制以及管理工程方面的问题。Unified Modeling Language User Guide有一些关于有效使用组件和部署工件的特别好的讨论（Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh 1998a）。

The best sources of additional information about using the UML's component and deployment artifacts are two that are specifically associated with Rational's Unified Process, Walker Royce's Software Project Management: A Unified Process (1999) and Phillipe Kruchten's The Rational Unified Process: An Introduction(1998). Royce's book is especially good at addressing the mechanics of system development, as well as managing the engineering aspects. The Unified Modeling Language User Guide has some especially good discussions on using the component and deployment artifacts effectively (Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh 1998a).

第三部分：另一个起点

Part III: Another Starting Point

三、另一个起点

上下文中的 9 种模式

9 Patterns in Context

10 语境中的 UML

10 The UML in Context

11 综合考虑：反思设计工作

11 Putting It All Together: Reflecting on the Work of Design

第 9 章上下文中的模式

Chapter 9. Patterns in Context

一位非常伟大的音乐家来了并住在[我们]的房子里。他犯了一个大错误——[他]决定教我音乐，结果没有学。不过，我确实从他那里随便偷学了一些偷来的知识。

Bandyopadhyay (Brown and Duguid 1992) 中引用的拉宾德拉特·泰戈尔 (Rabindrath Tagore)

A very great musician came and stayed in [our] house. He made one big mistake[he] determined to teach me music, and consequently no learning took place. Nevertheless, I did casually pick up from him a certain amount of stolen knowledge.

Rabindrath Tagore quoted in Bandyopadhyay (Brown and Duguid 1992)

模式的编写和使用方式与软件行业中的任何其他开发工件截然不同：

The way patterns are written and used is strikingly different from any other development artifact in the software industry:

  • 模式的社会方面与其技术优势一样重要。

  • The social aspects of patterns are as important as their technical benefits.

  • 它们是不是来自更高权威的权威学习工具，也是不受控制或标准化的“标准”。

  • They are authoritative learning tools that don't emanate from a higher authority, and "standards" that aren't controlled or standardized.

  • 而且，它们是一种源自文学和建筑而非机器的“技术”。

  • And, they are a "technology" that is derived from literature and architecturenot from machines.

它们之所以不同，是因为模式既有人性的一面，也有技术性的一面。最好的模式不仅仅是技术性的，它们也不是孤立存在的。他们有一个社会维度来做好发展工作，而不仅仅是关注最终结果。它们嵌入在其他模式和生活本身的背景中。

They are different because patterns have a human side as well as a technical side. The best patterns aren't just technical and they don't exist in isolation. They have a social dimensiondoing the work of development wellnot just a focus on the end result. And they are embedded in a context of other patterns and life itself.

本章探讨了模式的人性化方面：特别是，软件模式如何与软件开发人员的工作方式以及他们在工作中遇到的问题联系起来。它适用于想要从知识和历史上更多地了解模式从何而来的读者，作为成为全面的专业从业者而不仅仅是技术人员的开始。

This chapter explores the human side of patterns: in particular, how software patterns connect to the way software developers work and the problems they have in working. It's meant for the reader who wants to know more about where patterns came from, intellectually and historically, as a start to becoming a well-rounded professional practitioner, rather than just a technician.

我将研究模式的背景（不仅是技术根源，还有人类根源）以及模式试图解决的社会、文化和组织问题。作为上下文的一部分，我将从个人和非常个性化的角度来谈论软件模式的历史和模式运动：社区创始人本身的观点。这些材料是从记录模式社区的存在和快速发展的各种书籍、网页、杂志文章和讨论列表中提炼出来的。对于任何想加入的人来说，这将是有用的背景材料，在其他任何地方都找不到。我还将详细研究模式的架构根源。

I'm going to look at the context for patterns (not just the technical roots, but the human ones) and the social, cultural, and organizational problems that patterns attempt to resolve. As part of the context, I'll talk about the history of software patterns and the patterns movement from a personal and very personalized perspective: that of the founders of the community themselves. This material is distilled from the various books, Web pages, magazine articles, and discussion-lists that document the existence and rapid growth of the patterns community. For anyone thinking of joining in, this will be useful background material that's not available in one place anywhere else. I will also look at the architectural roots of patterns in some detail.

模式的新手经常因为没有通过支付会费和阅读 Christopher Alexander 的开创性著作来完成功课而受到批评，尤其是The Timeless Way Of Building (1979) 和A Pattern Language: Towns, Buildings, Construction（Alexander、Ishikawa 和 Silverstein） 1977 年）。而且，对于任何想在工作中使用模式并了解模式思维的人来说，亚历山大的书是最好的起点。然而，这两本主要书籍很长，他的主要思想分散在整本书中，因为他在阐明这些思想时采用的是说服而非说教的方法。

Newcomers to patterns are frequently criticized for not doing their homework by paying their dues and reading the seminal works of Christopher Alexander, especially The Timeless Way Of Building (1979) and A Pattern Language: Towns, Buildings, Construction(Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977). And, for anyone who wants to use patterns in their work and understand the thinking that goes into patterns, Alexander's books are the best place to start. However, the two main books are long, and his key ideas are scattered throughout them because of the persuasive instead of didactic approach he takes to articulating those ideas.

尽管它们对于处理模式很重要，但模式社区制作的大部分材料并没有很好地解释 Alexander 的想法。除了少数例外，可用的解释通常过于简短和误导性的简化，或者它们陷入了哲学基础。Alexander 的想法不容易简化，尽管作为哲学的基础哲学（道教、禅宗和 Alexander 自己的观念的结合）很有趣，但它本身对于开始理解模式并不是至关重要的。

Despite their importance to working with patterns, most of the material produced by the patterns community don't do a good job of explaining Alexander's ideas. With a few exceptions, the available explanations are typically either too brief and misleadingly simplified, or else they get caught up in the philosophical underpinnings. Alexander's ideas are not easy to simplify, and although the underlying philosophy (a combination of Taoism, Zen, and Alexander's own notions) is interesting as a philosophy, it isn't itself critical to a beginning understanding of patterns.

我试图在本章中实现中间路径。我介绍了 Alexander 关于模式的基本思想，这些思想对模式的初级实践者很有用。但我避免了亚历山大思想中更深奥的元素，只是因为他们需要自己写一本书，而亚历山大写了很多卷。

I try to achieve a middle path in this chapter. I present Alexander's fundamental ideas about patterns, the ones that are useful to the starting practitioner of patterns. But I avoid the more esoteric elements of Alexander's ideas, simply because they need a book by themselvesand Alexander wrote it in many volumes.

9.1 一点背景

9.1 A Little Starting Context

的初始上下文软件模式是面向对象的设计。软件开发人员，尤其是面向对象的开发人员，在 Alexander 的模式书籍出版十年后的 80 年代后期开始对模式产生兴趣，但一开始只是以非常小的方式产生兴趣。软件模式源于当时变得非常明显的许多需求。托马斯·库恩会称这些现象的出现需求危机：挑战现有做事方式和认知方式的情况，因此它们会引发新的范式。我将它们视为亚历山大意义上的力量：需要解决的条件才能在不平衡的情况下建立新的平衡，从而创造新的“整体性”。

The initial context for software patterns was object-oriented design. Software developers, particularly object-oriented ones, started getting interested in patterns ten years after Alexander's patterns booksin the late '80sand only in a very small way at first. Software patterns emerged out of a number of needs that were becoming very evident then. Thomas Kuhn would have called the emergence of these needs crises: situations that challenge the existing way of doing and knowing, and so they provoke new paradigms. I'll treat them as forces, in the Alexandrian sense: conditions that need to be resolved to establish a new balance in an unbalanced situation, creating a new "wholeness."

9.1.1 力量一：构造抽象，抽象结构

9.1.1 Force 1: Structuring Abstraction, Abstracting Structure

的到来模式是由认识到需要比面向对象设计中的对象和类更高层次的抽象所驱动的。模式运动的先驱彼得·科德 (Peter Coad) 在他为 ACM 撰写的一篇反映亚历山大影响的早期文章中这样说道：

The coming of patterns was driven by recognition of the need for a higher level of abstraction than objects and classes in object-oriented design. Peter Coad, a pioneer in the pattern movement, put it this way in an early article he wrote for the ACM that reflects Alexander's influence:

面向对象的方法倾向于关注最低级别的构建块：类及其对象。类和对象对应于 Alexander 不断重复的最低级别元素。最低级别元素的模式和它们之间的关系构成了更有效的 OOA 和 OOD 的构建块。(Coad 1992, 152)

Object-oriented methods tend to focus on the lowest-level building block: the class and its objectsClasses and objects correspond to Alexander's constantly repeating, lowest-level elements. Patterns of lowest-level elements and relationships between them form a building block for more effective OOA and OOD(Coad 1992, 152)

这种需求反映了自 70 年代后期以来软件开发中的一股力量：结构化系统的趋势，以及只要顾问可以摆脱它，就将企业结构化为架构。业务系统日益增加的复杂性和相互依赖性使得旧的一次一个应用程序视图变得不可行，即使在 COBOL、JCL 和大型机数据库的狭窄范围内也是如此。

This need reflected a force in software development that had been gaining steam since the late '70s: the trend toward structuring systems and, whenever consultants could get away with it, structuring enterprises as architectures. The increasing complexity and interdependence of business systems made the old one-at-a-time view of applications unworkable, even within the narrow confines of COBOL, JCL, and mainframe databases.

到 80 年代后期，最初作为模拟编程和儿童游戏方式的对象成为构建互连系统复杂性的灵丹妙药，也是认真对待软件架构思想的第一个真正理由。

By the late '80s, objectswhich started life as ways to program simulations and children's gamesbecame both the silver bullet for structuring the complexities of interconnected systems and the first real justification for treating the idea of software architecture seriously.

然而，虽然对象似乎解决了第一代商业软件工具创建但无法解决的管理复杂性问题的关键部分，但对象创建了另一个需要管理的复杂性级别。结构化程序可以由具有物理和逻辑意义的过程、模块和文件块组成，但对象是……好吧，对象。尽管结构化开发人员拥有大量工具来组织他们的工作和设计，但面向对象的开发人员却缺乏任何此类工具。因此，开发人员问，“我们如何组织这些称为对象的东西？”

However, while seemingly solving key parts of the managing-complexity problem that the first generation of commercial software tools created and couldn't solve, objects created another level of complexity that needed to be managed. Structured programs could be composed of procedures, modules, and fileschunks that made physical and logical sensebut objects werewell, objects. Although structured developers had a substantial arsenal of tools for organizing their work and their designs, object-oriented developers lacked any such facilities. So, developers asked, "How can we organize these things called objects?"

答案：软件架构。也许模式：

The answer: software architecture. And maybe patterns:

成熟的设计师能够看到他们使用的软件架构中的广泛模式——过程、对象和[其他]抽象——提供构建块：模式提供整体架构。(Coplien 1994a, 1)

Mature designers are able to see the broad patterns in the software architectures they work withProcedures, objects, and [other] abstractionsprovide the building blocks: patterns provide the overall architecture. (Coplien 1994a, 1)

模式还为这种新型架构提供了一种方便的语言，它有别于过程和模块的旧语言（不仅仅是对象抽象的进步）：

Patterns also provided a convenient language that was distinct from the old language of procedures and modules (not just a step up in abstraction from objects) for this new kind of architecture:

模式为我们提供了一个词汇表来讨论比模块、过程或对象更大的结构，这些结构超出了过去十年为我们服务的合理对象设计方法的词汇表。其中许多结构并不新鲜；有几个人认识他们几十年了。模式将这些技术和谈论它们的词汇带到了日常生活中程序员。(Coplien 1997, 36)

Patterns have given us a vocabulary to talk about structures larger than modules, procedures, or objects, structures that outstrip the vocabularies of the sound object design methods that have served us for the past decade. Many of these structures aren't new; a few people have known them for decades. Patterns bring these techniques, and a vocabulary to talk about them, to the everyday programmer. (Coplien 1997, 36)

9.1.2 力量2：创意引导、创意引导

9.1.2 Force 2: Guiding Creativity, Creative Guidance

由80 年代后期，面向对象设计日趋成熟，传统方法论和第一代面向对象方法论无法胜任打包和交流所学内容的任务。

By the late '80s, object-oriented design was maturing, and the traditional methodologies and first-generation object-oriented methodologies were not up to the task of packaging and communicating what was being learned.

对面向对象设计和编程的一套体面的可重复指南的普遍需求正在出现，这些指南反映了技术的交互质量。这些是当时的方法无法解决的问题：

A mundane need for a decent set of repeatable guidelines for object-oriented design and programming was emergingguidelines that reflected the interactive quality of the technology. These were needs not being addressed by the methodologies of the day:

为面向对象编程寻找合适的方法论通常会重复陈旧的旧思想，但事实是 OOP 是如此不同，以至于仅靠 [传统] 方法的强制配合无法提供对 OOP 内在潜力的访问“这些方法[不]解决用户界面设计问题”[并且]虽然ER [例如]似乎是“面向对象的”，但它不适合对象的动态特性，并鼓励使用全局视角在设计时，在面向对象编程中肯定是失败者。我们建议使用改编自 Christopher Alexander 作品的概念彻底改变设计和实现的负担。（Beck 和 Cunningham 1987）

The search for an appropriate methodology for object-oriented programming has seen the usual rehash of tired old ideas, but the fact is that OOP is so different that no mere force-fit of [traditional] methods will provide access to the potential inherent in OOPthese methods [do not] address the user interface design issues[and] while E-R [for example] seems to be "object-oriented" it is not suited to the dynamic nature of objectsand encourages the use of a global perspective while designing, a sure loser in object-oriented programmingWe propose a radical shift in the burden of design and implementation, using concepts adapted from the work of Christopher Alexander (Beck and Cunningham 1987)

模式被视为提供了一种记录技术的替代方式——一种可能与交互式、基于对象的软件开发世界更同步的替代方式。通过独立又相互连接，它们类似于对象。模式反映了面向对象中隐含的目标，例如语言和平台的独立性以及对环境的适应性：

Patterns were seen as offering an alternative way of documenting techniquesan alternative more in synch perhaps with the world of interactive, object-based software development. By being self-contained and yet connected, they resemble objects. Patterns reflect targets implicit in object orientation, such as independence of language and platform, and adaptability to circumstances:

模式形式非常适合记录[面向对象]设计技术。与设计文档不同，模式反映了已在多种情况下使用的东西，因此具有一定的普遍性。模式还以允许根据情况的细节进行一些变化的方式表达解决方案。最后，模式可以表达独立于语言和设计方法的体系结构考虑因素。（Berczuk 1994）

The pattern form is well suited to documenting [object -oriented] design techniques. Unlike a design document, a pattern reflects something that has been used in a number of situations and thus has some generalityPatterns also express solutions in ways that allow for some variation depending on the details of a circumstance. Finally, patterns can express architectural considerations independent of language and design methodology(Berczuk 1994)

而且，由于是生成性的（创造性解决方案的来源）而不是规定性的，模式需要模式用户的交互式参与：

And, by being generative (a source of creative solutions) rather than prescriptive, patterns require an interactive involvement by the pattern user:

生成软件设计模式的使用方式与我们使用服装图案或船只图案的方式相同：指导设计师打造新的衣服或船只。我们可以将模式编织成生成模式语言，相关模式系列共同为单个领域中的系统构建问题提供解决方案集。(Coplien 1997, 36)

A generative software design pattern can be used in the same way we use a dress pattern or a boat pattern: to guide a designer to build a new dress or boat. We can weave patterns together into generative pattern languages, families of related patterns which together provide a solution set for system-building problems in a single domain. (Coplien 1997, 36)

Generative是有关软件模式的文献中最受欢迎的术语，它继承自 Alexander。它暗示了一种间接的创造力，一种为创造性解决方案提供方向而不详细说明如何实现它的方法。

Generative, a favorite term in the literature about software patterns, is inherited from Alexander. It suggests an indirect creativity, a way of providing the direction for a creative solution without detailing how to achieve it.

伴随着对流行方法的不满，模式也反映出一种健康的不尊重对于计算机辅助软件工程 (CASE)，以前的灵丹妙药被证明是如此令人失望和昂贵。CASE 最终将过时的技术和实践自动化。最后，软件设计过程的自动化被证明是毫无结果的，就像寻找一种方法来“数学化”建筑中的设计过程一样，这导致 Alexander模式。

Along with a dissatisfaction with the prevailing methodologies, patterns also reflect a healthy disrespect for Computer Assisted Software Engineering (CASE), the previous silver bullet that proved so disappointing and expensive. CASE ended up automating obsolete techniques and practices. In the end, automating the design process for software turned out to be as fruitless as the search for a way to "mathematicize" the design process in architecture that led Alexander to patterns.

9.1.3 力量 3：追求质量和重用

9.1.3 Force 3: The Search for Quality and Reuse

额外的支持模式思想的力量来自对软件质量的新兴强调。在面向对象的编程中，软件质量与对通过重用提高开发效率的可能性的关注相结合。以模式作为组织原则的对象提供了比原始代码更高级别的重用的诱人可能性：设计工件、架构元素，以及最终的体验：

Additional forces that supported the idea of patterns came from an emerging emphasis on software quality. In object-oriented programming, software quality combined with a focus on the possibilities of increased development productivity through reuse. Objects with patterns as an organizing principle offered the tantalizing possibility of reuse at a higher level than raw code: design artifacts, architectural elements, and, ultimately, experience:

模式是以强调这些结构的重用潜力的方式描述结构结构的形式。它们提供了一种以独立于应用程序的方式记录和共享设计专业知识的方法。（Berczuk 1994）

Patterns are forms for describing architectural constructs in a manner that emphasizes these constructs' potential for reuse. They provide a way to document and share design expertise in an application-independent fashion (Berczuk 1994)

模式也被视为将人为因素和一定程度的进化过程纳入软件质量和重用领域的一种方式：

Patterns were also seen as a means for including the human element and a degree of evolutionary process into the arena of software quality and reuse:

我们相信软件质量和生产力的目标将通过成功设计的有条不紊的编目得到最好的服务。我们仍然受到亚历山大收集的令人印象深刻的设计目录的启发。[他]声称大多数好的建筑理念都是从无数代人建造结构中演变而来的为了他们自己的需要。这些想法代代相传，受制于自然选择的形式。我们在亚历山大的策略中找到了很多鼓励，将选择重新引入最近由 [the] 接管的设计领域不感兴趣。（罗沙 1988）

We believe the goals of software quality and productivity will be best served by the methodical cataloging of successful designswe remain inspired by the impressive design catalog assembled by Alexander[He] claims most good architectural ideas evolved out of uncountable generations of people building structures for their own need. These ideas, passed on from generation to generation, were subject to a form of natural selectionWe find much encouragement in Alexander's tactic for reintroducing selection into a field of design recently taken over by [the] disinterested. (Rochat 1988)

9.1.4 更广泛的文化和专业力量

9.1.4 Broader Cultural and Professional Forces

任何如果不讨论软件模式出现期间的知识和文化潮流，那么对理解模式的背景的讨论将是不完整的。Rochat 和 Cunningham 表达的感受反映了当时浮出水面的一种更普遍的力量：在面对“去技能化”、专业化、和不断的变化。

Any discussion of the context for understanding patterns would not be complete without some discussion of the intellectual and cultural currents that were flowing in the period when software patterns emerged. The feelings expressed by Rochat and Cunningham reflect a more general force that surfaced then: a desire for what Ivan Illich, one of the key social critics of the Baby Boom decades, called "virtuous practice" in the face of "deskilling," specialization, and constant change.

Ivan Illich 与人合着了一份声明，暗示了模式运动背后的一些更广泛的社会背景：

Ivan Illich co-authored a declaration that suggests some of the broader social context behind the patterns movement:

美德是具体的实践，只有在习俗塑造和限制其应用领域的地方才能存在。所谓美德，我们指的是行动的形式、顺序和方向受传统影响，受地点限制，受演员惯常能力范围内的选择限制。（凯莱 1992 年，第 48 页）

Virtue is embodied practice which can only exist where custom has shaped and limited a field for its application. By virtue, we mean that shape, order and direction of action informed by tradition, bounded by place and qualified by choices made within the habitual reach of the actor. (Cayley 1992, 48)

这些感受也反映了对专业知识“去神秘化”的渴望，Donald Schon 认为这在 80 年代被许多专业人士所接受。他提供了“反思性实践者”作为专业人士的模型，这些专业人士希望向外界和他们的社区开放他们所做的事情以及他们如何做，这是一种与软件模式社区的出现非常一致的策略。

These feelings also reflect the desire for the "demystification" of professional knowledge, which Donald Schon discusses as being embraced by many professionals during the '80s. He offered the "reflective practitioner" as a model for professionals looking to open up what they do and how they do it to the outside world and within their communitya strategy very much in keeping with the emergence of the software patterns community.

模式提供了一种方便的方式来记录软件开发的“习惯”，该领域充满了紧迫的新颖性、个人控制的丧失和不断变化的边界。模式社区为共享和揭开技术神秘面纱提供了一个良好的、老式的市政厅环境知识。

Patterns provided a convenient way for documenting the "custom" of software development in a field overrun by urgent novelty, the loss of personal control, and ever-shifting boundaries. The patterns community provided a good, old-fashioned town hall environment for sharing and demystifying technical knowledge.

9.2 模式思想

9.2 The Pattern Idea

当 Peter Coad 的文章于 1992 年发表时，该文章在一般开发人员中建立了思想共享立足点，社区的雏形已经形成。

By the time Peter Coad's article appeared in 1992, which established a mindshare toehold for the idea among developers in general, the beginnings of a community had been formed.

模式的概念似乎在 80 年代后期流行起来。会议记录来自OOPSLA86 提到模式60 次（顺便说一句，有趣的是，这是 OOPSLA 编年史中该术语在接下来十年中的最高水平）主要与人工智能、消息传递和模式匹配有关。但只有 Bertrand Meyer 的一篇论文（讨论 ADA 与面向对象语言）有一些诱人的参考，仅限于 ADA 包中的通用参数模式，这些模式可能暗示设计模式。

The notion of patterns seemed to be in the air in the late '80s. The proceedings from OOPSLA86 mention pattern 60 times (incidentally and interestingly, a high-water mark for the term in the annals of OOPSLA for the following decade)mostly in connection with AI, message-passing, and pattern-matching. But only one paper by Bertrand Meyer (discussing ADA versus object-oriented languages) had some tantalizing references, limited to patterns of generic parameters in ADA packages that perhaps hint at design patterns.

9.2.1 初步提示

9.2.1 First Hints

在1987 年，Tom DeMarco 和 Tim Lister 这两位著名的老派方法论大师出版了一本名为《Peopleware: Productive Projects and Teams》的书. 这是第一次提到模式，而不是软件模式。在研究 500 多个软件项目时，他们发现绝大多数失败的项目（相当大一部分）并不是因为技术原因而失败。相反，通常是项目的“社会学”出了问题：它的管理文化、团队设置或物理空间。在寻找解决方案时，他们将许多问题作为目标，这些问题最终出现在软件模式编写者的菜单上。例如，他们研究了处理重大管理失误的方法：“将人当作组件来管理的倾向”（DeMarco 和 Lister 1987）。他们对问题和解决方案的大部分讨论都采用隐喻的、类似论文的形式。所以，他们看到了亚历山大

In 1987, Tom DeMarco and Tim Lister, two well-known methodology gurus from the old school, published a book called Peopleware: Productive Projects and Teams. It was the first mention of patternsbut not software patterns. In studying more than 500 software projects, they found that the great majority that failed (a sizable chunk) had not failed for technological reasons. Instead, usually a project's "sociology" was at fault: its management culture, team setup, or physical space. In looking for solutions, they targeted many of the problems that have since ended up on the menu of software pattern writers. For example, they examine ways to deal with a major management failing: "a tendency to manage people as though they were components" (DeMarco and Lister 1987). And much of their discussion of the problems and solutions takes a metaphorical, essay-like form. So, they saw Alexander's ideas as a congenial base for sensible solutions to the organizational problems that were endemic to development.

同年，Ward Cunningham 和 Kent Beck 开始研究将 Alexander 的想法应用到界面设计中。肯特在俄勒冈大学读本科时发现了亚历山大。这并不太难，因为他在那里被亚历山大包围了。俄勒冈校区由亚历山大和他的同事设计，采用了亚历山大倡导并最终以书籍形式出版的原则，即俄勒冈实验(1988)。

In that same year, Ward Cunningham and Kent Beck started looking into applying Alexander's ideas to interface design. Kent discovered Alexander while he was an undergraduate at the University of Oregon. This wasn't too difficult because he was surrounded by Alexander there. The Oregon campus was designed by Alexander and his colleagues, using the principles that Alexander championed and ultimately published in book form as The Oregon Experiment (1988).

Kent Beck 几乎是潜移默化地接受了 Alexander 的想法：

Kent Beck picked up Alexander's ideas almost by osmosis:

我大一宿舍的很多学生（准确的昵称“Gonads”）都在建筑学院。因为我从六七岁起就一直在画愚蠢的房子计划，他们把我指向了克里斯托弗亚历山大的方向。在几个月的时间里，我在大学书店里读完了《The Timeless Way of Building》一书。（贝克 1994）

Many of the students in my freshman dorm (accurate nickname "Gonads") were in the School of Architecture. Since I had been drawing goofy house plans since I was six or seven, they pointed me in the direction of Christopher Alexander. I read all of The Timeless Way of Building standing up in the university bookstore over the course of several months. (Beck 1994)

过了一段时间，毕业后，他又遇到了亚历山大：

Awhile later, after graduating, he came across Alexander again:

我在泰克公司工作了一年半。我发现了一本破旧的形式综合笔记——亚历山大在第二版导言中对方法论的谴责与我的偏见产生了共鸣。似乎他没有做的一切喜欢建筑师，我不喜欢软件工程师。（贝克 1994）

I had been working at Tektronix for a year and a halfI found a battered old copy of Notes on the Synthesis of FormAlexander's excoriation of methodologists in the introduction to the second edition resonated with my biasesIt seemed everything he didn't like about architects, I didn't like about software engineers. (Beck 1994)

9.2.2 早年

9.2.2 The Early Years

肯特和一个我的朋友 Ward Cunningham 是使用 Smalltalk 的开发人员，Smalltalk 是最早的面向对象语言之一。他们还设计用户界面。一个有问题的项目变成了尝试这种称为模式的新方法的机会：

Kent and a friend, Ward Cunningham, were developers working with Smalltalk, one of the first object-oriented languages. They were also designing user interfaces. A problem project became an opportunity to try this novel approach called patterns:

Ward 和我正在咨询一个在设计用户界面时遇到困难的小组。我们决定，开着 Ward 的 VW Vanagon 在路上，尝试我们一直在研究的模式。Alexander 说建筑物的占用者应该设计它，所以我们让系统的用户设计界面。Ward 提出了一种五模式语言，帮助他们利用 Smalltalk 的优势并避免其劣势。我们对他们设计的界面的（无可否认的斯巴达式）优雅感到惊讶。（贝克 1994）

Ward and I were consulting with a group that was having trouble designing a user interface. We decided, in Ward's VW Vanagon on the way over, to try out the pattern stuff we'd been studying. Alexander said the occupiers of a building should design it, so we had the users of the system design the interface. Ward came up with a five-pattern language that helped them take advantage of Smalltalk's strengths and avoid its weaknessesWe were amazed at the (admittedly Spartan) elegance of the interface they designed. (Beck 1994)

第一个模式？

The first patterns?

  • 每窗口任务

  • Window per Task

  • 很少窗格

  • Few Panes

  • 标准窗格

  • Standard Panes

  • 名词和动词

  • Nouns and Verbs

  • 短的菜单（贝克 1994）

  • Short Menus (Beck 1994)

这些模式非常简单：Window per Task 决定哪些窗口可用，以及在其中做什么；Few Panes 和 Standard Panes 将每个窗口划分为多个窗格；名词和动词以及快捷菜单标识了每个窗格中可以完成的操作。

These patterns are very simple: Window per Task determines what windows will be available and what will be done in them; Few Panes and Standard Panes divide each window into panes; Nouns and Verbs and Short Menus identify what can be done within each pane.

不幸的是，发生翻天覆地的革命的时机还不成熟：

Unfortunately, the time wasn't quite ripe for an earthshaking revolution:

我们在奥兰多的 OOPSLA'87 上报告了这个实验的结果。我们讨论模式，直到我们脸色发青，但没有更具体的模式，没有人报名。（贝克 1994）

We reported the results of this experiment at OOPSLA'87 in Orlando. We talked patterns until we were blue in the face, but without more concrete patterns nobody was signing up. (Beck 1994)

当时似乎只有 Grady Booch 对对象设计方法感兴趣：他从他在军队的工作中得到了关于模式语言的建议。
