Only Grady Booch, who was even then concerned with object design methods, seemed interested at the time: he had a suggestion for a pattern language from his work with the military.

然后，在 1987 年到 1993 年间，许多开发人员开始对模式产生兴趣，在许多情况下是独立的。有时，他们遇见了。

Then, between 1987 and 1993, a number of developers started to take an interest in patterns, in many cases independently. Sometimes, they met.

9.2.3 想法出现

9.2.3 The Idea Emerges

布鲁斯·安德森，来自IBM 英国；Erich Gamma，当时是瑞士的一名计算机科学专业的学生；和 Richard Helm（另一位 IBM 员工）聚在一起在 EcoopOopsla90 并开始讨论模式。Erich Gamma 在攻读博士学位时一直在思考模式。他在 1991 年的论文中包含了设计模式，并在次年将其写进了书中。1991 年夏天，Erich 加入了 Richard Helm，“在一个闷热的夏日，在苏黎世的屋顶上”（Coplien 和 Schmidt 1995，ix），结果是第一个设计模式目录的开始。

Bruce Anderson, from IBM UK; Erich Gamma, at that point a Computer Science student in Switzerland; and Richard Helm (another IBMer) got together at EcoopOopsla90 and started talking patterns. Erich Gamma had been thinking about patterns as part of his Ph.D. He included design patterns in his thesis in 1991, and in the book that came out of it in the following year. The summer of 1991 saw Erich joining Richard Helm "on a rooftop in Zurich on a sweltering summer's day" (Coplien and Schmidt 1995, ix), and the result was the start of the first catalog of design patterns.

那年晚些时候，有两件事发生在OOPSLA 提供了很大的推动力。

Later that year, there were two events at OOPSLA that provided a big nudge.

首先，Peter Coad 和 Mark Mayfield 举办了一个关于提供动力的模式的研讨会。研讨会努力制定一个议程，其中包括定义模式、确定一些模式并弄清楚它们的影响。一个结果是在相当大的范围内列出一长串潜在模式。另一个是认识到需要做大量工作才能使它们有用，尤其是在开发模板或标准格式方面。计划在次年重复该研讨会。

First, Peter Coad and Mark Mayfield conducted a workshop on patterns that supplied momentum. The workshop struggled with an agenda that included defining patterns, identifying a few, and figuring out their impact. One result was a long list of potential patternsover quite a range. Another was a recognition that a lot of work was needed to make them usefulespecially in the area of developing templates or standard formats. Plans were laid to repeat the workshop the following year.

然后，布鲁斯·安德森 (Bruce Anderson) 举办了一个关于开发架构手册的研讨会。事实证明，这是模式文化的开创性事件，也是模式社区的起点。许多后来成为塑造模式运动的关键参与者的人都在那里。

Then, Bruce Anderson ran a workshop on developing an architecture handbook. This turned out to be the seminal event for the culture of patterns and the starting point for the patterns community. Many of the people who would later turn out to be key participants in shaping the patterns movement were there.

布鲁斯·安德森 (Bruce Anderson) 工作室发生的事情的 WikiWikiWeb 故事给人一种夏令营氛围的感觉，这种氛围帮助激发了开端：

The WikiWikiWeb story of what happened in Bruce Anderson's workshop gives a sense of the summer camp atmosphere that helped spark the beginnings:

[C] 相互矛盾的未来愿景弥漫在空气中。Kent Beck 的未来愿景是模式。当 Bruce 让小组两人一组为建筑手册编写条目时，Kent 抓住了 Ralph [Johnson]。他们花了一个小时左右写下 8 或 9 个使用 HotDraw [一种图形元工具] 的模式，然后强制要求Norm Kerth 成为他们的测试对象。他们教他模式，然后当需要向小组展示他们的作品时，他们让 Norm 通过实时和未经排练的设计数据流图编辑器来展示它。Ralph 和 Kent 都认为这是一个巨大的成功. （肯特和拉尔夫在 1997 年的建筑研讨会上）

[C]onflicting visions of the future were in the air. Kent Beck's vision of the future was patterns. When Bruce told the group to work in pairs to write an entry for the Architecture Handbook, Kent grabbed Ralph [Johnson]They spent an hour or so writing down 8 or 9 patterns for using HotDraw [a graphics meta-tool] and then coerced Norm Kerth into acting as their test subject. They taught him the patterns, and then when it came time to present their entry to the group, they had Norm show it off by designing a dataflow diagram editor, in real-time and unrehearsedBoth Ralph and Kent thought it was a fabulous success. (Kent And Ralph At The Architecture Workshop 1997)

玩乐结束后，拉尔夫·约翰逊将图案带回家，很快发现它们需要帮助：

After the fun was over, Ralph Johnson took the patterns home with him, and soon discovered that they needed help:

一个月后，拉尔夫看着这些图案，认为它们看起来光秃秃的、虚弱的。除非对它们进行更好的解释，否则没有人会理解它们。他不明白为什么一个月前他会如此兴奋，但相信自己的热情记忆，他把这几行充实成几页，开始传阅。（肯特和拉尔夫在 1997 年的建筑研讨会上）

A month later, Ralph looked at the patterns and thought they looked bare and feeble. Nobody would understand them unless they were better explained. He couldn't understand why he had been so excited a month before, but trusting the memory of his enthusiasm, he fleshed out the few lines into a few pages, and started circulating them. (Kent And Ralph At The Architecture Workshop 1997)

以他的学生为实验对象，拉尔夫得出结论，模式需要某种结构才能有效学习（肯特和拉尔夫将它们写成单独的段落）。拉尔夫回到概念根源提出了一种格式：

Using his students as guinea pigs, Ralph came to the conclusion that some sort of structure was needed for the patterns to be effective for learning (Kent and Ralph had written them up as individual paragraphs). Ralph went back to the conceptual roots to come up with a format:

我再次研究了 Alexander 的模式语言，并意识到每个模式都依赖于示例，并且他根据建筑材料属性或社会交互的基础理论为他的模式提供了解释。我将示例与模式结合起来。[并] 把第一个模式中的设计理论足以定义主要词汇，并将其余部分尽可能放在模式中。模式是自 1992 年初以来分发的 HotDraw 版本的唯一文档，用户说他们对此很满意。一旦我弄清楚了格式，编写模式就不难了。（约翰逊 1995）

I studied Alexander's pattern language again, and realized that each pattern relied on examples and that he provided explanations for his patterns in terms of underlying theories of the properties of building materials or social interactionI integrated the examples with the pattern[and] put enough of the theory of design in the first pattern to define the main vocabulary and put the rest as far down in the patterns as possibleThe patterns are the only documentation for a version of HotDraw that has been distributed since early 1992, and users say they are satisfied with itWriting the patterns was not hard once I figured out the format. (Johnson 1995)

同时，在平行轨道上，来自 AT&T 的 Jim Coplien 制作了一个系列早在 1989 年就在 AT&T 流行的成语（特定于语言的 C++ 模式）的集合。1991 年，它们作为一本书出版， Advanced C++ Programming Styles and Idioms (Coplien 1991)。（吉姆和拉尔夫从此成为模式社区的书挡，当社区似乎与最初的精神和意图失去联系时，每个人都充当良心和刺激者。）到 1992 年，吉姆也接触到了亚历山大。

Meanwhile, on a parallel track, Jim Coplien from AT&T had produced a collection of idioms (language-specific C++ patterns) that were making their way around AT&T as early as 1989. In 1991, they were published as a book, Advanced C++ Programming Styles and Idioms (Coplien 1991). (Jim and Ralph have since become the bookends of the pattern community, each acting as conscience and goad when the community seems to lose touch with the original spirit and intentions.) By 1992, Jim had been exposed to Alexander as well.

IBM 本身也对此产生了兴趣：Bruce Anderson，现在是模式研讨会的教父，并且仍然是 IBM 员工，于 1993 年 5 月在其 Thornwood 教育中心举办了一个由 IBM 赞助的研讨会，许多人来自早期的模式社区出席。

IBM itself became interested: Bruce Anderson, by now godfather of patterns workshops and still an IBMer, held a workshop that IBM sponsored at its Thornwood education center in May 1993, with many from the inchoate patterns community in attendance.

9.2.4 PLoP 的开端

9.2.4 The Beginnings of PLoP

1993 年 8 月看到了一些最初的建筑手册研讨会参与者，以及其他人，如 Jim Coplien，躲在科罗拉多州由 Kent Beck 和 Grady Booch 发起的山区度假胜地。他们的任务是：“评估模式作为对这个问题的回答，对象之后是什么？”（Coplien 1994a）。

August 1993 saw a number of the original Architecture Handbook workshop participants, and others such as Jim Coplien, holed up at a mountain retreat in Colorado initiated by Kent Beck and Grady Booch. Their mandate: "evaluating patterns as an answer to the question, What comes after objects?"(Coplien 1994a).

他们决定成立一个正式的小组来赞助模式方面的进一步工作，包括后来成为程序会议系列 (PLoP) 的模式语言。在山坡上进行了一次“气喘吁吁”的会议后，他们直接使用 Alexander 的模式并考虑为该团队设计办公室，他们称他们的团队为Hillside Generative Patterns Group 。他们使用了这个词生成最初是为了表明他们想要像克里斯托弗·亚历山大作为规划和建设的创造性工具那样工作的模式，而不仅仅是那些“捕捉观察”的模式（Cunningham 和 Beck 1997）。

They decided to start a formal group to sponsor further work on patterns, including what was to become the Pattern Languages of Program conference series (PLoP). They called their group the Hillside Generative Patterns Group, after spending a "breathless" session on a hillside working with Alexander's patterns directly and thinking about a design for an office for the group. They used the term generative originally to indicate that they wanted patterns that worked like Christopher Alexander'sas creative tools for planning and building, rather than simply those that "captured observations" (Cunningham and Beck 1997).

第一个 PLoP 的计划始于 1994 年 4 月。Richard Gabriel 加入了这个小组，当时他是斯坦福大学的计算机科学教授，他在 1992 年开始认真研究 Alexander 的想法。他还是一位苦苦挣扎的诗人，适合小组的文化出色地：

Planning for the first PLoP started in April 1994. The group was joined by Richard Gabriel, then a professor of computer science at Stanford who had started looking into Alexander's ideas seriously in 1992. He was also a struggling poet and fit the culture of the group well:

我们想要一些真正古怪和不寻常的东西......[Dick Gabriel] 告诫我们所有人要充满信心地进入 PLoP，并且表现得好像我们知道自己在做什么一样。8 月 4 日，大约 80 人聚集在伊利诺伊州蒙蒂塞洛附近的阿勒顿公园庄园，以完成这项工作。事情进展顺利，甚至天气也很配合。Ward Cunningham 和 Ralph Johnson 分别担任项目主席和会议主席。Kent 刚刚迎来了一个新的家庭成员，却没能成功。PLoP 程序于 1995 年 5 月出版，名称为“程序设计的模式语言”。（坎宁安和贝克 1997）

We wanted something really wacky and unusual[Dick Gabriel] exhorted us all to go into PLoP with confidence and act as though we knew what we were doing. On August 4, about 80 people came together at the Allerton Park estate near Monticello, Illinois, to do just that. Things went well, with even the weather cooperating. Ward Cunningham and Ralph Johnson were program and conference chair, respectively. Kent, who had just welcomed a new addition to his family, couldn't make itThe PLoP proceedings came out in May, 1995, as "Pattern Languages of Program Design." (Cunningham and Beck 1997)

Jim Coplien 将 PLoP 会议视为一个“分水岭事件”（Coplien 和 Schmidt 1995，ixx）。其他一些与会者对程序员和设计师工具系列中提议的新增功能并没有那么不知所措。Robert Martin 和 C++ 大师 Coplien 一样评论道：

Jim Coplien regarded the PLoP conference as a "watershed event" (Coplien and Schmidt 1995, ixx). Some of the other attendees were a little less overwhelmed with the proposed new addition to the programmers' and designers' family of tools. Robert Martin, like Coplien a C++ guru, commented:

我来到 PLoP 时满怀希望，希望能参加一个充满活力和信息丰富的会议——一个务实的会议——在很多方面，这正是我得到的。提交的大部分论文都做得很好，值得一读……[但是]有几件事困扰着我。我想听听人们用某些模式讨论他们自己的成功和失败。相反，似乎有很多人在认为“模式”是“方式”、“解决方案”、长期寻求的“灵丹妙药”的会议——兴奋度高，但在许多情况下实质性低——总体上倾向于谈论模式；好像其中有某种精神意义“模式”一词（Martin 1994）

I arrived at PLoP with high hopes of a very dynamic and information packed conferencea pragmatic conferenceIn many ways, this is just what I got. The majority of the papers presented were well done and worth reading[but] there were several things that bothered meI wanted to hear people discuss their own successes and failures with certain patternsInstead, there seemed to be a lot of folks at the conference who felt that "patterns" was the "way," the "solution," the long sought "magic bullet"Excitement was high, but in many cases substance was lowthere was a tendency to talk about patterns in general; as if there was some spiritual significance in the word "pattern" (Martin 1994)

9.2.5 四人帮及以后

9.2.5 The Gang of Four and After

尽管PLoP 诞生后，Erich Gamma、Ralph Johnson、Richard Helm 和 John Vlissides 聚在一起继续 Erich 和 Richard 于 1991 年在苏黎世屋顶开始的工作。国家、三段婚姻和两个 [不相关] 后代的出生”（Gamma 等人，1995 年，第 429 页），其成果是一本关于面向对象模式的书，也是面向对象设计的重要著作之一。称为设计模式：可重用面向对象软件的元素（1995 年），它最终于 1994 年出版，正好赶上 OOPSLA94。从一开始就取得了巨大的成功：

While PLoP was being born, Erich Gamma, Ralph Johnson, Richard Helm, and John Vlissides had gotten together to continue the work Erich and Richard started on the rooftop in Zurich in 1991. After a flurry of emails, and a context that included "four countries, threemarriages and the birth of two [unrelated] offspring" (Gamma et al. 1995, 429), the result was to be the book on object-oriented patterns and one of the key works on object-oriented design. Called Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software (1995), it was finally published in 1994, just in time for OOPSLA94. It was a runaway success from the start:

它在会议上售出 750 本，是 Addison-Wesley 在会议上销售的任何技术书籍的最高销量的七倍多。这本书仍然做得很好。事实上，《面向对象编程杂志》 (JOOP) 将其评为（在 1995 年 9 月发行的）1995 年最好的面向对象书籍和有史以来最好的面向对象书籍。（坎宁安和贝克 1997）

It sold 750 copies at the conferencemore than seven times the highest number of any technical book Addison-Wesley had ever sold at a conference. The book is still doing very well. In fact, Journal of Object-Oriented Programming (JOOP) named it (in their September 1995 issue) both the best object-oriented book of 1995, and the best object-oriented book of all time. (Cunningham and Beck 1997)

罗伯特·马丁的反应突出了这本书的重要性：

Robert Martin's reaction highlights the significance of the book:

对于我们中的一些人来说，Gamma 书中的模式并不新鲜。多年来，我们一直在使用类似的技术。然而，新的是给它们命名和标准形式并将它们放入目录中的概念。给这些模式命名和标准形式允许我们对它们进行推理，并将它们用作我们设计中的正式组件。对它们进行编目使我们这些没有自己偶然发现这些技术的人可以访问它们。（马丁 1994）

For some of us, the patterns in Gamma's book are not new ideas. We have been using techniques like them for years. What is new, however, is the notion of giving them names and standard forms and putting them in a catalog. Giving these patterns names and standard forms allows us to reason about them, and to use them as formal components in our designs. Cataloging them makes them accessible to those of us who have not stumbled across the techniques on our own. (Martin 1994)

编目员后来被称为四人帮，以 70 年代中国共产党的反毛派命名，这本书及其图案经常被引用为四人帮图案。

The cataloguers came to be known as the Gang of Four, named after the anti-Mao faction in the Chinese Communist Party in the '70s, and the book and its patterns are frequently cited as Gang of Four patterns.

其他作品开始出现。1995 年，Peter Coad 以他的书《对象模型：策略、模式和应用程序》（Coad 1996）重新出现，这本书打破了队伍，强调追随 Alexander。相反，他建议将软件模式视为模板和示例，而无需任何无关的哲学包袱——正在进行的争论。

Other works started appearing. In 1995, Peter Coad resurfaced with hisbook Object Models: Strategies, Patterns, and Applications (Coad 1996),which broke ranks with the emphasis on following Alexander. Hesuggested instead that software patterns be treated as templates and examples without any extraneous philosophical baggagean ongoing debate.

PLoP1 的论文集于 1995 年以书的形式出版，由 Jim Coplien 和 Doug Schmidt 编辑（Coplien 1994a）。PLoP2 和 PLoP3 继承了这一“传统”，PLoP3 的合集由现已深信不疑的 Robert Martin (1994) 共同编辑。面向模式的软件架构：模式系统（也称为“POSA 书”）（Buschmann 等人，1996 年）已经被提及。从那时起， Martin Fowler 的Analysis Patterns (1997) 等书籍扩展了该类型的范围，William J. Brown、Raphael C. Malveau、William H 的AntiPatterns: Refactoring Software, Architectures, and Projects in Crisis (1998) . Brown、Hays W. McCormick III 和 Thomas J. Mowbray 开辟了不同的方式来使用模式概念。

The proceedings from PLoP1 were published in book form in 1995, edited by Jim Coplien and Doug Schmidt (Coplien 1994a).PLoP2andPLoP3carried on this "tradition" with PLoP3's collection co-edited by a now convinced Robert Martin (1994). Pattern-Oriented Software Architecture: A System of Patterns(also called "the POSA book") (Buschmann et al. 1996) has already been mentioned. Since then, books such as Analysis Patterns (1997) by Martin Fowler have extended the scope of the genre, and AntiPatterns: Refactoring Software, Architectures, and Projects in Crisis (1998) by William J. Brown, Raphael C. Malveau, William H. Brown, Hays W. McCormick III, and Thomas J. Mowbray have opened up different ways to use the pattern notion.

9.3 模式作为文献

9.3 Patterns as Literature

除了他们的技术根源，软件模式出现在 80 年代后期的另一场运动中：文学编程和文档甚至程序可以而且应该作为文学来编写的概念。文学编程的概念起源于 Donald Knuth，并从实际考虑出发对 Kent Beck 产生了显着影响：

Aside from their technological roots, software patterns emerged out of another movement in the late '80s: literate programming and the notion that documentation and even programs could beand should be written as literature. The concept of literate programming originated with Donald Knuth, and influenced Kent Beck noticeably, from practical considerations:

传统上，程序员的角色是理解问题并将该知识编码为计算机可以执行的程序。这种方法的问题在于，将计算机作为程序的消费者来关注会导致其他程序员难以理解的程序。一个有文化的程序是一个文学实体，从头到尾都是为了阅读而编写的，并且承担了一本书或一篇文章的特征。文学编程扩展了程序员的角色，包括组织程序的责任，使读者自然而然地理解形成代码的决定。（贝克和坎宁安 1987）

Traditionally, the programmer's role has been to understand a problem and encode that knowledge in a program a computer can execute. The problem with this approach is that focusing on the computer as the consumer of programs leads to programs that are difficult for other programmers to understand.A literate program is a literary entity, written to be read from beginning to end, and taking on the character of a book or essay. Literate programming expands the role of the programmer to include the responsibility for organizing a program in such a way that a reader is led naturally to an understanding of the decisions that shaped the code. (Beck and Cunningham 1987)

为了生成有读写能力的程序，需要一种合适的编程语言。熟悉的没有一个是合适的。在某些方面，模式可以被视为一种可用的模型，甚至是一种替代模型。

In order to produce literate programs, an appropriate programming language was necessary. None of the familiar ones were suitable. In some ways, patterns could be seen as an available model or even as an alternative.

Christopher Alexander 的图案是自觉的文学作品。他使用类似论文的形式来构建模式，特别是描述它们解决的问题。这些文章的简单性和实用性，几乎直截了当，赋予了他的模式一种特殊的力量。他的写作质量再次简单、直接、直接，使他的模式产生共鸣。他最好的模式激起了强烈的情感反应，并促使读者做出创造性的反应。

Christopher Alexander's patterns are self-conscious literature. He uses an essay-like form for structuring patterns and, in particular, for describing the problems they solve. The simplicity and practicality of these essays, almost stark in their directness, gives his patterns a special power. The quality of his writingagain simple, straightforward, and directgives his patterns a resonance. The best of his patterns provoke strong emotional reactions and urge a creative response in their readers.

例如，一种名为“在街上跳舞”的模式讨论了鼓励人们在街上跳舞的身体条件。他指出，在大多数文化的音乐和戏剧中，在街上跳舞是“至高无上的欢乐形象”，并提到“在街上转来转去，陷入恍惚状态的巴厘岛舞者”。但是，他感叹道，它在我们的文化中基本上已经消失了。他建议可能有机会在街上重新引入舞蹈，并说：

For example, a pattern called Dancing in the Street talks about the physical conditions that will encourage people to do just thatdance in the streets. He notes that dancing in the street is an "image of supreme joy" in the music and theater of most cultures, and mentions "Balinese dancers who fall into a trance whirling around in the street." But, he laments, it has mainly disappeared in our culture. He suggests that there may be opportunities to reintroduce dancing in the street and says:

[T] 正确的设置可以实现它并让它扎根。要点很简单：音乐家的平台，也许有封面；演奏台周围都是适合跳舞的坚硬表面；供想要观看和休息的人坐下和倚靠的地方；提供一些饮料和点心（一些墨西哥演奏台有一种漂亮的方式，可以在演奏台的底部建造小隔间，这样人们就会被舞者吸引到音乐中喝水果饮料或啤酒。（Alexander，Ishikawa , 和 Silverstein 1977, 321)

[T]he right setting can actualize it and give it roots. The essentials are straightforward: a platform for the musicians, perhaps with a cover; hard surface for dancing, all around the bandstand; places to sit and lean for people who want to watch and rest; provision for some drink and refreshment (some Mexican bandstands have a beautiful way of building tiny stalls into the base of the bandstand, so that people are drawn through the dancers and up to the music for a fruit drink or a beer (Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977, 321)

理想情况下，人们认为软件模式也应该这样做。而且，正如 Alexander 更人性化的构建方式吸引了软件开发人员的注意，文学作品（包括 Alexander）提供了一种更人性化的交流方式，类似于Koans、Metaphors 和 Parables（Coram 1997）。

Ideally, it was felt that software patterns should do the same. And, just as Alexander's more human way of building captured the attention of software developers, literature (including Alexander) offered the promise of a more human way of communicatingsimilar to Koans, Metaphors, and Parables (Coram 1997).

模式社区试图通过将软件模式视为一种文学体来实现这一理想，并将模式编写视为一种创造性练习，以培养创造性写作的方式进行培养：通过研讨会、公开发表和讨论以及共同审查. 这种态度贯穿于对个别作者作品的尊重：

The patterns community has attempted to meet this ideal by treating software patterns as a body of literature, and by treating pattern-writing as a creative exercise to be nurtured the way creative writing is nurtured: through workshops, open publication and discussion, and communal review. This attitude carries through to a respect for the work of individual authors:

当你仔细检查 [PLoP1] 的内容时，你会观察到丰富多样的模式形式。我们尽一切努力保留作者的原始形式。我们尽可能避免篡改个人表达：我们没有尝试强制执行统一的写作风格。虽然这本书缺少一个作者的声音，但我们别无选择。我们希望您能与我们一起在新文学体的形成阶段庆祝这种多样性。（Coplien 和 Schmidt 1995，ixx）

As you examine the contents of [PLoP1] carefully you will observe a rich diversity of pattern forms.We made every effort to preserve the authors' original forms. We avoided tampering with individual expression as much as possible: We made no attempt to enforce a uniform writing style. Although the book lacks the voice of a single author, we wouldn't have it any other way. We hope you join us in celebrating this diversity in the formative stage of a new body of literature. (Coplien and Schmidt 1995, ixx)

随着文学倾向的出现，人们开始关注反思、内省和作为知识来源的经验，而不是被认为是当前对新事物的痴迷：

Along with the literary bent came a focus on reflection, introspection, and experience as a source of knowledge, as opposed to what is perceived as a current obsession with the new:

[PLoP 的创始人] 已经意识到，他们的学科的进步受到其文学偏见的限制——这是科学出版传统的产物——偏爱新的、最近的发明或发现，而不是普通的、不不管多么有用。创始人对普通事物的兴趣可能来自于他们的观察，即尽管采用了最新技术，但项目仍会因缺乏普通解决方案而失败。[他们都]同意将注意力集中在解决方案的传播上。（约翰逊和坎宁安 1995，ix-x）

[The founders of PLoP] had come to realize that the advance of their discipline was limited by a bias in its literaturea product of the traditions of scientific publicationto favor the new, the recent invention or discovery, over the ordinary, no matter how useful. The founders' interest in the ordinary may have comefrom their observations that projects fail despite the latest technology for lack of ordinary solutions. [They all] agreed to focus their attention on the dissemination of solutions. (Johnson and Cunningham 1995, ix-x)

然而，尽管模式社区的实践很好地满足了模式作为文学的想法，但结果很少能达到理想。软件开发人员是软件开发人员而不是作家（通常），他们通常更喜欢具体的和定义的，而不是难以捉摸和暗示的。因此，在对模式文献的任何评论中，硬币的另一面是显而易见的：大量的模板和食谱，以及很少的文章创造这啊哈反应，因为它被称为。

However, although the idea of patterns-as-literature is well served by the practices of the patterns community, the results rarely live up to the ideals. Software developers being software developers and not writers (usually), they are typically more comfortable with the concrete and defined than the elusive and allusive. And so, the opposite side of the coin is apparent in any review of the patterns literature: an abundance of templates and recipes, and very few essays that create the aha reaction, as it's called.

对于那些拥有必要技能并需要补充文学抱负的模式作家来说，结果接近于真正的文学：想到吉姆科普林和迪克加布里埃尔。以下“简单易懂的代码”是来自 Dick Gabriel 的示例：

For those pattern writers who have the necessary skills and needs to complement literary ambitions, the results verge on real literature: Jim Coplien and Dick Gabriel come to mind. The following "Simply Understood Code" is an example from Dick Gabriel:

简单易懂的代码

在程序的最低层是代码块。这些是需要了解的地方才能自信地对程序进行更改，最终彻底理解一个程序需要理解这些块。

* * *

在许多代码片段中，迷失方向的问题很严重。人们不知道代码的每个组成部分是做什么用的，因此他们会承受相当大的精神压力。

假设您正在编写一段代码，它并不复杂到需要大量文档的地步，或者它不够重要，以至于编写此类文档的麻烦是值得的，尤其是当代码本身足够清晰时。您应该如何编写这段代码？

Simply Understood Code

at the lowest levels of a program are chunks of code. These are the places that need to be understood to confidently make changes to a program, and ultimately understanding a program thoroughly requires understanding these chunks.

* * *

In many pieces of code the problem of disorientation is acute. People have no idea what each component of the code is for and they experience considerable mental stress as a result.

Suppose you are writing a chunk of code that is not so complex that it requires extensive documentation or else it is not central enough that the bother of writing such documentation is worth the effort, especially if the code is clear enough on its own. How should you approach writing this code?

人们需要盯着代码才能充分理解它，从而安心地对其进行更改。花时间从一个窗口切换到另一个窗口或上下滚动以查看代码片段的所有相关部分会分散注意力，从而无法理解代码并获得修改代码的信心。

People need to stare at code in order to understand it well enough to feel secure making changes to it. Spending time switching from window to window or scrolling up and down to see all the relevant portions of a code fragment takes attention away from understanding the code and gaining confidence to modify it.

人们可以更容易地理解他们可以按照自然文本阅读顺序阅读的内容；对于西方文化，这通常是从左到右，从上到下。

People can more readily understand things that they can read in their natural text reading order; for Western culture this is generally left to right, top to bottom.

如果不能自信地理解代码，它就会被意外破坏。

If code cannot be confidently understood, it will be accidentally broken.

因此，安排代码的重要部分使其适合一页。让从上到下阅读它的人可以理解该代码。不需要重复扫描代码来了解数据是如何使用的以及控制是如何移动的。

Therefore, arrange the important parts of the code so it fits on one page. Make that code understandable to a person reading it from top to bottom. Do not require the code to be repeatedly scanned in order to understand how data is used and how control moves about.

* * *

* * *

这种模式可以通过使用以下模式来实现：

This pattern can be achieved by using the following patterns:

  • LocalVariablesDefinedAndUsedOnOnePage，它试图将局部变量保留在一页上。

  • LocalVariablesDefinedAndUsedOnOnePage, which tries to keep local variables on one page.

  • AssignVariablesOnce，它试图通过只更改一次变量来最大程度地减少代码扫描。

  • AssignVariablesOnce, which tries to minimize code scanning by having variables changed just once.

  • LocalVariablesReassignedAboveTheirUses，它试图在从上到下扫描时在使用变量值之前使变量值明显。

  • LocalVariablesReassignedAboveTheirUses, which tries to make a variable's value apparent before its value is used while scanning from top to bottom.

  • MakeLoopsApparent，它可以帮助人们理解程序中非线性的部分，同时保留线性扫描它们的能力。

  • MakeLoopsApparent, which helps people understand parts of a program that are non-linear while retaining the ability to scan them linearly.

  • 使用FunctionsForLoops，它将涉及多个状态变量的复杂循环结构打包成块，每个块都可以很容易理解。（科普林 1997）

  • Use FunctionsForLoops, which packages complex loop structure involving several state variables into chunks, each of which can be easily understood. (Coplien 1997)

对于面向模板（和“实用”）的模式编写者来说，他们的技能和需求绝对是技术性的，专注于创建文献可能会导致一些人称之为“乏味”的冗长之处。但是两个派系在模式中都有自己的位置社区。

For the template-oriented (and "practical") pattern writers, whose skills and needs are decidedly technical, the focus on creating a literature can result in what some have called "tedious" verbiage. But both factions have their place in the patterns community.

9.4 软件模式的类型

9.4 Types of Software Patterns

有如有多少软件模式格式就有多少模式定义，模式社区中几乎有多少思想流派描述了可接受的各种风格。最明显的区别是生成模式和非生成模式之间的区别。方便的是，每种类型都与一种特定格式相关联，用于构建生成的模式。

There are as many software pattern formats as there are definitions for patterns, and there are almost as many schools of thought within the patterns community that delineate various flavors of acceptability. The clearest distinction is between generative and non-generative patterns. Conveniently, each type is associated with a particular format for structuring the resulting patterns.

正如我已经提到的，生成能力可以被视为促进创造性地解决问题的能力。生成性是间接的，不是直接来自模式，而是来自它所暗示和使之成为可能的创造性机会。

As I've already mentioned, generativity can be seen as a capacity for facilitating a creative resolution to a problem. Generativity is indirect, not coming from the pattern directly but from the creative opportunities that it suggests and makes possible.

生成模式与构建行为有关。它们旨在体现亚历山大的理想，尽管没有人认真地创造出一种与亚历山大的范围和野心相匹配的模式语言。

Generative patterns are concerned with the act of building. They are meant to embody the Alexandrian ideals, although no one has seriously created a pattern language that matches the scope and ambition of Alexander's.

在生成模式中，对问题的讨论最为重要，因为它为理解和重新设计解决方案提供了基础。Jim Coplien 的赞助人模式（我将在第 9.4.1 节“CoplienForm”中详细讨论）是生成模式的一个示例。其中，对问题的讨论包括力量和基本原理，以及简单的问题陈述本身。留给读者找出实现赞助人在他们的开发项目中的角色的最佳方式。我称这些模式CoplienForm，在他们之后鼻祖。

In generative patterns, the discussion of the problem is most important because it provides the basis for understanding and reworking the solution. The Patron pattern from Jim Coplien (which I will discuss in detail in the section 9.4.1, "CoplienForm" ), is an example of a generative pattern. In it, the discussion of the problem includes the forces and the rationale, as well as the simple problem statement itself. It's left to the reader to figure out the best way to realize the role of a patron for their development project. I call these patterns CoplienForm , after their originator.

另一方面，非生成模式是有启发性的，解决方案才是最重要的，问题陈述是为了观察和实践而不是暗示。

On the other hand, a non-generative pattern is instructive, the solution is what's important, and the problem statement is meant to be observational and practical rather than suggestive.

非生成模式旨在具有描述性和可用作最佳实践的个人陈述，最终作为模板。他们关心的是使用模式来演示和解释对正常设计问题的重复出现的良好解决方案的构建工件。

Non-generative patterns are meant to be descriptive and useable as individual statements of best practiceultimately as templates. They are concerned with the artifacts of buildingusing patterns to demonstrate and explain recurring good solutions to normal design problems.

这些通常称为 Gamma 或 Gang of Four 模式，我称它们为GammaForm模式。它们起源于设计模式一书（Gamma 1995），并且在面向对象的杂志中经常出现这样的例子。它们的意图与亚历山大提供的另一个定义更加一致：

These are frequently called Gamma, or Gang of Four, patternsI'll call them GammaForm patterns. They originated in the book Design Patterns(Gamma 1995),and examples pop up frequently in object-oriented magazines. They're more closely aligned in intent with another definition that Alexander provides:

简而言之，模式既是世界上发生的一件事情，也是告诉我们如何创造那件事情以及何时必须创造它的规则。它既是过程又是事物；既描述了有生命的事物，也描述了生成该事物的过程。(亚历山大 1979, 247)

The pattern is, in short, at the same time a thing, which happens in the world, and the rule which tells us how to create that thing, and when we must create it. It is both a process and a thing; both a description of a thing which is alive, and a description of the process which will generate that thing. (Alexander 1979, 247)

在这两种格式之间，重点有所不同，这使得它们对不同的受众和不同的任务很有用。由此产生的风格和用法上的差异意味着想要充分利用现有模式的模式用户都必须理解它们。

Between these two formats, there's a difference in focus that makes them useful to different audiences and different tasks. The resulting differences in style and usage mean that they both have to be understood by a pattern user wanting to make the most of the patterns that are out there.

但是不要紧。目的不同；方法不同。软件模式的用户受益于不同格式和原理的灵活性，以及​​能够挑选和选择要使用/重用的模式，而不必担心文档格式不当。这是软件开发中的一个领域，其中没有标准是一种福气。

But no matter. The purposes are different; the approaches are different. A user of software patterns benefits from the flexibility of different formats and rationales, and from being able to pick and choose patterns to use/reuse without having to worry about the documentation being inappropriately formatted. This is one area in software development in which the lack of a standard is a blessing.

9.4.1 复制表格

9.4.1 CoplienForm

这是一个Coplien 格式的细分，按部分：

Here's a breakdown of Coplien's format, by section:

  • 姓名 

    吉姆建议，在选择模式名称时，应像选择长子的名字一样谨慎。尽管 GammaForm 名称往往是标志性的和“硬的”（例如，Façade 和 Adapter），但 CoplienForm 模式的名称往往具有暗示角色或关系并描述解决方案的名称（例如，Patron 或 Architect Also Implements）。

  • Name 

    Jim suggests that the name for a pattern should be chosen with as much care as the name for a firstborn child. Although GammaForm names tend to be iconic and "hard" (for example, Façade and Adapter), CoplienForm patterns tend to have names that suggest roles or relationships and that describe the solution (for example, Patron or Architect Also Implements).

  • 问题 

    要解决的问题：这种模式有助于实现什么任务？它在回答什么问题？

  • Problem 

    The question to be resolved: What task is this pattern helping to make possible? What question is it answering?

  • 语境 

    这就是您如何帮助模式从业者确定模式的适用性。有两件事需要考虑：

    • 需要哪些更大规模的上下文信息？（例如，语言/技术架构/业务领域/基础设施问题。）

    • 这种模式在特定情况下能否奏效的关键成功因素是什么？

    鉴于缺乏模式语言来提供上下文，这两个考虑因素是最重要的。例子在这里很有用。Coplien 还建议，如果有任何预期已经采用的模式，可以在此处提及。

  • Context 

    This is how you help the pattern practitioner determine the applicability of a pattern. There are two things to consider:

    • What larger-scale contextual information is necessary? (For example, language/technical architecture/business domain/infrastructure concerns.)

    • What are the critical success factors to this pattern that will make it work or not in a given situation?

    Given the absence of a pattern language to provide a context, these two considerations are paramount. Examples can be useful here. Coplien also suggests that if there are any patterns that were expected to have been employed already, they can be mentioned here.

  • 军队 

    奇怪的是，模式应该既明显又令人费解。它应该确定需要解决的要素，使其不仅仅是一次性解决方案或陈词滥调。同时，要避免自作聪明，以防万一。模式中的力量是所有这些变得清晰的地方。一个好的模式可以简洁地描述为什么解决方案不是直接的或直截了当的。或者，正如 Coplien 所说，“是什么让这成为一个难题？用一种力量来解决这个问题。” 力还描述了可能（最好应该）发生冲突的元素。

  • Forces 

    Oddly enough, a pattern should be both obvious and mind-bending. It should identify the elements that need to be addressed to make it more than a one-off solution or a cliche. At the same time, it should avoid the temptation to be clever at the risk of being impenetrable. The forces in a pattern are where all of this becomes clear. A good pattern can succinctly describe why a solution isn't immediate or straightforward. Or, as Coplien puts it, "What makes this a hard problem? Capture that in a force." Forces also describe the elements that may (preferably should) be in conflict.

  • 解决方案 

    与现实生活中一样，解决方案是平衡行为。所有的力量都必须得到解决和协调。整体解决方案必须符合上下文。

  • Solution 

    As in real life, solutions are balancing acts. All the forces must be resolved and harmonized. The overall solution must fit the context.

  • 草图 

    不一定是 UML 图或类似的面向对象的图形，这可以是代表符号时尚中所涉及力量的手绘图像。Coplien 建议粗糙的手绘图形实际上更好，因为它可以具有暗示性而不是误导性的技术性。

  • Sketch 

    Not necessarily a UML diagram or similar object-oriented graphic, this can be a hand-drawn image that represents the forces involved in a symbolic fashion. Coplien suggests that a rough, hand-drawn graphic is actually better because it can be suggestive rather than misleadingly technical.

  • 结果上下文 

    环境如何因解决方案而改变？

  • Resulting context 

    How has the context changed as a result of the solution?

  • 基本原理 

    讨论问题存在的原因，是什么导致了所描述的解决方案，以及模式背后的动机。示例和扩展评论也可以包含在此处。

  • Rationale 

    Discuss why the problem exists, what lead to the solution as described, and the motivation behind the pattern. Examples and extended commentary can also be included here.

这是一个示例，取自 PLoP1 中 Coplien 的组织模式语言（Coplien 1994b）：

Here's an example, taken from Coplien's organizational pattern language in PLoP1 (Coplien 1994b):

赞助人

PATRON

问题

PROBLEM

给予一个项目的连续性。

Giving a project continuity.

语境

CONTEXT

定义角色的开发组织。Patron仅在Developer Controls Process时有效。

A development organization in which roles are being defined. Patron works only if Developer Controls Process.

军队

FORCES

  • 集中控制可能是一种拖累。

  • Centralized control can be a drag.

  • 无政府状态可能是更糟糕的拖累。

  • Anarchy can be a worse drag.

  • 大多数社会都需要国王/父母的形象。

  • Most societies need a king/parent figure.

  • 一个组织需要一个单一的最终决策者。做出决定的时间应该少于执行决定的时间。

  • An organization needs a single ultimate decision-maker. The time to make a decision should be less than the time it takes to implement it.

解决方案

SOLUTION

将项目访问权限交给一位可见的高级经理，他将支持项目的事业。赞助人可以成为项目决策的最终仲裁者，为组织快速决策提供动力。赞助人负责消除阻碍进展的项目级障碍，并对组织的“士气”（幸福感）负责。

Give the project access to a visible high-level manager who will champion the cause of the project. The patron can be the final arbiter for project decisions, which provide a driving force for the organization to make decisions quickly. The patron is accountable for removing project-level barriers that hinder progress, and is responsible for the organization's "morale" (sense of well being).

结果上下文

RESULTING CONTEXT

拥有赞助人可以为组织带来存在感，并为以后的流程和组织变革提供关注点。

Having a patron gives the organization a sense of being and a focus for later process and organizational changes.

其他角色可以根据顾客的角色来定义。

Other roles can be defined in terms of the patron's role.

管理者的角色不是做一个完全集中的控制者，而是做一个冠军。也就是说，经理的影响范围主要在产品本身的开发人员之外，但包括那些为产品的成功进行合作所必需的人员（支持组织、资助者、测试组织等）。此角色还充当赞助人或赞助商；这个人通常是一个有远见的公司。

The manager role is not to be a totally centralized control, but rather to be a champion. That is, the scope of the manager's influence is largely outside those developing the product itself, but includes those whose cooperation is necessary for the success of the product (support organizations, funders, test organizations, and so on). This role also serves as a patron or sponsor; the person is often a corporate visionary.

设计原理

DESIGN RATIONALE

  • 我在 QPW 的 Phillippe Kahn 那里观察到了这一点；塞西等人。在 AT&T的C++工作中；高生产力网络系统项目的经理；在另一个多地点 AT&T 项目中。

  • I have observed this in Phillippe Kahn in QPW; Sethi, et al. in C++ efforts in AT&T; for a manager in a high-productivity Network Systems project; and in another multi-location AT&T project.

  • 这与Firewalls模式有关。

  • This relates to the pattern Firewalls.

  • Block 谈到项目无法直接控制的影响力的重要性

  • Block talks about the importance of influencing forces over which the project has no direct control

  • “pattern”一词来自中古英语patron（以及更古老的法语patron），仍然表示“patron”和“pattern”。在 16 世纪，patron 的口音发生了变化，显然开始读作“patrn”；它被拼写为“patarne”、“paterne”和“pattern”。到 1700 年，原始形式不再用于事物，赞助人/模式在形式和意义上都有区别。“建议模仿的原作；原型；要复制的东西；范例 (J.)；值得模仿的例子或模型；特殊卓越的例子或模型”，来自中世纪术语词典。

  • The term "pattern" comes from Middle English patron (and the more ancient French patron), which still means both "patron" and "pattern." In the sixteenth century, patron, with a shifted accent, evidently began to be pronounced "patrn;" and it was spelled as "patarne," "paterne," and "pattern." By 1700, the original form ceased to be used of things, and patron/ pattern became differentiated in form and sense. "The original proposed to imitation; the archetype; that which is to be copied; an exemplar (J.); an example or model deserving imitation; an example or model of a particular excellence"from a dictionary of medieval terms.

  • 让开发人员负责流程意味着管理（请参阅防火墙）头衔与支持角色相关联。这仅适用于经理决定成为开发人员的仆人的文化（来自 Norm 的见解克思）。

  • Putting the developer in charge of the process implies that management (see Firewalls) titles become associated with support roles. This works only in a culture in which the manager decides to be the servant of the developer (an insight from NormKerth).

9.4.2 伽玛形式

9.4.2 GammaForm

伽玛形式模式是由对良好的面向对象设计的关注所激发的。它们描述了对象可以协作和通信以产生标准解决方案的方式，并且不被视为生成。相反，它们是有意观察和描述的。就各个模式之间的联系而言，这种联系是间接的而不是必要的关系。亚历山大的作品是一种灵感，但仅此而已。

GammaForm patterns are motivated by a concern for good object-oriented design. They describe ways that objects can collaborate and communicate to produce a standard solution, and are not regarded as generative. Instead, they are deliberately observational and descriptive. To the extent that individual patterns are connected, the connections are relationshipsindirect rather than necessary. Alexander's works are an inspiration, but no more.

在Design Patterns (Gamma et al. 1995) 中，差异很明显：

In Design Patterns (Gamma et al. 1995), the differences are made clear:

  • 没有软件设计的经典例子可以借鉴，当然也没有公开可见的例子。因此，对你自己的工作和你尊敬的设计师的工作进行反思和反省成为模式的额外来源，以及既定的最佳实践、经验法则和一般启发法。

  • There are no classic examples of software design to draw from, and certainly none that are publicly visible. So, reflection and introspection about your own work and the work of designers you respect becomes an additional source of patterns, as well as established best practices, rules of thumb, and general heuristics.

  • GammaForm 模式被组织为一个目录，而不是一种语言。他们的关系或使用没有有机的顺序。每个模式都可以独立存在。语境不是与更高层次的联系，当然也不是与更广泛的社会语境的联系。有趣的是，采用目录方法的一个灵感来自 Donald Knuth 的著作，他为 Kent Beck（以及其他人）提供了采用文学方法处理模式的灵感。

  • GammaForm patterns are organized as a catalog, not a language. There is no organic order to their relationships or use. Each pattern can stand alone. The context is not a connection to a higher level, and certainly not to a broader social context. Interestingly enough, one inspiration for taking a catalog approach is the writings of Donald Knuth, who provided Kent Beck (among others) with the inspiration for taking a literate approach to patterns.

  • GammaForm 问题专注于解决方案，而不是问题本身。事实上，解决方案的描述很长，并且提供了 GammaForm 模式的大部分价值。

  • GammaForm problems are focused on the solution, not the problem. In fact, the solution descriptions are lengthy and provide the bulk of the value of GammaForm patterns.

Design Patterns中引用的其他一些差异似乎反映了对 Alexander 的误解，或者至少是技术专家在处理建筑师或诗人的暗示性语言时可能做出的那种误解。例如，亚历山大的模式语言被视为确定性和规范性的。

Some of the other differences cited in Design Patterns seem to reflect a misunderstanding of Alexander, or at least the kind of misinterpretation that a technologist can make when dealing with the allusive language of the architect or poet. For example, Alexander's Pattern Language is seen as deterministic and prescriptive.

查看架构模式和 GammaForm 模式之间联系的一种简单方法是将对象视为构建组件。力量是诸如需求、约束和塑造任何解决方案的底层技术环境的元素之类的东西。然后，就像 Alexander 的模式描述了组合墙壁、窗户、通道和饮食区的方式以生成真实的生活空间一样，GammaForm 模式可以展示经过时间验证的方式来组合对象和类以创建真正的工作、生活软件。

An easy way to see the connection between architectural patterns and GammaForm patterns is to think of objects as building components. Forces are things such as requirements, constraints, and elements of the underlying technical environment that shapes any solution. Then, in the same way that Alexander's patterns describe ways to combine walls, windows, pathways, and eating areas that generate real living spaces, so GammaForm patterns can show time-proven ways to combine objects and classes to create real working, living software.

Gamma 和其他人在Design Patterns中使用的格式非常清楚地显示了与 Alexander 在形式和精神上的差异：

The format that Gamma and others used in Design Patterns shows the differences with Alexander in form and spirit very clearly:

  • 图案名称及分类 

    与 CoplienForm 一样，名称很关键。GammaForm 模式使用了一个几乎是标志性的名称，并用尽可能少的单词捕捉了解决方案的本质。例如，Façade 是一种关于使用“统一接口”的模式。

  • Pattern name and classification 

    As with CoplienForm, the name is critical. GammaForm patterns use a name that is almost iconic and captures the essence of solution in as few words as possible. For example, Façade is a pattern about using a "unified interface."

  • 意图 

    该模式解决的基本原理、动机和具体问题。

  • Intent 

    The rationale, motive, and specific problem that the pattern addresses.

  • 也被称为 

    该模式在开发社区中可能有其他名称。这些是什么？

  • Also known as 

    The pattern may have other names it goes by in the development neighborhood. What are they?

  • 动机 

    本节是亚历山大图片的（名字不好）文字版本。动机是“说明设计问题的场景”，它提供了模式如何解决问题的实际描述问题。

  • Motivation 

    This section is a (badly named) textual version of Alexander's picture. A motivation is a "scenario that illustrates the design problem," which provides a practical description of how the pattern solves the problem.

  • 适用性 

    背景和力量的混合体。描述模式适用的情况以及评估其适用性的指南。

  • Applicability 

    A mixture of context and forces. Describes situations in which the pattern is appropriate and guidelines for evaluating its fit.

  • 结构 

    “模式中类的图形表示”。在《设计模式》一书中，这是 Booch 的 OMT 类图或交互图（Gamma 等人，1995 年）。现在，我们使用 UML 表示法。实际上，草图。

  • Structure 

    A "graphical representation of the classes in the pattern." In the Design Patterns book, this is an OMT class diagram or an interaction diagram from Booch (Gamma et al. 1995). Now, we use UML notation. In effect, a sketch.

  • 参加者 

    解决方案的一部分：类及其职责。

  • Participants 

    Part of the solution: classes and their responsibilities.

  • 合作 

    解决方案的另一部分：类如何协同工作以执行解决方案。

  • Collaborations 

    Another part of the solution: how the classes work together to carry out the solution.

  • 结果 

    解决方案的另一部分，这次包括权衡和结果的讨论。

  • Consequences 

    Yet another part of the solution, this time including a discussion of tradeoffs and results.

  • 执行 

    解决方案的指令方面的扩展；应用模式时要考虑的问题。

  • Implementation 

    An extension of the instruction aspect of a solution; issues to think about when applying the pattern.

  • 示例代码 

    实施的扩展，由现实生活中的代码示例组成。

  • Sample code 

    An extension of Implementation, consisting of real-life code examples.

  • 已知用途 

    模式已在现有系统中使用的真实世界验证。

  • Known uses 

    Real-world validation where the pattern has been used in existing systems.

  • 相关模式 

    标识与此模式相似或可以与此模式一起使用的其他模式。

  • Related patterns 

    Identifies other patterns similar to this one or that this one can be used with.

如您所见，与 CoplienForm 模式有很多重叠之处。也许主要的区别在于 GammaForm 模式是专门说教的，更接近于添加了解决方案的 Kuhn 范例的拼写版本。就他们关注个人和社会转变而言，这是一种间接和专业的方式。例如，设计模式谈到 啊哈经验：

As you can see, there are many overlaps with CoplienForm patterns. Perhaps the main difference is that GammaForm patterns are specifically didactic, closer to spelled-out versions of Kuhn's exemplars with the solutions added. To the extent that they are concerned with personal and social transformation, it is in an indirect and professional way. For example, Design Patterns talks about the Aha experience:

一旦您理解了设计模式并产生了“啊哈！”的感觉。与他们一起体验，你将永远不会以同样的方式思考面向对象的设计。您将获得使您的设计更加灵活、模块化、可重用和易于理解的见解。(Gamma et al. 1995, xi)

Once you understand the design patterns and have had an "Aha!" experience with them, you won't ever think about object-oriented design in the same way. You'll have insights that make your designs more flexible, modular, reusable, and understandable. (Gamma et al. 1995, xi)

遗憾的是，GammaForm 模式通常太长，无法在此处轻松提供示例。Design Patterns是详细介绍的最佳去处介绍。

Unfortunately, GammaForm patterns are typically too long to make it easy to provide an example here. Design Patterns is the best place to go for a detailed introduction.

9.5 根源：Alexander谈模式和模式语言

9.5 The Roots: Alexander on Patterns and Pattern Languages

对于亚历山大来说，图案，比如人，不是孤立的、分离的和截然不同的。他们的价值来自他们的联系。首先要建立的是任何一种模式所具有的联系。然后，在一个模式中，通过展示它如何以提供创造性使用机会的方式连接和组合解决方案的元素来确定其价值和生成性。最后，模式被编织成一种互连的 weba 模式语言，用户可以根据特定情况的需要以无穷无尽的方式遍历该语言。

For Alexander, patterns, like people, are not isolated, separate, and distinct. Their value comes from their connectedness. What is important to establish first are the connections that any one pattern has. Then, within a pattern, establish its value and generativity by showing how it connects and combines the elements of the solution in a way that provides opportunities for creative use. Finally, patterns are woven into an interconnected weba pattern language that the user can traverse in an endless variety of ways, depending on the needs of the particular situation.

亚历山大模式的形式是轶事和散文式的。每个都以一张图片开头，代表一个原型示例。随后是作为引言的上下文描述。该描述旨在通过解释它如何帮助完成更大的模式，即通过在不同的更高尺度上识别模式语言中可以与手头的模式一起工作的其他模式，为模式提供第一级的连通性。

The form of Alexandrian patterns is anecdotal and essay-like. Each starts with a picture, which is meant to represent an archetypal example. This is followed by a description of the context as an introduction. The description is intended to provide the first level of connectedness for the pattern by explaining how it helps to complete larger patternsthat is, by identifying other patterns in the pattern language at a different higher scale that can work with the pattern at hand.

问题陈述的两个版本如下：

Two versions of the problem statement follow:

  • 第一个亚历山大配音标题：以粗体字简要说明问题的本质。

  • The first Alexander dubs the headline: a short statement of the essence of the problem in bold type.

  • 第二个版本是一个扩展的讨论，包括示例、如何“显示”和验证它的指示，以及帮助读者定位问题的任何其他内容。

  • The second version is an extended discussion that includes examples, indications of how it can be "manifested" and validated, and anything else that helps the reader situate the problem.

最后，通过醒目的“因此：”将解决方案与模式的其余部分分开：简单、简洁、直接的文本和说明完成模式的解决方案的草图。文字和图片都是必要的。它们构成了 Donald Schon 所说的“设计语言”：

Finally, separated from the rest of the pattern by a highly visible "Therefore:" comes the solution: simple, terse, straightforward text and a sketch illustrating the solution to finish the pattern. Both the words and the pictures are necessary. They constitute what Donald Schon describes as "the language of designing:"

绘画和谈话是平行的设计方式，它们共同构成了我所说的设计语言。语言和非语言维度密切相关。(Schon 1983, 41)

Drawing and talking are parallel ways of designing, and together make up what I call the language of designing. The verbal and non-verbal dimensions are closely connected. (Schon 1983, 41)

因为亚历山大是一名建筑师，他的解决方案与建筑环境有关。他的模式太长，无法在一篇文章中引用，但对典型模式的总结至少提供了其组织及其影响的一些风味。

Because Alexander is an architect, his solutions are concerned with the built environment. His patterns are too long to quote in one piece, but a summary of a typical pattern provides at least some of the flavor of both their organization and their impact.

在一个例子中，亚历山大谈到了在解决建筑入口问题时必须考虑的力量。一般情况下，建筑物与公共空间相连。语言中的上下文由处理 Main Gates 和 Half-hidden Gardens 的其他模式定义。

In one example, Alexander talks about the forces that have to be considered while solving the problem of building entrances. The general context is that a building is connected to public space. The context within the language is defined by other patterns dealing with Main Gates and Half-hidden Gardens.

所涉及的力量包括对“到达感”的需求，具体而言，是一种心理需求，表明有可能发生比公共场所常见的“街头行为”更亲密的行为。然而，从外面进来通常意味着带着这种街头行为的心理气球。

The forces involved include the need for a "feeling of arrival," specifically, a psychological need to signal the possibility of more intimate behavior than the "street behavior" common to a public space. Coming in from the outside usually means bringing this psychological balloon of street behavior along, however.

然后，对于一个房子（比如），也需要感觉进入就是进入一个私人领域。但外部世界显然是公开的，那么如何让公开到私人的转变变得明显和强化呢？（这两种“力”也相反；“离开”与到达一样重要。）

Then, for a house (for example), there's also a need to feel that entering means entering a private domain. But the outside world is visibly public, so how is the change from public to private going to be made apparent and reinforced? (Both of these "forces" work in reverse as well; "leaving" is as much a part of the picture as arriving.)

最后，还有技术力量需要考虑：在家里（再次作为一个例子），现在大多数人都是通过汽车到达和离开的。但是，汽车停在哪里以及如何停放可能取决于便利性，并增加与入口的便利性相关的力量相对于汽车的停车位。

Finally, there are technological forces to consider: at home (again as an example), most people these days arrive and leave via a car. But where and how a car is parked may be determined by convenience and add forces that are related to the convenience of the entrance with respect to the car's parking spot.

这里实际上存在三种相互关联的模式。亚历山大的三个解决方案：创建一个可见且可识别的主入口；有变化的、有层次的、明显的过渡区；并将与汽车的连接视为一种特殊形式的过渡空间。他称这些模式为 Main Entrance、Entrance Transition 和 Car Connection。他的解决方案比我的总结陈述要详细得多，而且对背景和力量的描述包括示例，而且一点也不生硬。但无论级别或主题如何，都遵循相同的元模式。在软件方面，他的模式是可扩展的，也是可重用的和架构的。

There are really three interrelated patterns here. Alexander's three solutions: create a visible and identifiable main entrance; have a varied, graduated and obvious transition area; and treat the connection to the car as a special form of transitional space. He calls these patterns Main Entrance, Entrance Transition, and Car Connection. His solutions are a great deal more detailed than my summary statement, and the descriptions of context and forces include examples and are not at all cut-and-dried. But all follow the same meta-pattern, regardless of level or topic. In software terms, his patterns are scaleable, as well as reusable and architected.

当然，Alexander 有大量的图案比这个更实体。然而，所有这些都强调可能被称为社会几何学的东西：你如何组织你在社会维度网格上构建的东西之间的关系是需要满足的。

Of course, Alexander has a large number of patterns that are more bricks-and-mortar than this one. All of them emphasize what might be called social geometry, however: the relationship between how you organize what you build on the grid of the social dimensions that are the underlying needs to be met.

就像单词组合成短语使演讲成为一种创造性行为一样，组合模式是创造性设计和构建的基础。如同在口头语言中一样，模式作为模式语言中的语言元素的默示结构化以及动态排列和重新排列它们的可能性是模式和模式语言都具有生成性和创造性的方面。

In the same way that words combined into phrases make speech possible as a creative act, patterns in combination are the basis for creative design and building. As in spoken language, a tacit structuring of the patterns as language elements in the pattern languageand the possibility of dynamically arranging and rearranging themis what gives both patterns and the pattern language a generative and creative aspect.

对于模式从业者来说，模式的相互关联性使得可能的结果成为可能，这些结果本身也是相互关联的，而且不仅仅是它们各部分的简单相加。Alexander 将此描述为“压缩”：将A与B放在一起会产生比孤立的各个部分更丰富、更健康、更好的整体，并且比简单的协同作用更具有“意义”。这种组合产生的品质仅凭单个元素是无法解释的。

For the patterns practitioner, the interconnectedness of the patterns makes possible results, which are themselves also connected and more than the simple sum of their parts. Alexander describes this as "compression": Putting Atogether with Bresults in a whole that is richer and healthier and better than the individual parts in isolation, and it is denser in "meaning"more than simple synergy. A quality emerges from the combination that is inexplicable solely in terms of the individual elements.

Alexander 的模式语言是按比例结构的。但他的规模结合了物理和社会；这不仅仅是关于“房屋数量”。它还是关于事件和互动——发生在这些房子里的生活，这种生活既源于又塑造了它们的布置和建造方式。因此，他的模式包括社会背景和评论，以讨论每个解决方案背后的驱动力。

Alexander's pattern language is structured by scale. But his scale combines the physical and the social; it is not just about "numbers of houses." It is also about the events and interactionsthe lifethat take place in those houses, a life that both derives from and shapes the way they are arranged and built. So, his patterns include social context and comment in discussing the driving forces behind each solution.

例如，在最高层次上，关于区域规模和城市与乡村物理交织的模式被称为“乡村街道的花边”的模式所激发，其中包括观察“郊区是一种过时且矛盾的人类住区形式"（Alexander、Ishikawa 和 Silverstein 1977，244）。另一个例子是 Scattered Workplaces，它谈到需要避免只容纳工作的死角：“禁止大量集中工作，周围没有家庭生活他们。”

For example, at the highest level, patterns about the size of regions and the physical interweaving of city and country are leavened by a pattern called Lace Of Country Streets, which includes the observation that "the suburb is an obsolete and contradictory form of human settlement" (Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977, 244). Another example is Scattered Workplaces, which talks about the need to avoid dead spaces where only work is accommodated: "Prohibit large concentrations of work, without family life around them."

9.6 关于这门语言的注释

9.6 A Note on This Language

这本书中的模式语言受到的批评与我对一般软件模式主体的批评相同。这里的模式没有上升到文学的高度，模式语言本身也缺乏亚历山大那种明显的联系。

The pattern language in this book is subject to the same criticisms that I've leveled at the body of software patterns in general. The patterns here don't rise to the level of literature, and the pattern language itself lacks the obvious connectedness of Alexander.

理想情况下，关于建模的模式应该能够在有用的地方结合社会维度和认知维度。同时，它们需要简洁实用。为了实现这些目标，我使用了一个框架，该框架将证明可以随着时间的推移发展这种语言，并且使用适合主题的语言结构，而不是直接遵循 Alexander 或复制任何现有的软件模式方法。

Ideally, patterns about modeling should be able to incorporate social dimensions and cognitive dimensions where these are useful. At the same time, they need to be pithy and practical. In order to achieve these goals, I used a framework that will prove serviceable for evolving this language over time, and a language structure that fits the subject matter, rather than following Alexander directly or copying any existing software patterns approach.

语言的连通性建立在其层次的递归性和习语的通用性中。它在每章正文之前的共同力量的讨论中明确表达，并在每章结束时对相关模式和其他材料进行简要说明章节。

The connectedness of the language is built into the recursiveness of its levels and the commonality of its idioms. It is explicitly expressed in a discussion of common forces that precedes the body of each chapter, and brief notes on related patterns and other material that end each chapter.

我打破了语言成水平和成语。级别（域、产品和组件）反映了正在构建的隐式架构：现代软件密集型系统的模型。这些级别本身是递归的：例如，域级别的模式也可以应用于产品级别，并且在某种程度上可以应用于组件级别。这些级别在概念上很方便，但并非无懈可击。这些成语适用于所有级别。

I broke the language into levels and idioms. The levels (Domain, Product, and Component) reflect the implicit architecture of what is being built: models of modern software-intensive systems. The levels themselves are recursive: for example, patterns at the Domain level can also be applied at the Product level, and to some extent at the Component level. The levels are conceptually convenient, but not watertight. The idioms apply across all levels.

Alexander 通过上下文部分中的引用将他的模式在级别之间和级别内连接起来。使用较少数量的模式，我为每个级别绘制了共同的力量，这些力量在该级别的许多模式中全部或部分继承。目前，层次之间的联系留给了本章开头的讨论。

Alexander connected his patterns between levels and within levels via references in the context section. With a smaller number of patterns, I drew out common forces for each level that are inherited in whole or in part across many of the patterns in that level. The connectedness between levels has been left, for the moment, to the discussion that begins a chapter.

Alexander 通过在他的模式中嵌入的非建筑引用和想法，将他的模式与生活和建筑之外的世界联系起来。我做了一点，但在大多数情况下，我依赖于使用介绍性章节和最后一节作为这些连接的位置。

Alexander connected his patterns to life and the world outside architecture through non-architectural quotes and ideas embedded in his patterns. I did this a little, but I relied, for the most part, on using the introductory chapters and this end section as the location for those connections.

因此，在某种程度上，我塑造语言的解决方案是妥协，可能会随着模式的增多而消失。然而，它们也代表了关于像这样的语言应该如何理想化的最初想法成形。

So, to some extent, my solutions to shaping a language are compromises that may disappear with more patterns. However, they also represent first thoughts on how a language like this one should ideally be shaped.

9.7 模式的重要性

9.7 The Importance of Patterns

我已开始本章通过将模式与软件开发的其他工件区分开来，强调它们的社会、学习和非技术特性。我详细介绍了模式的历史，以便为它们提供人性和社会面孔，并让读者了解像模式这样不同的东西如何作为集体学习自然地出现，以响应关键的专业需求。我探索了两种重要的模式替代形式，以强调模式思想的灵活性。这两种形式不是竞争，而是互补。然而，要发挥作用，它们需要用户了解差异背后的原因，而这些差异绝不是表面现象。最后，我介绍了有关 Alexander 的一些重要细节，这是任何想要真正理解模式的人的基本背景。

I started this chapter by differentiating patterns from other artifacts of software development, emphasizing their social, learning, and non-technical qualities. I detailed the history of patterns in order to provide them with a human and social face, and to provide the reader with an understanding of how something as different as patterns can emerge naturally as collective learning in response to critical professional needs. I explored the two significant alternative forms for patterns in order to underline the flexibility of the pattern idea. The two formats are not competitive, but complementary. However, to be useful, they require the user's understanding of the reasons behind differences that are anything but cosmetic. Finally, I included some significant detail on Alexander, essential background for anyone who wants to really understand patterns.

剩下的就是解释为什么模式很重要，超越任何一种模式或一组模式的重要性，以及它们的发展方向。

What remains is to explain why patterns are important, beyond the importance of any one pattern or set of patterns, and where they're going.

对我来说，它们的重要性源于它们在新兴社会实践形式中支持软件设计工作和学习不变性质的方式。特别是，它们加强了软件设计实践的非技术方面——使系统工作不同于工程的部分，而不是似乎是许多信息技术专家关注的焦点的男孩玩具狂热。

To me, their importance stems from the way they support the unchanging nature of work and learning in software design, within emerging forms of social practice. In particular, they reinforce the non-technical aspects of the practice of software designthe parts that make systems work differently from engineering and more than the boys-with-toys mania that seems to be the focus of so many technologists in information technology.

协作、思想的不断变化、边界的转变以及人类社会问题从一开始就一直是系统开发实践的基石，它们抵制简单的形式化或将计算机工作变成一门科学的持续努力。模式缺乏标准、社会性质、协作目的和起源，有助于保持与我们作为开发人员所做工作的人性化方面的联系。

The collaboration, constant churn of ideas, shifting boundaries, and human social problems that have been the bedrock of systems development as a practice since the start resist easy formalization or ongoing efforts to make working with computers into a science. Patterns, with their lack of standards, social nature, and collaborative purposes and origins, help maintain a connection with the human side of what we, as developers, do.

在这方面，他们体现并加强了发展的社会实践。本章开头关于“被盗知识”的引述来自学习研究所的 John Seeley Brown 和 Paul Duguid 的一篇文章，该研究所是 Xerox 著名的 PARC 研究实验室（1992 年）的一个分支机构。他们解释说，泰戈尔通过在课外观看和聆听音乐家的演奏来“窃取”知识，以供他自己和他人娱乐：“[只有]那时，而不是在支离破碎的教学练习中，泰戈尔才能够看到和理解音乐修养的社会实践。” 也就是说，制作音乐的方式是一种共同的行为和一种将音乐家和他们不断变化的听众联系起来的社会环境。

In this, they exemplify and enhance the social practice of development. The quote on "stolen knowledge" that starts this chapter is from a piece by John Seeley Brown and Paul Duguid of The Institute for Learning Research, an offshoot of Xerox's famous PARC research lab (1992). They explain that the Tagore "stole" knowledge by watching and listening to the musician playing outside his classes, for his own and others' entertainment: "[o]nly then, and not in dismembered didactic exercises, was Tagore able to see and understand the social practice of musicianship." That is, the way making music is about a shared doing and a social context that connects the musicians and their ever-shifting audience.

作为开发工作中和从业者之间的非正式实践过程集的基础，以及作为结果的载体，模式已被证明是实现“窃取的知识”的一种手段。

Both as the basis for an informal set of practical processes, within a development effort and between practitioners, and as a vehicle for the results, patterns have turned out to be a means of enabling "stolen knowledge."

模式也被证明是卓越的协作技术：

Patterns have also turned out to be sublime collaborative technology:

“真正的协作技术是一种允许参与者将缺乏明确行动可能性的共享体验转化为社区可以常规和有意义地处理的体验。协作技术”允许社区不断重建共享体验，以便为未来行动的成功产生更大的意义和更大的潜力。（罗舍尔 1995）

a truly collaborative technology is one which allows participants to transform a shared experience that is lacking clear possibilities for action into an experience that can be routinely and meaningfully handled by their communityCollaborative technologyallows the community to reconstruct a shared experience continually so as to produce greater meaning and greater potential for successful future action. (Roschelle 1995)

一种观察模式的方法可以揭示其几乎自相矛盾的性质情境学习和实践社区，两个相关的最新想法，以及与库恩关于科学范式的部分著作相呼应的想法。

One way to look at patterns that throws light on their almost paradoxical quality is from the perspective of situated learning and communities of practice, two recent ideas that are relatedand ones that echo parts of Kuhn's writings on scientific paradigms.

学习研究所开始使用这个词大约在模式社区形成的同时进行学习。其中一篇论文的正式定义描述了情境学习与情境学习之间的联系和实践社区：

The Institute for Learning Research started using the term situated learning at about the same time that the patterns community was forming. A formal definition from one of its papers describes the connection between situated learning and communities of practice:

情境学习……[认为]对学习和认知的探究必须认真考虑社会互动和身体活动。从情境学习研究中出现的一个统一概念是“实践社区”，即学习是通过有目的的、有模式的活动的共享而构成的。这个想法同样强调“实践”和“社区”。知识被视为做事和做事的实际能力。实践社区是通过协调使用技术（广义上包括语言）来达成共同理解的解决方案而产生的有问题的经历。（罗舍尔 1995）

Situated learning[holds that) enquiries into learning and cognition must take serious account of social interaction and physical activity. A unifying concept emerging from situated learning research is "communities of practice"the idea that learning is constituted through the sharing of purposeful, patterned activityThis idea stresses "practice" and "community" equally. Knowledge is seen as practical capability for doing and makinga community of practice arises through the coordinated use of technologies (broadly defined to include language) to arrive at mutually intelligible resolutions to shared problematic experience. (Roschelle 1995)

《财富》杂志不太正式地描述了实践社区：

Fortune magazine described communities of practice less formally:

学习的团体、实践社区具有特殊的特征。它们是自动出现的：[许多]人发现自己被一种社会和职业的力量吸引到彼此。他们直接合作，互相作为共鸣板，互相教导。（管理：想法和解决方案/前沿 1996）

Groups that learn, communities of practice, have special characteristics. They emerge of their own accord: [a number of] people find themselves drawn to one another by a force that's both social and professional. They collaborate directly, use one another as sounding boards, teach each other (Managing: Ideas and Solutions/The Leading Edge 1996)

实践社区通常被理论家定义为发生在边界明确的组织中。事实上，模式可以给组织带来的重要社会和文化好处之一就是提供促进所谓的出现的方言。 地方实践社区。然而，正如本章所描绘的模式社区的历史所表明的那样，一个基础广泛的实践社区可能会出现，它跨越组织边界，并在网络世界中重新调整社会互动和身体活动的比例。

Communities of practice have typically been defined by theorists as occurring within well-bounded organizations. And, indeed, one of the significant social and cultural benefits that patterns can bring to an organization is to provide the vernacular that facilitates the emergence of so-called local communities of practice. However, as the history of the pattern community sketched in this chapter suggests, a broad-based community of practice can emerge that crosses organizational boundaries and, in a networked world, reworks the ratio of social interaction and physical activity.

一个基础广泛的实践社区为专注于学习和分享的共同文化提供了基础，而不是规定性的和依赖于明确的规则。其原因，借用 Thomas Kuhn 的话说，范式先于规则并优先于规则——在共享范式建立后，显式规则就不再必要了。共享范式使实践社区内的正常智力活动成为可能。正如 Donald Schon 所说，个体从业者建立了“一系列例子、图像、理解和行动”（1983 年），将艺术和技术结合起来，并允许创造性地和独特地处理问题。这个曲目是从业者的概念工具包。

A broad-based community of practice provides a foundation for a common culture focused on learning and sharing, without being prescriptive and dependent on explicit rules. The reason for this, to paraphrase Thomas Kuhn, is that paradigms precede and have priority over rulesexplicit rules are not necessary after a shared paradigm is established. A shared paradigm makes possible normal intellectual activity within a community of practice. As Donald Schon puts it, an individual practitioner builds up "a repertoire of examples, images, understandings and actions"(1983) that combine art and technique, and permit problems to be dealt with creatively and uniquely. This repertoire is the practitioner's conceptual toolkit.

诸如模式社区之类的实践社区找到了通过不仅包括单词还包括动作的通用词汇表来共享这些工具包的方法和图像。

A community of practice such as the patterns community finds ways to share these toolkits via a common vocabulary that includes not only words, but also actions and images.

PLoP 和 OOPSLA 研讨会；以及由此产生的各种书籍、网页、杂志文章和讨论列表都证明了模式社区的存在。它是非正式的、自定义的和不断变化的。尽管在这些方面是短暂的，但对于塑造模式方向并提供产生新想法所必需的智力发酵的模式爱好者的核心来说非常重要。

The PLoP and OOPSLA workshops; and the various books, Web pages, magazine articles, and discussion lists that have resulted all document the existence of a patterns community. It is informal, self-defined, and ever-changing. Although ephemeral in these respects, it is very important to the core of patterns enthusiasts who shape the direction of patterns and provide the intellectual ferment necessary to generate new ideas.

就模式而言，亚历山大范式使思想家和实干家的一般社区的出现成为可能，并使他们产生的一般思想体系成为可能。并且，在促进实践社区形式的过程中，范式（使用库恩的意思）建立了最佳实践和使用方式的范例模式。

In the case of patterns, the Alexandrian paradigm made it possible for a general community of thinkers and doers to emerge, as well as making possible the general body of ideas they produced. And, in promoting a form of community of practice, the paradigm (using Kuhn's meaning) established an example for the best way to do and use patterns.

9.8 都去哪儿了？

9.8 Where Is It All Going?

彼得Coad 在 1992 年发表的Communications of the ACM文章以一条注释结尾，该注释今天仍然非常合适，通过确定仍然需要完成的工作才能使模式真正有用：

Peter Coad's 1992 Communications of the ACM article ended on a note that is still very appropriate today, by identifying work that still needs to be done to make patterns truly useful:

本文只是调查、发现和应用面向对象模式的工作的一个很小的开始。需要对模式发现和使用进行额外调查。鉴于大量的 OOA 和 OOD 结果，是否可以应用一种系统的方法来发现和分类模式？是否存在模式层次结构 如何查看示例并得出最佳使用指南？可以使用什么策略将一种模式连接到另一种模式？一种模式的出现何时意味着需要另一种伴随模式？(152-159)

This article is only a very small beginning of the work to be done on investigating, finding, and applying object-oriented patterns. Additional investigation is needed on pattern discovery and usage. Given a large number of OOA and OOD results, can one apply a systematic approach to discovering and cataloging patterns? Is there a hierarchy of patternsHow does one look at examples and derive guidelines for best usage? What strategies can be used for connecting one pattern to another? When does the occurrence of one pattern imply the need for another companion pattern? (152-159)

Jim Coplien 坚持认为模式不仅仅是面向对象的设计，它可能是避免模块化、组件式系统方法固有的潜在僵化的关键元素：

And Jim Coplien insists that patterns are going to be about something more than object-oriented design, perhaps as a critical element for avoiding the potential rigidities inherent in a modularized, component approach to systems:

当模式扎根时，[对象] 恰好是占主导地位的世界观。我相信模式是在面对复杂性时生根发芽的。对象可能有助于模式的兴起，只是因为它们与模式如此对立，并强调了对模式之类的东西的需求。亚历山大本人强调了使用预制部件建造的危险。模式提供了更广阔的软件视野，帮助我们在系统级、架构级思考软件。我认为那里有一个美好的未来。但这将是一种民间发展，它会自行开花结果，最好在没有太多有意识的指导或干预的情况下让它自己成熟。（科普林 1997）

[Objects] happened to be the predominate worldview when patterns took root. I believe patterns took root in the face of complexity. Objects may have aided the rise of patterns just because they're so antithetical to patterns, and underscore the need for something like patterns. Alexander himself underscored the danger of building from pre-manufactured parts. Patterns offer a broader view of software, helping us think about software at the system level, the architectural level. I think there's a strong future there. But it will be a folk development that will blossom of its own accord, and best be left to its own maturation without too much conscious direction or tampering. (Coplien 1997)

具有讽刺意味的是，模式的未来可能是由模式社区所摒弃的趋势所塑造的。目前，软件开发时尚的流沙更倾向于组件而不是对象。银弹的接力棒已经传承，从本质上是手工制品到现成的工业发展形式。电子商务、互联网、其他网络和千禧年的到来加剧了复杂性管理的问题。因此，尽管模式现在可能被视为对象的公认救赎，但也许很快它们就会从自身中拯救“组件件”开发。

Ironically, the future of patterns may be shaped by the very trends abjured by the patterns community. Currently, the shifting sands of software development fashion favor components over objects. The baton of the silver bullet has been passed on, from essentially handcrafted objects to a form of industrial development that is off-the-shelf. The coming of e-commerce, the Internet, other networks, and the millennium have ramped up the issue of complexity- management. So, although patterns may now be seen as the putative salvation of objects, perhaps soon they will be saving "componentware" development from itself.

不管它们还能帮助发生什么，模式已经成为软件开发未来的一部分。当他们帮助成熟明显不成熟的工艺时，他们的真正好处可能会在未来某个时候实现：

Regardless of what else they help happen, patterns have become established as a part of the future of software development. Their real benefit may be realized some time in the future when they help to mature a noticeably immature craft:

Alexander 的模式语言包含超过 250 种模式，从高级到低级组织。记录软件架构中存在的模式的目的是获得一个类似的系统，但这将慢慢来。（贝尔丘克 1994）

Alexander's pattern language contains over 250 patterns, organized from high level to low level. The goal in documenting patterns that exist in software architectures is to arrive at a similar system, but this will take time. (Berczuk 1994)

第 10 章上下文中的 UML

Chapter 10. The UML in Context

没有正确或错误的模型，只有对手头的工作更有用的模型。

Martin Fowler，分析模式 (1997, 2)

There is no right or wrong model, merely one that is more useful for the job at hand.

Martin Fowler, Analysis Patterns (1997, 2)

第 2 章，“统一建模语言”， 探讨了 UML 在软件开发传统中的根源。第 3 章，“UML 要素、元素和工件” （简要地）描述了该语言的元素和工件。当然还有第二部分中的模式已经大致了解了如何使用 UML 进行建模。本章将 UML 置于建模实践中，并讨论 UML 作为建模语言而不仅仅是开发工具的基本思想。特别是，我将探讨一些使 UML 不同于以前的建模能力的重要思想，例如它对抽象和体系结构的强调，以及它的灵活性。我打算给读者留下对 UML 形成批判性评价的基础，这将有助于了解现在如何使用它以及如何应对随着它的成熟而不可避免地重塑它的变化。

Chapter 2, "The Unified Modeling Language," explored the roots of the UML within the traditions of software development. Chapter 3, "UML Essentials, Elements, and Artifacts," described (briefly) the elements and artifacts of the language. And, of course, the patterns in Part II have given a glimpse of how to use the UML for modeling. This chapter will situate the UML in the practice of modeling and discuss the basic ideas behind the UMLbut as a modeling language, not just a development tool. In particular, I will explore some of the ideas that are important in making the UML different from previous modeling faculties, such as its emphasis on abstractions and architecture, and its flexibility. I intend to leave the reader with the basis for forming a critical appreciation of the UML, which will help to come to terms with how to use it now and how to respond to the changes that will inevitably reshape it as it matures.

10.1 为什么要制作系统模型？

10.1 Why Make System Models?

因为是在软件开发中有这么多术语的情况下，在开发系统的实践中，一定的歧义掩盖了建模、设计和构建之间的联系。

As is the case with so many terms in software development, a certain ambiguity has shaded the connections between modeling, design, and building in the practice of developing systems.

在许多方法中，有一个设计阶段不同于分析和实施阶段（例如）。部分由于大型机开发的僵化，对于许多人来说，设计实践已经成为设计阶段活动的代名词，即使在大型机文化消亡之后也是如此。Gang of Four design patterns 一书（Gamma et al. 1995）反映了这种标签；本书着重于在确定需求和在代码中实现结果之间巧妙地适应中间世界的模式。

In many methodologies, there is a design phase that is distinct from the analysis and implementation phases (for example). Partly as a result of the rigidities of mainframe development, for many the practice of design has become synonymous with the activities that are part of the design phaseeven after the demise of mainframe culture. The Gang of Four design patterns book (Gamma et al. 1995) is a reflection of this labeling; the book focuses on patterns that fit neatly into that middle world between identifying requirements and implementing the results in code.

在设计之前让需求 100% 完成并可验证地正确的旧观念（经常宣扬，很少实践）当然已经被强调迭代分析、设计和开发以及需求的逐步演化的更实用的方法所取代。特别是，越来越复杂的建模方法使开发人员能够将需求和分析活动视为设计过程的要素，并在他们的工作中使用更广泛的设计技术。

The old notion (frequently preached, seldom practiced) of getting the requirements 100 percent complete and verifiably correct before design has, of course, been replaced by more practical approaches that emphasize iterative analysis, design, and development, and the gradual evolution of requirements. In particular, increasingly sophisticated approaches to modeling have made it possible for developers to treat requirements and analysis activities as elements of the design process and to use a broader palette of design techniques in their work.

同时，在开发过程的另一端，构建代码是一项单独的活动，尽管它是由模型在合理的组织中驱动的。还应该指出的是，建模的复兴为原型制作带来了新的尊重。在某些方面，原型的构建现在是设计过程的一个元素，需要以不同于编码的方式执行。但传统意义上的编码仍然是一种个人技能，通常具有特殊的品质。它受到标准的约束，但通常是在孤独中执行的。

Meanwhile, at the other end of the development process, building code is a separate activity, although one that is driven in a sensible organization by models. It should also be noted that the resurrection of modeling has brought with it renewed respectability for prototyping. In some ways, the building of prototypes is now an element of the design process that needs to be performed differently from coding as well. But coding in the traditional sense remains a personal skill with, frequently, an idiosyncratic quality. It is constrained by standards but, it is usually executed in solitude.

相比之下，建模是一项具有公共品质的关键设计技能，与规范标准相比，它更多地受到有效沟通和描述需求的限制。设计本身已经成为一个持续的协作过程，几乎渗透到现代软件开发的所有活动中。甚至规划和管理也是由迭代的、渐进的、架构化的开发方法塑造的，这种方法既反映又鼓励建模的重新出现。因此，建模正在成为一种社区努力，有助于确保开发的内容符合预期并达成一致，而不仅仅是设计师的愿景和技术限制之间的妥协。

In contrast, modeling is a critical design skill with communal qualities, constrained more by the need to communicate and describe effectively than by prescriptive standards. Design itself has become an ongoing and collaborative process that permeates virtually all of the activities in modern software development. Even planning and management are shaped by the iterative, incremental, architected approach to development that both reflects and encourages the re-emergence of modeling. As a result, modeling is becoming a community effort that helps ensure that what is developed is what was intended and agreed upon, not just a compromise between the designer's vision and the technical constraints.

因此，“为什么要制作系统模型？”这个问题的一个答案。是它们是协作设计过程的关键，而协作设计过程正在成为当今软件开发的核心。所有这一切的一个含义是，现在必须将设计实践与开发过程分开考虑——这是查看系统设计和软件建模的通常背景。事实上，任何从事设计的人都需要了解设计实践系统开发。

So, one answer to the question of "Why make systems models?" is that they are the keys to a collaborative design process that is becoming the core of software development today. One implication of all of this is that the practice of design must now be considered separately from the process of developmentthe usual context for looking at systems design and software modeling. In fact, the practice of design needs to be understood by anyone engaged in systems development.

10.1.1 模型有什么用？

10.1.1 What Use Is a Model?

其他回答“为什么要做系统模型？”的问题 来自最终结果：模型本身。模型是通过一种技术来管理软件开发复杂性的有用方法称为抽象​​。简而言之，模型从特定视角的集合中表示系统现实的编辑细节。

Another answer to the question of "Why make system models?" comes from the end result: the models themselves. Models are useful ways to manage the complexity of software development by means of a technique called abstraction. In short, a model represents edited details of a system reality from an aggregation of specific perspectives.

因为业务建模是 UML 的有效用途之一，并且从系统的角度来看，业务是一个系统，所以模型是可以在 UML 中包含业务的系统的抽象。

Because business modeling is one of the valid uses of the UML, and a business is a system from a systems perspective, models are abstractions of a system that can include a business in the UML.

模型是（小d ）设计过程的产物：对两种简化且相互关联的现实（一种是描述性的，一种是规范性的）的解释、表示和规范。这涉及两个现实。真实世界，包括系统的上下文以及它在外部世界与之交互的事物，都需要像最终结果一样被建模。模型是关于系统的原因和方式的知识的容器。

Models are the products of the (small d) design process: interpretations, representations, and specifications of two simplified and connected realities (one descriptive and one prescriptive). There are two realities involved. The real world, including the context of the system and the things that it interacts with in the outside world, need to be modeledjust as much as the end result. Models are containers for knowledge about both the why and how of the system.

实际上，被建模的系统现实将被描述的问题空间（需求、分析和功能规范）与被规定的解决方案空间（设计、构建、测试和部署）联系起来。与人类历史上的任何其他技术不同，软件开发竭尽全力将正在解决的问题空间的解释性概念化与规范性解决方案联系起来。模型调解了这种联系。

In effect, the system reality being modeled connects the problem space being described (requirements, analysis, and functional specification) with the solution space being prescribed (design, construction, testing, and deployment). Unlike any other technology in the history of humanity, software development goes to great pains to connect an interpretive conceptualization of the problem space being addressed to a prescriptive solution. Models mediate this connection.

这就是模型的明显作用：系统设计的最终产品，系统思想的实现。不过，即使在这里，也有细微差别需要考虑。模型的风格和形状反映了在开发过程中以及在开发和客户组织中起作用的文化、社会和政治力量。模型不仅是标准化的表示，即使在最原始的开发车间也是如此。特别是 UML 模型，在文化和社会方面位于它们反映和塑造的组织和过程中。

This is the obvious role of models: the end products of system design, the realization of the idea of the system. Even here, though, there's a nuance to consider. The style and shape of a model is a reflection of cultural, social, and political forces at work in the development process and in the development and client organizations. A model is not only a standardized representation, even in the most prim development shop. And UML models, in particular, are situated culturally and socially in the organizations and processes that they both reflect and shape.

更狭义地说，即使在系统技术方面的范围内，系统的架构风格也不仅仅是架构约束和所做选择的产物，而且还是架构师有意识选择的建模构造的反映。正如 Ivar Jacobson、Martin Griss 和 Patrick Jonsson 在软件重用：业务成功的架构、流程和组织中解释的那样，“我们可以将架构风格视为可以构建的所有（良好）模型的集合”，使用这些结构 (1997, 51)。

More narrowly, even within the confines of the technical aspects of a system, the architectural style of a system is not just a product of the architectural constraints and choices that are made, but also a reflection of the modeling constructs consciously selected by the architect. As Ivar Jacobson, Martin Griss, and Patrick Jonsson explain in Software Reuse: Architecture, Process and Organization for Business Success, "[W]e can think of the architectural style as the set of all (good) models that can be built" using these constructs (1997, 51).

UML 特别迎合了将建模作为设计的活跃媒介的想法，塑造了过程和结果。原型和其他扩展功能提供图形定制。接受某些模型和图表的不完整性和不一致性有时会鼓励使用模型作为与用户和利益相关者进行持续舞蹈的姿态。视图驱动模型的概念 强化诠释的塑造力。包含灵活的包装结构提供了模型结构的变化，其目的不仅仅是技术和实施绑定。

The UML specifically caters to the idea of modeling as an active medium for design, shaping both the process and the results. Stereotypes and other extension capabilities provide for graphical customization. The acceptance of incompleteness and inconsistency as givens for some models and diagrams sometimes encourages the use of models as gestures in an ongoing dance with users and stakeholders. The notion of models being view-driven reinforces the shaping force of interpretation. The inclusion of flexible packaging constructs provides for variations in the structure of models for purposes that aren't just technical and implementation-bound.

10.2 每幅图讲述一个故事：作为建模语言的UML

10.2 Every Picture Tells a Story: The UML as a Modeling Language

开始使用 UML 的一个好地方是考虑编程语言和应用程序之间的区别。建模语言。

A good place to start with the UML is to think about the difference between a programming language and a modeling language.

与从语法（其元素的有序和正确排列）中获得其有效性的编程语言不同，建模语言依赖于其语义、每个元素中隐含的含义以及元素在概念上连接的方式以实现有用的最终结果。

Unlike a programming language, which derives its effectiveness from syntax (the orderly and correct arrangement of its elements), a modeling language relies on its semantics, the meaning implicit in each element, and the way elements connect conceptually to achieve a useful end result.

一个程序就是这么多的文本；每一段文字都具有由使用规则定义的功能意义。语法很关键：用错地方的词是没有意义的，或者（更糟的）错误。语义是只有本地源代码可以将苹果称为橙子并且仍然可以正确执行，只要意图是唯一地命名一个对象并且命名是一致的。该名称与底层操作无关。命名和标签是完全分开的。

A program is just so many pieces of text; every piece of text has a functional meaning defined by rules of usage. The syntax is critical: a word used in the wrong place is meaningless, or (worse) an error. The semantics is only localsource code can call an apple an orange and still execute properly, as long as the intent is to uniquely name an object and the naming is consistent. The name has nothing to do with the underlying operations. Naming and labeling are quite separate.

因为一个程序做某事，就像一台机器，只有指令必须是正确的。但是，没有巧妙解释的余地​​。任何聪明都留给程序创建者，通过算法和组织压缩而不是聪明的抽象。但是因为编程语言是规定性的，我们不希望解释规定，所以即使是逻辑压缩本身也被认为是编程中的不良风格，因为它迫使维护程序员解释和混淆本应明确甚至明显的含义。

Because a program does something, like a machine, only the instructions have to be correct. However, there's no room for clever interpretation. Any cleverness is left to the program creator, by means of algorithmic and organizational compression rather than clever abstraction. But because a programming language is prescriptive and we don't expect prescriptions to be interpreted, even logical compression itself is regarded as bad style in programming because it forces maintenance programmers to interpret and puzzle out meaning that should be explicit, even obvious.

模型无一例外地专注于机器。查看模型的一种方法是将其视为协作符号的结构化集合——一种抽象体系结构。语法很重要，但由于模型的存在是为了交流，而不是为了做事，所以解释才是关键。
