Models are differentless focused on the machine. One way to look at a model is as a structured collection of collaborating symbolsan architecture of abstractions. The syntax is important, but because a model exists to communicate, not do, interpretation is the key.

模型本身没有生命；它仅通过其人类解释器集体提供的意义而存在：在模型中，与程序不同，将苹果称为橙子会混淆或者可能被认为是诗意的。在展示模型时，图形句法很重要，但并不重要——符号的位置或它们的连接形状与其他任何东西一样，都是风格或方便的结果。

A model has no life on its own; it lives only through the meaning that its human interpreters provide collectively: in a model, unlike a program, calling an apple an orange will confuse or perhaps be taken as poetic. In presenting models, graphical syntax is important but not criticalthe location of symbols or the shape of their connections is as much a result of style or convenience as anything else.

这种区别是建模目的的核心，对于达到一定程度的 UML 舒适度至关重要。

This distinction goes to the heart of the purpose of modeling and is critical to achieving a level of comfort with the UML.

UML 模型本身并不是正式的规范；它们是分析、设计和管理工具。试图将它们与蓝图等同起来会使建模从业者的隐喻水域变得模糊不清，因为他们努力将建模与一个最终产品构建的软件系统联系起来。蓝图是工作图；希望它们是以明确的方式构建物理现实的严格规范。它们的目的是翻译，而不是解释和交流，所以句法比语义更重要。真正的建筑类比是将建筑图纸作为一个整体，而不仅仅是蓝图。早在 1987 年，JA Zachmann 在他关于信息系统架构框架的开创性论文中就提出了这一点。Zachman 强调，在建筑物的设计和建造中使用的每个标准建筑表示“在本质上与其他建筑不同，而不仅仅是在细节层次上”（1999 年，460）。他将这些差异作为他解释系统架构的重要部分。

UML models are not formal specifications by themselves; they are analysis, design, and management tools. Trying to equate them with blueprints muddies the metaphorical waters for modeling practitioners in an effort to tie modeling to one ultimate end productconstructed software systems. Blueprints are working drawings; they are, hopefully, rigorous specifications for constructing a physical reality in an unambiguous fashion. Their purpose is translation, not interpretation and communication, so syntax is more important than semantics. The real architectural analogy is to architectural drawings as a whole, not just to blueprints. J.A. Zachmann made this point in his seminal paper on architectural frameworks for information systems back in 1987. Zachman emphasized that each standard architectural representation used in the design and construction of a building "differs from the others in essence, not merely in level of detail" (1999, 460). He made those differences an important part of his explanation of system architecture.

区别不仅在于内容和详细程度；它也是目的和绘图行为（或建模，在软件系统的情况下）影响过程的方式。在为什么建筑师画, Edward Robbins 谈到了建筑师制作的不同类型的图纸，从那些非常个人化和概念化的图纸到工作图纸，以及为建筑商和律师制作的“在设计过程结束时生成的常规表示”。“[W] 除了工作图纸，一个人如何选择绘画暗示了一系列复杂的观点”，这些观点在不同类型的图纸中有选择地呈现 (1994, 27)。艺术和实用性在于选择，也在于结果；绘制形状的行为是超出图纸内容的最终结果。只有工作图纸是常规的，因此不在设计的特定文化和背景中。

The difference isn't just in content and level of detail; it's also in purpose and the way the act of drawing (or modeling, in the case of software systems) impacts the process. In Why Architects Draw, Edward Robbins talks about the different types of drawings an architect produces, ranging from those that are very personal and conceptual to working drawings, "conventionalized representations produced at the end of the design process" for the builders and lawyers. "[W]ith the exception of the working drawings, how one chooses to draw suggests a whole series of complex viewpoints" that are selectively rendered in different kinds of drawings (1994, 27). The art and the usefulness are in the selection as well as in the result; the act of drawing shapes is the end result beyond the content of the drawings. Only working drawings are conventional and, therefore, not situated in the particular culture and context of the design.

这UML 规范说了类似的话：“选择创建的模型和图表对如何解决问题以及如何形成相应的解决方案有着深远的影响”（Rational Software Corporation 1999, 13）。有趣的是，作为集体产品的 UML 识别出个体解释器通常不识别的区别。它继续确定与图纸在建筑中的使用方式相呼应的其他考虑因素：

The UML Specification says something similar: "The choice of what models and diagrams one creates has a profound influence upon how a problem is attacked and how a corresponding solution is shaped" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 13). Interestingly enough, the UML as a collective product recognizes a distinction that individual interpreters usually don't. It goes on to identify other considerations that echo the way drawings are used in architecture:

  • 最好通过一小组几乎独立的模型视图来处理每个复杂系统。没有单一的观点是足够的。

  • Every complex system is best approached through a small set of nearly independent views of a model. No single view is sufficient.

  • 每个模型都可以在不同的保真度级别上表达。

  • Every model may be expressed at different levels of fidelity.

建筑图纸和系统模型之间还有其他相似之处；特别是，两者都用作工作规划的基础，更重要的是，用作概念实验的基础。“模型让我们有机会在受控条件下失败”（Booch 1994，22）。

There are other similarities between architectural drawings and system models; in particular, both are used as the basis for the planning of work and, more importantly, for conceptual experimentation. "Models give us the opportunity to fail under controlled conditions" (Booch 1994, 22).

有不同之处。与建筑绘图的自由形式概念组合不同，模型中的每个元素都有一定的意义；UML 确实对在图表中呈现模型元素时可以出现和不可以出现的内容施加了规则。但是，就像绘图一样，每个图表和模型都应该作为一个整体，上下文在讲述故事中起着主要作用。模型的上下文是它实现的视图。在 UML 中，每个模型都是用户和模型用途的反映。它从特定的角度代表系统。

There are dissimilarities. Unlike the free-form conceptual compositions of architectural drawing, in a model every element has some meaning; the UML does impose rules about what can and can't appear in presenting a model element in a diagram. But still, like a drawing, each diagram and model is meant to be taken as a whole, with the context playing a primary role in telling the story. The context for a model is the view it realizes. In the UML, each model is a reflection of the user and the uses of the model. It represents the system from a particular viewpoint.

正如一首摇滚歌曲所暗示的那样，每张照片都讲述了一个故事。有时，这个故事是有创意的和非正式的，有时是正式的，有时是关于组织工作的。无论如何，对于 UML，它始终是一个带有点的故事看法。

Every picture tells a story, as one rock-and-roll song suggests. Sometimes, the story is meant to be creative and informal, sometimes it is formal, sometimes it is about organizing work. Regardless, with the UML, it is always a story with a point of view.

10.3 UML规范和元模型

10.3 The UML Specification and Metamodel

系统模特，就像时装模特一样，依靠“肢体语言”来传达不可言喻的信息，但他们依靠标准的姿势和手势来表达观点。语义定义了建模语言的标准姿势和手势（符号风格是肢体语言的图形等价物）。

System models, like fashion models, depend on "body language" to convey the ineffable, but they rely on standard postures and gestures to get the point across. Semantics define the standard postures and gestures for a modeling language (and notational style is the graphic equivalent of body language).

UML 在其规范文档中形式化了建模的语义。该语言基于一个模型本身，一个元模型，它与诞生它的面向对象的范例是一致的。元模型定义了系统与其在 UML 模型中的表示以及语言体系结构之间的联系。

The UML formalizes the semantics of modeling in its Specification document. The language is based on a model itself, a metamodel, that is consistent with the object-oriented paradigm that gave it birth. The metamodel defines the connection between a system and its representation in UML models, and the architecture of the language.

元模型以反映标准面向对象结构的方式定义建模语言架构；例如，建模语言是元模型的一个实例。递归地，模型然后“定义描述信息域的语言”（Rational Software Organization 1999, 25）。实际上，系统的每组模型都是建模语言的一种方言，其中基本规则由语言设定，但实际实现是开发环境中各种力量的产物。

The metamodel defines modeling language architecture in a way that reflects standard object-oriented constructs; for example, a modeling language is an instance of the metamodel. Recursively, a model then "define(s) a language that describes an information domain" (Rational Software Organization 1999, 25). In effect, each set of models of a system is a dialect of the modeling language, in which the basic rules are set by the language, but the actual realization is a product of the forces at work within the development environment.

UML规范充实了元模型，包括对模型及其基本元素的非常详细的理解，理解这一点很重要，以便能够从使用 UML 作为一种语言中获得最大收益。

The UML Specification fleshes out the metamodel, and comprises a very detailed understanding of models and their essential elements, one that is important to understand to be able to get the most benefit out of using the UML as a language.

在 UML 中，一个系统被打包成一个或多个模型，每个模型都以对用户有用的方式反映了对系统的看法，而不是符合某些规定的理论框架。反过来，模型由模型元素组成。而且，如前所述，模型代表现实世界各方面的外部现实或构建现实软件系统的内部现实。

In the UML, a system is packaged into one or more models, each reflecting a perspective on the system in a way that is useful for users rather than fitting some prescribed theoretical framework. In turn, models are made up of model elements. And, as mentioned earlier, models represent either the external reality of aspects of the real world or the internal reality of a constructed realitya software system.

UML 模型不是图表和图片。尽管模型和模型元素代表它们所指的系统，但它们不同于用于象征性地传达其含义的图形表示。以下内容来自UML 规范：

UML models are not diagrams and pictures. Although models and model elements represent the system they refer to, they are distinct from the graphical presentation used to communicate their meaning symbolically. The following is from the UML Specification:

模型

具有特定目的的物理系统的抽象。

参见：物理系统。

物理系统

1. 模特的主题。

2. 连接的物理单元的集合，可以包括软件、硬件和为实现特定目的而组织起来的人员。一个物理系统可以用一个或多个模型来描述，可能从不同的角度来看。（Rational 软件公司 1999）

model

An abstraction of a physical system, with a certain purpose.

See: physical system.

physical system

1. The subject of a model.

2. A collection of connected physical units, which can include software, hardware, and people that are organized to accomplish a specific purpose. A physical system can be described by one or more models, possibly from different viewpoints. (Rational Software Corporation 1999)

符号 ( symballein )的希腊语原意是“带来、扔掉或放在一起”(Illich 1996, 31)，一个集体理解的记号或标记。很久以后，Symbol 才采用sign的概念，暗示与外部现实的某种真实联系。

The original Greek meaning of symbol (symballein) was "to bring or throw or put together" (Illich 1996, 31)a collectively understood token or mark. Symbol took on the notion of sign, with the implications of some real connection to an external reality, much later.

古希腊人对艺术应该匹配（复制现实世界）还是创造（发明一个）一直很困惑。建模面临着类似的争议：我们应该使用对象来表示域中的抽象，还是这意味着不成熟的实现？符号的精神分裂词源部分是在过错。

The ancient Greeks got all hung up about whether art should be matching(copying the real world) or making (inventing one). Modeling faces a similar controversy: should we use objects to denote abstractions in the domain, or does this imply an implementation that is premature? The schizophrenic etymology of symbol is partly at fault.

UML 图将符号作为记号与符号作为记号相结合，但其方式神奇地逆转了符号的历史。现实世界是通过集体理解的标记呈现的，试图匹配那里的事物；构建的、想象的世界体现在符号中。作为建模者，我们只能通过影子了解现实世界，但我们以一种亲密而独特的方式了解我们的结构，因为我们制造了它们。诀窍是在我们构建模型来交流和表达我们的理解时兼顾两者，而 UML 使这成为可能。

UML diagrams combine symbols as tokens with symbols as signs, but in a way that magically reverses the history of symbols. The real world is presented through tokens of a collective understanding, attempts to match things out there; the constructed, imagined world is embodied in signs. As modelers, we can know the real world only as shadows, but we know our constructions in an intimate and unique way because we make them. The trick is to juggle the two when we build models to communicate and express our understanding, something that the UML makes uniquely possible.

模型的图形表示由 UML 的符号标准定义。UML 规定了符号标准，以确保在使用模型进行表示和交流时语义的一致性。UML规范将 UML 符号描述为“用于表示 OA&D 模型的人类可读符号——一种优雅的图形语法，用于一致地表达 UML 的丰富语义——OA&D 建模和 UML 的重要部分”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，xi ).

The graphical presentation of a model is defined by the notation standards of the UML. The UML mandates notational standards to ensure semantic consistency in the use of models to represent and communicate. The UML Specification describes the UML notation as "[a]human-readable notation for representing OA&D modelsan elegant graphic syntax for consistently expressing the UML's rich semanticsan essential part of OA&D modeling and the UML" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, xi).

各种表示元素用于传达模型的含义。每个模型元素都有一个或多个可供选择的表示元素，建模者可以使用这些元素来描述模型的视图。表示元素通过图表进行包装，图表本身就是一种模型元素。

Various presentation elements are used to communicate the meaning of a model. Each model element has one or more alternative presentation elements that the modeler can use in depicting views of the model. Presentation elements are packaged by means of diagrams, which are themselves a type of model element.

图是模型信息的特定实例。图表提供对特定目的实用且有意义的模型方面的简洁视图。每个都显示了某个时间点有关特定模型的信息子集。

A diagram is a specific instance of model information. Diagrams provide succinct views of aspects of the model that are practical and meaningful for a particular purpose. Each presents a subset of information about a particular model at a point in time.

模型本身提供了从观察者的角度定义景观的整体视图。在一个模型中，每个图都显示对某一目的有用的信息，但（通常）不是所有可用的信息。UML 允许抑制或省略许多图表元素，以促进视觉清晰度或强调模型的特定方面。因此，一个特定的 UML 图可能会也可能不会显示关于所呈现的模型元素的所有内容。

The model itself provides the overall view that defines the landscape from the perspective of the viewer. Within a model, each diagram shows information useful for a purpose, but (usually) not all the information available. The UML allows the suppression or omission of many diagram elements to facilitate visual clarity or to emphasize a specific aspect of a model. So, a particular UML diagram may or may not show all there is to see about the model elements being presented.

由于UML的图形语法非常灵活，约束作用有限，因此UML规范语法正确性的规则不是某种理论观点的表述，而是实用的、合理的。事实上，UML不是在谈论正确性，而是在谈论“格式良好”，这是一个允许有区别地应用精确规则的软边概念。

Because the graphical syntax of the UML is so flexible and limited in its constraining effect, the UML rules governing syntactical correctness are not expressions of some theoretical perspective, but are practical and sensible instead. In fact, rather than talking about correctness, the UML talks about "well- formedness," a soft-edged concept that allows for precise rules applied with discrimination.

例如，“希望供应商对格式良好的规则执行的严格程度采取一些自由裁量权。工具应该能够报告格式良好的违规行为，但不一定强制所有模型都格式良好。不完整的模型在期间很常见开发生命周期的某些阶段，因此应该允许它们”（Rational Software Corporation 1999，xvi）。无论如何，格式良好是一个语义问题而不是句法问题，UML 规范似乎对什么是格式良好感到特别困惑，尽管每个 ModelElement 都附带了一套规则。

For example, vendors are "expected to apply some discretion about how strictly the well-formed rules are enforced. Tools should be able to report on well-formedness violations, but not necessarily force all models to be well formed. Incomplete models are common during certain phases of the development lifecycle, so they should be permitted" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, xvi). At any rate, well-formedness is a matter of semantics rather than syntax, and the UML Specification seems especially muddled about what well-formedness is, although each ModelElement does come with a set of rules.

10.4 我们建模什么？

10.4 What Do We Model?

虽然UML规范讨论了“软件密集型系统”的建模（Rational Software Corporation 1999, 17），它基本上没有定义这个想法。查看系统建模的更好方法是根据构成软件产品的三个要素，以及以松散的方式形成任何应用程序背后的真实系统，如图 10.1所示。

Although the UML Specification talks about modeling "software-intensive systems" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 17), it leaves that idea largely undefined. A better way to look at systems modeling is in terms of the three elements that go into making a software product and that form, in a loose way, the real system behind any application, as illustrated in Figure 10.1.

图 10.1。系统产品的要素。

通常，建模不仅仅是关于最终产品本身。相反，设计人员在获得产品模型的过程中对架构、领域和解决方案进行建模。这些中的每一个都可以以递归方式查看和建模。随着越来越多的基于组件和迭代的开发，以及对每个级别重用的关注，建模将通过改进和重构的方式建立在以前开发的模型上，而不是重新发明车轮。

Typically, modeling is not just about the end product itself. Instead, designers model the architecture, the domain and the solution, in the process of arriving at a model of the product. Each of these can be looked at and modeled in a recursive fashion. And increasingly, with component-based and iterative development, and the focus on reuse at every level, modeling will build on previously developed models by means of refinement and refactoring instead of being an exercise in reinventing the wheel.

10.4.1 架构

10.4.1 Architecture

作为一个 抽象，架构提供了系统或系统部分的高级视图。它突出了系统最重要的元素和关键特性，并为细节提供了一个框架。它不是设计（或者正如 Jacobson、Griss 和 Jonsson [1997] 所坚持的，设计不仅仅是架构）。相反，它是围绕给定技术或业务解决方案的组织和结构的战略决策的体现。

As an abstraction, an architecture provides a high-level view of the system or portions of the system. It highlights the most important elements and key features of a system and provides a framework for the details. It is not the design (or as Jacobson, Griss, and Jonsson [1997] maintain, the design is not just the architecture). Rather, it is the embodiment of the strategic decisions around organization and structure for a given technical or business solution.

对于一个系统来说，架构是递归的：一个系统体现了一个架构，同时也反映了不同类型的外生架构，如企业架构、网络架构等。事实上，体系结构提供了“将 IT 系统地集成到业务中的环境和思考业务本身的概念框架”（Wladawsky-Berger 1999，449），这有助于战略调整和功能匹配。

For a system, architecture is recursive: a system embodies an architecture and also reflects exogenous architectures of different types, such as the enterprise architecture and the network architecture. In fact, architecture provides a "context for the systematic integration of IT into business and a conceptual framework for thinking about the business itself" (Wladawsky-Berger 1999, 449) that facilitates strategic alignment and functional fit.

在应用程序级别，体系结构是系统各个部分及其之间连接的结构化表示。它可能包括动态元素（行为的解释）以及静态元素（组织的解释）。这不是系统设计；正如 Philippe Kruchten 所写：“架构是当你不能再拿走任何东西但仍能理解系统时剩下的东西”（1998 年，第 78 页）。

At the level of an application, an architecture is a structured representation of the pieces of a system and the connections between them. It may include dynamic elements (explanations of behavior) as well as static elements (explanations of organization). It is not the system design; as Philippe Kruchten writes: "Architecture is what remains when you cannot take away any more things and still understand the system" (1998, 78).

它是多层次的和松散递归的。例如，应用程序的体系结构受其目标环境的技术体系结构的约束，并受其服务的企业体系结构的影响。反过来，技术架构可能由网络架构、服务架构、工作站架构等组成。

It is multi-leveled and loosely recursive. For example, the architecture of an application is constrained by the technical architecture of its target environment and shaped by the enterprise architecture it services. In turn, the technical architecture may be made up of a network architecture, a service architecture, a workstation architectureand more.

应用程序可以是组件的包装。每个组件本身可能有一个粗粒度的架构，或者它可能遵循为其开发和使用提供关键标准的架构框架。在大多数情况下，这种架构将被标准化；Enterprise JavaBeans 就是一个例子。组件采购很可能需要通过指定架构以及服务和接口的合同来管理，因为只有架构才能提供组件复杂性的度量，从而控制风险。

An application may be a packaging of components. Each component might have an architecture itself if coarse-grained, or it may adhere to an architectural framework that provides the key standards for its development and use. In most cases, this architecture will be standardized; Enterprise JavaBeans is an example. Component purchases will more than likely need to be managed through contracts that specify architecture as well as services and interfaces because only the architecture can provide a measure of the complexity of a component, and therefore a handle on the risk.

架构一词在系统中的多次使用实际上涵盖了三个相似但不同的概念：架构本身、框架和拓扑。我简要描述的 UML 元模型是架构模型的一个很好的（尽管是抽象的）示例。框架的范围较窄，通常涵盖特定领域甚至应用程序：金融套件架构就是一个例子。最后，拓扑更像是地图；显示 LAN 和路由器部署的网络架构就是一个例子。

The multiple uses of the term architecture in systems actually cover three similar but different ideas: architecture itself, framework, and topology. The UML metamodel I described briefly is a good (although abstract) example of an architecture model. A framework is narrower in scope, typically covering a specific domain or even an application: a financial suite architecture would be one example. Finally, a topology is more like a map; a network architecture showing the deployment of LANs and routers would be an example.

尽管我在这三种类型之间做出的区分并不是系统标准词汇的一部分，但它建议为每种架构类型使用不同类型的模型：

Even though the distinction that I drew between the three types is not part of the standard vocabulary of systems, it suggests using different types of models for each architecture type:

  • 架构的传统分层静态模型。

  • A conventional layered, static model for an architecture.

  • 框架的协作包。

  • A package of collaborations for a framework.

  • 拓扑的部署图。

  • A deployment diagram for a topology.

事实上，这似乎是一种新兴模式。

And, in fact, this seems to be an emerging pattern.

体系结构的想法需要更多的讨论，尤其是因为 UML 已经使体系结构成为建模中的一个活跃成分。因此，我会详细地回到它 之后。

The idea of architecture requires more discussion, not the least because the UML has made architecture an active ingredient in modeling to such an extent. Therefore, I'll return to it in detail a little later.

10.4.2 域

10.4.2 Domains

一个域 是一个感兴趣的领域（域的典型字典定义），具有以下内容：

A domain is an area of interest (the typical dictionary definition of domain) with the following:

  • 可以跨应用程序共享的业务抽象词汇表（事件、概念、事物）

  • A vocabulary of business abstractions (events, concepts, things) that can be shared across applications

  • 一组共同的需求，或许还有机会

  • A common set of needs and, perhaps, opportunities

领域为软件开发提供了直接的上下文，并定义了感兴趣领域的范围和解决方案的关注重点。

A domain provides the immediate context for software development, and defines the scope of the area of interest and focus of attention for a solution.

这是我的定义，综合了正在使用的多种变体。域的概念，就像我之前讨论的系统最佳实践的概念一样，是旁观者的眼睛。对于具有重用观点的软件开发人员来说，域可以是应用程序系列或产品线，即产品集合。对于进行业务再造的人来说，它可能是整个企业或功能区域。

This is my definition, synthesized from the multiple variations being used. The idea of domains, like the idea of systems' best practices that I discussed earlier, is in the eye of the beholder. For a software developer with a reuse perspective, a domain may be a family of applications or a product linethat is, a collection of products. For someone doing business re-engineering, it may be the overall enterprise or a functional area.

领域工程和分析是开发工具集的新成员，因此围绕领域仍然存在大量术语变动。在喧嚣之下，他们添加了一个关键领域（超出范围、上下文和词汇表），需要在面对新出现的重用强调时建模：共性/可变性。

Domain engineering and analysis are recent additions to the development toolset, and so there's still a lot of terminological churn around domain. Beneath the hubbub, they added a key area (beyond those of scope, context, and vocabulary) that needs to be modeled in the face of an emerging emphasis on reuse: commonality/variability.

领域模型定义了工程、设计和管理的边界和范围。它们提供了将开发团队和用户社区聚集在一起的通用词汇表。它们是由领域专家（以前称为主题专家的利益相关者）创建的或由领域专家创建的。对它们进行分析以寻找可以分解的共性元素，从而为高级重用提供基础。在一个领域内，大量的显着变化为区分单个产品提供了基础。

Domain models define boundaries and scope for engineering, design, and management. They provide the common vocabulary that brings together the development team and the user community. They are created with or by domain experts (the stakeholders formerly known as subject matter experts). They are analyzed for elements of commonality that can be factored out to provide a basis for high-level reuse. Within a domain, chunks of significant variations provide the basis for distinguishing individual products.

域可以而且应该以一种与体系结构同样递归的方式建模。可能需要对整个企业，甚至是企业的插值进行建模，以提供问题空间的上下文和词汇表。结果是一个企业模型，用于使高级技术架构与业务的战略方向保持一致。

A domain can and should be modeled in a fashion that is equally as recursive as an architecture. The enterprise as a whole, or even an interpolation of enterprises, may need to be modeled to provide the context and vocabulary for the problem space. The result, an enterprise model, is used to align a high-level technology architecture with the strategic direction of the business.

例如，需要跨组织边界对通过提供共享服务和公共基础设施来支持多个合作组织的共享系统进行建模。供应链和基于外联网的系统可能需要类似地建模，而不考虑组织边界正在消失的“柏林墙”。

For example, shared systems that support multiple co-opetive organizations by providing shared services and a common infrastructure need to be modeled across organization boundaries. Supply chain and extranet-based systems may need to be modeled similarly, without regard to the fading "Berlin Walls" of organizational boundaries.

当然，根据分析的重点和需要服务的业务，可以查看和建模组织内的多个甚至重叠的域。功能视角可以服务于组织的运营方面。工作流视角可以服务于组织的客户驱动方面。

Of course, there are multiple even overlapping domains within an organization that can be viewed and modeled, depending on the focus of the analysis and the business needs to be served. A functional perspective may serve the operational aspects of the organization. A workflow perspective may serve the customer-driven aspects of an organization.

第 6 章，“领域模式”， 根据前面的讨论提供了领域建模的基本元素的图片。然而，一些开发方法扩展了域的概念。Jim Coplien 在他的最新著作中谈到了问题域和解决方案域等概念。Shlaer-Mellor 方法将系统分解为多个交互域，包括应用程序域（最终用户感兴趣的区域）和各种技术域，涵盖系统的技术和基础设施方面 系统。

Chapter 6, "Domain Patterns," provides a picture of the essential elements of domain modeling based on the previous discussion. However, some development approaches extend the notion of domain. Jim Coplien talks about concepts such as problem domains and solution domains in his latest writings. The Shlaer-Mellor methodology breaks a system down into multiple interacting domains, including an application domain (the area of interest to the end user) and a variety of technical domains, covering the technology and infrastructure aspects of the system.

10.4.3 产品

10.4.3 Products

一个产品 既狭窄又广泛。一方面，它是一次一片地交付给客户的东西。另一方面，它是生产组织在其整个生命周期中所管理的。归根结底，产品是作为一个单元进行规划、管理和交付给最终用户的。

A product is both narrow and extensive. On the one hand, it is what is delivered to the customer one slice at a time. On the other, it is what is managed by the producing organization, through its life. Ultimately, a product is what is planned, managed, and delivered to the end user as a unit.

产品具有独立于开发生命周期的生命周期和生命周期，尤其是在迭代设计和增量交付的情况下。它们诞生、引入、进化、成熟，理论上有一个日落。无论是在组织内部还是在公开市场上销售，它们都需要在单个开发项目的边界之外进行管理和建模，并为指定和设计每个开发突增提供上下文。产品“拥有”设计工件，包括 要求。

Products have a life and a lifecycle that is separate from the development lifecycle, especially now with iterative design and incremental delivery. They are birthed, introduced, evolved, matured, and theoretically have a sunset. Whether internal to an organization or sold on the open market, they need to managed and modeled beyond the boundaries of a single development project, and provide the context for specifying and designing each development spurt. The product "owns" the design artifacts, including the requirements.

10.4.4 解决方案

10.4.4 Solutions

在一些 从某种意义上说，19 世纪的伟大技术成就是系统的发现。技术创新者的关注点从单个工具或发明机器转移到使一项技术变得实用、有用和有利可图所需的整个环境。爱迪生和福特都是整体系统思维的例子：例如，电灯需要提供发电站、配电设施和营销基础设施。一个产品是不够的。

In some ways, the great technological achievement of the nineteenth century was the discovery of systems. The focus of technology innovators shifted from the individual tool or inventionthe machineto the whole environment that was needed to make a piece of technology practical, useful, and profitable. Both Edison and Ford were examples of whole system thinking: for example, the electrical lamp required the provision of generating stations, distribution facilities, and a marketing infrastructure. A product was not enough.

在您正在探索的模式中，解决方案是总包——技术营销大师杰弗里·摩尔 (Geoffrey Moore) 在他颇具影响力的著作《跨越鸿沟》( Crossing the Chasm , 1991, 110135) 中称之为“整体产品”。这是产品的概念扩展到包括对产品的不同看法以及对使产品成功所需的条件的更广泛理解。尽管 Moore 的书是关于营销新技术而不是开发新技术，但他提出的许多观点都需要成为设计过程的一部分，以帮助塑造所产生的模型。它们提供了产品上下文的另一个方面，超出了通过调查领域确定的内容。

In the schema you're exploring, a solution is the total packagewhat Geoffrey Moore, the technology marketing guru, called a "whole product" in his influential book Crossing the Chasm (1991, 110135). It's the idea of the product extended to include varying perceptions of the product and an enlarged understanding of what is needed to make a product successful. Although Moore's book is about marketing new technology, rather than developing it, many of the points he raises need to be part of the design process to help shape the models that are produced. They provide an additional aspect of product context, beyond what's identified from investigating the domain.

本质上，在讨论产品的想法时，Moore 说他正在利用 Theodore Levitt (1984) 的工作。根据 Moore 的说法，莱维特认为，向客户做出的营销承诺与客户得到的东西之间存在差距。

Essentially, in discussing the idea of a product, Moore says he is leveraging the work of Theodore Levitt (1984). According to Moore, Levitt suggested that there's a gap between the marketing promise made to the customer and what the customer gets.

这是软件开发人员熟悉的领域，对他们来说，管理用户期望是一项与营销一样重要的技能，而且对他们来说，开发工作中参与者之间的沟通从来都不是完美的。任何长期从事软件开发的人都看过动画片，它展示了 IT 构建的秋千，从分析师、设计师、程序员和用户的角色的角度来理解。用户想要的是用两根绳子挂在树枝上的一块木板，最终变成了一个悬挂在树干上的轮胎。这棵树被支撑在杆子上，树干上有一个洞可以容纳秋千。

This is familiar territory to software developers, for whom managing user expectations is a skill as critical as marketing, and for whom communications among the players in a development effort is never perfect. Anyone who's been in software development for any length of time has seen the cartoon that shows a swing built by IT as understood from the perspective of the roles of analyst, designer, programmer and user. What the user wanted, a board hanging from a tree branch by two ropes, ends up as a tire suspended across the trunk of a tree. The tree is held up on poles, with a hole in the trunk to accommodate the swing.

莱维特确定了产品的四个视角，按照我对软件开发的解释，这些视角包括以下内容：

Levitt identifies four perspectives for a product, which, as I interpret them for software development, include the following:

  • 用户得到什么的通用产品。

  • The generic productwhat the user gets.

  • 预期产品用户认为他或她正在获得满足用户所需的最低配置。

  • The expected productwhat the user thought he or she was gettingthe minimum configuration needed to satisfy the user.

  • 增强型产品——以满足用户最大期望的方式充实产品。

  • The augmented productthe product fleshed out in a way that will meet the maximum expectations of the user.

  • 潜在产品随着支持产品的可用和改进，产品的增长空间。

  • The potential productthe product's room for growth as supporting products become available and enhancements are made.

每一个都是设计师所设想的产品的一部分。

Each is a slice of the product in time as envisioned by the designer.

Moore 以 PC 为例。通用 PC 是基本框。预期的产品包括键盘、显示器和鼠标。增强产品包括一台打印机、一些软件、培训和实际支持。潜在的 PC 可能包括诸如语音识别和集成开发环境之类的蓝天附加组件。（自从Crossing The Chasm于 1991 年出版以来，它对当今 PC 的营销方式的影响变得显而易见。）

Moore uses a PC as an example. The generic PC is the basic box. The expected product includes a keyboard, monitor, and mouse. The augmented product includes a printer, some software, training, and real support. The potential PC could include blue-sky add-ons such as voice recognition and an integrated development environment. (Since Crossing The Chasm was published in 1991, its influence has become obvious in the way that PCs are marketed today.)

这些观点值得纳入软件的设计和规划过程，其中一些可能有助于建模为增量开发生命周期的一部分。例如，Moore 提出的一个推论是，不同类型的产品可能在产品生命周期的不同阶段有用；例如，对于早期采用者来说，当出现通用产品时，他们会更加宽容和适应性更强。

These perspectives are worth incorporating into the design and planning process for software, and some might be useful to model as part of an incremental development lifecycle. For example, one corollary consideration Moore presents is that the different types of product may be useful at different stages in the life of a product; with early adopters, for example, being more forgiving and adaptable when presented with a product that is generic.

Moore 提供了他自己对整个产品的看法，更直接、更明显地适用于思考解决方案。它为需要成为建模练习一部分的开箱即用思维提供了基础。他的版本有两个组成部分，而不是四种产品类型：交付的产品以及为使购买和使用成功而需要提供的支持服务和功能。因此，他的整个产品图包括测试、安装、培训和文档等项目。这些都是成功的开发工作的所有方面，需要在早期考虑，而不是在结束时考虑，并且需要随着开发工作的进行以及在产品的生命周期中不断发展。

Moore offers his own vision of the whole product that is more directly and obviously applicable to thinking about a solution. It provides the basis for that outside-the-box thinking that needs to be a part of the modeling exercise. His version has two components rather than the four product types: the product as delivered and the supporting services and features that need to be provided to make the purchase and use successful. So, his whole product diagram includes items such as testing, installation, training, and documentation. These are all aspects of a successful development effort that need to be considered early on, rather than at the end, and need to be evolved as the development effort proceeds as well as over the life of the product.

这些见解也可以在组织内有用地应用。软件工程研究所是能力成熟度模型的来源，目前正在研究一种促进采用解释摩尔思想的新技术的过程。

These insights can be applied usefully within an organization as well. The Software Engineering Institute, source of the Capability Maturity Model, is currently working on a process for facilitating the adoption of new technology that interprets Moore's ideas.

UML 不直接支持甚至不需要 Levitt 和 Moore 版本的定义解决方案的整体产品思维。尽管了解产品在设计时和设计后都会进化，但 UML 中没有太多内容可以支持产品生命周期或整个产品思维。两者都属于需要记录的项目类别，并作为文本和补充 UML 图的非标准图作为模型包装的一部分。

Neither Levitt's nor Moore's version of whole product thinking in defining a solution is supported directly or even required by the UML. Despite an understanding that products evolve, both when being designed and after, there's not much in the UML to support a product lifecycle or whole product thinking. Both fall into the category of items that need to be documented and made part of the model packaging as text and non-standard diagrams that supplement the UML diagrams.

也许这是一件好事。正如 Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills 所写，重点应该是“模型的小片段与解释性散文交织在一起”（1998 年，708），方法是使用叙述性文本来传达非正式元素，而不是图画书中光鲜亮丽的图表。从某种意义上说，这种方法包括将整个产品理念应用于 UML 模型 他们自己。

Perhaps this is a good thing. As Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills write, the emphasis should be "on small fragments of models interleaved with explanatory prose" (1998, 708) by using narrative text to communicate the informal elements rather than glossy diagrams in a picture book. In a sense, this approach consists of applying the whole product idea to UML models themselves.

10.5 抽象和架构变得简单

10.5 Abstraction and Architecture Made Simple

抽象和体系结构是 UML 奉行的两个关键概念，这是前几代建模工具和方法所没有的。到目前为止，我在没有详细解释的情况下使用了这些术语，依靠的是对它们的含义的一般理解。然而，尽管系统社区的很大一部分经常自称希望接受正式和严谨，但这些术语在常用时尤其受到“定义性腹泻”的困扰。因此，因为它们在 UML 中都非常重要，所以值得花一些时间来了解它们。

Abstraction and architecture are the two key concepts that the UML enshrines, in a way that previous generations of modeling tools and methodologies didn't. So far, I used the terms without detailed explanation, relying on a general sense of what they mean to carry the day. However, despite the often self-proclaimed desire of a large part of the systems community to embrace formality and rigor, these terms in particular suffer from "definitional diarrhea" in common use. So, because they are both so important within the UML, it's worth taking some time to ground them.

10.5.1 抽象

10.5.1 Abstraction

为了UML，抽象是与面向对象编程的关键概念联系。建模是关于制作、操作和管理抽象。对象是跨越建模和编程之间门槛的抽象概念。

For the UML, abstraction is the key conceptual connection with object-oriented programming. Modeling is about making, manipulating, and managing abstractions. Objects are abstractionsones that cross the threshold between modeling and programming.

抽象之于建模和面向对象就像算法之于结构化编程：问题的实质。正如 Booch 所说：“[D]为给定领域确定正确的抽象集是面向对象的核心问题”（1994 年，第 42 页）。他的评论同样适用于使用 UML 建模。

Abstractions are to modeling and object-orientation what algorithms are to structured programming: the meat of the matter. As Booch puts it: "[D]eciding on the right set of abstractions for a given domain is the central problem in object-orientation" (1994, 42). His comment applies to modeling using the UML just as easily.

模型通过抽象来管理复杂性。建模语言提供了多种抽象方法，通常采用与面向对象编程语言中的抽象并行的方式。

Models manage complexity by means of abstraction. A modeling language provides a variety of means for abstracting, often in ways that parallel abstraction in object-oriented programming languages.

大多数情况下，UML 文档仅引用了对抽象的基本解释：抽象作为对现实的过滤、消除不必要的细节以及创建简化的视图。

For the most part, the UML documentation invokes only a basic explanation of abstraction: abstraction as a filtering of reality, an elimination of unnecessary details, and the creation of simplified views.

这可以被视为编程的基本抽象，这可能就是为什么它已成为 UML 中抽象本身的试金石定义的原因。作为更广泛目的的一部分，UML 作为一种建模语言与编程语言具有不同的范围。因此，建模中使用的许多抽象都不是程序化的。在 UML 中，抽象经常反映面向对象编程的抽象，但通常它们不是。例如，关联（基本上是类之间的松散链接）和聚合（类的松散集合）可以由程序员以不同的精度来近似，这取决于目标语言是 Smalltalk、Java 还是 C++。其他抽象，例如角色或用例，没有任何直接对应的编程抽象。

This could be seen as the fundamental abstraction for programming, which is probably why it has became a touchstone definition for abstraction itself within the UML. The UML as a modeling language has a different scope from programming languages, as part of a broader set of purposes. Therefore, many of the abstractions used in modeling are not programmatic. In the UML, abstractions frequently reflect the abstractions of object-oriented programming, but often they don't. For example, association (basically, a loose link between classes) and aggregation (a loose collection of classes) can be approximated with varying precision by a programmer, depending on whether the target language is Smalltalk, Java, or C++. Other abstractions, such as role or use case, don't have any directly corresponding programming abstractions.

UML 隐含地支持对抽象过程的广泛理解：

The UML implicitly supports a broad understanding of the process of abstracting:

  • 模型本身通过包装进行抽象。 

    打包通常是一种管理抽象，无论所讨论的管理是为了交流还是概念化（或两者），或者只是为了组织模型。只要包装被理解为由外生因素驱动，并且可能与正在建模的内容没有任何本质联系，使用包进行管理就更容易了。

    UML 提供包（第 3 章中的详细信息）作为模型组织的构造，其意图类似于程序化模块化。也就是说，它有助于对逻辑上连接的元素进行分组，同时遵循耦合和内聚的原则，最大限度地减少不同组中各个元素之间的连接。Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills 明智地建议文档应该围绕包结构来构建 (1998, 709)。

    模型和图表也是包装抽象，在某些方面，UML 的模式方法也可以看作是一种执行概念包装的方式。

  • Models themselves abstract by packaging. 

    Packaging is typically a management abstraction, whether the management in question is for communication or conceptualization (or both), or simply to organize models. Management is easier with packages, as long as the packaging is understood to be driven by exogenous considerations, and may not have any essential connection to what is being modeled.

    The UML provides packages (details in Chapter 3) as a construct for a model organization that resembles programmatic modularization in intent. That is, it facilitates the grouping of logically connected elements while minimizing connections between individual elements of different groups, following the principles of coupling and cohesion. Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills wisely suggest that documentation should be structured around package structure (1998, 709).

    Models and diagrams are also packaging abstractions, and in some ways, the UML's approach to patterns can also be seen as a way of performing conceptual packaging.

  • 模型和表示元素通过过滤进行抽象。 

    关于事物及其联系的不必要细节从视线中隐藏起来，必要时留下的内容取决于图表的视角或视图。这是 UML 文档通常依赖于抽象的含义，也是提到省略时的意图。UML 积极支持从图表中删除不必要的信息并使用相同模型元素的多个表达式来显示拼图的不同部分的想法。

  • Model and presentation elements abstract by filtering. 

    Unnecessary details about things and their connections are hidden from sight, and what is left as necessary depends on the diagram's perspective or view. This is the meaning that the UML documentation relies on for abstraction in general, and is what is intended when elision is mentioned. The UML actively supports the idea of leaving out unnecessary information from a diagram and having multiple expressions of the same model elements that show different pieces of the puzzle.

  • 模型和表示元素（例如符号和表单）也提供操作抽象。 

    这是 Desmond D'Souza 用于黑盒抽象的术语，源自 Booch。例如，在根据规范进行测试时使用它。在建模中，操作抽象是具有隐含效果（建模功能、服务和行为）的占位符，这些效果可以与所表示的实例相关联。例如，因为方框代表类或类型，所以可以假定类图中名为 Customer 的方框展示了包含该图的模型中类的句法和语义行为。

  • Model and presentation elements (such as symbols and forms) also provide operational abstractions. 

    This is the term Desmond D'Souza uses for black-box abstraction, derived from Booch. It is used, for instance, when testing against a specification. In modeling, operational abstractions are placeholders that have implied effects (modeling features, services, and behaviors) that can be associated with the instance that is being represented. For example, because a box symbolizes class or type, a box called Customer in a class diagram can be assumed to exhibit the syntactic and semantic behavior of a class in the model that contains the diagram.

笔记

Note

D'Souza 和 Booch 在他们的主要书籍中散布了关于抽象的优秀材料 D'Souza 更具设计风格（1998 年）和 Booch 更具编程风格（1994 年）。

D'Souza and Booch sprinkle their main books with good material on abstractionD'Souza with more of a design flavor (1998) and Booch with more of a programming flavor (1994).

UML规范还通过不那么明确的程序化结构，以惯用的方式将抽象作为元模型中的模型元素。换句话说，它支持显式和隐式的抽象。

The UML Specification also enshrines abstraction idiomatically as a model element in the metamodel, by means of constructs that are not so clearly programmatic. In other words, it supports abstraction explicitly as well as implicitly.

UML 中抽象的显式版本不可避免地侧重于建模需求，因为它是规范的一部分。特别是，它为建模者提供了一种组织模型组件的方式，这种方式比 UML 之前的中文框的简单层次结构更复杂。

The explicit version of abstraction in the UML is focused on modeling needsinevitably because it is part of a specification. In particular, it gives the modeler the means to organize the model components in ways that are more sophisticated than the simple hierarchical structures of Chinese boxes that preceded the UML.

抽象是两个模型元素或模型元素集之间的依赖关系。根据UML 规范，抽象发生在 供应商元素和 client元素，但这暗示了一个层次结构，但情况不一定如此。两者之间确实必须存在明显的关系——它们必须“在不同的抽象层次或从不同的观点表示相同的概念”（Rational Software Corporation 1999, 219 ）。作为良好的面向对象公民，供应商-客户关系可以是一对多，也可以是多对多。它可以是单向的或双向的。

An abstraction is a dependency relationship between two model elements or sets of model elements. According to the UML Specification, the abstracting takes place between a supplier element and a client element, but this implies a hierarchy, which is not necessarily the case. There does have to be an overt relationship between the twothey have to "represent the same concept at different levels of abstraction or from different viewpoints" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 219). Being good object-oriented citizens, the supplier-client relationship can be one to many in either direction, or even many-to-many. It can be unidirectional or bidirectional.

抽象以图形方式呈现为依赖关系的定型版本。我已经提到了抽象构造型（从 UML 1.3 开始）：推导、实现、细化和跟踪（参见第 3 章）。

Abstraction is presented graphically as stereotyped versions of the dependency relationship. I've already mentioned the abstraction stereotypes (as of UML 1.3): derivation, realization, refinement, and trace (see Chapter 3).

10.5.2 架构

10.5.2 Architecture

UML规范清楚专注于架构。它将架构模型确定为建模世界中的一等公民，以及熟悉的静态模型、行为模型和使用模型（Rational Software Corporation 1999，xi）。它以架构为中心。

The UML Specification clearly focuses on architecture. It identifies architectural models as first-class citizens in the modeling world, along with the familiar static models, behavioral models, and usage models (Rational Software Corporation 1999, xi). It is architecture-centric.

尽管静态模型和行为模型可以很容易地从软件历史中解释出来，并且使用模型显然是对用例方向的认可，但架构模型的概念从未得到定义；作为一个想法，它既不是历史的，也不是直观的。

Although static models and behavioral models can be interpreted easily from software history, and usage models are obviously a nod in the direction of use cases, the idea of architectural models never gets defined; it is neither historical nor intuitive as an idea.

也不可能依靠建筑领域本身来获得概念上的支持，因为建筑领域并没有真正等同于系统所称的建筑。在某种程度上，这里讨论的体系结构概念在各个层面（区域、城市、社区）的规划中都有体现。在使用时，它还建议使用高级蓝图，尽管这些是工作图而不是概念图，这是一种混合。

Nor is it possible to rely on the field of architecture itself for a conceptual leg-up because the field of architecture doesn't really have an equivalent to what systems call architecture. To some extent, the systems notion of architecture as talked about here has echoes in plans at various levels (regional, urban, community). As used, it also suggests high-level blueprints, although these are working drawings and not conceptual ones, which is quite a mix.

架构一词的首次应用出现在 50 年代。IBM 的 Gerritt Blaauw 是与 Howard Aiken 在 Harvard Mark III 系统上合作的早期巨人之一，后来是 System/360 工作的一部分，他使用该术语来描述模块化大型计算机系统的逻辑结构，包括硬件和软件。当时和现在一样，当简单的层次结构不够时，它是一种管理复杂性的方法。

The first application of the term architecture came in the '50s. IBM's Gerritt Blaauw, one of the early giants who worked with Howard Aiken on the Harvard Mark III system and later was part of the System/360 effort, used the term to describe the logical structure of a modular mainframe computer system, including both the hardware and software. Then, as now, it was a way to manage complexity when a simple hierarchy was insufficient.

到 80 年代后期，这个想法得到了更广泛的应用，因为在开发潜在的分布式 IT 资源时需要进行真正的规划变得很明显。随着时间的推移，推动最初发明系统架构以描述昂贵且复杂的大型机（以及随后使用它们的企业）的相同需求开始应用于应用程序本身。这一转变的开创性论文是 John A. Zachman（1999 年）的“A Framework for Information Systems Architecture”。（我在第 10.2 节“每张图片都讲述一个故事：UML 作为建模语言”中介绍了他。 ）他试图使用架构师的工作方式和他们创建的模型作为构建系统的各种视图的基础。

By the late '80s, the idea was being applied more generally, as the need to do real planning when developing potentially distributed IT resources became evident. Over time, the same needs that drove the original invention of system architecture for describing expensive and complicated mainframes (and then the enterprises that used them) began to be applied to applications themselves. The seminal paper in this transition was "A Framework for Information Systems Architecture" by John A. Zachman (1999). (I introduced him in Section 10.2, "Every Picture Tells a Story: The UML as a Modeling Language." ) He attempted to use the way architects work and the models they create as the basis for structuring the various views of a system.

Zachman 关于架构师工作实践的想法简单地偏向于当时软件工程师的理想开发过程，因此提供了一个类比基础，如果将其视为对设计实践的解释（1999），就会产生误导。他对架构师工作方式的描述令人毛骨悚然地想起臭名昭著的瀑布方法，而这种方法现在只是大型机一厢情愿的残余。他通过验证他对当时典型的制造产品开发周期的理解，也（现在）已经过时，使错误更加复杂。

Zachman's idea of the working practices of an architect were simplistically biased toward the software engineer's ideal development process of the time, and so provide a basis-in-analogy that is misleading if seen as an explanation of the practice of design (1999). His version of the way an architect works is eerily reminiscent of the infamous waterfall methodology that is now merely a remnant of mainframe wishful thinking. And he compounded the error by validating his understanding against a typical manufacturing product development cycle of the time, also (now) outdated.

但他提出的框架是可靠的，并且仍然构成了 IT 中关于架构主题的大部分思考的基础。这是已提出的最全面的方法。

But the framework he proposed is solid, and still forms the basis for most of the thinking on the subject of architecture within IT. It is the most comprehensive approach that has been proposed.

UML 规范在很多方面都与 Zachman 相呼应，但是是间接的。Zachman 介绍的两个想法对于使用 UML 及其开发至关重要：

The UML Specification echoes Zachman in many ways, however indirectly. Two ideas that Zachman introduced are critical to using the UML, and critical to its development:

  • 构建复杂的工程产品需要一组反映参与者观点的架构表示。

  • Building a complex engineering product requires a set of architectural representations that reflect the perspectives of the participants.

  • 可以用多种方式描述产品，反映描述的目的以及参与者的观点。

  • A product can be described in a variety of ways, reflecting the purposes of the description as well as the perspectives of the participants.

Zachman 最初的架构版本提出了一个模型矩阵，其中一个维度是角色（所有者、设计师、构建者）或目标（棒球场、产品）。另一个维度最初包括三个问题的答案：什么、如何以及在哪里？前两个是任何分析师或设计师都熟悉的；如果没有作为范围的一部分提出，最后一个通常由运营部门询问。

Zachman's original version of an architecture proposed a matrix of models, with one dimension being role (Owner, Designer, Builder) or goal (Ballpark, Product). The other dimension originally consisted of the answers to three questions: what, how, and where? The first two are familiar to any analyst or designer; the last is usually asked by Operations if not brought up as part of the scope.

矩阵中的每个单元格都是一个独特模型类型的家。“什么”模型侧重于需求，“如何”模型侧重于实现，“在哪里”侧重于部署。任何一套完整的模型都可以解释构成解决方案的这些领域的战略决策。由此产生的产品在细节中，当然就像魔鬼一样。

Each cell in the matrix was home for a unique model type. The "what" models focused on requirements, the "how" models on implementation, and the "where" on deployment. Any set of models that was complete could explain the strategic decisions in these areas that comprised a solution. The product that resulted was in the details, of coursejust like the devil.

尽管 Zachman 的框架仍然具有相当大的影响力（例如，在 OMG 试图定义业务对象框架时），但在任何有关 UML 的文献中都很少提及它。有（大概）这样做的充分理由：

Although Zachman's framework continues to be a considerable influence (for example, in the OMG's attempts to define a Business Objects Framework), it is scarcely mentioned in any of the literature on the UML. There are (probably) good reasons for this:

  • Zachman 的框架 (1999) 是前对象，因此他的模型类型反映了开发和可交付成果的结构化视图；他们还没有更新。

  • Zachman's framework (1999) is pre-object, and so his model types reflect a structured view of development and deliverables; they have not been updated.

  • Zachman 继续在他的矩阵中添加列以涵盖“谁”、“何时”和“为什么”元素，这些元素使本来应该是一种管理复杂性的方法变得复杂。由此产生的 36 个单元格矩阵增加了复杂性而不是解决了它。

  • Zachman went on to add columns to his matrix to cover "who," "when," and "why"elements that complicate what is supposed to be a way of managing complexity. The resulting thirty-six-cell matrix adds to the complexity rather than resolving it.

  • Zachman 和他的支持者认为他的框架也可以应用在企业层面，大部分后续工作都针对企业建模。事实证明，这是一条死胡同。企业模型通常需要数年时间才能创建（之后它就会过时），而且高级管理层的关注范围根本无法获得。它还增加了复杂性。

  • Zachman and his supporters felt that his framework could also be applied at the enterprise level, and most of the follow-up efforts have been directed at enterprise modeling. This has turned out to be a blind alley. An enterprise model typically requires years to create (after which it is out-of-date) and an attention span from senior management that simply is not available. It also adds complexity.

然而，在系统层面，Zachman 的原始框架仍然是战略性地概念化系统所有元素（包括它们如何交互）的最佳方式 (1999)。

However, at the system level, Zachman's original framework is still the best way to conceptualize all the elements of a system strategically, including how they interact (1999).

当然，还有一个作用企业架构。但是，就像千禧年之交的任何企业一样，它必须敏捷灵活。在企业层面，架构应该简单地模拟一个组织的技术组合及其组件的配置。作为复杂矩阵的替代方案，企业架构将企业的战略块组织成层和级别，提供一组简单的打包抽象及其关系。

Of course, there is a role for enterprise architecture. But, like any enterprise at the turn of the millennium, it has to be agile and flexible. At the enterprise level, architecture should simply model an organization's technology portfolio and the configuration of its components. As an alternative to a complicated matrix, an enterprise architecture organizes the enterprise's strategic chunks into layers and levels, providing an easy set of packaged abstractions and their relationships.

有一些面向对象的框架争相成为 Zachman 的继承者。

There are object-oriented frameworks contending to be successors to Zachman's.

国际标准组织 (ISO) 有一个“开放式分布式处理的参考模型”，对象管理组的工作组在不同时期都赞同地注意到它（一个例子是业务对象组件体系结构提案）。一篇 UML 工作论文说，虽然 UML“源于早期的对象分析和设计方法（Booch、OMT、OOSE）”，但通过使用 UML 扩展，可以在很大程度上实现与 ODP 建模语言的兼容性没有直接通信的机制”（MCI Systemhouse Corporation 1997，37）。ODP 架构框架涵盖了从企业领域到部署的各种可能观点，使用反映 Desmond D' 工作的对象概念 Souza 和 Fusion 比三个朋友更多。然而，观点是抽象的；它们不像 Zachman 那样反映了特定利益相关者的担忧。

The International Standards Organization (ISO) has a "Reference-Model for Open Distributed Processing," which has been noted approvingly by working groups of the Object Management Group at various times (one example is the Business Object Component Architecture Proposal). A UML working paper says that, although the UML "stems from an earlier generation of object analysis and design methods (Booch, OMT, OOSE)it is possible to achieve a large measure of compatibility with the ODP modeling language by using the UML extension mechanisms where there are no direct correspondences" (MCI Systemhouse Corporation 1997, 37). The ODP architecture framework covers the range of possible viewpoints from the enterprise domain down to deployment, using object concepts that reflect the work of Desmond D'Souza and Fusion more than the Three Amigos. The viewpoints are abstract, however; they do not reflect the concerns of specific stakeholders as Zachman's does.

另一个竞争者是 Phillippe Kruchten (1998) 提出的四+一框架，之所以这样命名是因为它由四个技术观点和一个用户观点组成。这已经成为 Rational Software 的官方框架，并且通过扩展成为三个朋友。实际上，它提供了一种构建有关应用程序的工作和战略信息的方法。不幸的是，在这样做时，它并没有在一个观点中分离“什么”和“如何”的关注点，它只是真正解决了系统的工程方面。在统一建模语言用户指南中、Jacobson、Booch 和 Rumbaugh (1998a) 清楚地表明，架构将组合来自每个视图的部分模型，而不是简单地成为所有视图的集合。它基本上是一个适合方法的框架，作为在开发工作流程的上下文中组织可交付成果的一种方式，而不是一个真正的架构。

Another contender is the Four+one framework from Phillippe Kruchten (1998), which is so named because it consists of four technical viewpoints plus a user viewpoint. This has become the official framework for Rational Software and, by extension, the Three Amigos. In effect, it provides a way of structuring both the work and the strategic information about an application. Unfortunately, in doing so, it doesn't separate the "what" and "how" concerns within a viewpoint, and it only really addresses the engineering aspects of a system. In The Unified Modeling Language User Guide, Jacobson, Booch, and Rumbaugh (1998a) make it clear that an architecture would combine portions of the models from each view, rather than simply being the set of all the views. It is basically a framework fitted to a methoduseful as a way of organizing deliverables in the context of a development workflow, rather than a real architecture.

面向模式的软件架构： 

Pattern Oriented Software Architecture: 

A System of Patterns，即所谓的 POSA 书（Buschmann 等人，1996 年），从面向对象的角度提供了对软件架构的最佳讨论，包括对主要架构框架的清晰的基于模式的描述，例如模型-视图-控制器。

A System of Patterns, the so-called POSA book (Buschmann et al. 1996), provides the best discussion of software architecture from an object-oriented viewpoint, including lucid pattern-based descriptions of major architectural frameworks such as Model-View-Controller.

10.6 透视图：通用建模框架

10.6 Perspectives: A Generic Modeling Framework

模型需要组织。但如果您的工具集不提供可用的组织方法，并且以体系结构为中心的组织方式似乎不合适，则您需要即兴创作一个模型类型的基本框架。UML 图的核心集可用于开发过程各个阶段的各种模型，因此，它们本身并不能提供足够的组织结构。开发方法通常不会超越识别分析和设计模型的存在，并暗示代码本身就是实现模型。但是，Syntropy是 UML 之前的面向对象过程，它讨论了模型类别（透视图），这些模型提供了关于如何组织模型的非正式想法。以下是同熵观点：

Models need organizing. But if your toolset doesn't provide a usable organizing approach, and if the architecture-focused ways of organizing seem inappropriate, you'll need to improvise a basic framework of model types. The core set of UML diagrams can be used in a variety of models at various stages of a development process, so, by themselves, they don't provide enough organizing structure. Development methods often don't go beyond identifying the existence of analysis and design models, and suggesting that the code itself is the implementation model. However, Syntropy, a pre-UML object-oriented process, discusses categories of models (perspectives) that provide an informal idea of how to organize your models. The following are the Syntropy perspectives:

  • 基本观点： 

    该视角对领域中出现的想法和关系进行建模。结果是一个没有实现语言细节的概念模型。模型中的类型和协作直接反映领域概念，尽管通常没有直接映射。概念模型的目的是用领域本身的术语准确地表示领域：捕捉其基本结构、关系和过程。

  • Essential perspective: 

    This perspective models the ideas and relationships that appear in the domain. The result is a conceptual model that is free of implementation language details. Types and collaborations in the model reflect domain concepts directly, although there often is no direct mapping. The purpose of the conceptual model is to accurately represent the domain in its own terms: to capture its essential structure, relationships, and processes.

  • 规格视角： 

    这个观点的重点是软件，但特别是软件的接口而不是实现。规范模型强调谁向谁提供什么服务，而不解释如何完成服务的机制。从这个角度来看，类代表类型（抽象接口）而不是编程类。

  • Specification perspective: 

    The focus in this perspective is on software, but particularly on the interfaces of the software rather than the implementation. A specification model has an emphasis on who provides what services to whom without explaining the mechanics of how it is done. Classes in this perspective represent types (abstracted interfaces) rather than programmed classes.

  • 实施视角： 

    此处公开了所有实施细节，并详细描述了系统行为的细节。

  • Implementation perspective: 

    All the implementation details are exposed here and the specifics of system behavior are described in detail.

Martin Fowler、Kendall Scott 和 Ivar Jacobson 在UML Distilled：Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language中赞许地提到了这种方法，因为它促进了关于应该使用对象、类和类型的方式的一些关键区别（19​​97）。重要的是，它有助于避免陷入关于对象是否是实现抽象的讨论，因此在分析和可能的规范中是不合适的。Fowler 的书对这些观点的影响进行了很好的详细描述，这不在本次讨论的范围内，但值得任何关心生成清晰且清晰的模型的人参考实际的。

Martin Fowler, Kendall Scott, and Ivar Jacobson mention this approach approvingly in UML Distilled: Applying the Standard Object Modeling Language because it facilitates some critical distinctions about the way object, class, and type should be used (1997). Significantly, it helps avoid getting trapped in discussions about whether an object is an implementation abstraction, and so is out of place in analysis and possibly specification. Fowler's book has a good detailed description of the impact of these perspectives, which is outside the scope of this discussion, but worth consulting for anyone concerned with producing models that are clear and practical.

第 11 章综合考虑：反思设计工作

Chapter 11. Putting It All Together: Reflecting on the Work of Design

当你建造一个东西时，你不能仅仅孤立地建造那个东西，还必须修复它周围的世界，这样一个地方的更大的世界就会变得更加连贯、更加完整，而你所造的东西也能发挥它的作用。随心所欲地放置在自然之网中。

克里斯托弗·亚历山大 (Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977, xiii)

when you build a thing, you cannot merely build that thing in isolation, but must also repair the world around it, so that the larger world at that one place becomes more coherent, and more whole, and the thing that you make takes its place in the web of nature, as you make it.

Christopher Alexander (Alexander, Ishikawa, and Silverstein 1977, xiii)

通常，在结束之前很久，一本关于 UML 的书会描述一个开发过程，供读者用作嵌入建模工作产品的心理框架。因为 UML 独立于过程，所以必须提供一个框架，并且该框架总是被解释为开发工作。

Normally, long before the end, a book on the UML describes a development process to be used by the reader as a mental framework for embedding the work products of modeling. Because the UML is independent of process, a framework has to be provided, and that framework is invariably interpreted as the work of development.

预定义的流程作为框架很诱人；作为一个固定的解决方案，它避免了对构成使用 UML 的真正原因的上下文和该上下文中的力量的详细讨论。过程提供了一种将 UML 嵌入到待完成工作中的简单方法，通过典型的示例，这些示例充当 Kuhn 为 UML 新手用户提供的范例。

A predefined process is tempting as a framework; as a canned solution, it obviates elaborate discussions of the context and forces within that context that constitute the real reasons for using the UML. And a process provides an easy means of embedding the UML in the work-to-be-done, via stereotypical examples that function as Kuhn's exemplars for the budding UML user.

在本书中，我采用了不同的方法，展示了建模本身作为一种技能和活动如何为使用 UML 提供上下文。我还依靠模式提供了一个起点，以了解应该如何进行建模，无论是一般的还是惯用的。

In this book, I've taken a different approach, showing how modeling itself, as a skill and an activity, provides a context for using the UML. I've also relied on patterns to provide a starting point for looking at how modeling should be done, both generally and idiomatically.

然而，过程为软件书籍提供了一个额外的目的，但这里仍然缺少：过程将理论、工件、技术等所有内容联系在一起，并将部分编织成一个整体，即使过程只是一个间接的贡献者到书的内容。在本章中，我将提供这个缺失的成分。我将采取不同的方法，将本书的各个元素放在一起而不是捆绑在一起。而且，我将专注于设计工作，而不是开发工作。特别是，我将使用麻省理工学院的 Donald Schon 20 年前首次发表的关于设计实践的想法，这些想法现在才在系统开发领域受到认真关注。在 Schon 的帮助下，我

However, there's an additional purpose that a process provides for a software book, which is still missing here: A process ties everything togetherthe theory, the artifacts, the techniquesand weaves a whole out of the parts, even if the process is only an indirect contributor to the book's contents. In this chapter, I will provide this missing ingredient. I'll take a different approach by pulling together rather than tying together the various elements of the book. And, rather than the work of development, I'll focus on the work of design. In particular, I'll be using the ideas on the practice of design that Donald Schon of M.I.T first published twenty years agoideas that are just now getting serious attention in the systems development world. With Schon's help, I'll attempt to show a different way of seeing how the UML and patterns fit into the work-to-be-done of design.

11.1 设计工作

11.1 The Work of Design

我避免接地UML 在任何一个特定的过程中有两个原因：

I avoided grounding the UML in any one specific process for two reasons:

  • 这让我有机会认真对待 UML 的过程独立性（和类似 mutt 的质量）。我能够专注于 UML 本身的想法，而不是它们的使用方式。而且，我已经能够使用来自 Rational 的统一过程和 Desmond D'Souza 和 Alan Wills 的对象、组件和框架与 UML 的示例：催化方法（1998）以多种方式处理极端对立的过程，其中流程-具体差异显着。

  • This provided me with an opportunity to take the UML's process- independence (and mutt-like quality) seriously. I was able to focus on the ideas that are the UML itself, rather than the way they are used. And, I've been able to use examples from both Rational's Unified Process and Desmond D'Souza and Alan Wills' Objects, Components and Frameworks with the UML: The Catalysis Approach (1998) to process polar opposites in many ways in which process-specific differences are significant.

  • 我觉得专注于一个过程，无论多么好，都会继续未说明的，也许是无意识的，对已经渗透到 UML 文献（但不是UML本身，有趣的是）的开发即编程的关注。

  • I felt that focusing on one process, however good, would continue the unstated, perhaps unconscious, focus on development-as-programming that has permeated the UML literature (but not the UML itself, interestingly).

后一个原因对我个人而言是两者中更重要的原因。

The latter reason was the more important reason of the two for me personally.

前段时间我经历了自己的个人范式转变，但作为建模师，而不是程序员。作为上一代开发人员的一部分，我看到建模的出现是结构化方法（旧范例）框架内的一项独特技能。

I went through my own personal paradigm shift some time ago, but as a modeler, not as a programmer. As part of a previous generation of developers, I'd seen the emergence of modeling as a distinctive skill within the framework of structured methodsthe old paradigm.

作为一名建模师，对象对我来说很有趣，因为我在进行传统建模时不断遇到一些顽固的问题。作为工件产生的抽象与用户的世界无关，并且它们难以用于建立他们的需求和验证结果。一旦定义，翻译成程序员可读格式的过程通常是一个折磨人的过程，有许多神奇的烟雾和镜子时刻来调解翻译。我们制作的模型虽然对管理有用，但对真正的假定受益人用处不大。

As a modeler, objects became interesting to me because of intransigent problems I continually ran into when doing traditional modeling. The abstractions produced as artifacts were unrelated to the world of the user, and they were difficult to use in establishing their needs and validating the results. Once defined, the process of translation into programmer-readable format was frequently a tortured one with many magic moments of smoke and mirrors mediating the translation. The models we produced, although useful to management, were less useful to their real supposed beneficiaries.

对象提供了一条摆脱这种困境的方法，面向对象的分析和设计成为成就，用库恩的话来说，重新定义了我所做的工作。

Objects presented a way out of this dilemma, and object-oriented analysis and design became the achievement that, in Kuhn's terms, redefined the work I did.

UML 和模式合在一起，对我来说是这种个人范式转变的最后关键。它们不是灵丹妙药。他们确实提供了以不同方式进行设计的工具，其方式与过去十年中所有其他重要成就完全一致。结合起来，它们共同构成了一般系统开发和系统设计的范式转变特别的。

The UML and patterns, taken together, are for me the final linchpins in this personal paradigm shift. They are not silver bullets. They do provide the tools to do design differently, in a way that is fully congruent with all of the other significant achievements over the last ten years. Combined, they add up to a paradigm shift for system development in general, and for system design in particular.

11.1.1 什么是设计？

11.1.1 What Is Design?

部队在查看系统设计工作时需要平衡的观点从本书的前面部分中会很熟悉：

The forces that need to be balanced in looking at the work of system design will be familiar from earlier parts of this book:

  • 初始情况是一种不确定性和复杂性，其中要解决的问题可能表达得很差或不完整，甚至可能不正确，或者可能不是正确的。

  • The initial situation is one of uncertainty and complexity, in which the problem(s) to be addressed may be expressed poorly or incompletely, may not even be right, or may not be the right one(s).

  • 上下文和情况是要解决的问题的重要部分，而不仅仅是要存档的信息。

  • Context and situation are important parts of the problem to be solved, not just information to be archived.

  • 愿景，而不仅仅是当前的问题，是最终结果的动力和塑造者。

  • Vision, and not just current problems, is a motivator and shaper of the end result.

  • 尽管软件中的问题解决方案通常是技术性的，但问题通常是业务问题。

  • Although problem solutions in software are typically technical, the problems are typically business problems.

  • 在设计的“艺术表现”中，反馈与前馈（即概念化）一样重要，但两者所需的抽象层次和类型可能有很大不同。

  • Feedback is as important as feedforward (that is, conceptualization) in the "artistic performance" of design, but the levels and types of abstractions required for each may be significantly different.

  • 原型制作和建模都是设计活动；它们被当作技术来教授，但需要作为技能来应用。模型可以看作是文档和规范；原型可以看作是模拟和实验。但是设计师可以试验模型并指定原型。

  • Prototyping and modeling are both activities in design; they are taught as techniques but need to be applied as skills. Models can be seen as documentation and specification; prototypes can be seen as simulations and experiments. But a designer can experiment with models and specify with prototypes.

  • 表示不是演示。世界和系统在模型中的表示方式以及模型的呈现方式反映了不同的需求。“地图不是领土，”正如雪江早川曾经宣扬的那样。

  • Representation is not presentation. The way the world and the system are represented in a model and the way that model is presented reflect different needs. "The map is not the territory," as Sessue Hayakawa used to preach.

这些力已经作为模式中的力以各种形式出现。它们也是 UML 背后的思想以及 RUP 和 Catalysis 等过程背后的思想中的明显元素（D'Souza 和 Wills 1998）。然而，大多数关于软件设计的讨论都掩盖了它们，或者将它们视为默认理解的共享知识，因此不需要明确关注。

These forces have appeared in various guises already as forces in the patterns. They are also obvious elements in the thinking behind the UML, and in the thinking behind processes such as RUP and Catalysis (D'Souza and Wills 1998). However, most discussions of software design bury them or treat them as being tacitly understoodshared knowledge, and so not in need of explicit attention.

一般来说，在系统开发的背景下，设计的构成与我们开发专业人员似乎宣称的大多数其他想法一样模糊。例如，Ivar Jacobson、Grady Booch 和 James Rumbaugh 可以坚持认为设计不仅仅是建筑(1998a)，而 Jim Coplien 可以采取设计就是建筑(1998a)的立场。我已经提到了广泛持有的默认概念，即设计只是分析和构建之间标准开发生命周期中的一个阶段。甚至 Rational Unified Process 也只是通过重新发明它来避免这种观点：对于 RUP，设计是迭代中介于需求分析和实现之间的部分。

Generally, what constitutes design in the context of systems development is as fuzzy as most of the other ideas we development professionals seem to profess. For example, Ivar Jacobson, Grady Booch, and James Rumbaugh can maintain that design isn't just architecture (1998a), while Jim Coplien can take the position that design is making architecture (1998a). I already mentioned the widely held tacit notion that design is only a stage in the standard development lifecycle between analysis and construction. Even the Rational Unified Process only avoids this view by reinventing it: for RUP, design is that part of an iteration that falls between requirements analysis and implementation.

还有一种观点认为设计与特定角色相关联。设计师设计，架构师架构，分析师分析，程序员开发。每个角色都应用特定于该角色的已知技术和为该角色精心设计的重复出现的问题。

There's also the view of design as tied to a specific role. Designers design, architects architect, analysts analyze, and programmers develop. Each role applies known techniques specific to that role and recurring problems that are well-formulated for that role.

这种方法大部分来自 IBM 早期尝试通过编程团队和 IBM 的体系结构视图使开发过程官僚化。当然，真实的画面总是有些模糊，那是 IBM 帮助制定的。众所周知，分析师在开发开始时就侵占设计地盘，而程序员则在最后沉迷于设计修复。

Much of this approach came from IBM's early attempts to bureaucratize the development process via programming teams and IBM's view of architecture. Of course, the real picture has always been somewhat smudged, and it was when IBM helped formulate it. Analysts encroach on the design turf at the beginning of development, and programmers are known to indulge in design fixes at the end.

有必要将设计与工程区分开来。强调设计不是工程，尽管它是工程的补充，许多工程师既做工程又做设计。

There is a need to distinguish design from engineering. Design is emphatically not engineering, although it complements engineering, and many engineers do design as well as engineering.

从狭隘的角度来看，工程学就像库恩描述的在定义明确的概念框架中解决问题的常规科学。设计比这更广泛、更混乱。

Narrowly viewed, engineering is like the normal science that Kuhn describesproblem-solving in a well-defined conceptual framework. Design is broader and messier than that.

IDEO 首席执行官兼斯坦福大学设计顾问大卫·凯利 (David Kelly) 是这样说的：“(t)他的设计师有一个超越现有事物的梦想，而不是固定现有事物——设计定义了它应该是什么——工程做到了“（Winograd 等人，1996 年，152157）。虽然承认工程和设计之间的明显区别也只是漫画，但凯利补充说，工程“不应该是混乱的——你试图假设混乱——只有在你解决一个精心设计的问题时才有效”。设计师试图理解混乱（而不是）”（1996 年，153）。

David Kelly, CEO of IDEO and a design consultant at Stanford, puts it this way: "(t)he designer has a dream that goes beyond what exists, rather than fixing what existsdesign defines what it ought to beengineering does it" (Winograd et al. 1996, 152157). Although admitting that clear distinctions between engineering and design only caricature either, Kelly adds that engineering "is not supposed to be messyyou try to assume away the messinessthat only works when you are solving a well-formulated problem. Designers try to understand the mess (instead)" (1996, 153).

工程师们可能会合理地抗议，这种狭隘的工程学观点只代表了工程师所做事情的一小部分。工程作为一种实践体现了我们在设计中发现的许多了解和实践的方式。就连 Kelley 也承认，根据他的经验，“[G]ood 工程师实际上是设计师-工程师——从这个词的每一个意义上来说都是设计师”（Winograd et al. 1996, 153）。但设计仍然不是工程，无论两者如何相互补充并一起实践。

Engineers may rightfully protest that this narrow view of engineering represents only a limited portion of the things engineers do. Engineering as a practice embodies many ways of knowing and doing that we find in design. Even Kelley admits that, in his experience, "[G]ood engineers are really designer-engineersdesigners in every sense of the word" (Winograd et al. 1996, 153). But design is still not engineering, however much the two complement each other and are practiced together.

在系统中，设计渗透到任何开发过程中，并构成一种实践——一种由系统专业人员参与的认识和做事方式的全部内容，而不是技术角色或一组活动。正如 Jim Coplien 所说，在现实中“我们不能将设计与架构和实现分开”（1998a，40）。而且，随着建模成为管理和运营开发产生的软件产品的关键要素，在某些方面，设计也成为管理和运营的一部分，甚至变得模糊不清更多的。

In systems, design permeates any development process, and constitutes a practicea repertoire of ways of knowing and doingengaged in by systems professionals, rather than being a technical role or set of activities. As Jim Coplien puts it, in this reality "we can't separate design from architecture and implementation" (1998a, 40). And, as modeling becomes a key element of managing and operating the software products that development produces, in some ways design also becomes part of management and operations, and things get smudged even more.

11.1.2 超越模式和范式

11.1.2 Beyond Patterns and Paradigms

什么那么，设计师所做的与工程有什么不同吗？他们是怎么做到的？

What do designers do, then, that's different from engineering? And how do they do it?

Donald Schon 在他关于反思的实践者。Schon 强调专业反思的持续作用以及实践知识在确保专业实践有效性方面的重要性。

An alternative to the engineering view of things is provided by Donald Schon in his books on the reflective practitioner. Schon emphasizes the ongoing role of professional reflection and the importance of practical knowledge in ensuring the effectiveness of professional practice.

他用这个词 professional practitioner作为对为客户（可能被称为其他名称，例如patient或student）提供服务的专业人员的一般描述。他利用了通常与练习一词相关的两种含义。他的实践概念结合了一系列服务的执行和执行这些服务的准备。归根结底，对于 Schon 来说，专业从业者是“反复遇到某些类型情况的专家”（1983 年，第 60 页）。

He uses the term professional practitioner as a general description of a professional engaged in providing a service for a client (who may be called something else, such as patient or student). He leverages both meanings that are usually associated with the word practice. His notion of practice combines the performance of a range of services and the preparation for performing them. Ultimately, for Schon, a professional practitioner is "a specialist who encounters certain types of situations over and over again" (1983, 60).

在 Schon 看来，专业人士不是简单地将技术专长应用到结构良好的问题上，而是不断地面对需要“在行动中反思”的惊喜，包括正在运用的知识和正在采取的行动。他平衡理论知识和实践知识，其中一些知识可能是隐性的，不容易表达出来。从实践中获得的即兴创作至少与在研究生院学到的任何课程一样重要。

In Schon's view, rather than simply applying technical expertise to well-formed problems, a professional is continually being confronted with surprises that require "reflection-in-action" about both the knowledge that is being brought to bear and the actions being taken. He balances theoretical knowledge with a repertoire of practical knowledge, some of which may be tacit and not easily articulated. Improvisation that is acquired from practice is at least as important a component of performing well as any lessons learned in graduate school.

设计是反思性实践的特例，但又不止于此。

Design is a special case of reflective practice, but it is more than that.

与 Coplien 对设计在系统开发中的作用的理解相似，Schon 认为设计渗透到专业实践的各个方面。例如，当 Schon 讨论反思性实践在工程和科学中的作用时，他含蓄地回应了 Kelley 的评论，即“(g) 优秀的工程师实际上是设计师-工程师”（1983 年）。然而，很明显，虽然设计可以成为这些职业实践中的一个元素，但对他们来说并不是必不可少的。（但反思性实践可能被视为在工程和科学中以不同的方式必不可少，因为在需要考虑意外异常时创建新范式。）

In a way that parallels Coplien's understanding of the role of design in systems development, Schon sees design as permeating all aspects of professional practice. When Schon discusses the role of reflective practice in engineering and the sciences, for example, he implicitly echoes Kelley's comments that "(g)ood engineers are really designer-engineers" (1983). However, it's clear that although design can be an element in the practice of those professions, it isn't essential to them. (But reflective practice might be seen to be essential in engineering and the sciences in a different wayin the creation of new paradigms when surprise anomalies need to be accounted for.)

Schon 的设计过程模型就是他所说的“与情境的反思对话”(1983, 40)。简而言之，它可以被描述为一个迭代的、增量的、以架构为中心的、用户驱动的但非正式的过程。

Schon's model for the design process is what he calls a "reflective conversation with the situation" (1983, 40). In a nutshell, it could be described as an iterative, incremental, architecture-centric, user-driven, but informal process.

对 Schon 的设计理念最好的总结来自 Schon 自己：

The best summary of Schon's idea about design is by Schon himself:

设计师做东西。有时他制作最终产品；更常见的是，他制作了由其他人建造的人工制品的表示、计划、程序或图像。他在特定情况下工作，使用特定材料，并使用独特的媒介和语言。通常，他的制作过程很复杂。可能的移动、规范和它们之间的相互关系的变量种类比有限模型中可以表示的要多。由于这种复杂性，设计者的动作往往会产生意想不到的后果，无论是喜是忧。发生这种情况时，设计师可能会通过形成新的欣赏和理解并采取新的行动来考虑到情况中发生的意外变化。他根据他对情况的初步认识来塑造情况，情况“

在一个好的设计过程中，这种与情境的对话是反思性的。在回答情况的回话时，设计者在行动中反思问题的构建、行动的策略或现象的模型，这些都具有隐含在他的动作中。(1983, 79)

A designer makes things. Sometimes he makes the final product; more often, he makes a representation, plan, program, or image of an artifact to be constructed by others. He works in particular situations, uses particular materials, and employs a distinctive medium and language. Typically, his making process is complex. There are more variableskinds of possible moves, norms, and interrelationships of thesethan can be represented in a finite model. Because of this complexity, the designer's moves tend, happily or unhappily, to produce consequences other than those intended. When this happens, the designer may take account of the unintended changes be has made in the situation by forming new appreciations and understandings and by making new moves. He shapes the situation, in accordance with his initial appreciation of it, the situation "talks back," and he responds to the situation's back-talk.

In a good process of design, this conversation with the situation is reflective. In answer to the situation's back-talk, the designer reflects-in-action on the construction of the problem, the strategies of action, or the model of the phenomena, which have been implicit in his moves. (1983, 79)

11.2 反射设计的要素

11.2 Elements of Reflective Design

舍恩将设计嵌入到他所谓的实践认识论中，即“行动中的反思”。为简单起见，我将使用术语“反思设计”来涵盖设计的扩展视图，将“行动中的反思”的关键方面折叠到他对设计细节的讨论中。

Schon embeds design into what he calls an epistemology of practice, "reflection-in-action." For simplicity, I'll use the term reflective design to cover an extended view of design that folds the key aspects of reflection-in-action into his discussion of the details of design.

对于设计的细节，我将依靠Schon对师生之间的建筑设计会话的描述和分析，他的例子来介绍这些细节。他将会议作为起点，因为“建筑是公认的最古老的设计专业，因此，它可以作为其他专业设计的原型”（1983 年，第 77 页）。

For the details of design, I'll rely on Schon's description and analysis of an architectural design session between a teacher and a student, his example for introducing those details. He uses the session as a starting point because "architecture is the oldest recognized design profession, and, as such, functions as prototype for design in other professions" (1983, 77).

并非 Schon 关于架构设计的所有讨论都可以轻松映射到系统设计。但是他对设计过程的分析提供了一个重要的起点，可以将设计的其他未说明的方面作为个人过程进行检查，从个人角度而不是组织角度使用 Watts Humphrey 的术语过程。

Not all of Schon's discussion of design in architecture maps easily to systems design. But his analysis of the design process provides an important starting point for examining otherwise unstated aspects of design as a personal process, to use Watts Humphrey's termprocess from a personal perspective rather than an organizational one.

设计实践在塑造建模语言及其应用方面应该与其旨在支持的技术目标一样重要。UML作为建模的工作工具，需要与设计人员的工作实践保持一致。此外，考虑到 UML 的作者谈论架构的快速和宽松的方式，他的例子也提供了一个有趣的例子和对真实架构思维的解释。它可以为现有的建筑实践表示提供有价值的解毒剂。

The practice of design should be as important in shaping a modeling language and its application as the technical goals that it is meant to support. As a working tool for modeling, the UML needs to be consistent with the working practices of designers. Also, given the fast and loose way that writers on the UML talk about architecture, his example also provides a fascinating example and explanation of real architectural thinking. It can provide a valuable antidote to the representations of architectural practice that are out there.

Schon (1983) 确定了反思设计中的一些元素，这些元素结合起来定义了专业实践：

Schon (1983) identifies a number of elements in reflective design that combine to define professional practice:

  • 问题设置

  • Problem setting

  • 一种设计语言

  • A language of design

  • 一种关于设计的语言

  • A language about designing

  • 表演

  • Performing

  • 关闭

  • Closure

我将使用这些类别来探索 Schon 的设计元素组合形成实践的方式，以及 UML 和模式如何支持反思设计。

I'll use these categories to explore the way Schon's elements of design combine to form a practice, and how the UML and patterns can support reflective design.

这些类别是我自己的，真正熟悉 Schon 作品的任何人都可能认为它们有些限制和限制。Schon 流畅、近乎轶事的风格掩盖了他作品中微妙的结构，这使得简单的总结变得困难。他的写作更像是要播放的音乐，其中一种并非总是显而易见的塑造来自对通常必须从材料中哄出来的分句的逐渐欣赏。

These categories are my own and may be considered somewhat restricting and limited by anyone who's really familiar with Schon's work. Schon's fluid, almost anecdotal style masks a subtle architecture in his writing that makes simple summarization difficult. His writing is better approached as music to be played, where a not-always-obvious shaping comes from a gradual appreciation of phrasing that often has to be coaxed out of the material.

作为类别，它们很有用，因为它们与大多数开发人员都熟悉的正式流程有一些明显的相似之处。然而，它们应该被视为相互关联并在某些方面重叠，而不是作为单独的活动。当然，在 Schon 关于设计的著作中，它们以递归和迭代的方式出现和重新出现，作为惊喜流行即兴应用向上。

As categories, they're useful because of some obvious parallels with the formal processes that most developers will be familiar with. However, they should be seen as interconnected and in some ways overlapping, rather than as separate activities. Certainly, in Schon's writing about design, they appear and reappear in recursive and iterative fashion, to be applied improvisationally as surprises pop up.

11.2.1 问题设置

11.2.1 Problem Setting

设计师最初呈现的是有问题的情境，而不是“令人费解、麻烦和不确定”的问题情境（Schon 1983，40）。因此，反思设计的第一步是理解情境，构建其现实，并提供一个框架来理解它并与之互动。这种意义建构不是技术性的。问题设置“本身不是技术问题”（40）。手段和目的是“相互依存的”（165）。

A designer is initially presented with problematic situations rather than problemssituations that are "puzzling, troubling and uncertain" (Schon 1983, 40). The first step in reflective design, then, is to make sense of the situation, to construct its reality, and provide a framework for understanding and interacting with it. This sense-making is not technical. Problem setting "is not itself a technical problem" (40). Means and ends are "framed interdependently" (165).

Schon 补充说：

Schon adds:

当我们设置问题时，我们选择了我们将要处理的事物作为情境的“事物”，我们设定了我们对它的注意力的界限，并且我们强加了“连贯性”——我们命名了我们将要关注的事物并构建了我们将在其中关注他们。(1983, 40)

When we set the problem, we select the things we will treat as the "things" of the situation, we set the boundaries of our attention to it, and we imposecoherencewe name the things to which we will attend and frame the context in which we will attend to them. (1983, 40)

但是问题设置不仅仅是建立一个上下文。它是情境的主动框架，至少暗示了将要产生的设计的某些元素。在构建情境时，设计师将从业者的经验和知识模型带入“框架实验”。

But problem setting is not merely the establishment of a context. It is an active framing of the situation that at least implies some elements of the design that will result. In framing the situation, the designer brings to the "framing experiment" the practitioner's repertoireof experience and knowledgemodels to start from.

这种描述应该立即引起 UML 建模者和模式用户的共鸣。

This description should resonate immediately with UML modelers and patterns users.

  • 架构风格的问题在使用 UML 的任何过程中都得到了早期处理。这可以被认为是框架的一部分，因为重复UML 规范所说的：“（t）选择一个人创建的模型和图表对如何解决问题以及如何形成相应的解决方案有着深远的影响”（ Rational 软件公司 1999, 13).

  • The question of architectural style is dealt with early in any process using the UML. This can be considered part of the framing because, to repeat what the UML Specification says: "(t)he choice of what models and diagrams one creates has a profound influence upon how a problem is attacked and how a corresponding solution is shaped" (Rational Software Corporation 1999, 13).

  • 业务对象和/或类型的标识；通过参与者、事件和交互建立上下文；以及通过用例集中注意力是使用 UML 建模时问题设置的所有方面。

  • The identification of business objects and/or types; the establishment of context via actors, events, and interactions; and the focusing of attention via use cases are all aspects of problem-setting when modeling with the UML.

  • 分析与设计的明确分离，加上实施问题的长期推迟，正在被分析和设计的迭代、递归循环所取代，并与早期对架构的关注交织在一起。

  • The clear separation of analysis from design, coupled with a lengthy postponement of implementation concerns, is being replaced by iterative, recursive cycles of analysis and design, interleaved with an early focus on architecture.

在使用模式时，问题设置是明确的。您首先从所有可用的模式中创建您自己的小型模式语言。根据 Alexander、Ishikawa 和 Murray 的说法，“你所构建的东西的特征将由你使用的模式语言赋予它”（1977 年，xxxvii）。模式语言是本地的；当您开始构建或设计时，它就开始了。

In using patterns, problem-setting is explicit. You start by creating your own small pattern language from all the patterns available. According to Alexander, Ishikawa, and Murray, "the character of what you build will be given to it by the language of patterns you use" (1977, xxxvii). A pattern language is local; it starts when you begin to build or design.

每个模式都是一个微型框架，包含有助于映射到情况的元素。特别是，应该将所选模式中的力量映射到情境中的力量，以努力在模式和情境之间建立一致性。成功的映射有助于“构建上下文”，因此有助于为适当设置问题的概念连贯性奠定基础和恰如其分。

Each pattern is a miniature frame, containing elements that help with the mapping to a situation. In particular, there should be a mapping of the forces in the selected patterns to forces in the situation, in an effort to establish congruence between patterns and the situation.
