Successful mappings help "frame the context," and so help create a basis for conceptual coherence in setting the problem appropriately and fittingly.

11.2.2 设计语言

11.2.2 A Language of Design

这 Schon 所指的“与情境对话”当然不是字面意思。他描述的是情境与设计师之间的来回互动。两者之间的对话有多种形式，但总是不仅仅涉及绘画。将白板视为交互的媒介。

The "conversation with the situation" that Schon refers to is, of course, not meant to be taken literally. He's describing the back-and-forth, give-and-take interaction between the situation and the designer. The dialogue between the two takes many forms, but always involves more than just drawing. Think of the whiteboard as a medium for interaction.

就像模型既是文本又是图形一样，设计语言涉及“绘图和谈话……作为平行的设计方式”(Schon 1983, 80)，它只适用于一种情况，而不是通用的模式语言。重点是设计语言，而不是设计语言。

In the same way that models are both text and graphics, a language of design involves "drawing and talking[as] parallel ways of designing" (Schon 1983, 80) that is local to a situationnot genericlike pattern languages. The emphasis is on a language of design, not the language of design.

在某些方面，设计语言弥合了通用建模语言（例如 UML）和生成模式语言之间的差距。语言和非语言相互作用，尤其是在协作设计活动的表现中。非语言信息通过非正式的语言信息得到加强、增强、扩展和澄清。在成功的项目中，口头和非口头速记最终以方言的形式出现。模型成为方言的存储库，其中的一部分可能更私密，而其他部分可能在不同程度上公开。有些信息可能会被正式化并记录下来；其中一些将是临时的和即兴的。

In some ways, a language of design bridges the gap between a generic modeling language such as the UML and a generative pattern language. The verbal and nonverbal interact, especially in the performance of collaborative design activities. Nonverbal information is reinforced, enhanced, extended, and clarified by informal verbal information. In successful projects, verbal and nonverbal shorthand eventually emerges in the form of a dialect. Models become repositories for dialects, parts of which may be more private, whereas other parts may be public in varying degrees. Some of the information may be formalized and recorded; some of it will be temporary and improvisational.

在使用 UML 时，模型、建模者和客户之间的这种来回相互作用是至关重要的。模型不是简单地作为存档文档，而是用于促进这种相互作用。诸如省略不必要的细节、局部和临时的刻板印象以及使用注释等策略可以在这个过程中发挥有用的作用。情景构建和练习（如 CRC 卡片）可以成为项目设计语言出现的强大工具。

In using the UML, this back-and-forth interplay among model, modelers, and clients is critical. Rather than simply being archival documentation, models are used to facilitate this interplay. Tactics such as the elision of unnecessary detail, local and temporary stereotypes, and the use of notes can play useful roles in the process. Scenario-building and exercises such as CRC cards can be powerful tools in the emergence of a language of design for a project.

与传统的建筑绘图不同，UML 模型有意既是文本又是图形。此外，UML 明确鼓励使用超链接作为建立联系和促进概念导航的一种方式。因此，UML 提供了可以以多种方式增强设计语言的工具。其中一些可以形式化，但只能在事后进行。例如，Catalysis 提供了一个名为dialect的包构造原型，它支持这种形式化（D'Souza 和 Wills 1998）。

Unlike traditional architectural drawings, UML models are deliberately both text and graphics. Furthermore, the UML explicitly encourages the use of hyperlinks as a way of building connections and facilitating conceptual navigation. Thus, the UML provides tools that can augment a language of design in a variety of ways. Some of this can be formalized, but only after the fact. For example, Catalysis provides a constructa stereotype of package called dialect, which supports such formalization (D'Souza and Wills 1998).

当然，模式可以提供许多可以作为设计语言基础的丰富词汇。公共模式可以重用；可以引入更能反映当地条件的变化；可以创建设计方言本地的私有模式。

Patterns, of course, can supply much of the rich vocabulary that can be the base for a language of design. Public patterns can be reused; variations can be introduced that reflect local conditions more closely; private patterns that are local to the design dialect can be created.

创建模式的过程本身就是设计语言的一个方面。研讨会、研究小组和其他已经发展成为呈现和发展模式的良好方式的活动可以成为设计语言。

The process of creating patterns is itself an aspect of a language of design. Workshops, study groups, and other activities that have evolved as sound ways to surface and evolve patterns can be part of the development of a language of design.

11.2.3 设计语言

11.2.3 A Language about Designing

舍恩仔细区分“一种设计语言”和“一种关于设计元语言的语言”(1983, 81)。这也需要成为练习的一部分。专业实践不仅仅是从业者对当地情况的个人反应；相反，它也有一个更大的背景，即实践本身的背景。关于能力本质的想法交织在发生的交互中，并提供了一些用于交流结果的框架。专业标准、提供指导的范例和启发式都需要作为设计对话的一部分提供。

Schon carefully distinguishes "a language of design" from "a language about designinga metalanguage" (1983, 81). This too needs to be a part of practice. Professional practice isn't just about the personal responses of practitioners to local situations; rather, it too has a larger context, which is the context of the practice itself. Ideas about the nature of competency are interwoven into the interactions that take place, and provide some of the framework for communicating the results. Professional standards, exemplars that provide guidance, and heuristics all need to be available as part of the design conversation.

同样，UML 和模式都提供了解决此需求的不同方法。UML 通过元模型和规范明确响应。可以找到既体现“设计语言”又体现“设计语言”的模式。最后，指导和模式编写是将关于设计的语言纳入其中的方法每个设计师的做法。

Again, both the UML and patterns provide different ways of addressing this need. The UML explicitly responds, via the metamodel and Specification. Patterns can be found that exemplify both "a language of design" and "a language about designing." And finally, mentoring and pattern-writing are ways to include a language about designing into every designer's practices.

11.2.4 性能

11.2.4 Performance

问题设置和命名和框架导致对情况的一组执行响应。Schon 使用移动、站姿和草图等词来表示设计师进行的表演性话语和动作。

Problem setting and naming-and-framing lead to a set of performed responses to the situation. Schon uses words such as move, stance, and sketch to indicate the performative utterances and actions that a designer engages in.

他利用performance一词的歧义，就像他利用practice一词的类似歧义一样。对他来说，表演既是成功地创造出最终产品，也是对它的艺术化处理。深思熟虑的设计师与客户共舞，同时也必须产生切实的结果。

He leverages the ambiguities of the word performance the same way he leverages similar ambiguities in the word practice. For him, performance is both successfully creating an end product and the artistic doing of it. The reflective designer is engaged in a dance with the client that must also produce tangible results.

以问题框架为起点，以领域语言为起点进行设计，这仍然只是在起跑线上。设计师必须“执行”设计，以便在合作、绘图、写作中行动，并最终构建一个大于部分的整体。

Having a problem framework as a starting point and a domain language as a beginning point to design is still just being at the starting line. The designer has to "perform" designto act in collaborations, draw, write, and, ultimately, architect a whole that is greater than the parts.

以下部分讨论了 Schon 描述的设计性能的基本要素他们。

The following sections discuss the essential elements of design performance as Schon portrays them.

动作

一招是一种设计行动，产生潜在的问题解决方案，其后果需要被理解，含义需要被理解。动作是设计的增量，就像模型一样，“让我们有机会在受控条件下失败”（Booch 1994，22）。重要的是能够看到不断变化的整体以及部分：“[e]每一步都是一个局部实验，有助于重新构建问题的全球实验”（Schon 1983，94）。

A move is a design action that produces potential problem-solutions in miniature with consequences that need to be appreciated and implications that need to be understood. Moves are the increments of design that, like models, "give us the opportunity to fail under controlled conditions" (Booch 1994, 22). The important thing is to be able to see the changing whole, as well as the parts: "[e]ach move is a local experiment that contributes to the global experiment of reframing the problem" (Schon 1983, 94).

这个过程就像一场国际象棋比赛，随着比赛的进行，它会重新定义规则。这就是“顶嘴”的用武之地。情况可能会“抵制”此举；也就是说，此举可能不会提高整体解决方案的质量。对一步棋的评估可能会揭示意想不到的后果，有些有用，有些则无用。

The process is like a chess game that redefines its rules as the game proceeds. This is where "back-talk" comes in. The situation may "resist" the move; that is, the move may not contribute to the quality of the overall solution. The evaluation of a move may reveal unexpected consequencessome useful and some not.

设计语言为交流和评估这些举措提供了工具。Schon 建议设计师使用类别来组织她的动作和反应。他称这些类别设计领域；每个领域都对应一个关注领域，以及专业人员为情况带来的经验和知识库的一个方面。域组织了需要提出的问题：成本是多少？我应该给这个设计元素起什么名字？它应该采取什么形式？它和我所知道的或我所知道的一样吗完毕？

The language of design provides the vehicle for communicating and assessing these moves. Schon suggests that a designer use categories to organize both her moves and her responses. He calls these categories design domains; each domain corresponds to an area of concern and an aspect of the repertoire of experiences and knowledge that a professional brings to the situation. A domain organizes the questions that need to be asked: What will the costs be? What name should I give this design element? What form should it take? Is it like anything else I know about or that I've done?

结果

每个move 导致需要表达的情况发生变化。还需要通过在手头的设计领域内使用设计语言，将它们作为意图和通过检查意外后果来进行解释和评估。过去的经验和直觉都会在检查设计更改或添加可能产生的后果时发挥作用。

Each move results in changes to the situation that need to be expressed. They also need to be explained and assessed, both as intentions and by examining unintended consequences, by using the language of design within the design domains at hand. Past experience and intuition both come into play in examining how a design change or addition might have consequences.

Schon 使用术语欣赏描述设计者考虑一个举动的可能影响的行为。该术语以评估或评价所没有的方式捕捉了设计师反思表现的直觉和美学方面。欣赏包括适合感和质量感，以及对全球范围影响的考虑，而不仅仅是从技术角度识别当地影响。

Schon uses the term appreciation to describe the designer's act of considering the possible effects of a move. This term captures the intuitive and aesthetic aspects of the designer's reflective performance in a way that assessment or evaluation doesn't. Appreciation includes a sense of fit and quality, as well as a consideration of the effects at the global scalenot just an identification of the local impacts from a technical perspective.

因此，设计师必须能够看到整体，感受整体中呈现的品质，并根据整体的不断发展进行工作，而不仅仅是埋头于零件。

So, the designer has to be able to see the whole, feel the qualities present in the whole, and work in terms of the ongoing evolution of the wholenot just be buried in the parts.

启示

有考虑到设计实验的预期和非预期后果，设计师可以决定是否接受结果。设计师有多种选择：接受这个举动，重新定义问题，或者在考虑后果时采取新的立场（重新审视欣赏）。

Having considered the intended and unintended consequences of a design experiment, the designer has a decision to make about committing to the results. The designer has a variety of options: accepting the move, reframing the problem, or adopting a new stance in considering the consequences (revisiting the appreciation).

考虑后果的过程是一种欣赏，而考虑影响的过程更多是一种测试。当做出决定时，必须在过去行动的影响的背景下计算和评估决定的影响：“（T）这里是设计的字面逻辑，一种‘如果...那么’命题的模式这将先前动作的累积顺序与设计师现在面临的选择联系起来”（Schon 1983，99）。

Whereas the process in considering the consequences was one of appreciation, the process at work in considering the implications is more one of testing. When a decision is being made, the implications of the decision have to be worked out and evaluated in the context of the implications of past moves: "(T)here is a literal logic of design, a pattern of 'ifthen' propositions that relates the cumulative sequence of prior moves to the choices now confronting the designer" (Schon 1983, 99).

在设计行动过程中建立起来的一系列影响创造了它自己的复杂性——所有决策的复杂性及其在设计生命周期中的影响。Schon 将这种复杂性描述为“动作网络”，其中“暗示系统”成为设计过程的“规则”(1983, 131)。

The set of implications built up over the course of design moves creates its own complexitythe complexity of all the decisions and their implications through the life of a design. Schon describes this complexity as the "web of moves" in which "systems of implications" become "disciplines" for the design process (1983, 131).

任何决定都会建立所谓的新概念基线，该基线将用于考虑未来的行动。当然，这些基线不是一成不变的。设计者不必尊重先前动作的含义。它们的存在是为了促进一致性、连贯性和适应性，并帮助管理“动作网络”的复杂性。

Any decision establishes what might be called a new conceptual baseline that will be used in considering future moves. These baselines are, of course, not cast in stone. The designer doesn't have to honor the implications of previous moves. They're there to facilitate consistency, coherence, and fit, and to help manage the complexity of the "web of moves."

如果一个新动作在某种程度上被认为足够特殊，那么它可能会违反设计逻辑。它可能会建立一个新的逻辑，或者创建一个新的纪律来强加给流程。如果此举不够特别，则可能需要重新定义问题或重新审视升值：

If a new move has been appreciated as sufficiently special in some way, then it can violate the logic of the design. It establishes a new logic, perhaps, or creates a new discipline to impose on the process. If the move is not sufficiently special, then reframing the problem or revisiting the appreciation may be needed:

  • 重构问题允许设计者审查问题设置并尝试使情况适应新的理解问题的方式。重构可以采取对行动进行反思或对实践进行反思的形式——我不会详细讨论这两种其他类型的专业反思。从本质上讲，行动反思发生在正在进行的设计过程之外，而实践反思可能包括质疑设计实践本身的性质。

  • Reframing the problem permits a designer to review the problem setting and attempt to fit the situation into a new way of understanding the problem. Reframing may take the form of reflection-on-action or reflection-on-practicetwo additional types of professional reflection that I won't deal with in detail. Essentially, reflection-on-action takes place outside of the ongoing design process, whereas reflection-on-practice might include questioning the nature of the design practice itself.

  • 重新审视鉴赏提供了一个重新考虑此举的后果的机会，也许可以通过查看用于鉴赏的设计领域的优先级排序移动。

  • Revisiting the appreciation provides an opportunity to reconsider the consequences of the move, perhaps by looking at the prioritization of the design domains used in making the appreciation of the move.

11.2.5 关闭

11.2.5 Closure

重构问题或重新审视可能会导致重复 movesconsequencesimplications 的过程，或者设计师可能会继续前进。发生一定程度的关闭。Schon 所说的设计师对设计变化的态度；设计师致力于某些方面，它们的含义变得更加固定，并且对特定设计领域的关注发生了转变，通常转向与构建相关的领域，而不是概念化。但与此同时，由于该过程的互动性和探索性，可能会提出新的问题并发现新的机会。

Reframing the problem or revisiting the appreciation may lead to reiterating the process of movesconsequencesimplications, or the designer may move on. A degree of closure occurs. What Schon calls the stance of the designer toward the design changes; the designer commits to certain aspects, their implications become more fixed, and there's a shift in the attention paid to specific design domains, typically toward those domains concerned with building and away from conceptualizing. At the same time, however, because of the interactive and exploratory nature of the process, new questions may have been raised and new opportunities identified.

关闭永远不会是最终的；它很有用，并受进一步设计迭代的结果影响。关闭的问题可能需要在以后进行审查和返工。但是有一种隐含的理解，即设计决策具有已经完成，现在是向前迈进的时候了。

Closure is never final; it is useful and subject to the results of further design iterations. Closed problems may need to be reviewed and reworked down the road. But there is an implicit understanding that design decisions have been made, and it is time to move forward.

11.2.6 反思设计和系统建模

11.2.6 Reflective Design and Systems Modeling

该设计我总结的过程与 UML 的主要工件没有任何明显的联系。但是，它隐含在正确使用 UML 中。在许多关于系统设计的书籍中都可以看到它“在行动”，这些书籍有案例研究来说明设计工作实际上是如何在 UML 之前和使用 UML 时进行的。

The design process I've summarized doesn't have any obvious connections to the main artifacts of the UML. However, it is implicit in working with the UML properly. It can be seen "in action" in many of the books about system design that have case studies illustrating how the work of design is actually carried outboth pre-UML and when using the UML.

UML 之前的 movesconsequencesimplications 的两个很好的例子是 David Taylor 的Business Engineering With Objects (1995) 和 Nancy Wilkinson 的Using CRC Cards: An Informal Approach to Object-Oriented Development (1995)。专门处理 UML 使用的最佳示例是Geri Schneider 和 Jason P. Winters（1998 年）的Applying Use Cases: A Practical Guide 。后一本书中描述的关于建立子系统初始架构的“移动”是对架构性能作为反思的特别好的描述设计。

Two good examples of movesconsequencesimplications from before the UML are David Taylor's Business Engineering With Objects (1995), and Nancy Wilkinson's Using CRC Cards: An Informal Approach to Object-Oriented Development (1995). The best example that deals specifically with using the UML is Applying Use Cases: A Practical Guide, by Geri Schneider and Jason P. Winters (1998). The "moves" described in the latter book about establishing an initial architecture of subsystems is an especially good description of architectural performance as reflective design.

11.3 待续。

11.3 To Be Continued

结束就是开始

终点就是我们的起点。而每一句

正确的句子是结束也是开始。

历史是一种模式

永恒的时刻

我们所有探索的终点

将到达我们开始的地方

第一次知道这个地方

穿过未知的、记忆中的大门 (Eliot 1966, 58-59)

to make an end is to make a beginning

The end is where we start from. And every phrase

And sentence that is rightis an end and a beginning

history is a pattern

Of timeless moments

the end of all our exploring

Will be to arrive where we started

And know the place for the first time

Through the unknown, remembered gate (Eliot 1966, 58-59)

我的概述Schon 关于反射设计的想法必然只是一个简短的例子。他关于反思性实践的书籍包含更多可能对任何从事系统设计的人有用的内容。我相信所有优秀的设计师都会遵循 Schon 讨论的方法，但是是默认的。像亚历山大、石川和默里一样，舍恩提出了永恒的、也许是普遍的做事方式。UML 和模式表达了一种类似的需求，即利用经验并与经过验证的知行方式联系起来。

My overview of Schon's ideas on reflective design is necessarily just a brief sample. His books on reflective practice contain much more that could be useful to anyone doing systems design. I believe that all good designers follow the approach Schon discusses, but tacitly. Like Alexander, Ishikawa, and Murray, Schon surfaces ways of doing that are timeless and perhaps universal. The UML and patterns are expressions of a similar need to leverage experience and connect with proven ways of knowing and doing.

这是我的书的结尾，但像这样的书永远不会完成。UML 仍在进行中，模式总是在变化。还有许多其他有价值的模式、文章、网页和书籍可以联系起来。这里的大部分材料都可以改进、细化和精炼。因此，在 UML 2.0 出现并且真正稳定的 UML 基础可用之前，我将维护一个网站 ( www.umlpatterns.com )，它将成为新模式、更好的示例和扩展链接。

This is the end of my book, but a book like this is never complete. The UML is still a work-in-progress, and patterns are always changing. There are many other valuable patterns, articles, Web pages, and books that can be connected. Much of the material that is here can be improved, detailed, and refined. Therefore, until UML 2.0 comes out and a real stable UML base is available, I'll be maintaining a Web site (www.umlpatterns.com) that will be the home for new patterns, better examples, and extended links.
